content.text: Exceptional architectural design : analyses and strategies of problem use ; meet conditions, use problems, increase order. Klappentext: This book aims to provide information by contrasting, comparing and analysing buildings of the past to what extent harsh conditions, e.g. conditions of use of the builders, constraints due to land cut and scarcity of financial resources, were once decisive for special solutions in the construction sector and are also today in our design tasks. The book aims to call upon our environment and our architecture to be time-appropriately convincing, locally concise and high-quality. Target groups are designers, designers, architects and environmentally conscious citizens.
content.title_en: Exceptional architecture : analyses and strategies of problem use ; meet conditions, use problems, increase order

content.text: The wood bending: Production of curved wood furniture. Reprint of an overview of wood bending technology published in 1903. For furniture restorers, collectors, conservationists and museum people. Bugwood furniture is still enjoying a strong interest of dealers and collectors (Thonet chairs!). Despite the millions of furniture production, hardly any literature has been published about the production techniques. This reprint from 1903 shows the technical state of the turn of the century, but is still interesting in parts (recipes for colouring/slicing and painting; individual processing techniques) for furniture restorers, collectors, conservationists and museum people, even in vocational libraries, since no newer literature is available. Supplement to the picture book "Bugwood furniture" by G. Candilis and others (Krämer, 1979).
content.title_en: The wood bending : manufacture of curved wood furniture

content.text: The local constitution and the possibilities for its reform have been discussed more strongly in all the Länder in recent years.It is no longer a question of details, but of basic questions.These fundamental questions are particularly important: firstly, whether the German municipal constitution systems are to be replaced by a uniform system and secondly, whether the constitutional system is to be aligned with the parliamentary government system with a government elected for the electoral period and an opposition or whether it is to retain an administrative head with a longer term of office, a model which is more or less geared to the participation of all the major political groups of the municipal council in the general administration.Two authors, who have recently been particularly involved in the field, comment on these two questions, on the first question Emil Vesper and on the second question Michael Borchmann.
content.title_en: Reform problems in local constitution law

content.text: Environmental crisis and change in value: the re-evaluation of values as a strategy of survival. As never before in history, the chances of survival of humans are currently threatened by a accumulation of crises in the natural and social environment. It is becoming increasingly clear that a mere symptom fight with the help of the previous technical and economic dynamics will exacerbate the problem pressure. Since the socioculturally conveyed value orientations form central determinants of human behavior, the overcoming of the multi-layered environmental crisis can only succeed by a profound re-evaluation of values in favour of life-quality behaviour patterns.
content.title_en: Environmental crisis and change in value : the re-evaluation of values as a strategy for survival

content.text: Dichloromethane. From the preface: The "Consultant Board for Ecological Wastes" (BUA) of the Gesellschaft Deutscher Chemiker has assumed the task of dealing with the problems of the old substances with regard to their potential for environmental hazards. This has been done by the preparation of a selection process as an environmentally relevant chemical which has led to a list of 60 substances. The data necessary for the evaluation of these substances are collected, critically weighted and published as a continuous series of material reports. Recommendations suggest which studies are still necessary for evaluation. The advisory board hopes that these reports will be a major decision-making aid to the responsible and competent authorities in initiating necessary measures.
content.title_en: Dichloromethane

content.text: Practice of child and youth assistance : Handbook for the social pedagogical application of the KJHG. In 1991 the Youth Welfare Act (JWG) from 1922 was replaced by the Children and Youth Assistance Act (KJHG). In this volume, practitioners explain the tasks and achievements mentioned in the law, and in part examples of application are presented. The social framework conditions of youth assistance are also discussed. More important title oriented towards the social pedagogical practice for all those involved in this field. (2) (LK/W: Ute Scharmann)
content.title_en: Practice of child and youth assistance : Handbook for the social pedagogical application of the KJHG

content.text: The burden of great hopes: methodological action and self-control in social professions. Professional ethics and the living conditions of their clients in social professions push for holistic problem vision and insight into the interdependence of individual and social suffering. But this pushes these professions into a structural self-examination, which often ends in cynicism or resignation enough. On the other hand, the author would like to suggest that the processing of this dilemma be the focal point of professional competence.
content.title_en: The burden of great hopes : methodological action and self-control in social professions

content.text: The method of finite elements : [Study Edition] ; with 36 tables. The book provides a comprehensive overview of the current state of the FEM (Finite Element Method) applications and explains the theoretical basis of the method from the point of view of the engineer. The clever selection and methodical presentation of the extensive material is suitable to inspire the learner for the FEM, to assist the practitioner in modelling his particular problem and to encourage the theorist to further clarify the fundamentals.
content.title_en: Method of finite elements : [Study edition] ; with 36 tables

content.text: The study is based on the report "The medium-sized mechanical engineering at the German location in Germany - Opportunities and Risks in the Age of Globalisation and "New Economy" prepared by the ifo Institute under the direction of the "Strucural Change and Industries" working area for the Federal Ministry of Economics and Technology and completed in November 2001. The research project was developed in cooperation with the Fraunhofer Institute for Systems and Innovation Research (ISI) in Karlsruhe. The study is based on the development of German mechanical engineering, with its traditional structural features, taking into account its integration into the deepening international division of work and the increasing diffusion of information and I. communication technologies within and outside the mechanical engineering industry. In methodological terms, the analyses are based on a corporate survey on the use of modern ICT technologies for product development production control, which is regularly carried out by the ISI. This study is based on an expert assessment for the Federal Ministry of Economics and Technology in co-operation with the Fraunhofer Institutes ti tis Systems Innovation Research (ISI) In Karlsruhe. content.text: The post-migrant society: a promise of plural democracy. The rise of right-wing populist movements leads to a shift in norms in European societies and creates tensions that are reflected in polarization. It is less about migration itself than about the processes that take place when migrants and their descendants demand their rights. The question of how to deal with migration is thus a cipher for recognition of equality in democratic societies. Naika Foroutan shows that the migration question has become a new social question - in it distribution justice and cultural self-description are negotiated as well as democratic composure. "How do you think about migration?" stands for the question of what needs to be negotiated to keep plural democracy together. The post-migrant society is therefore one that reorders itself in the context of the debates about the importance of migration. "Even if the three complexes ("recognition and negotiation"), "ambivalences and ambiguities", "antagonists and alliances", on the basis of which the author unfolds its term of "the epithesis of the post-migrant society – the same thing.
content.title_en: Post-migrant society: a promise of plural democracy

content.text: ChanceMINT.NRW – study biographical turning points and career perspectives. The ChanceMINT.NRW project provides insights into professional practice, prepares students for their career entry and motivations them to shape the course of their studies with self-confidence. Together with partners from industry, committed female students visit major construction sites, second treatment plants and planning offices and talk to experts from partners companies about hurdles, succeeds and professional challenges. The ChanceMINT.NRW project provides insights into professional practice, prepares for the professional entry and motivates students to confidently design the course of their studies. Together with partners from the business community, committed students visit large-scale construction sites, sewage treatment plants, planning offices and speak to experts from the partner companies about the challenges they face.
content.title_en: ChanceMINT.NRW – Study Biographical Turning Points and Career Perspectives

content.text: The society of the future - observations from the present. Nobody knows what the future brings. Nevertheless or precisely for this reason we communicate constantly on the topic of the future – whether private or in the mass media. The author examines this communication and puts two points of reference in the focus: the functional differentiation of modern society and the inclusion of the population in functional systems such as politics, economics, education. How are these topics dealt with with with the society of the future and what impulses for decision arise from this?
content.title_en: Society of the Future - Observations from the Present

content.text: Migration and integration of refugees into municipalities: the long journey from arriving to staying. Migration to Germany has always been a cycle in recent decades. In the autumn and winter of 2015/2016, when refugees from North Africa and the Middle East were looking for protection and asylum in the Federal Republic of Germany, in particular. In the initial phase, the distribution, immediate accommodation and humanitarian first-time care of refugees have reached a phase in which the much more demanding requirements of integration can be met in the municipalities: it is about "coming" and "supporting in-life" in urban society - long-term processes in which the needs of immigrants and reception society must be taken into account equally. Against this background, the volume highlights the integration challenges that are currently facing the municipalities in concrete terms, but also possible solutions. Current scientific findings and experiences from practice are presented, with the aim of providing suggestions for a successful integration of refugees.
content.title_en: Immigration and integration of refugees in municipalities: the long way from arriving to staying

content.text: Privateness in digital society. Digitalization is the topic of the past years with its impact on human and society $adas$z privacy-relevant issues. Processes of digitalization lead to difficulties in protecting private information and bring demands for technical measures or legal regulation to bear. Digitalization processes seem to have the potential to change ethical boundaries and to play into questions of subject constitution. The expert contributions gathered in this interdisciplinary volume take into account the philosophical, media, cultural and legal perspectives of digitalization. These include questions regarding informational privacy, trust and responsibility in digital contexts, contributions to friendships and relationship formation on the Internet, scoring systems or nudging as well as perspectives of robotics and technology philosophy. / »Privacy in the Digital Society« -- This interdisciplinary edited volume concerns information.
content.title_en: Privateness in the digital society

content.text: Survey : Introduction to survey research methods. Opinion polls and the announcement of their results are part of our everyday life. Often, however, they are unconsequential or so trivial that we hardly take them to account. Furthermore, some surveys lack quality because the responsible person lacks the necessary knowledge. It is not surprising that the reputation of survey research has suffered in recent years. The aim of the book is therefore to provide theoretical basics and practical knowledge, with the help of which surveys can be critically assessed as well as questionnaires according to valid scientific standards themselves. The focus is on information on the formulation of questions and the construction of questionnaires as well as the planning and execution of field work. In addition to postal, personal and telephone surveys, online, mobile and mixed mode surveys are also explained. The book closes the gap between general textbooks on empirical social research and special textbooks on data analysis and counteracts the increasing problem of lack of validity and reliability of survey data.
content.title_en: Survey : Introduction to the methods of survey research

content.text: Is our society "suggested" as it was recently called in the "taz"? This book asks what contact means today and describes the dilemma of the late modern man: he needs physical closeness and yet wants to be protected from injuries. A touch can be electrifying and soothing. It conveys closeness and security, but it can also threaten, it can be wound, and one can disgust itself. People need touch to thrive. But by opening themselves up to others, they are also vulnerable. Elisabeth von Thadden shows the ambivalences of the modern promise of integrity and late capitalist striving for the perfect body. That bodily injuries and unwanted touching are finally being looked for today is a great achievement. But where previously forced proximity was, today self-determined isolation threatens the direct contact in the digital worlds.
content.title_en: The non-contact society

content.text: Bitcoin and Blockchain: the failure of an ideology and the success of a revolutionary technology. The introduction of form currencies and blockchain technology poses completely new challenges for our society. Already in the near future, all the components of our lives will be under the influence of a decentralized network. Banks, companies, even governments rely on the potential of decentralized data storage. But what are blockchain and cryptocurrencies and how they emerged? This book is an indispensable reading for all who want to develop a deep understanding of this topic without dealing with formulas or program code. To introduce the author illuminates the history of money and shows how the future currency Bitcoin could develop thanks to the innovative blockchains. The legendary inventor of the first cryptocurrency, Satoshi Nakamoto, remains anonymous to this day, however, is in the currency that he has even shaped with his name, still millions of times difficult. Detailedly, the author describes the ideology behind the technology and its numerous applications. Besides the famous Bitcoins have developed by now also more cryptocurrencies of the Internet, the evolution of the Blockchain is based on the same technology.
content.title_en: Bitcoin and Blockchain : the failure of an ideology and the success of a revolutionary technique

content.text: The quest for autonomy: Reflections on digital change. Digital transformation as a networking between people, organisations, machines, and simple objects of everyday life has more or less a strong impact on all areas of life. Artificial intelligence and autonomous technical systems have a direct impact on the autonomy of individuals, which raises new questions for science and practice. Different contributions outline the gains and losses of autonomy that can be identified in the areas of law, information and communication technologies, art and design, customer relations, cryptocurrencies, media content and in the digital everyday work. Critical developments such as digital carelessness and tools and procedures such as project management software or predictive analytics are to be evaluated. This volume thus provides an overview of the current state of discussion, shows connections and sensitizes for the design of digital change.With contributions byProf. Dr. Dirk Drechsler, Prof. Dr. Dirk Westhoff, Prof. Daniel Fetzner, Prof. Dr. Hans-Ulrich Werner, Prof. Dr. Stefan Ernst, Prof. Volker Volker Singer, Prof. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr.
content.title_en: The quest for autonomy : Reflections on digital change

content.text: SQL Server Administration : Insider knowledge - practical & competent. SQL Server is a relational database management system of Microsoft, which is available in its current version 2017 in several editions with different scope of services. The book is addressed to readers with extensive prior knowledge in data technology and earlier versions of SQL Server and is therefore, especially in larger libraries, a good addition to the introduction work for beginners in SQL Server 2017 by K. Konopasek and R. Panther - only version 2016, but with many examples and tasks with solutions. Books on previous versions such as U. Boddenberg should be replaced. Extensively explained the numerous additional functions in the current version with their possibilities of use. Focus is on the Azure cloud service, the troubleshooting of applications, the protection of the server and its data, the performance optimization of the SQL server, high availability and the emergency recovery that goes beyond the normal backup, each separately after the different editions.
content.title_en: SQL Server Administration : Insider knowledge - practical & competent

Accordingly, this volume gathers experts from various disciplines, each of which devotes themselves to different dimensions of transport.The aim is to present the complex structure of transport and to convey a sense of the possibilities and limits of transport policy design.For the new edition, the concept of the textbook has been updated and extended.The content On the political science of transport.- Transport dimensions.- Central topics.- Outlooks The target groups Students and lecturers in political sciences Journalists Actors in politics and administration The editor Prof. Dr. Oliver Schwedes is head of the department Integrated Transport Planning at the Technical University Berlin

content.text: Death and Death in Germany: an introduction to Thanatosociology. Death, death and the coping of grief are seen primarily as events that are uninfluencing humans or as an expression of individual behaviour. Basically, however, the directions and forms that have arisen are culture, that is, socially conditioned. Death remains the ambivalence. Thus, in modern societies it was successfully fought out, i.e., it was possible to postpone it. On the other hand, there is still the deliberate, politically legitimate killing. Currently, a profound upheaval in the culture of mourning and burial is observed. In addition to a progressive professionalization, de-sacralization and anonymization, a variety of individual and milieu-specific forms are created. This sociological introduction places the change in the context of overall social developments. The content of death and death To the history of death and death To mourn and memorials Burial and cemetery culture The target groups are students and lecturers of sociology and social sciences. The author Dr. Frank Thieme is lecturer at the Ruhr-University Bochum, Faculty of Social Science.
content.title_en: Death and Death in Germany : An Introduction to Thanatosociology

content.text: Voilà un homme - About Goethe, the people and life. "Inwardly no human being learns to recognize his innermost thing. Man only recognizes himself in man, only life teaches everyone what he is, says Torquato Tasso. The thought is central in this book about Goethe, which focuses on anthropological and deep psychological motives in his life and work. Goethe's biography as well as his dramas, poems and novels are a fruitful treasure trove for human, all too human, and therefore it is worth referring him and his work time and again to our own existence. Goethe's literary figures and his way of life allow us to discuss many problems and questions of general human nature, and as a rule the solutions the poet has put forward are also extremely worth considering. Man is the most interesting thing for man and should be interested in him all by himself - Goethe meant with this basic attitude. The book in question, the surprisingly new and current perspectives on the Weimar artist and scientist, is also a way of prologue -- Biographical, Characteristic Man of the World - Conception of the Goethe-Religion - of the Human-Religion-Religous-Religiousness of the Goethe-Religion

content.text: Apps are effectively managed and marketed: their own app is successfully published: from conception to marketing. Idea and conception -- App development and project controlling -- Testing and deployment -- App Store Marketing -- Iterative app management Learn how to market your app effectively, structured and inspiringly worldwide. In this practical book you will get a concise overview of the idea and conception of an app, the development and publication of the app, and its marketing and further development. In order to describe the way to your app as vividly as possible, we will follow the entire life cycle of an app in this book. In addition, we will learn about methods for formulating and continuously improving the entire app business model. The content Idea and conception App development and project controlling Testing and deployment App Store Marketing Iterative app management The target groups app and game developers Product managers of apps Marketing managers The author Max Ott is a successful app developer and marketer, an innovative marketing consultant and a book author is also able to efficiently present their business practices, on the one hand, and to help them to manage and market their customers quickly.
content.title_en: Manage and market apps effectively: publish your own app successfully: from conception to marketing

content.text: iPhone and iPad – over 300 cool insider tips. Do you know tapbacks? Have you ever used your phone as a flashlight? And how can you enhance the font on your display and visually highlight icons? A. Ochsenkühn is a renowned author for Mac or the iOS family. This collection of tips and tricks contains a variety of candys in addition to conventional hints about flight mode, problem solving or gesture control, which are not (all) familiar with long-term appel users (single-hand mode, photography with the headset, telephone conferences). The basis is iOS 12 e.g. iPhone 6-X. If tips are not applicable on all devices, this is clearly marked. The texts are concise and illustrated with screenshots if necessary.
content.title_en: iPhone and iPad – over 300 cool insider tips

content.text: Basics of transcription: a practical introduction. Susanne Fuß and Ute Karbach provide practical instructions on transcription of scientific interviews for qualitative social research. The basic manual introduces the practice of social science transcription. It is aimed at students or scientifically active persons who transcribe interviews or group discussions for the first time for social science analysis. The volume presents the basics of transcription and its application, shows the advantages and disadvantages of language recognition and transcription software and gives tips on problem cases.
content.title_en: Basics of transcription: a practical introduction

content.text: Introduction to Diary methods : Theory and practice in qualitative research. The book offers an introduction to Diary methods, i.e. different accesses to diaries. This introduces a new field of interpretative social research and explains the implementation practically. Diary methods are used in social research at the latest since the Marienthal study, but a comprehensive methodological referral with them was available so far. Here the volume sets out: It provides - among other things - an overview of the use and dissemination of the procedures, -a typology for the classification of the diaries from different disciplines, -a theoretical-methodological justification of diaries as instruments of qualitative social research as well as -a knowledge of the quality of diary data. Through examples and research spragmatic hints he wants to help readers to assess and use diary instruments in their suitability for their own research questions.
content.title_en: Introduction to Diary Procedures : Theory and Practice in Qualitative Research

content.text: And it's a good thing that we have to do with the Wild West. What does the Wild West have to do with the World Wide Web? A whole lot: back then and now people started into a new, unknown world, where there was no law and law, but there were unimagined possibilities for it. And then and now, excesses and maladministrations accompany the way: gun heroes and post-coach robbers then, money-getting data monopolies today. GAFA – Google, Amazon, Facebook and Apple – have a power that the "robber barone" of Standard Oil, AT&T or the large railway companies at the end of the 19th century could only dream of. But it was also the time of the "Trust Busters" that anti-monopoly and occupational health and safety laws were used to. Because the "Blattgold Age" of the robber barone followed in America the "Progressive Era" – a half century that was shaped by social progress. What we need today is a new one, a digital propiquite that all need a new one, and that's new one. We have to do it's new rules and that're must be kept up to do it'.
content.title_en: Wild Wild Web : what the history of the Wild West teaches us about the future of digital society

The methodology can be transferred to other drainage systems without calibration, by requiring only standard operating data. In this way, the necessary remediation scope and renovation measures can be planned long- and short-term taking into account the technical and financial aspects. content.text: The German Anti-Terrorism Department of the German and European Anti-Terrorism Department of the German Federal Ministry of the Interior, the German Federal Ministry of the Interior, the German Federal Ministry of the Interior, the German Federal Ministry of Defence and the German Federal Ministry of Defence, the German Federal Ministry of Defence and the German Federal Ministry of Defence, the German Federal Ministry of Defence and the German Federal Ministry of Defence, the German Federal Ministry of Defence and the German Federal Ministry of Defence, the German Federal Ministry of Defence and the German Federal Ministry of Defence and the German Federal Ministry of Defence, the German Federal Ministry of Defence and the German Federal Ministry of Defence and the German Federal Ministry of Defence and the German Federal Ministry of Justice. • The German Federal Ministry of Defence and the German Federal Ministry of Defence and the German Federal Ministry of Defence and the German Federal Ministry of Defence and the German Federal Ministry of Justice and the German Federal Ministry of Justice and the German Federal Ministry of Justice and the German Federal Ministry of Justice and the German Federal Ministry of Justice and the German Federal Ministry of Justice are responsible for the fight against terrorism.

content.text: The counterrevolution: the struggle of governments against their own citizens. The military strategy of fighting uprisings is developing - especially in the course of the "war on terror" - more and more into a new form of government. The author analyses this development from the perspective of a legal and political scientist. - Review: The author is a professor of law and political science, works as a defender for those condemned to death and is a committed human rights activist. In his analysis he is devoted to a frightening development. The way in which colonial uprisings were fought in the past has developed into a new form of government in the course of the "war on terror". In this context, not only phantom enemies are targeted, but more and more every citizen. What amazes the author most is the fact that this development goes without counter-resistance. The author Carolin Emcke sums up the current argument: "The American president constantly generates new obscene spectacles, which can be scandalized - thus the actual scandals can remain unobserved" - the most important argument is recommended to his book.
content.title_en: Counterrevolution: the struggle of governments against their own citizens

content.text: Power and social intelligence: why modern societies threaten to fail. "Fairness lies in the nature of man. This is evidenced by social psychological experiments. But without pressure from outside, social cohesion is dwindling, the philosopher Michael Pauen warns. In his book, he shows that inequalities arise in societies without external threats. The West has no common enemy – and that is a danger to democracy (No. 1 of the non-fiction list for June 2019)
content.title_en: Power and Social Intelligence: Why Modern Societies Threaten to Fail

content.text: Digital ethics: a value system for the 21st century. In its non-social-critical non-fiction book, Sarah Spiekermann develops an ethics for the technologies of the future - and at the same time a plea for freedom and self-determination in the age of digitalization. Apps that send unsolicited information; cars controlled by Google machines; language assistants who make orders for us - ask more and more people: What does digitalization do with me and my life? Sarah Spiekermann criticizes that we are being degraded to passive recipients of a de-mining technology.She therefore demands a radical rethink: we need a technology that serves us instead of mastering us.Digitization must no longer be driven by the profit-seeking of IT corporations, but must help to realize values such as friendship, privacy and freedom. For only in this way will we be able to secure our human being in a digitalized world of life.
content.title_en: Digital Ethics: a value system for the 21st century

content.text: The resonance strategy: why we need to rethink sustainability. The author is an educational and social scientist and has dealt with the "creativity of slowness" and "dissipation" early on. Here the phenomenon of "time" is now treated with its many aspects both abstractly and in often own language, as well as concretely. An important aspect, therefore, is the resonance, which according to Friedrich Cramer and his "general resonance theory" "contains the world in its innermost together". Thus, the cohesion of the world is explained, but not yet its change in time. Thus, the first chapter deals with the relationship "time and resonance". Not quite stringently, three chapters follow the human environment, in its "co-world" and "inner world", which can and should be experienced as "resonance spaces". One of the recommendations is to "take over from the monetary welfare to the time state", which is explained in concrete and enlightening also by an "excursion: unconditional basic income and redistribution of time".
content.title_en: The Resonance Strategy: Why We Need to Rethink Sustainability

content.text: We and the intelligent machines: how algorithms determine our lives and how we can use them for ourselves. How we can make a better one from the digital world. How to defeat cancer before it arises. Prevent the crime before it happens. Getting the dream job, without vitamin B. algorithms make long-held desires become reality. But they can also eliminate the solidarity-based health system, cause discriminatory court rulings or exclude people from the labour market. Algorithms already determine our lives today. This book describes their chances and risks for each of us by means of vivid case examples. And it makes concrete suggestions on how we can put artificial intelligence at the service of society.
content.title_en: We and the intelligent machines: how algorithms determine our lives and how we can use them for ourselves

content.text: The final decree of the prosecution office: a guide for exams and practice. The entry into the work at the prosecution office and also the practical »procuratorial final examination statement«, which is often the subject of exams, is difficult for many referenda, since it differs clearly from the usual verdict clause. Not only pragmatic solutions are expected, but also the mastery of some formalities. With the valuable hints and instructions of this work, these difficulties for referenda, but also for the »young« prosecutor are to be mastered well. The various types of dispositions and their most important procedural problems are discussed in detail and illustrated by overviews. A exam with detailed solution completes the volume and enables the training of the learned on the »practical case«.
content.title_en: Final decree of the prosecutor's office : a guide for exam and practice
Digital transformation in healthcare : Transformation, innovation, disruption

content.text: Manual series : Older than (Co-)producers of district networks - Impulse from the project QuartiersNETZ / Forschungsinstitut Geragogik, Fachhochschule Dortmund (ed.) ; Manual 5: Technology support - Building initiatives to strengthen the participation of older people in the district. How can older people be supported in the use of technology and especially digital media and thus receive more opportunities for digital and social participation? Manual 5 provides answers - with suggestions on how initiatives for "technology support" can be developed and expanded. Using project experiences with civic-minded technology ambassadors and technology managers working in outpatient care in Gelsenkirchen, it is presented how it can be possible to build sustainable structures and shape qualification formats for the entry into technical support interesting and targeted. Both the support of a learning platform and tips for accompanying the commitment in practice are discussed.
content.title_en: Manual series : Older than (co-)producers of district networks - Impulse from the project QuartiersNETZ / Forschungsinstitut Geragogik, Fachhochschule Dortmund (ed.) ; Manual 5: Technology support - Building initiatives to strengthen the participation of older people in the district

content.text: 8-bit microcontrollers : understand PIC and AVR. PIC and AVR refer to two important microcontroller families, which are relatively inexpensive and are often used because of their easy programming. Literature has been discussed more often, e.g. J. Henning (ID-G 5/17 - AVR programming for cross-inputers) or G. Spanner (ID-B 27/15 - AVR programming especially in computer science lessons). The author is known for a more special work on data exchange between microcontrollers and peripherals via serial interfaces (ID-G 33/17). The book here is a basic book based on many examples. It deals with the architecture and pin assignment of the mentioned microcontroller families and explains details of pin access with short programs in Assembler. This allows a very deep understanding of technology, in contrast to a C programming. The assembler examples are realized on a universal hole grid board. - The book ends with a construction instruction for a simple programming device for microcontrollers.
content.title_en: 8-bit microcontroller : Understanding PIC and AVR

content.text: Management of digital transformation : interdisciplinary theoretical perspectives and practical approaches. Digitalisation has a significant influence on the activities of almost all organizations. In this context, the question no longer arises whether the digitalization affects existing activities of organizations. Rather, the question arises in which areas and to what extent this influence takes place and how the effects on changes in working, organizational and market structures as well as the associated processes and strategies can be adequately handled. In view of these observations, the aim of the book is to address the topic of digital transformation from the perspective of management research and practice. This is to illuminate the multifaceted phenomenon of digital transformation from as many different perspectives as possible.
content.title_en: Management of digital transformation : interdisciplinary theoretical perspectives and practical approaches

content.text: Technical expansion of buildings: and sustainable building technology. The state-of-the-art technology is the latest in the completely revised basic work. The new chapter "Energy concepts" brings together the numerous explanations on sustainable building systems. The technical contents are compressed according to the relevant facts and contexts for architects and civil engineers. The comprehensive illustration section with detailed drawings for the pictorial commentary of the text has been revised and updated. The "Bohne" remains therefore an indispensable foundation for the technical expansion with the dynamic technological development, the increasing comfort demands and the requirements for an economic and environmentally friendly handling of energy. The content Basics - sanitary rooms - waste water and water technology - heat and cooling systems - space air technology - electrical engineering - conveyor systems - energy concepts The target group Architects and civil engineers in study and practice The author Univ.-Prof. Dr.-Ing. Dirk Bohne teaches building technology at Leibniz Universität Hannover and is a partner of engineering companies for technical building equipment in Düsseldorf, Siegen and Berlin Fundamentals - Sanitary rooms - - Waste water technology - heat and cooling systems - cooling systems - electrical engineering - electrical engineering - energy systems -
content.title_en: Technical development of buildings : and sustainable building technology

content.text: Screenshots: Literature on the web. We hold the timeline and take a screenshot: What new literature, what procedures and authorship, what political interventions have found their place in the digital? This volume gives an insight into the new writing methods in the virtual space. Instagram or Facebook, Twitter or blogs: Here new creative text forms are created that fit into a sign limit or grow further through likes and shares. Literature is not only what fits between two book covers. It is created digitally, dynamically, often collectively or in dialogue with readers and with a very own poetry. "Screenshots. Literature on the web" emerges from a conference of the Bavarian Academy of Writing at the Literaturhaus Munich. How good, how new, how important is this literature in the post-digital age, was asked. The volume focuses these questions on four thematic complexes: In what tradition of small forms are these texts? Which is the "I" that speaks in them? What new methods of bot literature and texts are there through algorithms? And finally: Which new forms of political intervention are tested in them?
content.title_en: Screenshots : Literature on the Web

content.text: How we will live: the development of the apartment and the architecture of tomorrow. Cities are growing, rents and prices for city apartments are exploding, the space in the metropolises is running out. In the countryside, emigration and vacancy are lamented. How can there be affordable and decent housing for all? New housing concepts are in demand - urban planners and architects all over the world are already working on it. Klaus Englert presents an analysis on a current topic that concerns each of us. He traces the development of modern living since the end of the 19th century and outlines the direction in which residential architecture is developing today and in the future, from active house to "Dachacher". Interviews with international architects, among others with Winy Maas and Werner Sobek, provide first-hand information on how they can imagine the urban living conditions of the future
content.title_en: How we will live : the development of the apartment and the architecture of tomorrow

content.text: Red List of endangered animals, plants and fungi in Germany / Federal Office for Nature Conservation (BfN) ; Volume 7: Plants. Volume 7 of the Red List of endangered animals, plants and fungi in Germany deals with the plant groups of terrestrial, limnic and marine habitats (with the exception of the marine macroalgae, which were already published in Volume 2 of the marine organisms). Thus the risk analysis of the plants in this series is completed. In this volume the fern and flower plants (Trachaeophyta) with 4,305 taxa and the mosses (Anthocerophyta, Marchantiophyta and Bryophyta) are completely treated with 1,195 taxa. The four algae groups (Vaucheriaceae) and the ornamental algae (Phaeophyae) with 3,152 taxa and red algae (Rhodophyta), the limnic diatoms (Bacillariophyta), the tube algae (Desmidiales) are also treated with this information on the significance of the species of the world.
content.title_en: Red List of endangered animals, plants and fungi in Germany / Federal Office for Nature Conservation (BfN) ; Volume 7: Plants

content.text: Hannes Meyer and the Bauhaus : in the dispute of interpretations. The volume takes a new look at Hannes Meyer, the second Bauhaus director in Dessau, who was politically pushed out of office in 1930. The book documents how the committed architect and socialist has communicated his idea of the Bauhaus from the time he took up office as Bauhaus director until his death. On the other hand, international experts investigate in a series of essays how Meyer's positions have changed and been discussed and received in different social and political contexts. This not only reflects the potential of Hannes Meyer's ideas, but also documents a history of the interrelationship between architecture and politics based on one of the most controversial positions of the avant-garde of the 20th century. In the volume, for the first time, extremely inaccessible originals of German and/or hitherto not translated into German Bauhaus catalogues appear as reprints
content.title_en: Hannes Meyer and the Bauhaus : in the dispute of interpretations

content.text: Manual series : Older than (co-)producers of district networks - Impulse from the project QuartiersNETZ / Forschungsinstitut Geragogik, Fachhochschule Dortmund (ed.) ; Manual 1: Urban quarters : Understanding framework conditions and understanding starting situation. Urban development in urban societies is highly on course. Their success is always dependent on framework conditions, which vary from region to region, from municipality to municipality. Before such a development begins, it is important to understand and describe the framework conditions, for example (social-)structural, demographic, milieucultural and (senior) political conditions and transformation processes. How can the initial situation of selected districts be empirically captured? Manual 1 goes on to this exemplarily - with reference to the Ruhr area and the city of Gelsenkirchen - to develop "good" life. If one knows the framework conditions, the initial situation has captured this is a good basis, with older and for older people.
content.title_en: Manual series : Older than (co-)producers of district networks - Impulse from the project QuartiersNETZ / Forschungsinstitut Geragogik, Fachhochschule Dortmund (ed.) ; Manual 1: City quarters : Understanding the framework conditions and understanding the initial situation

content.text: The fight against climate change is no longer solely the subject of scientific discussions, but is one of the central challenges facing mankind. The book presents the institutional framework conditions necessary to keep emissions below the necessary threshold of 2°C. Without international cooperation and cross-border initiatives, this goal will not be achieved. Since the 1970s, the international community has committed itself to protecting climate and the environment in countless agreements. A selection of the most important agreements is set in the natural scientific context of climate genesis and will be illuminated on its socio-economic and cultural implications. To this end, the topics of climate impacts and the scientific foundations of climate change are described first. The institutional and technical instruments of climate protection policy are discussed and extensively selected conferences are documented under the umbrella of the United Nations. From the conferences, the clear signal for the willingness to develop the practical instruments for climate protection is examined in the context of the research and research activities of the University of Göttingen. After Paris 2015, it can be observed that climate change can only be influenced by a more comprehensive internationalization. The author Ulrich Ranke is a professor of the Department of Development and the Department of Geography.
content.title_en: Climate and environmental policy

content.text: Dialog Robots: How Bots and Artificial Intelligence Change Media and Mass Communication. Technologies such as artificial intelligence and natural language programming become triggers of the so-called "Dialogue Turnaround". This book understands the mass distribution of autonomous language dialogue systems and automatic language assistants. The author examines which technologies are already available or are soon to be ready for series production. He analyses concrete uses and fields of application of bots and asks himself what needs to be considered in planning and conception, what changes in media and corporate communication are to be expected. The book also highlights the psychosocial consequences that come to our society when language dialogue systems are used in large numbers. The content • Characteristics of the Dialogue Turnaround • Digitization as drivers of the Dialogue Turnaround • Dialog Systems in everyday life • Conversational Design • Psychosocial consequences of the Dialogue Turnaround • Expulses the Dialogue Turnaround the Scriptures • Consequences of the Dialogue Turnaround The target groups of practitioners in the areas of media, marketing and corporate communication since the beginning. Scientists in the field of marketing, media and communication science and linguistics. The author Dr. Armin Sieber is a researcher at the University of Media Science.
content.title_en: Dialog Robots : How Bots and Artificial Intelligence Change Media and Mass Communication

content.text: Freedom and Communication: To Ensuring the constitutionally binding framework of communicative self-determination in a networked society. Introduction -- Mass Media Public Discourse -- Constitutional framework and mass media public discourse -- Execution of the constitutional framework -- Summary in Theses This book provides answers to how the constitutional protection of free public discourse can be successfully achieved in times of Facebook and Fake News. It examines how the constitution responds to a mass media discourse not only classically edited by radio and press, but also by a multitude of individuals, and how the understanding of constitutional building blocks that shape the discourse can be updated. The technical and economic conditions of mass media communication have fundamentally changed. The prevailing constitutional dogmatic protection concept - a "substitution model of freedom-- cannot sufficiently take account of this change. Today, the individual no longer only has to be protected before, but also in his media power. Based on communication-scientific findings, a constitutional understanding is developed that places the individual at the centre of a free mass media discourse.
content.title_en: Freedom and communication: To secure communicative self-determination in a networked society under constitutional law

content.text: Introduction to bar theory according to Timoshenko and Euler-Bernoulli. Basic equations of elastostatics -- Derivation of Timoshenko bar theory -- Derivation of Euler-Bernoulli bar theory -- Application examples The first order bar theory serves in the elastostatics to calculate voltages and deformations on a bar. Here, further calculations, such as a strength proof, and the design of bars, are distinguished into the Timoshenko (theory of the push-soft bar) and Euler-Bernoulli bar theory (theory of the push-resistant bar). The content of basic equations of elastostatics can be performed with knowledge of the tension and deformations, as for example a strength proof, and the design of bars. The necessary model assumptions and the corresponding leads are presented in this essentially understandable and application-oriented manner.
content.title_en: Introduction to Bar Theory according to Timoshenko and Euler-Bernoulli

content.text: (a) Introduction -- B) Legal development -- C) Right to use railway infrastructure -- D) Individual aspects of network access -- E) Analysis and conclusion -- Q) Final word -- Summary -- Annex: Explanation of roadmap diagrams -- Bibliography The railway legislation in its present form is a young area of law that has only been created by the railway reform which took effect on 1 January 1994. A central element of this reform is the opening of the railway sector to competition. As the establishment of a new rail network parallel to the existing economic situation, competition in this sector can only arise if the existing railway network is opened to interested companies. Thus, the regulation of network access is at the heart of the new railway legislation. The present work deals with all aspects of access to railway infrastructure, starting with the network access criteria for the allocation of infrastructure capacity and the fixing of prices for infrastructure use up to the management of railway operations and legal protection opportunities.
content.title_en: Non-discriminatory access to railway infrastructure in Germany

content.text: The problem will be of immense importance to mankind for a long time. What only a few generations of highly radioactive waste have produced, must thousands of generations after us be as safe as possible from the environment. Worldwide, not a single "final repository" is in operation. The large clean-up is constantly ignored, postponed or prevented. Why was the search for a location so far in vain? Can well-equipped intermediate camps defuse the situation? In this introduction, Achim Brunnengraber gives a sound overview of the natural-scientific and economic sides of the "final storage" and deals with the social, political and democratic developments in this process.In the second, revised edition, he goes to institutional change, the site selection law and the National Accompanying Body in Germany. The author thus prepares central escape lines from the complex mass situation of interests, responsibilities and participation claims and outlines solutions.
content.title_en: Eternity loads : the "final storage" of radioactive waste as a social, political and scientific project ; an introduction

content.text: Education for the Attitude to Learning and Work : Results of the Study on the Education of Upper-Level Pupils. On the Theoretical and Methodological Perspectives of an Education for the Attitude to Work and Learning in Higher-Level Pupils / Werner Dorst -- Psychological Problems of the Development of Attitudes to Learning and Work in Pupils / Manfred Clauss -- Didactic Studies on Attitude to Learning / Horst Wenge -- Some Results, Conditions and Problems of Education for the Socialist Attitude to Work / Gisela Knüpfer
content.title_en: Education for the Attitude to Learning and Work : Results of the Study on the Education of Upper School Students

content.text: Literary studies - introduction to a language game. Klappentext: "And is there not the case where we play and make up the rules as we go along?" (Ludwig Wittgenstein). Who reads is already in the middle of the sign-mediated game of encounters with words and texts. Literary studies try to make this game visible. The present volume presents it as an open set of tasks and solutions; he wants to raise attention for what we do when reading and writing texts. In five groups, prerequisites for reading, linguistic operations, strategies of structuring, building blocks of composition in text and image media, the handling of text sets are presented exemplary and encouraging to make critical participation.
content.title_en: Literature - Introduction to a language game

content.text: Costs and benefits in occupational health and safety. The text discusses various aspects of health care and care in the industrialised countries. It is mainly about the financing of health care. Especially because of the sharp increase in health care costs, it is necessary to find a balance between economic, technological institutional and social developments. It is discussed how, on the one hand, the financial burden on health care and, on the other hand, the best and comprehensive health care can be reconciled.
content.title_en: Costs and benefits in occupational health and safety

content.text: A new philosophy of biology. Ernst Mayr: "A new philosophy of biology". Preface by Hubert Markl. From the English by Inge Leipold. Piper Verlag, Munich 1991. 470 pp., born, 58,- DM
content.title_en: A new philosophy of biology

content.text: Herrenhaus Europa - Gender relations in the welfare state. Because many bodies have been involved in women's issues and equal opportunities for years in the EC, expectations have been reached (see Randzio-Plath: BA 5/79, 201). Bremer women scientists provide informative material in two detailed comparisons for 20 European countries. The state of women's and family policy is determined, partly tabularly, compared with demographic, socio-economic data and legal-social protection. Furthermore, the still existing disadvantages in spouse taxation, in foreign policy and in the proportion of women in management positions are again documented. The collection volume supports facts H. Hörburger "Europas Frauen gequellen mehr" (BA 4/92), also due to the useful country comparisons widely applicable. (LK/HH: Günther)
content.title_en: Herrenhaus Europa - Gender relations in the welfare state

content.text: Ecology and environmental protection: an action book. The focus here is on the possibilities of individuals to become active for the environment. Whether alone, in action groups or in citizens' initiatives, scientific foundations and current research results are explained and practical implementations in environmental protection are shown."
content.title_en: Ecology and environmental protection : an action book

content.text: The study aims to examine the conditions, marginal conditions and results of alternative planning and financing procedures. The study should help to make the controversial discussion of this subject more relevant. It should also mention countries and universities considering such implementation possibilities, providing assistance for the preparation and implementation of corresponding construction projects. The study focuses on the documentation and analysis of "unconventional" planning cases, which are described in detail in the course and outcome. It should also provide countries and universities considering such implementation possibilities, providing assistance for the preparation and implementation of corresponding construction projects.
content.title_en: Alternative methods of planning and financing university buildings

content.text: No beautiful country. Klappentext: This book is the critical portrait of a beautiful country. It takes stock of the state of our forests, rivers and lakes, the air and the soil. It shows failures, pays tribute to the nationwide movement of citizens' initiatives and examines the possibilities of an ecologically oriented policy for the eighties. A book with masterful color photographs, informative maps, environmental tips, environmental lexicon, addresses of citizens' initiatives and a chronicle of the environmental movement.
content.title_en: Not a beautiful country...

content.text: The European Water Framework Directive requires the good ecological status of all waters by 2015. The German Council for the Conservation of Waters (DRL) in its current opinion shows how the implementation of the EC Water Framework Directive can be made much more cost-effective by taking into account the impact of jets in river water systems. Specific, spatially limited measures for the expansion and networking of water habitats and a dedicated entertainment that can lead to a comprehensive improvement of the ecological condition are necessary. The use of the funds can be optimised by limiting the measure in the redesign section to the minimum necessary size for the activation of the beam effect, provided that complementary support measures (e.g. removal of barriers or addition of stepping stones) are implemented on the route [...] (source: Verlag)
content.title_en: Compensation of structural deficits in river basins by blast effect : opinion and results of the project "Potentials of river basins for the compensation of structural deficits ("radiation effect") from 01 October 2006 to 30 November 2007

content.text: Contributions to the Elsbeere. [...] Originally, it was the sympathy for an exclusive tree species that was aesthetically appealing to bloom and autumn dress, whose wood was named "the most beautiful wood in the world" at the 1900 Paris World Exhibition, so today its tolerance towards the expected climate warming is the focus. Almost inevitably we will pay more attention to the Elsbeere in the future. Thus, the "fine unknown" may become a "faithful companion" in the forest, the hallway, gardens and parks (source: LWF).
content.title_en: Contributions to the Elsbere

content.text: They were silent heroes : women and men who saved Jews from the Nazis. Portraits of 40 people (including Oskar Schindler) who were saved by their help during Hitler's fascistism Jews
content.title_en: They were silent heroes : women and men who saved Jews from the Nazis

content.text: The expert report on the regional plan Düsseldorf shows historically grown cultural landscape areas and archaeological areas in the regional district Düsseldorf. - - For the regional district Düsseldorf, the district government Düsseldorf is building on the existing regional development plan 99. The LVR cultural service stations LVR-Amt für Bodendendenkmalpflege im Rheinland, LVR-Amt für Denkmalpflege im Rheinland and the LVR-Fachbereich Umwelt have jointly developed a specialist contribution on the cultural landscape, which describes the cultural heritage of the region and highlights it as a basis for planning. Essential part of this report are maps that identify archaeological areas as find maintenance zones and 242 historically grown cultural landscape areas.
content.title_en: Technical article Cultural landscape to the regional plan Düsseldorf : preserved cultural landscape development

content.text: Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Bet-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Bet-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Beton-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-Bet-

content.text: Materials for the planning of the canteen: a documentation and comparative evaluation of new canteen buildings from 1985. With this publication HIS presents a comprehensive study on the planning and construction of mensen. The focus is on the documentation of new canteen buildings from the last years as well as the determination of general planning bases. Structure: 1. Introduction and overview 2. Overall organization of the food supply and operating modes of the canteen 3. Short documentation of new canteen buildings since 1985 (including Friedrich Schiller University Jena) 4. Long documentation of selected canteen new buildings since 1985 5. Determination of planning bases (5.1. Basic data for the determination of capacities 5.2. Operating area 5.3. Guest area 5.4. Additional areas of use 5.5. Costs 5.6. Total requirements for a canteen planning) Appendix (including overview of indicative and orientation values, commentated bibliography) (PHF/uebern.)
content.title_en: Materials for the planning of the cafeteria : a documentation and comparative evaluation of new cafeteria buildings from 1985

content.text: Information and Knowledge Processing in the Social Sciences : Contributions to the Implementation of New Information Technologies; [a publication of the Information Centre Social Sciences (IZ) of the Arbeitsgemeinschaft Sozialwissenschaftischer Institute e.V. (ASI)]. This volume contains a large number of specialist contributions, which were created in special events on new developments in the field of social science - computer science - information or were written specifically for this volume. Both as introductions and as part of special questions, approaches from the fields of artificial intelligence, image recognition, communication networks, hypertext, Scientometry, bibliometrics and others, each with reference to social science applications, are presented.
content.title_en: Information and Knowledge Processing in the Social Sciences : Contributions to the Implementation of New Information Technologies; [a publication of the Information Centre Social Sciences (IZ) of the Arbeitsgemeinschaft Sozialwissenschaftischer Institute e.V. (ASI)]

content.text: Modernisation of social work through method development and reflection. The book aims to contribute to the method reflection to the further development of social work: On the one hand, in several contributions, the personal and the steruerungs- und organizational-related methodological concepts should be subjected to a critical inventory. On the other hand, further contributions will propose a concept for overcoming the social technological paradigm and its significance for the scientific foundation of social work or the professional professional identity of the social workers.
content.title_en: Modernisation of social work through method development and reflection

content.text: The educational madness. Structure: Not an emergency, but a delusion. - Against the paedagogy cult. - "Education in its own hands" or The delusion of the educational market economy. - Views of a paedagogy republic (overmute to the emancipation?, unwound education, United mood situation, popular education?). - Education in contradiction. - Between generations. - From the all-time paedagogy furor (work education, screen education, transport education...). - Experience-paedagogy excursion - the world as a museum and safari park. - Electrified language or the equipment of modern people. - Untimelyness - about the education of the university (one-sided - speech, anspraech, speechless - jargon of communication science, standard - Is that then science?, practical relevance - a Trojan clapper, time-maesses - summit formation, education - fear of freedom?, responsibility of science?). - In good hands - school-up? - The last school? - The school.
content.title_en: The delusion of education

content.text: The author has been working on designing educational and play spaces suitable for children for years. This book provides instructions on the construction of playhouses made of different materials, for the creation of suitable gardens, water systems and miniature landscapes. Numerous photos show that solid buildings are meant here. A final chapter gives parents' initiatives and educators tips for planning and implementation. Interesting alternative to literature on playground design. (2) (LK/W: Scharmann)
content.title_en: Design and experience natural spaces

content.text: Informatik / Heinz-Peter Gumm, Manfred Sommer ; Volume 2: Computer architecture, operating systems, computer networks. The authors are known for a standard textbook "Introduction to computer science", which was repeatedly reissued in a 2- to 3-year cycle. The 10th edition was discussed as last. Obviously, a thorough revision is now planned, which mainly addresses students in bachelor's degree programmes. Three volumes are published; the 1st (programming, algorithms and data structures) has already been discussed. The 2nd volume here focuses on technical topics: computer architecture, operating systems, computer networks. The authors start with transistors and the highly complex circuits from which computers are constructed and come briefly also on assembly programming. The operating systems focus on Unix/Linux and Windows. Computer networks are represented as large units that can also include printers, video devices and even everyday devices. The closing peak is the Internet with its diverse services.
content.title_en: Informatik / Heinz-Peter Gumm, Manfred Sommer ; Volume 2: Computer architecture, operating systems, computer networks

content.text: Numerics of ordinary differential equations / Martin Hermann ; Volume 1: Initial value problems and linear marginal value problems. Verl.Beschr.: Systems of ordinary differential equations play a fundamental role in mathematical modelling of scientific, technical and economic processes as well as in internal mathematical questions. This two-volume textbook provides an introduction to the theory and practice of modern numerical processes, which are used in the software packages currently in use. The first volume focuses on integrative techniques for solving initial value problems and linear marginal value problems, while the second volume deals with numerical methods for solving nonlinear marginal value problems. The presentation of the material is also suitable for mathematicians, natural scientists and engineers. Easy to understand and illustrate introduction to the topic:Retains a variety of MATL methods free of charge With the help of the online application of the MATL, the most important peripheral material?
content.title_en: Numerics of ordinary differential equations / Martin Hermann ; Volume 1: Initial value problems and linear marginal value problems

content.text: Concrete calendar 2018 : Building protection, fire protection. For the design of economical structures with minimal repair, the latest state of the art in WU constructions and surface protection are presented. Currently, BIM are with examples, simplified proof of fire resistance duration and fire stress.
content.title_en: Concrete calendar 2018 : Building protection, fire protection

content.text: City - State - Region : regional cooperation in the area of the northern German city states Bremen and Hamburg. Urban-Umland relations have again come to the attention of regional planning policy as well as the spatially interested sciences in recent years. The urban-Umland problems, which are generally equally valid for all German city regions, are further exacerbated by the northern German city states regions Bremen and Hamburg. The present elaboration of the current state of cooperation in the areas Bremen and Hamburg and the possibilities for an optimization of approaches is aimed at developing proposals for a (further) improvement of cooperation from the intensive comparative discussion of the respective policy approaches.
content.title_en: City - State - Region : regional cooperation in the area of the northern German city states Bremen and Hamburg

content.text: Scientifically working with Word. From the content: handling Word 2000 and 2002; data security; basic program functions; setting up documents; important steps of daily work; designing layouts; headings and current text; source work, citation techniques and footnotes; illustrations, tables and cross references; inserting tables of contents, picture directories and other directories, and PDF export.
content.title_en: Working with Word Scientifically

content.text: The majority of older people want to stay in the familiar living environment for as long as possible. Due to demographic change, age-appropriate construction for architects and planners becomes an increasingly important task. The Swiss architect Beyeler analyses the requirements for house and land for a living in all phases of life in the large-format, attractively designed volume, conveys perspectives for new possibilities for the use of residential property and shows age-appropriate solutions on 12 houses and condominiums. The projects include new buildings, conversions, extensions, extensions or house divisions, which allow the best possible flexibility of use. With numerous interior and exterior photographs, floor plans, location plans and cross-sections for the previous-after-situation. Recommended according to the guide by Peter Burk: "Rebuilding age-appropriately" (BA 8/09), besides the sample collections "Living barrier-free" (BA 6/08), "Planning and building for living in old age" (BA 3/05), A. Barsuhn: "Stage-appropriately renovated" (BA 8/09).
content.title_en: Further building : Re-use of housing in old age

content.text: Plant use: the design book; basics of design; woody plants, perennials, roses, summer flowers; from the idea to planting plan; 8 tables. The author, working as a professor at the Erfurt University of Applied Sciences for the field of plant science/plant use, presents in this extensive compendium the basics of design with plants in gardening and landscaping. The rich, very informative pictorial material (colour photographs and drawings) in combination with the clearly structured and sophisticated text did not come up with a "dry" textbook, but rather an appealing non-fiction book. The first two chapters deal with the importance of shapes and colours as well as the diverse possibilities of design. The main part of the book deals with the tasks of the plants used (woody plants, perennials, summer flowers). Finally, the author shows the way from the sketch of ideas to the planting plan. A comprehensive standard work with detailed expertise for students and students of GaLaBau, but also for ambitious garden owners who want to obtain interesting information about the design of their garden. Purchase before the appropriate audience. (3) Standard of garden construction: a broad range of landscape construction.
content.title_en: Plant use: the design book; basic design; woody plants, perennials, roses, summer flowers; from idea to planting plan; 8 tables

content.text: Educational relations between recognition, injury and ambivalence. The way in which educators address the learners is a consequence of their well-being and achievements at all levels of education. Recognizing, hurting or ambivalent patterns of action affect development and learning as well as democratic socialisation.
content.title_en: Educational relations between recognition, injury and ambivalence

content.text: Methods of cultural anthropology. How do you develop a research question? And with which methods are best dealt with? How are data collected, analyzed, interpreted and presented? And how do you behave in the field and in the team? "Methods of cultural anthropology" answers these and many other questions reliably and well-founded.
content.title_en: Methods of Cultural Anthropology

content.text: Free time for the exploitation of volunteering and free work. Pinl is a attentive contemporary witness, worked politically, as a radio journalist and writes for the "taz". Her social criticism, coupled with irony, was refreshed in "men can clean up" (BA 7/97). Honorary posts were already her topic (BA 9/10). This is about the changes since 1989 with the increasing use of volunteering and civic engagement by politics and welfare associations, in order to compensate for omissions and savings. She assesses political measures and pronouncements, brings impressive examples (also figures) and recognizes the effects on the fragmented labour market. The Goodwill industry also takes them on grain, regards tablets and almosas as problematic as S. Selke (ID-A 19/13). She refers to him and other critics, also in content and tendency similar critical book by G. Notz (ID-A 5/13). Finally, she warns against the fact that good faith, helpful people are used as a misconducter for political action.
content.title_en: Voluntary service? : on the exploitation of volunteering and free work

content.text: Cultural heritage : an introduction. Cultural heritage is a much discussed topic today: it is the subject of international cultural policy. It is used as an advertising argument for tourism. And it serves different actors as a political instrument. But how does things, spaces and traditions become cultural heritage? (publisher)
content.title_en: Cultural heritage : an introduction
