content.title_en: Create PDFs Successfully

content.text: Megastructures : Architecture utopias between 1955 and 1975. Megastructures have been on the agenda of the current architecture discourse since Rem Koolhaa's Metabolism Talks at the latest. The focus is also on the question of the contribution that architecture utopias made to the history of the building between 1955 and 1975. With a new will to form, the post-war generation emancipated from the legacy of the past. Christoph Düesberg is exemplary in investigating the work of Japanese metabolists, the British group Archigram and French visionary Yona Friedman. This title therefore also contributes to a debate on the value of utopian designs for future architectural and urban development.
content.title_en: Megastructures : Architecture utopias between 1955 and 1975

content.text: Traces of life in stone : Excursions into the Earth's history of Central Europe. The richly illustrated and easy to understand essay collection with contributions by several scientists gives a comprehensive overview of the Earth's history in Central Europe from a biological and paleontological point of view. (1)
content.title_en: Traces of life in stone : Excursions to the Earth's history of Central Europe

content.text: Experienced humanity: memories. Hans Küng tells the story of life "my last three decades". He describes how the Roman Church's attempt to isolate its most dangerous critic (because of the interior of the church) fails. The Pope's power extends far even in the late 20th century and could destroy the life of a priest and professor. Küng, however, resists – and remains a victor. He opens up new fields, from the ecumenism of world religions to the epochal "world ethos", and is seen worldwide as one of the great pioneering thinkers. He is colorful, exciting, exciting his life has been, sums up Küng, and lets the reader participate in struggles and crises, in encounters with the greats of the earth and his own knowledge of his life. "Nevertheless, many calculations are open: Hans Küng decides his autobiography with the third volume. He tells of the loss of the teaching authority and his discovery of the world ethos.
content.title_en: Humanity experienced : memories

content.text: Drone War: Death from the bright sky; murder by remote control. For years armed, unmanned and remote-controlled missiles (drones) are being used against supposed terrorists worldwide. In the USA and Great Britain this has already caused public discussions, especially since the number of drone attacks has increased sharply and the image of war has changed profoundly. The book tries to illuminate and comprehensively inform this new type of warfare from all sides. The long-standing member of the UN, now peace activist in the USA, tells in 11 chapters understandable and vividly about the development of the drones, their technical peculiarities and the war-law aspects of their operations. It reports on the victims of the attacks, mostly civilians, in Pakistan, Yemen and Gaza and the "pilots", who are sitting in the USA at the helm and fire the highly explosive missiles of the drones. The significance of this revolutionary warfare for human and international law is emphasized. The Bundeswehr will also acquire these new weapons. For a soon, profoundly armed and unarmed personnel are being informed about the long-term and unarmed military-forced.
content.title_en: Drone War : Death from the sky; murder by remote control

content.text: A third of all adults complain about foot problems. Christian Larsen is a developer of the concept "Spiral Dynamics" for the diagnosis and therapy of all types of the movement system, which he applies here to the area of foot-feet. After introductory facts and information on anatomy, neurology etc. follows a guide for self-diagnosis of foot-feet positions such as kink-, sink- or spread foot or guiding symptoms (stuns, pain, changes). For therapy and self-help numerous spiral dynamics foot-exercises are recommended. Should a visit to professionals such as podologists, orthopaedists, physiotherapists etc. or an operation be unavoidable, checklists and background information are prepared. Also for the selection of suitable footwear there are helpful tips. With glossary and keyword list
content.title_en: Good walking for a lifetime : training instead of operating: the best exercises from Spiraldynamik®

content.text: Buddhist Symbols. The book lists 150 symbols, which are mainly from Tibetan Buddhism; with descriptions of their central statements and their respective religion related philosophy
content.title_en: Buddhist Symbols

content.text: PoetThinnerDadaists : Writer portraits of the Klewan Collection. Note International Hölderlin Bibliography: p. 170: Johann Friedrich Hölderlin (1770-1843), Heliogravure after a pastel by Franz Karl Hiemer (1786-1822)
content.title_en: PoetThunderDadaists : Writers' portraits of the Klewan Collection

content.text: Secret codes: the most famous encryption techniques and their history. After the more extensive and somewhat more sophisticated representations of cryptography and cryptoanalysis by S. Singh (BA 10/00) and R. Kippenhahn (BA 11/97 - under applied mathematics), which are also found in the literature recommendations of the volume to be discussed here, Pincock and Frary present a well manageable, according to the genre designed and abundantly illustrated non-fiction book. This also shows all highlights (Enigma, Purple and others) of the ciphering and coding or decryption of such secret writings from the first documents in ancient Egypt to quantum cryptography. Embedded in the historical background and/or consequences, the comprehensiblely explained encryption system is always in the foreground, also in the biographical notes. At the end, the authors offer their readers some codes for the self-cracking. - In addition to the above mentioned titles, the subject book, which is widely applicable, which is also already interested young people (for children see Kippenhahn: BA02 and 3heim).
content.title_en: Secret codes: the most famous encryption techniques and their history

content.text: Introduction to traffic planning: Basics, modeling, traffic forecasting, traffic networks. Systematic and clearly designed introduction for planners, engineers, students and also generally interested readers. The author was Professor of traffic planning at the University of Kassel. (Rolf Raschka) The former professor at the University of Kassel has written a concentrated introduction, ranging from basics to transport policy concepts to the future of traffic. The systematically structured, clearly designed text contains many formulas, graphics and tables. He mainly addresses planners, engineers and students, but can also address generally interested readers in parts. While the well-known traffic scientist H. Knofacher (e.g. "Virus Auto", ID-B 12/13) always criticized the planning oriented towards motorized individual traffic, Köhler deals with the problems of pedestrians, cyclists and rail drivers as well as the environmental consequences of traffic (see Johannes Meyer: "Sustainable city and traffic planning", Teubner, 2013, not displayed here). A recommendable book, which is still before the comprehensive Werner G 2:Gangabel edition of the German edition of the German road planning, German version of the German version of the German version of the German version of German road planning, German version of German.
content.title_en: Introduction to transport planning: basics, modelling, traffic forecasting, transport networks

content.text: Masing Handbuch Qualitätsmanagement. The manual classic on quality management, originally published by Walter Masing, is now published for the second time in the 6th edition by Prof. Dr.-Ing. Tilo Pfeifer and Prof. Dr.-Ing. Robert Schmitt, the former or current holder of the Chair of Manufacturing Measurement Technology and Quality Management at the WZL Machine Tools Laboratory at RWTH Aachen. The manual is based in its new edition on the contributions of the 5th edition, which have been continuously revised to take into account the current developments in quality management. However, the proven structure already established by Professor Walter Masing is maintained: quality management as the basis for the company's success and as the most important task of corporate management, quality management systems and quality management in the product life cycle of material and intangible products. In 49 chapters, over 50 leading experts from science, associations and industry have documented their knowledge and views on these different aspects of quality management. In the 6th edition, the chapters were adapted to the revised standards, standards and legal rules. New perspectives on business process management and the responsibility of the top management were not completely worked out. The layout of the work is also completely.
content.title_en: Masing Manual Quality Management

content.text: Mediterranean: [Geographie, Geschichte, Wirtschaft, Politik]. Scientific country studies of this region in transition: historical development of the territories, population, cities and economy with modern development processes in the environment, urbanization, globalization and tourism. (LK/WOB: Rugen) Review: After 10 years completely revised edition of the author of the "comprehensive scientific country studies of the greater Mediterranean region" (not available here). H.-G. Wagner has shortened his standard work by 150 pages, with structure and chapter headings remained the same. Many chapters were streamlined by the content revision. A color highlighted "overview" at the beginning calls main facts; the text is now better used for papers and technical work in upper secondary schools. Detailed, updated literature list. Jürgen Tecke's broad assessment of the region is also known for the political-economic upheaval in the north African Mediterranean states.
content.title_en: Mediterranean region : [Geography, history, economy, politics]

content.text: Computer technology-Fibel : Basics, processor technology, semiconductor memory, interfaces, data storage and components. The Computer Technology-Fibel is a hardware book about the basics of computer technology, processor technology, semiconductor memory, interfaces, data storage and components. This book is a supplement for the school and operational training and a faithful companion by the topic of computer technology. If questions or knowledge gaps arise again, then the with this book can be answered quickly and precisely. Through the Computer Technology-Fibel it is possible to acquire the basic knowledge about computer technology and thus to get a better understanding of computer technology and the correlations. Supporting this book contains far over 100 drawings and tables.
content.title_en: Computer technology-Fibel : Basics, processor technology, semiconductor memory, interfaces, data storage and components

content.text: The mathematical roots of culture: mathematical innovations and their cultural consequences. The fact that mathematicians - and thus mathematics - are generally considered as alien to the world is a widespread and deeply rooted view. This is also the subject of the ever increasing importance of mathematics for modern high-tech developments, with all the esteem that mathematics is paid for as science. This collection therefore examines, from very different perspectives, the cultural effects of mathematical discoveries. In doing so, special attention is paid to the specific cultural mechanisms of mediation. In this sample, economists and cultural scientists, mathematicians, mathematicians and computer scientists participate. The multifaceted picture that offers reveals the important role of mathematics also for cultural development as a whole. However, it is also clear that this role has always to be paid for with the abandonment of authorship: The products of mathematics can only be replaced on a larger scale with "user surfaces" of time.
content.title_en: The mathematical roots of culture: mathematical innovations and their cultural consequences

content.text: Handbook Aggression, Violence and Crime in Children and Young People. Interdisciplinary manual of 140 experts on the theory and practice of aggression, violence and crime in childhood and youth. The multiple appearance and cause structure is worked out in 5 thematic blocks, including current debates, e.g. on inclusion, stalking/(cyber) mobbing as well as optimized approaches to prevention and intervention. The contributors come from education and social sciences, psychology, criminology and legal sciences. They provide a systematic presentation of central concepts, discourses, theories and research results on the emergence and prevention of aggression, violence and crime in institutions, in family, kindergarten, school, youth assistance and peers. At the end, action perspectives. Each contribution with literature annex. - As an overarching textbook and reference work for students and professionals before the older (collective) works of W.P. Streit ("Youth Cult", BA 7/10), "Aggression and Violence among Children and Young People" (ID-G 1/99) and "Problektion und Gewaltung im Jugend-G im 43".
content.title_en: Handbook Aggression, Violence and Crime in Children and Young People

content.text: The Tree of Knowledge : the biological roots of human recognition. Humberto R. Maturana, Francisco J. Varela: "The Tree of Knowledge". From the Span. v. Kurt Ludewig. Scherz Verlag, Bern, Munich, Vienna 1987, 280 pp., born, 39.80 DM
content.title_en: The Tree of Knowledge: the biological roots of human recognition

content.text: School buildings: Handbook and planning aid. Flexibility, safety and accessibility: school buildings require the current technical, energetic and ecological standards as well as innovative construction solutions, far beyond the construction. This manual deals with school buildings from an architectural point of view. The authors carry out the cultural history development of school construction, define design tasks, formulate quality standards for contemporary learning and present typologies and spatial organizational models. According to educational levels 32 internationally successful school buildings are presented with detailed drawings and photos. Ten design parameters complete the practical planning aid for the successful construction of schools in the 21st century. With contributions by Natascha Meuser, Hans Wolfgang Hoffmann, Thomas Müller and Jochem Schneider.
content.title_en: School buildings : Manual and planning assistance

content.text: The website: 12 easy workshops for beginners. From Jacobsen there is already a very successful volume on the topic: "Website concept: Successful websites plan, implement and operate" (6th edition = 1st reissue 2011 was not available; 5th edition: ID-A 34/09). Now he has taken a different path with a co-author. "The first website in 3 minutes" promises the 1st of 12 workshops. However, it should not remain. Follow-up chapters introduce into a little HTML and CSS and then use the free loadable "Seamonkey Composer". Finally, another "website in 3 days" is created, more CSS is taught and important aspects of a website such as user friendliness or optimization for search engines are described. Even the different versions of the usual browsers are considered, the same code often different. This is illustrated with many generous colored pictures and screenshots. The well-readable square volume is also practical: it remains open if it is to be found.
content.title_en: Your own website : 12 easy workshops for beginners

content.text: Remotely controlled violence : a theory of drones. In the war at a distance it seems hardly significant that machines kill people: what counts is that they kill "human". This book shows the serious ethical, psychological and legal questions that the weapon of the armed drone poses to us.
content.title_en: Remotely controlled violence: a theory of drones

content.text: Plastics technology : Learning and workbook. Publisher's text: The "Plastics technology" provides information in an easy-to-understand way on the entire subject of plastics, from chemical basics to processing processes to waste problems and the question of recycling plastics. Key questions at the beginning of each lesson help the reader to work on them specifically; success checks at the end of each lesson enable a review of what is learned. A book for all students of the fields of plastics technology, materials technology, mechanical engineering, engineers, technicians, merchants in the entire plastics industry
content.title_en: Plastics technology : Learning and workbook

content.text: Collection goods in safety : lighting and light protection, air conditioning, security technology, fire protection. Collection goods in safety : lighting and light protection, air conditioning, security technology, fire protection / Günter S. Hilbert.
content.title_en: Collection in safety : lighting and lighting protection, air conditioning, security technology, fire protection

content.text: Differentiations think differently: Building blocks to a cultural theory of transdifference. In the course of globalization political and cultural differences appear in a new light. In the cultural sciences the consequences of superposition and mixing have been discussed for a long time. The volume presents for the first time the new concept of transdifference, which takes such zones of indeterminability and cultural multiple affiliation into account with their implicit power structures, but without neglecting the power of difference that inspires orientation. Furthermore, the potential and limits of transdifference are discussed on the basis of representative texts of selected cultural theoretic directions: interculturality (Edward T. Hall, Alexander Thomas), multiculturality (Will Kymlicka, Charles Taylor), transculturality (Fernando Ortiz, Wolfgang Welsch) and hybridity (Homi K. Bhabha, Jan Nederveen Pieterse).
content.title_en: Differential thinking : Building blocks to a cultural theory of transdifference

content.text: World of bacteria, archaeic and viruses : an introductory textbook of microbiology. This introduction is located between the subject and subject book in the entire field of microbiology. In terms of content, all important areas of microbiology, from evolution to microbial metabolism and technical applications to gene transfer, to endosymbionts and pathogens are covered. The work is attractively designed, provided with numerous color photographs and graphic representations and supplemented by a glossary, a literature and subject index.
content.title_en: World of bacteria, archaea and viruses : an introductory textbook on microbiology

content.text: Time: a cultural history. A cultural history overview of the origin and development of the various time concepts such as second, hour, day, week, season, lifetime, world time, end time, holiday, calendar, clocks and more (Dieter Altmeyer) An extensive and comprehensive history of the time culture of the Western world from the early 3rd millennium BC to today, written by the retired Berlin historian and cultural scientist A. Demandt (lastly "Pontius Pilatus", ID-B 18/12). This cultural history overview examines the origin and development of the different time concepts, time metaphors and time symbols such as second, hour, day, week, season, lifetime, world time, end time, holiday, calendar, clocks and more. Numerous quotations are documented in his remarks; black and white illustrations scattered in the text and concentrated in color illustrations at one point. In the appendix, literature directory, person and material registers. - An extremely facile, detailed, well-intelligent, well-intelligent, the reader.
content.title_en: Time : a cultural history

content.text: Mathematics for the first semester : Analysis and linear algebra for students of engineering sciences. A visual presentation of the basics of linear algebra and analysis relevant for students of engineering sciences in the first semester
content.title_en: Mathematics for the first semester : Analysis and linear algebra for students of engineering

content.text: Rapid methods for the assessment of food and its raw materials. The high demands on quality management in food are hardly possible without modern fast methods. The third carefully revised NEW edition of the "Classic" on fast methods, founded by Prof. Baltes, offers you a help. This book shows the possible applications of the respective methods and gives concrete instructions on how to carry out them. (Source: www.buchhandel.de 08.11.2010)
content.title_en: Rapid methods for assessing food and its raw materials

content.text: Industry 4.0: a practice-oriented approach. In industry, a paradigm shift is taking place, which is described as "Industry 4.0". It is about digitisation and networking of the entire value chain over the entire life cycle of products. Companies from the involved industries are working on this complex project and have already implemented first future-oriented projects that point towards Industry 4.0. This book is intended to provide the interested reader with practical expertise and provide him with valuable information.(Verlagstext)
content.title_en: Industry 4.0 : a practice-oriented approach

content.text: The fight continues: Resistance against mafia and corruption. Roberto Saviano (lastly BA 12/10), who has roused the world with his book on the mafia "Gomorrha" (BA 11/07), continues to fight against organized crime, even if he can only show himself in public with bodyguards. Based on a TV series "Vieni via con me" (Come with me) that has now been tilted by RAI, in which Saviano put his finger on the sore points of Italian society, he again describes in in in penetrating words the country's malady like the illegal toxic waste disposal, which has assumed an inconceivable extent. Saviano shows how the Calabrian N'drangheta has meanwhile also snatched its trap arms around the north of the country and how in 2009 during the earthquake in L'Aquila it became clear that many people did not have to die if not at the construction of the houses had been scourched. Especially for the German edition Saviano has written a preface in which he once again denounced the threat to Germany by means of the Mafi.
content.title_en: The fight continues : Resistance against Mafia and corruption

content.text: Young migrants online: Search for social recognition and assurance of belonging. What significance do the newly emerging social spaces on the Internet have for young migrants? In recent years, a multitude of online communities or virtual communities have emerged, which are specifically aimed at the second and third generation of immigrants in Germany, e.g. Vaybee.de, Bizimalem.de for Turkish-born, theindernet.de for indischstämmige or Asia-zone.de especially for Chinese, Japanese, Vietnamese and Korean-born young people.Beyond the narrow debate about the emergence of "virtual parallel societies" the volume shows empirically and qualitatively how they use online communities in order to find social recognition and to ensure their national-ethnic-cultural affiliation.
content.title_en: Young migrants online : Search for social recognition and assurance of belonging

content.text: Digital databases: a media theory in the age of big data. More, more, more! The digital media age is that of information. More, it is an age of information excess. Since 2007, the International Data Corporation (IDC) has regularly predicted an ever-increasing expansion of the digital information universe.1 At that time, it was estimated that 161 exabytes, i.e. 161 billion gigabytes, of digital information were created, captured or replicated (cf. IDC 2007: 3), in 2010 it was already about 1,200 exabytes (cf. IDC 2010:1). An end to this expansion is not in sight. In 2020, according to current forecasts, 40,000 exabytes of digital information are generated (cf. IDC 2012).2 Although this is mostly fleeting data that is not permanently stored, the question arises as to what effects the seemingly limitless availability of information will have.
content.title_en: Digital databases: a media theory in the age of big data

content.text: Brent Spar and the consequences : Analysis and documents on the processing of a social conflict. "Brent Spar or the future of the seas" by J. Vorager (BA 1/96) was the subject of the Greenpeace campaign against the disposal of the oil platform in the North Sea. In continuation of the (self-critical) inventory "The Greenpeace Book: Reflections and Actions" (BA 9/96) it is about the social conflict between consumer power (Shell-Boycott) and economic power (Group), more precisely: how he has expressed himself as a public opinion after Brent Spar and Moruroa. The not very extensive text is based on a study by the Hamburg office for publics. In Annex 102 documents, partly unfortunately in tiny pressure. - For expanded stocks. (3) (LK/F: Lüdtke)
content.title_en: Brent Spar and the consequences : analyses and documents on the processing of a social conflict

content.text: Creating work - now!. Klappentext: Everywhere in the western industrialized countries the number of unemployed is increasing. Practical, concrete solidarity is needed and concrete steps by the state to combat unemployment. This book aims to show possibilities.
content.title_en: Create work - now!

content.text: Migration and Integration Research - multidisciplinary perspectives : a reader. Migration and integration research are addressed in many disciplines, but each deals with different perspectives, methods and theoretical concepts. The task of this book is to present these perspectives, methods and concepts in an overview and in comparison. It becomes clear that not one and self-contained migration and integration research is to be defined, but many different research approaches with specific perspectives of knowledge. The book, which has now been published in a second, revised and expanded edition, serves to introduce the topic and is aimed not only at students but also at a wider audience, who would like to comprehensively and thematically address migration and integration research.
content.title_en: Migration and Integration Research - multidisciplinary perspectives : a reader

content.text: Animal welfare indicators: suggestions for the company's own control. As a result of the amendment of the Animal Welfare Act (TierschG § 11 paragraph 8), livestock farmers have been obliged to check the animal welfare justice of the livestock since 2014 in an operational own control. The aim is to raise awareness or strengthen the ownership of animal welfare issues. To this end, the farm managers need as objective test sizes as possible in order to assess animal welfare in their farm with reasonable effort and to be able to improve it if necessary. In two KTBL expert discussions, nearly 50 experts from science, consulting, administration, animal welfare associations and practice have compiled indicators that are particularly suitable for an operational own control for the assessment of animal welfare according to § 11 paragraph 8. The indicators should be simple to collect and at the same time sufficiently valid and reliable. In this paper, the recommendations of the experts on animal-related indicators for dairy cattle and fattening cattle, rearing calves, sows, piglets and fattening pigs, fattening turkeys and young chickens are compiled for each of the animal welfare indicators.
content.title_en: Animal welfare indicators : proposals for self-control

content.text: Self-determined norm: feminism, prenatal diagnosis, abortion. Achtelik (born 1978, social scientist, author and journalist) deals with the topic of "abduction and prenatal diagnosis" from a socio-political perspective and deals with three social movements that are active in this field: women's and disabled people's movement and "lifeguards". She criticizes the practice of prenatal diagnosis (PND) and the resulting selective abortions, which many disabled activists oppose, whose concerns are often taken by "lifeguards". The author's concern is to find a way to live up to the right of self-determination on his own body and the right of life of the disabled. She pleads for abortion if a woman does not want to have a child, but is against selective abortion and the standardized PND. A challenging book that addresses current debates, whose historical development is illuminated and offers solutions for discussion. It complements with a bibliography and an overview of initiatives and projects (2.3).
content.title_en: Self-determined norm : feminism, prenatal diagnosis, abortion

content.text: Building industry: Basics and methods. The complexity of construction projects is constantly increasing. In addition to innovative architectural and engineering services, decisions on business, construction law and management-oriented questions have to be answered more and more. The author provides in detail all necessary knowledge of the construction industry in his teaching and reference work. Standards, guidelines and laws have been completely updated for the second edition, for example the status of VOB and the collective bargaining law. New topics are information and communication, modern forms of competition and organization as well as financing methods in the construction industry. This is an indispensable basis for all construction contractors. (Source: www.buchhandel.de 16.02.2012)
content.title_en: Construction : Basics and methods

content.text: In the new era, however, the technologies developed by the leading engineers, biologists and computer scientists have been developed to make the successful construction of autonomous running machines look realistic. This book contains the results of the DFG's priority program "Autonomous Running" - which is based on an intensive collaboration between leading engineers, biologists and computer scientists in this field. It presents the successes of the technical realization of running machines, as well as the latest biological findings, which directly incorporate their results into such technical implementations. These include questions of topological structures of running, the problem of control and control and related questions of sensors and actuators, the modelling of dynamics and the design and construction of selected running machines. TOC:Just-in-Time Approach to Learning: Arguing the Case for Cost-Effective Knowledge Dissemination.- P-Dinamet: A Web-Based Adaptive Learning System to Assist Learners and Teachers.- Intelligent Agents: Learn to Deliverable Materials to Students Better Design and Simulation.
content.title_en: Autonomous running : with 9 tables

content.text: Atomic Physics and Human Knowledge : Essays and Lectures from 1930 to 1961. Niels Bohr: "Atom Physics and Human Knowledge". Essays and Lectures from 1930 to 1961. Vieweg Verlag, Braunschweig 1985. 160 pp., br., 27.80 DM
content.title_en: Nuclear Physics and Human Knowledge : Essays and Lectures from 1930 to 1961

content.text: Lexical-functional grammar: an introduction to the example of French with computer linguistic implementation. Among the various grammar models that today represent the state of research, lexical-functional grammar is one of those that can be implemented on the computer and thus enable an incorruptible review of grammatical analyses. Using this preference, this introduction combines grammatical description and analysis with its implementation. It introduces step by step into the model and simultaneously develops a grammar for a section of French. For the implementation, XLE is used, a widely proven software. The book also shows how flexion morphology can be implemented as finite state morphology and integrated into the syntax fragment. As far as French grammar is concerned, the following topics are dealt with, among other things: congruence, the clitic subject pronouns, the adjective, the prepositions, the determinence, the sentence-like complements, the infinitive constructions and the control verbs, the passive, the auxiliar selection of the tempus periphrases, and a particular section of the computer's and the mathematical language processing.
content.title_en: Lexical-functional grammar : an introduction to the example of French with computer linguistic implementation
Pre-industrial timber construction in South West Germany and German-speaking Switzerland : terminology and systematics

content.text: Netzmeister : technical basic knowledge of gas, water, district heating. "The manual for net masters is the reference work for the areas of gas, water and district heating. In cooperation with AGFW e.V., the pipe construction association e.V. gives the net masters a reference work which is not only useful for preparing for the master test, but also provides useful and reliable information for practice in the later day business."
content.title_en: Network master : basic technical knowledge of gas, water, district heating

content.text: The Moses puzzle: on the trail of a biblical invention. The question of the historicity of the Bible is as little new as that of the historicality of Moses. It is therefore legitimate when an Egyptologist of the Humboldt University in Berlin questions the historicity of Moses, the Pentateuch and some prophets for a non-academic audience, calls it an invention and opens up an Egyptian prince behind the legend of Moses. Less legitimate is that a book based on science, which argues with research results, contains no evidence for his theses despite its special titles of comprehensive bibliography. However, historicality does not matter, according to Heidelberg Egyptologist J. Assmann ("Moses of the Egyptians", ID 26/98), but rather the "Mosaic distinction" between true and untrue in religion, memory culture and tradition of thinking about God and the origin of monotheism: the title is called, but reference is not taken to it. However, it cannot do much harm. (3) (Friedrich Andrae)
content.title_en: The Moses puzzle : in the footsteps of a biblical invention

content.text: Survey interviews : Methods of standardized surveys. This textbook provides detailed information on the conduct of standardized surveys, especially of the general population. The book deals with general problems of question formulation and response behaviour. Special attention is paid to practical problems of questionnaire design and the execution of pretests. For all forms of standardized interviews (written, oral, telephone, via internet) the particularities of the survey instruments, the sampling procedure and the implementation are presented in practice. Here, above all non-response problems are discussed in detail and possibilities for their avoidance are presented.
content.title_en: Survey interviews : Methods of standardized surveys

content.text: The history of climate change: from the Ice Age to global warming. After a brief introduction to the development of climate in Earth's history to the appearance of man, historian Behringer describes in the main the influence of climate change on the rise and decline of civilizations around the world. One focus is the medieval climate optimum and the small ice age in the 16th and 17th centuries as well as the present anthropogenic influenced global warming. He shows that already small climate changes had great effects on the everyday life of people, on fashion, architecture, culture, religion, economy, politics and society order. Earlier ways out of the crisis were e.g. the neolithic and the industrial revolution. The author therefore calls for a more rational handling of climate change and an adaptation to the changing conditions. Other focal points than "climate change" (ID 37/07). This readable and thoughtful book is an important complement to "a short natural history of the last millennium change" by J. Reichholf (BA 6/07) and "a short history of climate change" by K. Ludwig (BA 12/06).
content.title_en: Cultural history of the climate : from the ice age to global warming

content.text: Cultural tourism for everyone? : new strategies for a growth market. Cultural tourism is changing. With offers off the classic cultural business, organizers try to respond to changing needs of travellers. But does it actually succeed in reaching people beyond the traditional cultural audience? And is there finally even the prospect of a transfer back to the cultural business? This volume takes into consideration hitherto neglected manifestations of cultural tourism in the discussion, which elude a typical classification by means of divisions and institutions. An illuminating contribution to the debate on the challenges of cultural tourism. (Verlagstext)
content.title_en: Cultural tourism for all? : new strategies for a growth market

content.text: Amtshausgärten : rural garden culture at the administrative offices in the Electorate/Kingdom of Hanover. The volume contains, among other things, garden plans of corresponding objects in Ahlden, Harpstedt, Iburg, Moisburg, Siedenburg, Meinersen, Steyerberg and Blumenau.
content.title_en: Office gardens : rural garden culture at the administrative seats in the Electorate/Kingdom of Hanover

content.text: The bicycle: a cultural history. Hans-Erhard Lessing explains and tells how the bicycle triggered an unprecedented euphoria around the world 200 years ago. For the first time, everyone could move individually and afford the "happiness on two wheels". A cultural history of the two-wheeled bike full of surprises - from the eruption of a volcano at the beginning to the revolution of the e-bike. No means of transport is so widespread all over the world. None is so numerous. None has undergone such a rapid development: from the wheeler to the high and low bike, from the pedal to the road bike and electric bike, the bicycle has prevailed against all competitors and is the most widespread means of transport. About 12-14 billion bicycles have been built since its invention and 72 million are moved in Germany alone. The bicycle is affordable for everyone, as evidenced by its spread in India or China today or in Europe and North America in the 19th century. Even the social, yes cultural change that made possible by the bicycle is impressive. The upcoming e-bike revolution already makes sense of being a reality of the bicycle, its age, its age of old and its history, its history, its history, its history of history, its history, its history of culture, its history, its history, its history, its history of culture, its history, its history of history of culture, its history, of history of history of culture, of history, of history, of history, of history, of history, of history, of history, of history, of history, of history, of history, of history, of history, of history, of history, of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history of history

content.text: The following is a description of the biography and the exit of four prominent neo-Nazi figures. Three of the new, Ingo Hasselbach, Detlef Nolde, Danny Thüring, and with Michael Petri, a representative from the old federal states. The portraits highlight domestic circumstances, "national" career, seduction, reflection and exit motives.
content.title_en: Dismissal : Ways out of the right scene

content.text: The conquest of Mexico: Cortés and Montezuma. This is the first great representation of the conquest of Mexico for over 150 years. Hugh Thomas designs an impressive and colourful painting of the encounter between two cultures, thinking and mentality. He resurrects the old Aztec empire with its capital Tenochtitsln and describes in an exciting way the military actions that sealed the demise of the world empire. Above all, however, he portrays the acting persons with the proven, clear view of the fishing for characters and their peculiarities - above all the two protagonists Cortés and Montezuma.
content.title_en: The conquest of Mexico : Cortés and Montezuma

content.text: A long way down. A funny, sad and sensitive novel about four very different people who happen to meet on a New Year's Eve and whose lives change forever through this meeting.
content.title_en: A long way down

content.text: The volume introduces the theory of numbers with a special emphasis on algorithmic methods using the little known computer algebra system MuPAD. A CD, which includes the system and an interactive preparation of the text, is included. However, the author is not limited to specifying computational rules with programming instructions, but represents the selected topics rounded and mathematically complete. The beginning is simple divisibility properties. Extensive discussion of chain breaks and their applications is detailed. A very nice section on cryptology is a shorter one. The comprehensiblely formulated book hardly requires more than school knowledge. (2 S) (Wolfgang Grölz)
content.title_en: Introduction to elementary number theory

content.text: The amateur researcher Rauter presents a history of 20th century civil underwater shipping. He begins with the German submarines in World War I (about 1/3 of the size), deals with offshore marine technology, deep-sea research and tourist submarines. Broader space takes up Piccard's and Cousteau's services. The work represents a successful mixture of material objectivity, a generally understandable text, and an appealing illustration. It should be before the thematically closer N. Gierschner: Diving boats (BA 1/81, 409). (2) (Martin Paulini) Picture-text-book on the history of 20th century civil underwater shipping. (Martin Paulini)
content.title_en: Diving boats unravel the seas of the world : from commercial submarine to research submersible

content.text: Walter Gropius, the Bauhaus in Dessau : from the idea to the form. The Kursorische Geschichte des Bauhaus, in which the famous university of the same name was based, ranges from planning to the present day and encompasses a wide range of uses. Since the building cannot be seen in isolation from the ideas of its creators and the ones who work in it, the basic principles of the Bauhaus school are also evident. The urban architect and architectural historian understands how to write scientifically correct, concisely and yet understandable. Well equipped with floor plans, time table, overview of the teachers and bibliography there. Not comparable with the much more profoundly "The Bauhaus Building in Dessau" (ID 10/99). (2) (Martin Paulini)
content.title_en: Walter Gropius, the Bauhaus in Dessau : from the idea to the form

content.text: The socialization of nature: studies on the social evolution of practical reason. With "nature" the social sciences have never been able to do much. One left the reflection on nature to the natural sciences and their appropriation to the technical disciplines. However, it becomes increasingly clear that this division of labour between nature and social sciences does not meet the ecological conditions. Only the view on the symbolic appropriation of nature, on the communication that enables it and through it is made possible makes the social nature relationship visible. This thesis is unfolded – in the use of symbolic anthropology and political economy – on phenomena such as essenabus and fast food, cannibalism and vegetarianism, romantic and industrial nature relations, natural food movement and industrial exploitation of nature.
content.title_en: The socialization of nature : studies on the social evolution of practical reason

content.text: The Infinite: mathematicians struggle for a term. Pythagoras and the Infinite in the Pentagram -- Euclid and the Infiniteness of Prim Numbers -- Archimedes and the Infinite Exhaustion -- Newton and the Infinite in the Movement -- Cantor and the Infinite Decimal Numbers -- Hilbert and the Infinite Certainty -- Brouwer and the Infinite Freedom Philosophers and theologians have thought about the Infinite. But the true science of the Infinite is mathematics. Rudolf Taschner manages to convey this central concept to the mathematical layman. In a vivid way, he describes how Pythagoras, Archimedes and Euclid have already tried to grasp the Infinite. He makes us acquainted with Newton and Leibniz, who discovered that the phenomenon of movement and change is only understood by the study of the Infinite. With tension, the reader can pursue the dramatic dispute between the different positions of Cantor, Hilbert and Brouwer - a dispute that is indistinctuous, according to the findings, is Gödel.
content.title_en: The Infinite: Mathematicians Wrestle for a Concept

content.text: The Lead Market Strategy : The secret of successful innovations worldwide. Overview of the Lead Market Concept -- Overview of the Lead Market Concept -- Identify Lead Markets -- What are Lead Markets? -- Explain Lead Markets -- Why are countries becoming Lead Markets? -- Use Lead Markets -- The Lead Market Strategy in Product Development -- Lead Market Analysis -- Lead Market and Policy -- The Lead Market Approach in Innovation Policy.

content.text: The organ deficiency: Is death unavoidable on the waiting list?. Executive Summary -- Executive Summary -- Starting position -- Medical basics and development perspectives of organ transplantation -- Organ requirements and organ intake in Germany -- Framework conditions and factors affecting the availability of organs -- Solutions -- Reporting hospitals -- Transplantation centres -- Coordination point -- Postmortal organ donors -- Live donors -- Implementation possibilities and their limits -- Problem awareness in the population -- Peoples, Europe and constitutional framework -- Summary, options for action and recommendations -- Summary, options for action and recommendations. The lack of donor organs in transplant medicine is a topic of high social relevance. As 1,000 patients die on the waiting list in Germany every year, society must not ignore the organ deficiency, but must always look again for solutions and discuss different options for action without taboos. The present study is the result of interdisciplinary research work. It addresses the causes of the organ deficiency and indicates ways of its detection to the organ. In addition to the organ withdrawal, the organ is characterized by a positive response to the decision of the patient.
content.title_en: Lack of organs : Is death on the waiting list unavoidable?

content.text: The future of the German cable television network: Six steps to digitalisation Market study for the Federal Ministry of Economics and Labour. Summary: Six steps to digitalisation of the German cable and recommendations for the policy -- and question -- Structure of the German cable TV market and current trends -- State of play of digitalisation of the German cable -- Technical aspects of digitalisation of the cable network -- Users: Demand behaviour and potential for use -- Regulation: Legal aspects and policy options -- Market drivers and market barriers to digitalisation of broadband cable networks -- Milestones of digitalisation in Germany -- Development of a scenario for the complete digitization of cable TV networks -- Recommendations for politics. The German cable television network is the second largest after the USA with 22 million connected households. With its high capacity, it could not only transmit hundreds of digital TV programs, but would also be ideal for new interactive services such as high-speed Internet and Internet telephony. The enormous economic and media-political significance of digitalisation is due to the fact that the new cable networks are only available in a single-point number of cable networks.
content.title_en: The future of the German cable television network: Six steps towards digitalization Market study for the Federal Ministry of Economics and Labour

content.text: Artificial intelligence of capital. Artificial intelligence: a technology that flows more into mass products from day to day and becomes the most important market in digital capitalism. But what is intelligence, and is it an adequate term for software, whose reactions we intuitively consider to be "intelligent" and thus give great confidence? How "learning" algorithms? Can their conclusions be understood or controlled? In the political context, the question arises who owns the algorithms and data, the means of production of the AI economy, who controls them and who bears responsibility for their decisions. If artificial intelligence influences credit contracts, job allocation, the amount of insurance contributions and even jurisdiction, if language assistants constantly accompany our everyday lives, what does that mean for the individual? When global companies earn money with AI, what does that mean for society? Timo Daum delivers left-wing criticism with political perspectives.
content.title_en: The Artificial Intelligence of Capital

content.text: Descriptive statistics: An introduction to methods and applications with SPSS. Basics -- Frequency distributions -- Measurements for one-dimensional characteristics -- Measurements for the relationship between two characteristics -- Two-dimensional quantitative characteristics: Linear regression -- Time series -- Ratios and indices -- Missing data -- Introduction to SPSS. Statistical methods are used both in the economy and in the natural and social sciences.Statistics are nevertheless considered difficult. To overcome this barrier threshold, the authors provide a didactically sophisticated, application-related introduction to the methods of descriptive statistics and data analysis. Using practical examples, the ideas of data management and data evaluation are described using SPSS and R. Many exercise tasks (with solutions) support the (self-) study of readers. The book covers the subject of Statistics I at German-speaking universities completely. New in this edition are the use of the statistical software package R and a short introduction to its practical use.
content.title_en: Descriptive statistics : An introduction to methods and applications with SPSS

content.text: SAP® on Linux : Architecture, implementation, configuration, administration. This book provides a comprehensive overview of the structure, operation and operation of SAP on Linux for the first time. It provides a practical, well-founded and technically detailed presentation of the basic concepts, system architecture and implementation of SAP on Linux by long-standing experts of the matter. The experienced Linux specialist is thus provided with the necessary tools to find a solid start to the SAP world, and the SAP administrator finds reliable information to be able to install and operate an SAP system on Linux safely and optimally. . Introduction -- SAP System Architecture -- Booting process, configuration, resource and error analysis -- SAP Memory Management under Linux -- Virtual address space, Shares Memory -- Operating system resources -- File systems, networks, parametrization -- Security from SAP on Linux -- Secure network configuration -- Installation and migration -- Building complex infrastructures -- High availability -- Databases -- Hardware aspects -- Frontend -- Security.
content.title_en: SAP® on Linux : Architecture, implementation, configuration, administration

content.text: The basics for construction process planning and logistics -- Key figures for construction operation and logistics -- Guide values for construction process planning and logistics -- Construction sequence planning in construction operation — Grob planning for "Bauwerk-Rohbau" -- Construction sequence planning in construction operation — Fine planning for reinforced concrete work -- Logistics in construction operation — Grob planning for structural raw construction -- Logistics in construction operation — Fine planning for reinforced concrete work -- Probability considerations — Calculation of duration -- Control loop for planning and controlling the construction process. One of the most important prerequisites for successful construction projects is the effective planning of the construction process and logistics. The book describes how this can be achieved using flow diagrams and interaction diagrams. In this way, systematic procedures in the processing and clear presentation of essential construction operations are promoted. The diagrams are also particularly suitable for studies on sensitivity and plausibility. Furthermore, the interaction diagrams show structural application cases for the rough and fine planning of the construction process and logistics can be systematically taken into account.
content.title_en: Construction process planning and logistics in construction

content.text: Mathematics for physicists 1 : Basic knowledge for basic experimental physics. Vector calculation -- Scalar product, vector product -- Simple functions, trigonometric functions -- Potences, logarithm, reverse functions -- Differential calculus -- Integral calculus -- Taylor series and potency series -- Complex numbers -- Differential equations -- Probability calculus -- Probability distributions -- Error calculus. Mathematics for physicists is a successful introduction in two volumes. The proven textbook is available from the 12th edition together with the software Mathematics for Natural Scientists, an interactive course for the PC. In addition, the approximately 1500 teaching and training steps of the study support have been integrated as pdf on a CD-ROM. The revised reprint contains a completely revised CD-ROM with new task set. A very useful, well rounded and proven teaching work in more than 25 years. System requirements: IBM-compatible PC, CD-ROM, Windows 3.1, 95, 98, ME. 4MB RAM, VGA Reader 4.0.
content.title_en: Mathematics for physicists 1 : Basic knowledge for basic studies of experimental physics

content.text: Basics and Models of Information Lifecycle Management. Information as a Production Factor and as a Product -- Information Lifecycle and Information Lifecycle Management -- Legal Basis of Information Lifecycle Management -- Key Factor ILM Model -- Strategic Introduction Concepts for ILM -- ILM from Project Management Point of View -- Key Factor Classification Concepts -- Key Factor IT Security -- Key Factor Quality Assurance -- Key Factor Risk Management -- ILM from the background of emerging trends in global competition and information technology -- ILM Project Management • Short Description Organization and Structure. In connection with IT Governance, Sarbanes-Oxley Act and Basel II, Information Lifecycle Management, or ILM, is a topic that every CIO must master. Authors consider information as a product that is subject to a life cycle. Each phase of this product life cycle requires different IT methods to store information cost-consciously, and process it and process it. Authors apply the legal provisions, work out the classification concepts and explain the safety concepts and their requirements for operating management and business as a global risk management component.
content.title_en: Basics and Models of Information Lifecycle Management

content.text: Java Basic Course for Business Informatics: Understanding the Basics — Object-oriented Programming — Getting to Know Advanced Concepts — Business-oriented Examples. This introduction to the programming of business information technology, which is oriented towards contents of business information technology, is equally suitable as a textbook for lectures and self-study, without pre-awareness being required. All the facts are illustrated by vivid practical examples and exercises. Also more advanced topics in the field of object orientation, algorithms and data structures and basics of programming Distributed applications are gradually developed and conveyed through numerous illustrations and examples. The presentation is based on numerous lectures and programming events of the authors. Each chapter concludes with an exercise section, which is available online and contains informative solution instructions.
content.title_en: Basic Java course for business computer specialists : Understanding the basics — Object-oriented programming — Getting to know advanced concepts — Business-oriented examples

content.text: The effective use of IT in Facility Management (FM) is still a major problem. This book presents for the first time all aspects that need to be considered in the introduction of a computer-aided facility management (CAFM) system. The importance, areas of application and processes of the CAFM as well as new models for economic analysis are discussed in detail. In addition to the most important IT basics and CAFM system approaches, the collection and maintenance of FM data and the practical introduction of CAFM are further focal points. Practical examples, an international comparison and many practical tips round off the content. The book was written by experts of the GEFMA working group CAFM from science and practice and is mainly aimed at decision-makers and users, consultants, software providers and service providers in the field of Facility Management. Motivation -- On the relationship between Facility Management and CAFM -- Application Fields -- Business processes in Facility Management and their illustration in the IT -- Business of CAFM -- Business of CAFM -- Selection of CAFM - IT basics for Facility Management - Data Acquisition Systems - Data Acquisition Systems - Business Managers - Business of CAFM
content.title_en: Using IT successfully in Facility Management : The CAFM Manual

The present book documents the inherent relationship between ground-based mechanics (theory) and geotechnology (practice) and takes account of the rapid development in its field by focusing on the presentation of concepts. content.text: Sensation, Scurrility and Tabus in the Media. Why are the sensations and the bizarre manifestations in the media fascinating? Are there any taboos in the media at all? Where does the desire for the frustrations of others come from? Inhibitions are falling, scandals become more bizarre, the claim to sensational increases. Media ethnographic dimensions form the basis for a description of the current media landscape, which is interdisciplinaryly expanded by psychological, philosophical, sociological and media pedagogical approaches Introduction: Sensations, Currility and Tabus in the Media -- Introduction: Sensations, Currility and Tabus in the Media -- Sensations for Millions -- The speciality of the tabloid press in Germany -- Findings on the cinema of sensations, irritations, currility and taboos -- What about the media? Sensations, Currility and Tabubisms in the Television -- Internet and Shame - Sensations, Scurity and Tabism in the Media.

content.text: Performance Measurement in Supply Chains: Balanced Scorecard in Value Added Networks. Overview and Objective -- Basics -- Analysis and Evaluation -- Performance Measurement in Supply Chains -- Evaluation of existing concepts -- Concept and case study -- Concept of Supply Chain Balanced Seorecard -- Case Study -- Final View. Supply Chain Management includes the integration of units into a value added network and the coordination of material, information and value flows in this network. The aim is to meet the needs of the end customer as well as the competitiveness of supply chain as a whole. This book presents a new method for using Balanced Scorecards as an instrument for strategy implementation and process optimization in supply chain management. Particularly noteworthy is the connection between local strategies of supply chain members and the overall strategy of supply chain. A case study from industry shows the application in practice. - Supply Chain Management - Performance Measurement in Supply Chains - Evaluation of existing concepts - Supply Chain Management Concept of Supply Chain Management is the highly innovative business management management approach.
content.title_en: Performance Measurement in Supply Chains : Balanced Scorecard in Value Added Networks

content.text: Holistic tourism marketing: The design of regional cooperation relationships. Through progressive globalization, increasing transparency and intense price and performance competition, tourist regions worldwide compete with each other. Modern communication systems allow travel companies to operate flexibly, and supply exceeds demand. With the approach of cooperative marketing, Sören Bär develops a holistic and universal model for tourism regions to be successful in competition. It shows how the competitiveness of tourist regions and their offers can change over time and that the cooperation of regional actors is dynamic and goes through different phases of cooperation. It is clear that the development of an efficient tourism organization is an important prerequisite for the development of a tourist region and that the tourist coordination body as the head of the organization should take over management, moderation and coordination of regional tourism cooperation and control cooperative marketing. Tourist destinations and requirements for marketing -- The model of cooperative marketing — the basis for the market trading of providers of tourist services in tourism regions -- The development of tourist regions — an analysis of the changes in internal and external conditions in the course of time -- Coordination agencies as the means of realising a cooperative marketing - the conclusion of tourism regions - the conclusion of tourism marketing.
content.title_en: Holistic tourism marketing : shaping regional cooperation relations

content.text: Brand strength measurement with special consideration of consumer heterogeneity: The example of the German brewing industry. Objectives of brand strength measurement -- Fundamentals of brand valuation in consumer goods markets -- Conceptualization and operationalization of brand strength -- Empirical results of brand strength measurement -- Implications for brand management -- Summary and outlook. While neurosciences are making great progress in the undertaking to demonstrate the effect of brands, it is important for economists to quantify these effects. This is mainly due to the fact that different people react to stimuli in different ways. If consumers show heterogeneous needs and behavioural forms, it is useful to combine these to homogeneous segments and to work differently. However, empirical measurements often cause the problem that the sources of heterogeneity are not known or tangible. Lars Köster develops a model for measuring brand strength in the presence of such latent structures. It is extremely valuable for brand management, because it provides information about the existence of different market segments and the possibilities for their targeted approach, and furthermore, the segment specific driver and representative of a data set for Germany.
content.title_en: Mark strength measurement with special consideration of consumer heterogeneity : The example of the German brewing industry

content.text: Interactions between suppliers and demanders in marketing and procurement of innovative services: An exploratory case study in the IT service sector. Services are becoming increasingly important as an economic factor: they provide 70 percent of gross value added and provide a job for around three quarters of all employees in Germany. Their systematic marketing becomes therefore a central challenge for suppliers if they want to compete in the long term, and the role of demanders is becoming the focus of interest. On the basis of theoretical-conceptional considerations, Antje Hoffmann analyses the interaction process between suppliers and demanders of services in marketing and procurement of innovative services. Based on an exploratory case study in the IT service sector, she identifies different patterns of interaction between suppliers and demanders, which she describes in detail and examines in her dependence on the framework conditions. Definition of key concepts -- theories and concepts -- reference framework for the empirical study -- carrying out of the empirical study -- Results of the empirical study -- final consideration.
content.title_en: Interactions between suppliers and demanders in marketing and procurement of innovative services : An exploratory case study in the IT services sector

content.text: Master course IT-Management : The knowledge for successful practice — Basics and exemplary implementation — For students and practitioners. What are the tasks and fields of action of IT-Management? The book shows the basics, fields of activity and essential steps of action. It illustrates the necessary measures based on selected examples from the operational practice (best practices). The reader thus receives a valuable orientation framework for the design of the tasks of IT managers. Introduction -- IT strategy -- IT organization and personnel -- IT controlling -- Management of application systems -- IT security management -- IT law -- IT governance.
content.title_en: Master course IT Management : Knowledge for successful practice — Basics and exemplary implementation — For students and practitioners

content.text: Natural Science - Armor - Peace : Basic knowledge for peace research. This introduction provides the scientific basis for peace and conflict research in an introductory and understandable way. This provides students with the opportunity to gain important background knowledge in the fields of physics, chemistry, biology and computer science and to assess conflicts, crisis situations and wars also in terms of the scientific possibilities and conditions.
content.title_en: Science - Armor - Peace : Basic knowledge for peace research

content.text: Performance measurement of stochastic service productions. Services are intangible goods whose creation requires the integration of an external factor. For the service producer, this external factor is often an uncertainty factor, since its quality is determined by the customer. Marcel Rossmy examines how stochastic service productions can be assessed. On production and efficiency theory bases, he analyses known performance measurement methods for their suitability for the evaluation of stochastic productions. The author develops a two-stage methodology based on data development analysis and expectation-benefit theory. To analyse the overall efficiency of a company, new indicators are introduced for the evaluation of production, adaptation and selection efficiency. Using the example of rehabilitation measures, he illustrates the application of the presented methodology and discusses extension possibilities and generalizations. Thus, the proposed methodology can be considered in particular as a basis for a stochastic production theory. Taking into account the uncertainty in service productions to be assessed, he describes the application of the presented methodology and discusses the generalizations. Thus, the proposed methodology can be considered in particular as a basis for a stochastic production theory.
content.title_en: Performance measurement of stochastic service productions

content.text: Mobile Solutions: Potential applications, usage problems and solutions. Field of research mobile activities -- Mobile ICT solutions in the field of tension over overarching guiding concepts and interaction design paradigms -- Architecture and problem structure of mobile solutions -- Inventory of available system components for mobile ICT solutions -- Inventory of mobile ICT solutions -- Potential applications for mobile ICT solutions in mobile activities -- Comparison of existing mobile technologies and identified requirements -- Conclusion and outlook. Increasingly smaller computers and information technology as well as the wireless networking that is available in many places contribute to the spread of "Mobile Solutions". New technologies (Wearable Computing, Ambient Intelligence, Smart Clothes) are now also used in areas of application such as maintenance, logistics and healthcare. However, the market share of these new technologies remains significantly behind the forecasts. Ingrid Rügge conducts a comprehensive research of technical components for mobile solutions and an inventory of existing or designed solutions. The author works out their respective specific properties and shows their limitations. The market share of these new technologies remains, however, significantly behind the forecasts.
content.title_en: Mobile Solutions : Potentials, usage problems and solutions

content.text: Profit concepts and performance statements according to IFRS: Analysis of the success components recorded directly in equity. Petra Husband analyses the factors that determine the degree of centralisation in the context of operational marketing and sales questions based on a sample of 133 surveyed Dyads from 29 countries. In addition, she examines the effects of the autonomy of state organisations.
content.title_en: Profit concepts and performance statements according to IFRS : Analysis of the components of the profit directly recorded in equity

content.text: The article also focuses on interdisciplinary approaches, ranging from scenarios, early warning and future analyses, to bureaucracy and organizational analysis, discourse analysis, cultural theoretical analysis and comparative foreign policy analysis. The case studies range from the transformation of NATO and the security identity of Europe to the cases of Iraq and Kosovo to the US National Security Strategy. The book represents the current research status and is also a practical methodological textbook for the subject of "International Politics and Security".
content.title_en: Methods of security policy analysis : An introduction

The principle of the book to understand power semiconductors based on semiconductor physics and not only to describe phenomenologically has been retained in this second edition. However, the immense technological progress has required major revisions and extensions. Therefore, not only the existing chapters have been updated and partly substantially expanded, but the following two new chapters "Construction and connection techniques in power electronics" as well as the "physical modeling of power semiconductors" have been added. Thus, a state-of-the-art plant is available, providing an extensive basis for the in-depth entry into power electronics. content.text: Regional performance and hospital planning: A simulation model based on an ant algorithm. Hospital planning in Germany is increasingly becoming a framework planning that leaves it to hospitals on site to fill this framework. However, hospitals usually lack suitable methods to create secure foundations for their own planning and to be able to talk about it in regional distribution negotiations. Based on the methods of international hospital planning, Axel Focke develops a model that allows the simulation of various "what-if-situations" with the help of an ant algorithm. It allows to use the little complicated and versatile adaptable nuclear algorithm to take account of different influences, e.g. policy changes, changed patient behaviour and shifts of hospitals/departments, and to quantify their effects.
content.title_en: Regional performance and hospital planning : A simulation model based on an ant algorithm

content.text: Participative governance: forms of participation and participation rights in the multi-level system of climate policy. Heike Walk addresses three current topics of political science research: the participation and governance debate as well as climate policy. The author deals with the democratic theoretical relevance of governance processes and describes the diverse forms of participation of non-state actors at the various levels of climate policy. The main emphasis is on the thesis that effective climate protection can be achieved not only by a broad public and information policy, but also by broad involvement and participation of wider sections of the population.
content.title_en: Participative governance: forms of participation and participation rights in the multi-level climate policy system

content.text: Information Lifecycle Management : Process implementation. In connection with IT governance, Sarbanes-Oxley Act and Basel II, Information Lifecycle Management, or ILM, is a topic that every CIO must master. Authors consider information as a product that is subject to a life cycle. Each phase of this product life cycle requires different IT methods to store and process information cost-consciously. The book describes how an ILM implementation project is set up and carried out. An overview of the technical implementation approaches of the common manufacturers forms the final part of the book. Readers receive consistent decision-making aids for implementing and selecting a successful information lifecycle management. Information Fuel for production and service -- Information Lifecycle Management (ILM) models -- Information Lifecycle Management — Project organization and structure -- Information Lifecycle Management Project -- Test concept for quality assurance -- Data classification -- Safety -- ILM from the point of view of providers -- Summary and summary.
content.title_en: Information Lifecycle Management : Process implementation

content.text: The European Retirement Facility (Mtgage Covered Bonds) and the Mortgage Backed Securities (Mtgage) in Europe. The mortgage loan business is very important throughout Europe. However, when refinancing the loans with deposits and unsecured bonds, the advantage of using the financed real estate and the loans granted for it as security and thus to reduce the cost of the loan is not used. This guarantee is the essential characteristic of Mortgage Covered Bonds and Mortgage Backed Securities, which are now used for refinancing in various European countries. In this context, the book is aimed at investigating mortgage loan transactions on major European markets, analysing the use of Mortgage Covered Bonds and Mortgage Backed Securities and their costs. In addition, it is shown how the use of the instruments and the legal framework can be improved in the field of business management at the University of Duisburg.
content.title_en: Covered instruments for refinancing mortgage loans: An analysis of Mortgage Covered Bonds and Mortgage Backed Securities in European Countries

content.text: Measurement technology : System theory for electrical engineers. This textbook deals with the system technical and system theoretical principles of measurement technology. The common methods common to all measurement systems are highlighted, which describe the physical behaviour by a mathematical model, improve the static and dynamic properties of measuring systems, measure stochastic quantities and collect data in the digital computer.For a better connection to the theory of stochastic processes, the theoretical foundations and the systematic classification of signal classes are summarized.The term power density is introduced and the Viennese filter is presented. Further topics are a comprehensive system theoretical description of errors in digital measurement data acquisition as well as the recording of frequency analogue signals. The 7th edition has been corrected and updated.
content.title_en: Measurement technology : System theory for electrical engineers

content.text: The relevance of the fair value assessment of investment properties was assessed in the context of IFRS: A deductive and empirical study of the pre-preferential value of alternative heuristics with regard to relevance and reliability. Problem assessment -- Thematic classification and demarcation -- Course of investigation -- Conceptual framework and methodological preliminary considerations -- Illustration of investment properties according to IAS 40 -- Problem clarification and definition -- Problem solving framework for the mapping of investment properties to fair value -- Inductive and deductive considerations for problem solving -- Empirical investigation -- Classification and objective -- Method selection and theoretical principles -- Data evaluation -- Interpretation and implications. The International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) accounting is mostly used to provide decision-making information. IAS 40 collects the claim to provide such information and therefore calls for fair value analysis of investment properties. Fair value is generally used to estimate the lack of current comparison prices in Germany with the help of a DCF procedure, but does not include specific guidelines on this. Christian Huschke uses an empirical analysis of the alternative problem-solving approach.
content.title_en: Real estate valuation in the context of IFRS : A deductive and empirical investigation of the pre-eminence of alternative heuristics regarding relevance and reliability in the fair value assessment of investment properties
