content.text: Realize IT offshore: Basics and central concepts, decision-making process and project management of IT offshore and nearshore projects. Introduction -- Basics and central concepts -- IT offshore structures -- IT offshore - Decision-making process -- Project management of IT offshore projects -- Outlook. IT offshore is "in-the-box" and this book shows you how to effectively realize IT offshore projects. It covers in detail conceptual foundations and diverse facets of offshore – embedded in a practice-oriented IT controlling concept. It makes the decision-making process in the company transparent and presents tried and tested procedures for the implementation of IT offshore and IT proximity projects.
content.title_en: Realising IT offshore: basics and central concepts, decision-making process and project management of IT offshore and nearshore projects

content.text: The aim of the Institute for Mobility Research is to contribute to greater transparency and objectivity of the topic of mobility. The aim of this collection of the international ifmo conference of the same name is to highlight and discuss future developments, impacts and challenges in connection with selected Internet applications. The following aspects are the main focus: Displaying the state of the art and the forecasts for the future in relation to the users and intensity of use in Germany and the USA; Discussion of the individual and societal impacts that this relatively new phenomenon brings with it; Discussion of the expected traffic and environmental effects by means of specific areas of application of virtual mobility and identification of further research needs and identification of options/opportunities for action.
content.title_en: Impact of virtual mobility

content.text: The book introduces the basics of engineering and the world of thought and working methods of engineers in a clear way. In the beginning, a short outline of the changes in the fields of work of engineers over the course of history is given. The main part of the book presents the individual subjects of engineering studies. The author also focuses on environmental research in engineering sciences. He also addresses management methods in engineering sciences, in particular the assessment of technology as sustainability management. The book is aimed at students of other fields (especially environmental sciences), at senior school students and interested lay people.
content.title_en: Study of Environmental Sciences : Engineering

content.text: Women, politics and media. Although the proportion of women in German politics is far from equal to their share of the population, they have now established themselves at the higher levels of politics. Do these complaints also deal with the way the media report on female politicians? Does the greater visibility of women in politics also lead to a special speech by female voters?This book summarizes studies from different countries in which women hold the highest state offices and examines how the media deal with them and how election campaigns by and for women are organised.
content.title_en: Women, Politics and Media

The important questions of the acoustics, hygiene, air quality, air quality, water treatment and economic efficiency are also addressed. content.title_en: God or Darwin? : Reasonable Talking about Creation and Evolution

content.text: Motor vehicles in income and VAT law: From purchase to sale. The authors describe the tax treatment of motor vehicles in practice, from purchase to daily use to sale. Here you look at the facts from both a tax and a VAT perspective. Numerous changes have been made to this legal area through legislation, jurisprudence and financial management. The work now presents the current state of all important questions and provides tax-optimized and practical solutions. The main focus of the work are: - Assignment to the operating assets - 1% method - Travel book method as well as in - Assignment to the business area - Pretax deduction - Vehicle use by the entrepreneur Numerous overviews and examples make the work a valuable means of work and allow quick access to the topic.
content.title_en: Motor vehicles in the field of income and turnover tax : From purchase to sale

content.text: Decisionability of Petri Networks : Overview and Compendium. Petri Networks and their Mathematics -- The Accessibility Problem -- Elementary Marking Problems -- Fire Sequences and Languages -- Petri Networks with Zero Test -- Overview. Petri Networks are the most widely considered and best studied model for parallel invoices and places/transition networks, the most famous and most important class of Petri Networks. In this book, for the first time, all important questions about the decisionability of classical locations/transition networks are systematically compiled and discussed. This includes, for example, the accessibility problem further questions that deal with markings and languages of Petri Networks, such as the accessibility of quantities of markings, the reproduction of markings and various concepts of vitality, or the question whether the language of a Petri network is e.g. empty, finite, total, regular, equal to another language. Various classic language and acceptance models of Petri Networks are considered.
content.title_en: Decisibility at Petri Nets : Overview and Compendium

content.text: Basic course Algorithms and data structures in JAVA : An introduction to practical computer science. Conceptualization -- Equivalent solutions -- Recursion and repetition -- Search -- Sorting methods -- Tree structures -- Classes of algorithms. The classic for education and study updated for Java version 6. It provides classic computer science content such as sorting algorithms, tree structures, complexity, recursion and algorithm classes. Clear orientation to practice, good understanding, easy readability of algorithms, with online service.
content.title_en: Basic course Algorithms and data structures in JAVA : An introduction to practical computer science

content.text: Supply Performance Measurement : Performance measurement in purchasing and supply management. Problem and course of the survey -- Supply Management and Controlling Research: Classification of Supply Performance Measurement into the scientific context -- Supply Performance Measurement as a control tool of supply management -- Concepts of supply performance measurement -- Case studies on supply performance measurement -- Development and empirical review of an integrated framework for supply performance measurement -- Theses-like summary: Supply Performance Measurement — New impulses for strategic management of supply management. For several years, research and practice have been discussing the further development of supply management's procurement in the context of declining value-added levels. In order to make the potential of external value-added usable for the company usable, the question of measuring and controlling the performance of supply management is at the center of interest. However, the establishment of such supply performance measurement systems has so far posed significant challenges to research and practice. Based on the methodology of applied management research, Aiko Entchelmeier is developing an integrated performance management approach to establishing performance management.
content.title_en: Supply Performance Measurement : Performance measurement in Purchasing and Supply Management

content.text: Acquisition-related value change of acquisition subjects: A synergy- and acquisition-based model. In connection with the acquisition of companies, acquisition-related value losses of acquisition subjects are often observed. Karsten Klopfer determines the net synergy and the acquisition premium as value-influencing factors. In an empirical study, he shows that the net synergy for the owners of the acquisition subject is limited and over-expanded acquisition premiums are paid, which explain the loss of value of acquisition subjects. He empirically derives a relationship that enables a forecast of the change in value of the acquisition subject from the amount of the acquisition premium granted. Compared to a frequently applied trading strategy, acquisition subjects could be sold empty when the acquisition announcement was made, thanks to the application of the model also to significant performance increases in the future. Basic -- Model for acquisition-related value change of acquisition subjects -- Empirical results of the company's empirical analysis - Application of the empirical results - Application of the acquisition claims to the acquisition entities.
content.title_en: Acquisition-related change in value of acquisition subjects : A synergy- and acquisition-based model

content.text: The contributions of this volume discuss the current shifts in the discourse of capitalism analysis and critique, which respond to the "neoliberal" transformation of the capitalist system. They are guided by the question of how to conceive a theoretically coherent and practically promising critique of capitalism, after the classical instruments of social critique have been discredited in many ways and have proved to be dull and outdated.The first part of the volume gathers contributions in which important strands of current critique of capitalism are presented.
content.title_en: Metamorphoses of capitalism – and its criticism

content.text: No panic before the tax consultant examination: How to pass the tax consultant examination safely. Memory techniques -- Written tax consultant examination -- Oral tax consultant examination -- Quick reading -- Description of the supplements. The tax consultant examination is feared mainly because of the numerous and complex audit contents. This book shows you how you can pass the difficult tax consultant examination – written as well as oral – objectively confident. The memory and learning training tailored to you helps you to keep the extremely extensive expertise for the examination easily available. Thus, you learn from technical examples to develop your memory capacity, read technical texts faster and how to keep your oral lecture completely free. Gottfried Jestädt, co-owner and managing director of the Academy of Tax Law and Economic Examination "Lectures Haas", to this work: "The combination of theoretical background and practical handling in tax law makes this work the ideal tool. ... A milestone for the existence of the examination."
content.title_en: Don't panic about the tax consultant exam: How to pass the tax consultant exam safely

content.text: Optimization of cooperative services in engineering customer service. The design and optimization of technical customer services, which are provided cooperatively in network structures, is becoming more important for many companies. The measurement, evaluation and feedback of performance-critical information required for this purpose, taking into account the requirements of different cooperation partners, plays a crucial role in the company's success. Tanja Klostermann shows in the technical customer service of mechanical engineering that technical services provided in network structures can be continuously optimized and controlled by the application of a control system, similar to technical processes. She examines the measurement, evaluation, control and optimization of cooperatively performed performance processes. On this basis, the author presents a solution concept for the development of a control system for the optimization of service processes and provides recommendations for their cooperation-based design. Initial situation, problem setting, objective, solution approach and structure of work -- Basics for cooperative technical customer services in engineering and rule-based optimization -- Approaches for the design of a rule-based optimization -- Requirements for the regulation-based optimization of cooperative technical technical services (TKDL) -- Methodical approach in the work - Development of a system for the evaluation of a cooperative-based optimization of a regulation-command-Optimization-Optimization-Optimization-Optimization-Optimulation-Optimulation-Optimulation-Optimulation-Optimulation-Optimulation-Optimulation-Optimulation-Optimulation-Optimization-Optimization-Optimization of a technical services
content.title_en: Optimization of cooperative services in technical customer service of mechanical engineering

content.text: Flow theory for mechanical engineering: Technology and examples. Hydrostatics -- Kinematics of instationary flow -- Current thread theory of friction-free fluids -- Applications of the pulse set -- Movement of compressible fluids -- Application of the NAVIER-STOKES motion equation -- Potential flow of incompressible fluids -- Fluid-induced fluids -- Fluid-induced fluids -- Interference layer currents -- Turbulent flows of incompressible fluids -- Flow of incompressible fluids in pipelines -- Flow of around and through bodies -- Similarity laws of flow theory -- Numerical flow calculation. This application-related deepening of the topics from the basics of flow theory is applied to engineers and students of engineering, physics and application-oriented mathematics. The numerous practical examples are helpful for manufacturers and users of predominantly flow-engineering industries. The division of the chapters corresponds essentially to the following in the volume: Hydrostatics, kinematics, impulse set, NAVIER-STES-related flow regulation, fluid flow regulation and flow regulation.
content.title_en: Flow theory for mechanical engineering : technology and examples

content.text: Street as a cultural space for action: Interdisciplinary considerations of the street space at the interface between theory and practice. The street, probably the most heterogeneous and active space in our society, is a space of the public, which can be entered by every citizen, influenced and thus co-designed. In order to be able to illustrate this spatial variety of action and effects textually, all contributions in this volume take a different focus into consideration. At the interface of scientific theory and project-oriented practice, the connection between ethnographic, sociological, artistic, media, economic, political, architectural, geographical, sport, cultural and communication-scientific views emerges from the so far unical spectrum of approaches to the urban street space, which can show where and by which ways the street can be 'read' and 'described'.
content.title_en: Street as a cultural action space : Interdisciplinary considerations of the street space at the interface between theory and practice

content.text: Concepts of object-oriented programming: With an introduction to Java. Object orientation: An introduction -- objects, classes, encapsulation -- inheritance and subtyping -- Building blocks for object-oriented programs -- object-oriented program frameworks -- parallelity in object-oriented programs -- programming of distributed objects -- summary, variants, outlook. The book provides a compact introduction to the concepts of object-oriented programming. It explains the object and class concept, describes encapsulation techniques and goes into detail on subtyping and inheritance. Software reuse in the form of library modules and program frameworks (frameworks) is discussed using the example of processing streams and the construction of graphical user interfaces. Furthermore, important concepts of parallel and distributed programming are discussed and the practical connection to object orientation is established. Each object-oriented concept is first introduced in general, i.e. independently of a programming language. Afterwards its concrete programming language implementation in Java is explained in detail.
content.title_en: Concepts of object-oriented programming : With an introduction to Java

content.text: Web-based data integration: approaches to measuring and securing information quality in heterogeneous data stocks using a fully web-based tool. Data cleaning and consolidation of heterogeneous data stocks -- Data quality -- Dimensions and architecture of information integration -- Data cleaning -- Conception of data cleaning toolkit -- Implementation -- Summary and outlook -- Finding and cleaning duplicates in heterogeneous data stocks -- Information, data and knowledge -- A definition attempt -- Information integration in the focus of data quality -- Duplicates in data stocks -- Concrete procedures for duplicate detection and classification -- Concept of data quality application "DCT-- Implementation, selected algorithms and data structures -- Conclusion and outlook - Today, companies and organizations use enormous amounts of data generated by different IT systems. Due to the heterogeneity of data sets, a holistic view of information is a major challenge, but the solution offers an immense advantage. To maintain an integration of different source systems, the information quality, measuring this, as well as the data quality of data can be used to develop a comprehensive role of data integration.
content.title_en: Web-based data integration : approaches to measuring and securing information quality in heterogeneous data sets using a fully web-based tool

content.text: Learn to understand Pro/MECHANICA® : from version Wildfire 4.0. The finite element program Advanced MECHANICA Wildfire 4 is integrated into the CAD system Pro/ENGINEER by PTC. Using easy-to-understand examples, the methodical approach is demonstrated under MECHANICA. The reader learns the essential features of the application: structure of the FEM model, analyses, convergence methods, evaluation of results. Plausibility as well as accuracy of the results and solutions with MECHANICA can be evaluated. As a prerequisite, the reader should have basic knowledge in technical mechanics. Users are engineers as well as students of mechanical engineering or civil engineering in the in-depth study. All tasks are explained step by step and illustrated with corresponding screenshots.
content.title_en: Learn to understand Pro/MECHANICA® : from version Wildfire 4.0

content.text: From the transformation to the openness of cooperation? : The opening of the legal systems of selected countries of Central and Eastern Europe to the law of peoples and Europe. Why and how far have the countries of Central and Eastern Europe opened their respective legal systems to supranational legal systems - international law and Community law - is the main question of work? And is there a constitutionally supported cooperation readiness in the countries studied? The most important feature of this opening is the analysis of the existence, form and limits of the transformation of the rules of supranational legal systems into a complementary legal source. The findings thus gained stem from the thesis that there is a specific relationship between the extent of this opening and the quality of the rule of law of the respective national legal system: the more open a legal system is, the greater the probability that it is also legal state. The book focuses on the question of why and how far the countries of Central and Eastern Europe have opened their legal systems to supranational legal systems such as international law and Community law. The most important feature of the opening is the author's analysis of the form and limits of the transformation of the rules of the law into a legal system is the same as a source of openness.
content.title_en: From transformation to openness to cooperation? : Opening up the legal systems of selected countries in Central and Eastern Europe to international and European law

content.text: Web design for study and profession : Website design, design and implementation. The learning goal of "Web design for study and profession" is the creation of design competence to master a web project including site architecture, creative design phase, navigation and screen design and the subsequent implementation with (X)HTML and CSS. The basics are learned in web project management. The book aims to become aware of the differentness of designing for electronic media and to identify ways to design optimal designs for this medium. By means of practical tasks and self-evaluable quiz questions, the acquired knowledge can be checked and tested on the basis of more complex design tasks. Preliminary remark -- Einf#x00FC;ehrung -- Grundlagen des Webdesigns -- Technische Grundlagen -- Siteplanung -- Design Design -- Prototyping -- Asset Design -- Technical implementation -- Tests and Launch.

content.text: Workshop book Family Center : Methods for successful practice. The organization of a family center requires responsible management skills and specialists to be extended. Four levels are particularly affected: the professional, methodological-strategic, the social and personal level. The workshop book presents practical methods and approaches to action in a compressed and vivid manner. The presentation is carried out by experts who are experts identified in the respective method. Dr. Stephan Rietmann is a diploma psychologist and heads the Psychological Advisory Office of the Caritasverband Borken. Dr. Gregor Hensen is a research assistant at the Institute of Educational Science at the Westfälische Wilhelms-Universität Münster.
content.title_en: Workshop book Family Center : Methods for successful practice

content.text: Explain better, sell more with the help of: A guide for technicians, engineers and other "specialist Chinese." Speak so that your customer understands you -- Image-like language – your key to the customer's world of ideas -- The connection between man and man: building positive contacts -- Writtenly build a positive relationship with customers: contemporary business correspondence -- Conduct a successful sales interview -- Use lay-related product descriptions and advertising media -- Understandably and convincingly present. What happens if an expert wants to advise a layperson and convince him of the purchase of a product that needs explanation? The preferred language of many salesmen, sales representatives and consultants is Chinese. The result: You can't read their statements. He may choose another offer or fail to win the customer's acceptance of your offer. This guide for "specialist Chinese" shows you how to adjust to your communication to people who have less background knowledge than you. You will learn to understand techniques, simplify complex facts. Or, it fails to use your offer. Illustrations by Andreas Gerhardt (Hüride) Gündt (Hüride has the background for this article).
content.title_en: Better explain, sell more : A guide for technicians, engineers and other "specialists"

content.text: System Landscape : Contemporary German landscape architecture. Landscape" is now increasingly understood as a complex system: biotopes and water circles, free spaces and buildings, neighborhoods and economic areas are components of this system. Such a consideration of the landscape space as a common interface of social, cultural, economic and other processes brings about through internationally conducted specialist discourses on climate succession landscapes or regional conversion new strategies of dealing with eco-systems. The book analyses and documents this international development as well as its importance for the
content.title_en: System Landscape : Contemporary German landscape architecture

content.text: Real Estate and Facility Management : From the point of view of consulting practice. This work looks at the ongoing change in the real estate industry, the current requirements for modern management and the integrative approach to the life cycle of the property: From portfolio management and - new - property management, to project development, project management, to facility management during planning and implementation, and in the use of the buildings. The sustainable management of the property resource, the necessary strategies, methods and the approach to the respective benefits of the tasks are detailed. Written from practice, the book is addressed to consultants and decision-makers in the construction and real estate industry as well as to the public sector, who are interested in the continuous optimization of this asset class and its management under return, risk, cost and benefit aspects. content.text: Price formation of medicines in international comparison. Pharmaceutical markets are regulated by law in almost all industrial nations. This includes above all pricing, usually across all distribution stages, from the manufacturer, through wholesalers, pharmacies, health insurance companies to patients. The book provides an overview of the different pricing strategies of the comparative countries Germany, France, Italy, Switzerland, Netherlands, Spain, Great Britain, Australia, Canada, USA and Japan. In particular, freely available and prescription drugs are used for international comparison, as both types are subject to different price formation influences across the distribution stages. Starting from a theoretical view, market economy, state and other factors of influence as well as their empirical influence on price formation and distribution margins are discussed with the aim of making effective patient prices of medicines internationally comparable. Theory of price formation at the manufacturer level -- Composition of patient price: Further price formation levels -- Price formation of medicines in international comparison: Order policy framework -- International price differentiation in practice -- Discussion of international drug pricing systems -- Summary and outlook.
content.title_en: International comparison of pricing of medicinal products

content.text: Logistics management in the automotive industry: basics of logistics in automotive engineering. Logistics management in the product formation process -- Logistics-compliant factory planning -- Virtual logistics -- Logistics-specific complexity management -- Logistics management in the context of simultaneous engineering -- Supply management -- Areas of responsibility of logistics planning -- Lean Logistics -- Logistics management in the customer order process -- Procurement logistics in automotive engineering -- Production logistics in automotive engineering -- Distribution logistics in automotive engineering -- Spare parts logistics in automotive engineering. The book provides practical and application-oriented knowledge in the logistics management of the automotive industry. The focus is on the view of the automotive manufacturer, as it has the highest level of requirement and complexity within the global value-added network. The book is structured in the same way as the planning and series phase of a vehicle into the two areas of logistics management in the product formation process and logistics management in the customer order process. In line-back principle, this book deals with all planning stages of logistics from the material demand location on the line, from internal and external logistics to the supplier in the context of the product formation process.
content.title_en: Logistics management in the automotive industry : Basics of logistics in automotive manufacturing

content.text: The following are the main reasons for this: - the over-exploited raw materials are the raw materials which cover the over-exploited part of the energy needs of mankind, are converted to heating today, essentially to be used as fuel and microbial origin. Until about 200 years ago, i.e. relatively short time ago, biomass as a renewable raw materials were the most powerful source for the energy needs of mankind.
content.title_en: Biotechnological energy conversion : current situation, opportunities and future research needs

content.text: Fluid technology in motor vehicles. Basics -- Passenger and commercial vehicles -- Self-propelled working machines -- Two-wheeled vehicles -- Sports vehicles -- Vehicle testing equipment. In Germany, the automotive industry remains one of the most important sectors of industry. The increasing demands on safety and comfort systems, but also an improvement in energy efficiency in vehicles, have led to a strong expansion of fluid technology applications. The book provides a closed overview of the fluid technology systems used in vehicle technology for the first time. In motor vehicles, hydraulic or pneumatic braking systems, hydraulic steering support, hydrodynamic converters, air conditioning systems, hydraulic cylinders, pumps and motors are used for different applications. The special features are presented in such a way that they are of benefit to students and technicians as well as to the engineer working in practice.
content.title_en: Fluid technology in motor vehicles

content.text: The study EduCare provides the first results on the design of the pedagogical quality for children in the different school forms: day school, school with block-time lessons and school with traditional teaching and possible differences. Furthermore, pedagogical quality features of the family are described and differences between the families of the children who attend the different school forms are analysed. The results show that the comparison of day school children with intensive use in terms of the level of development in school performance in language, socio-emotional development as well as the development of everyday skills compared to children who attend the traditional or block-time lessons is in favour of day school children. Marianne Schüpbach is a senior assistant and project manager at the University of Bern, Institute of Education, Department of Educational Psychology.
content.title_en: Full-day education and primary education: quality and effectiveness of different types of school compared

content.text: Industrial aeronautical management : Engineering and organisation of aeronautical plants. Authorities and organizations -- Rules and approvals -- Development -- Maintenance management -- Basics of aeronautical production management -- Manufacturing -- Maintenance -- Material and performance -- Personnel -- Quality management. The book describes the structure and activities of aeronautical plants. These are companies that develop, manufacture or maintain parts, components, assemblies and engines for aircraft or aircraft themselves. (technical) aviation industry has a significant specificity in contrast to other industries, as their activities are determined by the regulations of the relevant air inspectorates. With their specifications, the authorities have a significant influence on operational organisation, personnel qualification, quality system and performance. These specificities, connections and processes are discussed in the book from the perspective of aviation legislation as well as from the point of view of operational practice.
content.title_en: Industrial aeronautics management : aeronautical engineering and organisation

content.text: Operating Systems: A compact introduction to Linux. This textbook provides a well-founded and multi-layered introduction to the concepts and functions of modern operating systems. The basic mechanisms of an operating system are analysed and objectified by means of concrete program listings of the Linux kernel. The complexity of an operating system and the impressive ingenuity of the underlying algorithm and its clever implementation in C code are at the heart of the book. The reader thus gets a solid understanding of the system architecture and its concrete realization. The text is suitable for basic studies starting from the third semester and requires a solid understanding of the C programming alongside basic knowledge of algorithms and data structures. Introduction -- Computer Hardware -- System Calls -- Processes and Threads -- Scheduleling -- Linux Schedule -- Realtime -- Time Sharing -- Load Balancing -- Memory Management -- Segmentation -- Virtual Memory -- Page Table -- Paging -- Page Cache -- Swapping -- Slab Layer -- Synchronization -- Deadlocking Kernel-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-Philation-
content.title_en: Operating Systems : A compact introduction with Linux

content.text: Green IT, virtualization and thin clients: Reaching energy efficiency with new IT technologies, protecting the environment and saving costs. Entrepreneurs, IT managers, IT consultants and scientists are confronted with increasing IT performance and security requirements while simultaneously compulsioning them to save energy and costs. Thin clients and virtualization or server based computing offer an ecologically and economically advantageous alternative to traditional PC networks. This book enables a quick introduction to the basics of these technologies and presents the economic and ecological advantages, including based on recent studies by Fraunhofer Institute UMSICHT. Based on practical cases, the achieved savings and environmental benefits are demonstrated.The content: Energy efficiency in the data centerEsstablishment savings through virtualizationDesktop virtualization Thin clients: Introduction, economicity and ecologyNational and European environmental impactGreen Best Practice: Case studies from companies as well as public and private organizationsThe target group:- IT managers, administrators- environmental and cost-conscious entrepreneurs- IT consultants and marketing experts in the IT department.
content.title_en: Green IT, Virtualization and Thin Clients : To achieve energy efficiency, save the environment and save costs with new IT technologies

content.text: The taxation of foreign family foundations according to the Foreign Tax Act: Analysis and Perspectives. Foreign family foundations have been evaluated early on in the consulting practice as a suitable design building block for the wealth succession planning. Due to the progressive internationalization foreign family foundations will increasingly be looking into the field of foreign family foundations in the future. However, German foreign tax law has substantial sanctions available to prevent the establishment of foreign family foundations. Kay Alexander Schulz examines these regulations from a systematic, Community and constitutional perspective and develops guiding principles for a pre-determined redesign of the taxation of foreign family foundations. Introduction -- Fundamentals of the investigation -- The access taxation of § 15 AStG -- Effects of Community law on the access system of foreign family foundations -- Effects of constitutional law on the access system of foreign family foundations -- Approaches for a reformed access control of foreign family foundations -- Summary of the main results.
content.title_en: Taxation of foreign family foundations under the Foreign Tax Act : Analysis and Perspectives

content.text: Introduction to the design of multimedia web applications. This publication provides a solid introduction to multimedia applications, web applications, Web 2.0 and related areas. The project-oriented approach with many examples and detailed explanations will guide you step by step from the initial idea to the ability to design high-quality productions and manage the development process.
content.title_en: Introduction to the design of multimedia web applications

content.text: Injection pressure of modern passenger car diesel engines: influence on soot emission. Soot emission in diesel-engine combustion -- models of injection-jet-guided mixture formation -- influence of external exhaust gas return on soot emission -- influence of injection pressure on soot emission -- model for the two-phase area within the fuel beam -- validation of the model by motor investigations -- summary. The exhaust gas return is also one of the most important measures of internal motor reduction of NOx emissions in the passenger car diesel engine in the future. The NOx reduction potential is directly coupled with the receipt of low soot values with high back-guided exhaust emissions. Yvan Gauthier investigates how the high kinetic energy of the fuel beam can be implemented in partial load mode in such a way that the soot emission in the exhaust gas is significantly reduced. He first analyses the conventional car diesel combustion method and introduces new parameters in order to establish a correlation between input sizes of the engine with the soot emission in the exhaust gas. In the main part, he develops a two-phase fuel emission of the fuel emission, which is then the fuel emission of the fuel.
content.title_en: Injection pressure with modern passenger car diesel engines : influence on the soot emission

content.text: Statistics : An understandable introduction. This textbook of statistical data analysis was designed specifically for introductory courses and is aimed at all those who are looking for an easy-to-understand introduction to social science statistics. It refers to the field of educational and social sciences and does not treat the material as content-independent mathematical knowledge. They learn: - The basic methods of descriptive and inference statistics - The most important techniques of graphical representation - The logic of statistical argumentation - The basic principles of more complex statistical methods - Outputs of SPSS or SYSTAT to read correctly - Results of statistical analyses to interpret - Results of research projects to understand Dr. Udo Kuckartz is professor of empirical educational science and methods of social research at the Philipps University Marburg, heads the Marburg working group Methods Evaluation (MAGMA) and has many years of experience in statistical education. Stefan Rädker is a research associate at MAGMA and teaches methods of social research and social science data analysis. Thomas Ebert is a research associate, Julia Schehl is a research associate at MAGMA.
content.title_en: Statistics : An understandable introduction

content.text: The demographic impact of urban housing districts: development scenarios and options for action. Dr. Olaf Schnur is a representative professor of human geography at the Institute of Geography of the University of Potsdam. His main areas of work are urban and social geography, urban development in large cities and social urban development. At the urban development-politically so important level of residential districts there were for a long time only few research work with regard to demographic processes. This is no coincidence, because "the district" withdraws simple analyses. Olaf Schnur opens up new content and methodical perspectives: Using an investigation of four German cities he explores demographically and structurally differently structured residential districts in a creative mix of methods (including scenario technology, Delphi method). This will result in development scenarios within the framework of a residential district typology, "tools" for municipalities and the housing industry ("quartiersentwicklungsmanagement") as well as a demographically oriented, cyclical governance model of the district development. Individual types of teaching can be assigned to the district management of the urban district management.
content.title_en: Demographic impact in urban housing: development scenarios and options

content.text: Property-oriented description of the logical architecture of embedded systems. Logical architecture -- Formal foundations -- Basics of property-oriented architecture description -- Illustrative representation of property-oriented architecture specification -- Property-oriented architecture patterns -- Case study -- Summary and outlook. Automotive embedded systems are complex distributed networks consisting of numerous hardware and software subsystems. Many functionalities are distributed and can only be provided by the interaction of several subsystems. The logical architecture design, in which the specification of network architecture and distributed functionalities takes place, is therefore an essential part of the development process. In order to reduce the quality assurance effort and achieve high product quality, a specification of behavior and functionality is already important in the system design, which does not allow for ambiguities and at the same time allows precise definition of free spaces for further system development. David Trachtenherz develops the solution approach of property-oriented description of the logical architecture of embedded systems, which supports a precise declarative specification of functional properties with selectable degree of abstraction for different development phases and levels.
content.title_en: Property-oriented description of the logical architecture of embedded systems

content.text: Conventional drivetrain and hybrid drives. Application-related presentations are the hallmark of the book series "Bosch Fachinformation Automobil". Tailored to meet the need for practical background knowledge, the Auto-Fachmann finds a comprehensive overview of the structure and functioning of today's hybrid vehicles, including fuel cells and alternative fuels, an overview of transmissions and a detailed presentation of the electronic transmission control system. The belt offers the Bosch specialist knowledge first-hand and is therefore ideally suited for the everyday life of the development engineer, for the professional
content.title_en: Conventional powertrain and hybrid drives

content.text: International Contract Logistics: Theory and Practice also for smaller companies. International Contract Logistics as a Challenge for Small and Medium-sized Logistics Companies -- International Contract Logistics -- Implications of International Contract Logistics Process Research -- Internationalization Strategies of Logistics SMEs – Empirical Analysis -- Development of a Guide for the Implementation of International Contract Logistics Projects in SMEs -- Overall Conclusion and Recommendations for Action. In the field of contract logistics, no fundamental scientific analysis has yet been carried out. In this area, there is also a great discrepancy between operational practice and scientific discourse. The book therefore scientifically works on this topic and translates the results into a practice-oriented internationalization guide. Initially, the implications of internationalization process theories for international contract logistics are analysed for SMEs, in order to then present the results of empirical quantitative and qualitative studies on internationalization strategies or success factors of internationalization of logistics SMEs. Finally, these results are translated into a guide that analyses information for successful internationalization in practice using checklists and presents them with clear examples.
content.title_en: Internationalization in contract logistics : Theory and practice for smaller companies

content.text: Basics of technical documentation : Create instructions in a comprehensible and standard-oriented manner. This book provides practical expertise and process knowledge for the preparation of instructions. Based on relevant laws, guidelines and standards, a detailed content model for instructions is presented. The author describes in detail the process of documentation creation from project planning to translation and provides an insight into the daily work of the technical editor. Practically designed and illustrated chapters deal with the special requirements for the formulation of guiding texts and their functional and target group-oriented design. The selection and the correct use of visualization options are treated as well as the modular creation of instructions and the specificities of the US market. Table of Contents -- Basic -- Laws, guidelines and standards -- Documentation process -- Formulating instructions -- Design instructions -- Design instructions -- Designing safety instructions -- Visualisation -- Instructions modularly create -- Editorial guidelines -- Instructions for the US market -- The instructions in the business context -- Index.
content.title_en: Basics of technical documentation : Compile instructions intelligible and conform to the standards

content.text: The overcrowded sky: aviation in the 21st century. In this insider report on aviation 2000, visions of the future are not spared, but the reality of the present is the reality: mass tourism, the competition of airlines, insufficient aviation safety, recession in the aircraft industry, environmental degradation by the construction of gigantic airports, the failure of planning aviation managers and politicians. Braunburg (born 1924), former jet pilot at Lufthansa (last BA 3/92), comes to the conclusion that "the sky over Europe is not crowded at all, but is only poorly managed." - The latest critical aviation history, which reads well. (2) (Gisela Jonas)
content.title_en: The crowded sky : Aviation in the 21st century

content.title_en: Roles and Permission Concepts : Approaches for Identity and Access Management in the Company

content.text: Request-generating systems: Application analysis, implementation and optimization concepts. Flexible data access is essential in current information systems to meet the increased user requirements. Generating approaches are therefore used in a wide range of application areas to provide specific instructions for data access. Holger Schwarz discusses approaches to request generation and highlights implementation and optimization concepts. He explains the generation approaches in specific application scenarios from areas such as business intelligence, workflow management and search technologies. The spectrum covered ranges from individual applications to tools used in application development. The second focus is on current approaches to the optimization of complex structures of generated data access. These are presented and their optimization potential are demonstrated in sample scenarios. Basics -- Use of request-generating systems -- Scenarios and system examples -- Classification of request-generating systems -- Approaches to generate data processing instructions -- Approaches to optimize generated data processing instructions -- Deepening and evaluating selected optimization approaches -- Summary and outlook.
content.title_en: Request generating systems : application analysis, implementation and optimization concepts

content.text: The basics detection manual: Equipment and procedures. The basics exploration -- Historical development in drilling technology -- Basics of engineering geology -- Drilling technology -- Equipment and tools -- Grounds exploration drilling -- Drilling results detect and document -- Groundwater measuring points -- Investigations in drilling hole -- Exploring -- Use of computer -- Water in the building ground -- Grounds improvements -- Geothermal -- Contract and legal questions in special deep construction -- Occupational safety -- Quality assurance according to DIN EN ISO 9000 ff. -- Training and further education. With this manual, the author includes a significant gap in the literature. All areas of ground detection are detailed and practical in the comprehensive basic work, and important equipment and tools are described in detail according to the latest state of the art. The author also addresses the high risks in the basics engineering in connection with the topic of work safety.
content.title_en: Manual of ground detection : equipment and procedures

content.text: Risk management in insurance companies. To address the issue of risk management, it is necessary to include elements of insurance business theory, financial management and, of course, statistics. This book is intended to provide an overview of all the basics: from mathematical terms and methods to legal principles and methods of capital investment management. The core areas of insurance technology and investment are separately prepared, so that the book can also be used as an appropriate reference book. A combination of the asset and liabilities side of an insurance company to asset liability management takes place in a separate chapter. Basics: risk theoretical principles and procedures; basics of financial derivatives; legal bases of risk management; control tasks -- liability management: insurance risks; insurance technology procedures; control tasks -- asset management: investment principles; financial risks; financial risk management; control tasks -- value and risk oriented corporate management: risk management; risk models of the insurance industry; control tasks -- solutions to control tasks.
content.title_en: Risk management in insurance undertakings

content.text: Enterprise Architecture Frameworks Compendium : Over 50 frameworks for IT management. Introduction -- Introduction of a basic understanding of concepts -- Research and order of enterprise architecture frameworks -- Basics for describing selected frameworks in the interest of the information manager -- Detailed description of selected frameworks -- Exemplary implementation of individual frameworks within a fictitious application scenario -- Annex A: Conspect on Basic Capital Frameworks -- Annex B: Framework Selection Guide -- Literature Index -- Index. The author deals with over fifty Enterprise Architecture Frameworks (EAF), including the Zachman EAF, TOGAF, FEAF, DoDAF and the ARIS concept. First, the use of each framework is briefly and concisely presented. Then, over thirty of these EAFs are described in detail. Focus is on the respective framework metamodel with the architecture and procedure reference model. In addition, the reader receives information on the history, market relevance, availability and purchase costs of the frameworks. The summary in the form of a tabular comparison is the respective framework metamodel with the architecture and procedure model.
content.title_en: Enterprise Architecture Frameworks Compendium : Over 50 frameworks for IT management

content.text: RFID-Baulogistikleitstand : Research report on the project "RFID-supported control and documentation system for extended construction logistics using the example of construction logisticsleitstand for the construction site". In order to achieve the goals of a construction project with regard to dates, costs and qualities, the supply and disposal of the correct objects must be carried out at the right time, in the right quality and quantity, at the right place and at the right costs. To this end, inter alia, a functioning exchange of information and the recording, control, and documentation of the supplied materials as well as the persons entering the construction site is necessary in real time. The goal of the research project "RFID-Baulogistikleitstand" was to analyse the building logistics process chains and to develop an overall concept for material and personnel logistics supported by Auto-ID technology. This concept enables on the one hand a continuous exchange of information of the parties involved in the construction and contributes to the optimization of logistic processes by modifying and integrating existing applications.
content.title_en: RFID-Baulogistikleitstand : Research report on the project "RFID-supported control and documentation - system for extended construction logistics using the example of building logisticsleitstand for the construction site"

content.text: Semantic Technologies: Basic Concepts – Applications. This textbook provides a comprehensive introduction to basics, potentials and applications of semantic technologies. It is aimed at students of informatics and related disciplines as well as developers who want to use semantic technologies at the workplace or in distributed applications. However, with its practical examples, there are also users and decision-makers in companies who have a broad overview of the benefits and possibilities of this technology. Semantic technologies enable computers not only to store and retrieve information, but to evaluate it accordingly to its meaning, to connect it to new, and thus to provide flexible and purposeful useful services. In the first part, this book presents the techniques, languages and representationalisms referred to as semantic technologies. These elements allow to describe the knowledge contained in information formally and thus to be processed for the computer, to present concepts and relationships and finally to ask content for, open and accessible in networks. The second part describes how semantic technologies can be used by elementary functions and comprehensive services of information and knowledge-based applications, to include the multi-dimensional functions of the use of the new functions of the use of the information.
content.title_en: Semantic technologies: Basics – Concepts – Applications

content.text: Line diagrams in knowledge communication : A mathematical-didactical study. Being able to represent and communicate knowledge is an important prerequisite for participation in today's knowledge society. Line diagrams from formal conceptual analysis as part of a conceptual knowledge processing are a good means of enabling and stimulating communication of knowledge. Starting from a philosophical consideration of the meaning of line diagrams in knowledge processing, diagrams are presented as means of communication that bridge the gap between users and mathematical-logical representations, as well as between our everyday thinking and formal representations. Good line diagrams can be characterized in terms of their expressive power and strength to support communication processes in their meaning for knowledge communication. For this purpose, it is identified which thought actions are activated and trained in the creation and subsequent use of line diagrams. Finally, didactical basic assumptions and concrete elaborations of the learning environment for formal conceptual analysis are presented.
content.title_en: Line diagrams in knowledge communication : A mathematical-didactical study

content.text: What is the problem - Six Sigma+Lean Toolset: Mindset for the successful implementation of improvement projects. The Six Sigma+Lean Toolset is a comprehensive collection of all the tools needed for the improvement of processes for the project or workshop work. All tools are shown in a clear and clear structure and supplemented by examples and application tips. The chronology corresponds to the procedure of an improvement project with the steps D(efine), M(ease), A(nalyze), I(mprove) and C(ontrol. The present third edition of the book represents the meanwhile 15 years of practical experience of the UMS with the Six Sigma+Lean tool box. The most important innovation is to guide the user by asking questions about the selection of the suitable tool. This paradigm shift from tool to mindset has proven itself in the project work and ensures that operational problems with the aim of the efficient solution are addressed with the aim of the problem - how to solve the problem - how to solve the problem - how to solve the problem - how to solve the problem - how to solve the problem - how to handle the problem - how to handle the problem?
content.title_en: Six Sigma+Lean Toolset : Mindset for successful implementation of improvement projects

content.text: Partitioning for efficient duplicate recognition in relational data. Duplicates or duplicates are several data sets that describe the same real world object, for example multiple customers in a CRM system or different representations of a product. Finding these duplicates is a complex and time-consuming task for modern computers, too. Uwe Draisbach compares two of the relevant partitioning strategies that make an intelligent selection of dataset pairs to compare. From this he develops a generalized procedure and shows that an intelligent selection of dataset pairs can significantly reduce the effort without significantly reducing the quality of duplicate recognition. The work was awarded the "Information Quality Best Master Degree Award" by the German Society for Information and Data Quality. Duplicate recognition -- Blocking methods -- Windowing methods -- Comparison Blocking and Sorted-Neighborhood method -- Generalized method.
content.title_en: Partitioning for efficient duplicate detection in relational data

content.text: The city of short paths: everyday and mobile homes in Berlin's urban districts. City of short paths - introduction to the research project -- data and methods -- lifestyles,- mobility,- living conditions and mobility of migrants,- residential mobility -- shopping mobility A compact and functionally mixed city is once again sought out as an urban model and the guiding principle "City of short paths" is an expression of this approach. The motivation for the development of the guiding principle is closely linked to spatial structures that emerged during the suburbanisation phase and their effects (e.g. area consumption, increase in traffic and environmental pollution). The contributions investigate everyday mobility in the areas of shopping, leisure, residential environment and mobile homes in different Berlin's neighbourhoods. Based on extensive quantitative and qualitative surveys, the mobility behaviour of the inhabitants is examined to what extent the planning guidelines of a city of short paths conform to the planning guidelines of a city of short distances.
content.title_en: The city of short distances : everyday and mobile homes in Berlin's city districts

content.text: Parameter extraction of semiconductor components: Simulation with PSPICE. Complementary to lecture, to computational exercises and in particular to the laboratory internship in the electronics field, analytical methods for the extraction of SPICE model parameters of selected semiconductor components are presented. For components from the DEMO version of the OrCAD-PSPICE program, it is shown how their static and dynamic electric model parameters can be recovered with SPICE analyses. This parameter determination is presented for switching diodes, capacity diodes, Z diodes, npn bipolar transistors, N-channel spheroidal field effect transistor, CMOS array transistors, operating amplifiers and optocouplers. The content Semiconductor diodes – bipolar transistors – blocking layer field effect transistors – Mos field effect transisors – performance mos field effect transistor – operation amplifier – optocouplers The target groups Students of the Electrical Engineering and Technical and Applied Physics degree programmes at universities and technical universities Engineers and physicists in practice The author Prof. Dr. Field Transmitter - Stahlmann is the Head of the Electro-Electronal-Electron.
content.title_en: Parameter extraction for semiconductor components : Simulation with PSPICE

content.text: Parallel programming. Introduction -- Architecture of parallel platforms -- Parallel programming models -- Performance analysis of parallel programs -- Thread programming -- Message-Passing Programming -- Linear equation systems -- Nonlinear equation systems. Through cost-effective multiprocessor desktop computers, clusters of PCs and innovations such as hyperthreading technology or multicore processors, parallel computing resources are omnipresent. However, the efficient use of this parallel computing power is only possible through the use of parallel programming techniques, which thus spread to all areas of software creation. This book presents parallel programming for conventional parallel computers and for the novel parallel platforms comprehensively. In addition to the basics of parallel programming, portable programming environments such as pthreads, Java threads, OpenMP, MPI, PVM or UPC are presented in detail and the additional programming models are discussed. Parallel programming techniques leading to the successful realization of efficient parallel programs are presented with a variety of examples.
content.title_en: Parallel programming

content.text: Decision-making procedure for complex problems: A heuristic approach. Introduction:- Part I: Decision-making problems and decision-making procedures -- Part II: A general heuristic decision-making process -- Part III: Special problems and approaches to their solution -- Glossary -- Index of relevant words -- Bibliography. The most important task of executives is to make decisions of great importance. This is a difficult task, because the important decisions are usually complex. This book presents a decision-making process with which complex problems can be dealt with gradually. Compared to other texts on decision-making methodology, the statements place great emphasis on problem analysis, variant development and the development of the decision-making matrix. The book is suitable for executives who, however, are well-founded in practice with the management of complex problems. It also provides a good basis for practical training at universities and universities of applied sciences. The new edition has been revised linguistically and contains important extensions. The target groups executives in industry and service companies as well as in consulting companies at universities and universities of applied sciences.
content.title_en: Decision-making procedures for complex problems : A heuristic approach

content.text: Mathematics for engineers and scientists: Linear algebra and analysis in R. A ALL EXCELLENTLY designed work - with numerous creative and instructive examples. To whom is this book aimed? Students of engineering sciences as well as other technical and physical courses of study benefit from reading this work, especially because of the example-oriented approach to the content. Also mathematics and teaching students offer a determined access to the subject through their proof orientation. What makes this book special? Each section is attached tasks of different levels that directly address the presented sub-areas and thus serve the exercise and understanding. A total of 430 different tasks are in this book. Real numbers -- Complex numbers and polynomials -- Number sequences and series -- Linear algebra -- Vectors and matrices -- Real functions of a variable -- Differential calculus in R -- Integration of functions into R -- Function sequences and function series.
content.title_en: Mathematics for engineers and scientists : Linear algebra and analysis in R

content.text: Democratisation and Decentralization: State Organisational Reforms in the Context of Change of Regime and Government in Spain, Poland and Great Britain. Democratisation -- Transition -- Decentralization -- State Organisational Reform -- Context -- Institutions The transition from authoritarianism to democracy not only led to the introduction of democratic institutions in the political centres in the European states, but also had consequences for the entire state structure. A complex division of tasks and powers between the centre, regional and local levels was accompanied by the political system changes. Political decentralization, which, due to its symbolic and "technical" importance, was one of the institutional priorities of democratization, was subject to the conditions of political system change. Philip Stöver's study examines the interactions between these processes, using the democratisation and decentralisation processes in Spain and Poland. Comparison with the British state organisational reforms, which have taken place in a consolidated democracy, shows that the concrete decentralization processes of Spain and Poland cannot be explained without reference to the democratisation context.
content.title_en: Democratisation and Decentralisation: State Organisational Reforms in the Context of Change of Regime and Government in Spain, Poland and Great Britain

content.text: Russia - Introduction to the political system and comparison with the post-Soviet states. The political system of Russia is the focus of this book. Starting with a review of the historical roots of today's Russia in the Tsarist Empire and in the Soviet Union, it describes the political culture, presents the government system and turns in detail to the practices of rule and the most important political actors. It is common to evaluate Russia in comparison with the Western democracies. This book chooses a different perspective: Russia as one among other successor states of the Soviet Union. The second part of this book contains short portraits of other post-Soviet states, in particular Ukraine, Belarus and the states of the Caucasus and Central Asia. The content of Russia to the Soviet Union and back again. The emergence of the new Russia.- Political culture.- The government system.- The regime: Institutions and practices.- The world economic close points to the state world.- Russia in the state world.- Russia's neighbors.- The post-Soviet world. The target groups Students and lecturers of the political sciences.- Political historian.- In the political education. The Hamburg author of the German- University of the German-Kurthian-Relig.
content.title_en: Russia : Introduction to the political system and comparison with the post-Soviet states

content.text: Computer and Internet criminal law: A ground plan. Fundamentals: Introduction.- Constitutional considerations.- International guidelines -- General part: Criminal law.- Concept of writing.- Criminal law treatment of providers.- Doing and failing -- Perpetratorship and participation.- Injustice.- Special part: Statemental offences -- Interference in the personal sphere of life -- Fraud and computer fraud.- Attacks on software and hardware.- Debit of documents in computer.- Other computer and Internet offences of the StGB -- Sub-crime.- Criminal law: Basics -- Confiscation (§§ 94 et seq. StPO) -- Search (§§ 102 et seq. StPO) -- Use of technical means -- Short summary and outlook: To combat computer crime -- Outlook: Information criminal law as a new discipline? The modern information and communication technology means a challenge for the entire law. Criminal law is before the task of recording both classic offences in their new technicalized subject matter as well as new ones, as the computer network allows to address these issues in a more comprehensive manner.
content.title_en: Computer and Internet criminal law : A floor plan

content.text: International coordination of national enforcement activities: A critical analysis with special consideration of the German Accounting Auditing Agency. Practical and system-theoretical observations from the perspective of the German Accounting Auditing Agency (DPR) show that the international coordination of national enforcement activities allows active regulatory arbitrage in the current state, makes regulatory cooperation between national enforcement agencies more difficult and does not prevent the development of local IFRSs. Roland Bockmann develops ideal-typical conceptual models that address these shortcomings and in the best case can eliminate them. Enforcement of accounting -- Internationalization of capital markets and harmonisation of capital market-oriented accounting -- Conceptual models for the international coordination of national enforcement activities -- German Accounting Auditing Agency (DPR) -- Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) -- European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA).
content.title_en: International coordination of national enforcement activities: A critical analysis with special attention to the German Audit Agency for Accounting

content.text: Theoretical approaches to dealing with periphericization -- Empirical results from German mid-city cities -- Findings of further studies. Global economic restructuring processes, interregional migration and demographic change lead to a tightening of spatial disparities. The result is peripheral spaces that are characterised by a bundling of developmental disadvantages and problem situations. Within these spaces, however, differentiated development dynamics can be observed. Growth, stagnation and shrinkage processes often lie in close cooperation between time and space. Furthermore, the cities pursue different approaches in dealing with peripheric processes. The different development processes, governance forms and strategic repositioning of cities are the subject of the book. The focus is on the question of which options and logics influence the handling of local actors with peripheric processes. The content The theoretical approaches to dealing with periphericization. Empirical results from German mid-city cities.
content.title_en: Peripheralization, stigmatization, dependence? : German cities and their handling of peripheralization processes

content.text: The ever-increasing requirements for internal combustion engines do not stop at its heart – the piston. For less weight, friction or even more wear resistance, deep knowledge of the internal motor processes as well as the suitable materials, construction and machining processes for pistons, including the necessary testing measures, are necessary. Without such specific know-how, no expert in automotive technology can cope with any more, whether it is involved in design, development, testing or maintenance. This book answers these questions in a detailed and very clear and understandable manner. Piston function, requirements and construction methods Design guidelines Simulation of operational strength by FEM materials Cooling Component testing Motor testing Engineers with the field of engine development and maintenance Teaching staff and students from the fields of mechanical engineering, engine engineering and vehicle construction Engineering interests MAHLE is one of the 30 largest automotive suppliers and is the world's leading manufacturer of components and systems for the internal combustion engine and its periphery.
content.title_en: Piston and motor testing

content.text: Negotiations in consensus procedure: Variants of collective decision-making in expert bodies. Expert bodies aim at negotiating results, which are shared by a wide range of experts and stakeholders. Their decision-making processes follow an informal procedure, in which formal coordination is usually dispensed with and the collective decision is made by the absence of open resistance. This mode of consensus allows power asymmetries between the parties involved to emerge and leads to a variance of actual levels of approval. Eva Krick shows which mechanisms of agreement in the informal consensus procedure work, how actors are excluded and selective consent is achieved, but under which circumstances the interests of all parties is also possible. The content · Consensus procedures and variants of consensus decision · Degree of consent and power asymmetries of consensusal negotiation processes · Mechanisms and conditions of negotiated decision-making · Democratic legitimacy of governance with expert bodies The target groups Lecturers and students of social sciences The author Dr. Eva Krick is a political scientist at Humboldt University Berlin. Expert bodies as governance instruments - Operationalization of dependent variables "adoption" - approval of consensus- approval of consensus- approval of consensus- approval of consensus- approval of consensus- approval of consensus- approval of consensus-decisions
content.title_en: Negotiation in consensus procedure : Variants of collective decision in expert bodies

content.text: User acceptance of web-based applications : Model for acceptance measurement and identification of potential improvements. Modern web-based applications are increasingly being disseminated in our everyday lives. This is not only a form of user interaction interface, but also new social concepts within the terms of Web 2.0 and Enterprise 2.0. Daniel B. Wilhelm is studying the acceptance determinants of these applications. Based on the Technology Acceptance Model and user satisfaction research, he develops and validates a combined research model. In separate studies, he also investigates the extent to which the model is able to predict real system use.
content.title_en: User acceptance of web-based applications : model for acceptance measurement and identification of potential improvements

content.text: Multivariate modelling of operational risks in credit institutions. Operational risks affect almost every business activity of banks. They have a high potential for damage and pose a major challenge for the risk management of banks. Verena Bayer examines approaches to quantify operational risks and model the dependency structure between the business fields of a credit institution. The author examines the practicality of the procedures using extensive simulation studies and the empirical analysis of real loss data.
content.title_en: Multivariate Modelling of Operational Risks in Credit Institutions

content.text: The new mobile commerce: success factors and best practices. Mobile commerce - online channel of the future? -- obile-Web-Excellence- What is that exactly?- success factors in M-commerce -- best practices in the new M-commerce -- risk-benefit in M-commerce. Mobile commerce is presented as an online channel of the future, driven in particular by the rapid spread of smartphones and tablet computers and which is also envisaged for the next years stormy growth rates. Gerrit Heinemann explains what the special features of modern M-commerce are and how it differs from the other trading forms. This lays the foundation for the elaboration of specific success factors of M-commerce. Based on recognized best practices, it is demonstrated how successful mobile online commerce represents and what the "lessons- learned" of the last years are. The content of Mobile Commerce - online channel of the future. Mobile Web-Excellence- What is the actual success factors in M-commerce Best Practices in the new M-Commerce market leader and business leader in the business community.
content.title_en: The new mobile commerce : success factors and best practices

content.text: Equipment in machine tool construction: basics, calculation and construction. General -- Determining and clamping the device on the machine tool table -- Determining the workpiece in the device -- Clamping the workpiece in the device -- Device constructions -- Device parts. This easily understandable, scientifically sound book is addressed to designers and students; it deals with all areas of positioning and clamping of a workpiece. Workpieces are positioned, held and held in place in devices and, if necessary, guided. As diverse as the field of application of the devices, their design and design of clamping elements, clamping tools and device parts are also their design. Through the growing automation, the use of devices is constantly gaining importance. The author deals with the basics for optimal calculation and construction of devices. He attaches particular importance to the theoretical foundations for determining and clamping the workpiece in the device with many calculation and design examples and on the representation of all clamping elements and clamping tools. For the elements and tools shown, according to the DIN and factory standards of manufacturers, this knowledge enables it to calculate optimally used equipment standards and to calculate the requirements of the machine tool.
content.title_en: Machine tool construction devices : basics, calculation and construction
