content.text: Social Work in the Transformation of the Social: A Place-Determining. The Public Service Authority Social Work has become part of such a fundamental transformation process in the past decades that it has a tremendously different shape at the beginning of the second decade of the 21st century. This volume is used to systematically localize social work in this process of welfare state transformation.The content of social work in the transformation of the social • Social work as part of the welfare state arrangement • Social work and social services • Social management or management of the social? • Social work as a professional service authority • Power, subject and criticism • Transformed ways of thinking and expression Social work • Changed formats of the body government • The perspective of a welfare state transformation research in social work The target groups • Subject communities in the areas of social work, education science, sociology and political science • Students and professionals in social work • Social and educational policy decision-makers The author Dr. Fabian Kessl is professor at the Institute for Social Work and Social Policy at the University of Duisburg-Essen.
content.title_en: Social Work in the Transformation of the Social: A Localization

content.text: - Integral safety of vehicles: Biomechanics - Simulation - Safety in the development process. The passive safety of vehicles is of high importance in the design of vehicles, in the survey results of vehicle users and in the reporting in trade journals and automobile magazines. Their constantly growing importance as well as the high innovation rate is taken into account in particular by the inclusion of the chapters Sensorics for accident detection and safety engineering in the development process of vehicles. The sections for computational simulation, for the inspection and evaluation of safety as well as the vehicle development process have been revised and updated accordingly. In addition, the chapter Sensorics for accident detection has been extended and supplemented with active safety systems and assistance systems. The content The integral safety.- Accident research.- Biomechanics.- Safety measures.- Sensorics for accident detection.- Inspection and evaluation of safety.- Experimental and computational simulation.- Passive safety in the vehicle development process. The target groups Development engineers of the automotive industry with field of vehicle safety.- Accident research.- Vehicle expert instructors and students of vehicle engineering The editor of the Dresden-Frank.
content.title_en: Integral safety of motor vehicles : Biomechanics - Simulation - Safety in the development process

content.text: Risk management in insurance companies. To address the topic of risk management, one needs components of insurance business teaching, financial management and statistics. This book is intended to provide an overview of all basics: from mathematical terms and methods to legal principles and methods of capital investment management. The core areas of insurance technology and investment are separately prepared, so that the book can also be used as a suitable reference book. A combination of the asset and liabilities side of an insurance company to asset liability management takes place in a separate chapter. The second edition contains some modifications, e.g. in the chapter "Asset Management" the investment principles were adapted to the BaFin circular 4/2011. The authors Professor Dr. Christian Möbius teaches at DHBW Karlsruhe financial economics subjects such as investment & financing, financial and risk management as well as asset management. Professor Dr. Catherine Pallenberg teaches at DHBW Mannheim in the course "Insurance" of the course "Actuarial Mathematics of Life Insurance, Risk Management and Insurance Management. Basics - Management- Asset Management- Management-
content.title_en: Risk management in insurance undertakings

content.text: The Basics of Digital Information Transmission: From Theory to Mobile Applications. The Basics of Applied Information Theory -- Basics of Channel Encoding -- Digital Modulation and Transmission Procedures -- The Basics of Digital Information Transmission (MIM) is a topic of interest to the Department of Information Technology and Communication Technology. Current research areas such as multi-antenna systems (MIMO systems), multi-user communication and network coding are based on information theory approaches, but also on knowledge of coding theory, transmission technology and estimation methods. The main focus of this textbook is on powerful wireless transmission techniques, with particular attention being paid to mobile communications. Most of the principles and procedures are also applicable in other areas of digital transmission technology and related fields. By cross-references, a connection between sub-divisions is established and the reader is thus able to understand the essential facets of digital information transmission holistically.
content.title_en: Basics of digital information transmission : from theory to mobile applications

content.text: The influence of children on marital stability: Empirical analysis with data from the family survey. Theories of marital instability and children -- Empirical findings on children and divorce -- Effects of differentiated operationalization. Children are an important factor in the stability of marriages. But not every child necessarily increases marital stability: Depending on the relationship between children and their parents, the reduction or increase in marital stability is to be expected. This aspect is less considered in divorce research. Based on the theories of family sociology and the data of the family survey, Andrea Breitenbach examines the influences of different characteristics of children and different marital relationships on marital stability. It shows how relevant theories justify the influence of children on marital stability. The results confirm that depending on childhood relationship and other aspects, contrary directions of the risk of divorce can be observed. The content of theories of marital instability and children.- Empirical findings on children and divorce.- Effects of differentiated operationalization The target group and students of the social sciences in Frankfurt University are the subject of the academic community.
content.title_en: The influence of children on marital stability : Empirical examination with data from the family survey

content.text: Professional video technology: Basics, film technology, television technology, equipment and studio technology in SD, HD, DI, 3D. Development history -- The analog video signal -- The digital video signal -- Television signal transmission -- Film technology -- Image recording systems -- Image playback systems -- Image recording devices -- Video signal processing -- Video studio systems. The profound transition from analogue to digital technology is revolutionary in video technology: it leads to linking with computer and telecommunications technology. In this context, the book covers all aspects of modern video and video studio technology that are of interest to students of media technology, communication and telecommunications technology, as well as to engineers and media practitioners: the basics of perception and color metrics, the analogue and digital video signal transmission, the television signal transmission, the analogue and digital film technology, image recording and image reproduction systems, image recording devices, video signal processing and video studio systems. In practice, the book has been widely adapted to the needs of the media, especially in the field of video reproduction.

content.text: The lecture is held in the Department of Electrical Power Supply and Power Technology. The lecture is held in the Department of Electrical Power Supply and Power Technology. The lecture is held in the Department of Electrical Power Technology and is held in the Department of Electrical Power Technology. The lecture is a lecture on the entire field of teaching from one source and is therefore suitable for the study but also for the refresher of the knowledge of those involved in the field. The high social relevance of energy technology leads to emotional discussions in the public. There are just a few keywords: electromobility, electro smog, nuclear power plants, CO2 emissions and CO2 balance. The book explains the relevant connections to these areas in a generally understandable form without ideological determinations. The content of the lecture is based on the study of electrical engineering - electrical machinery - power electronics - lines - switching systems - high voltage technology - power generation - power supply networks - energy application The target groups are students of electrical engineering, especially in the field of energy technology at universities and universities as well as of economic engineering.
content.title_en: Electrical energy technology : basics, power supply, drives and power electronics

content.text: Applied statistics: An introduction to biologists and physicians. "Applied statistics" is a textbook for users of statistics who want to gain an understanding of statistical methods and a certainty in the application of these methods. Provided that only the knowledge of the school mathematical required for university or university entrance is provided. The textbook first introduces the probability calculation and presents basic probability distributions. Detailedly, the parameter estimation and testing of hypotheses are dealt with. The usual correlation measures and selected regression models are rounded off the statistical basic education. The chapters on variance analysis models and multivariate methods provide an insight into two other areas relevant to statistical practice. In addition, the specialisations and special applications are provided in supplementary sections. Numerous, fully calculated examples and exercise tasks with a detailed solution part make the "Applied statistical methods" a workbook that is also suitable for self-study. The orientation to the statistics software R (by reference to the corresponding R functions and the application of the statistical problem-solvent in the application of the statistical codes)
content.title_en: Applied statistics : An introduction for biologists and physicians

content.text: Food Safety Reports 2011 : National reporting to the EU. National residue control plan (NRCP) and import monitoring plan (EÜP). The NRKP includes all food-producing, live and slaughtered animal species as well as primary products from animals such as milk, eggs and honey. From 1989-1994 the NRKP set out requirements for monitoring cattle, pigs, sheep and horses. In 1995 poultry was also included. Since 1998 fish from aquaculture and since 1999 rabbits, game, eggs, milk and honey have also been controlled according to EU-wide regulations. The NRKP provides an annual set of substances for which the samples taken are to be tested at least (obligatory substances). Moreover, a defined number of animals and products can be selected according to current requirements and according to specific circumstances in the countries.The NRKP also covers the entire range of animal primary products or products imported into the Community via Germany. The range of substances and the country's examination figures are determined in accordance with the risk approach of Regulation (EC) No 882/2004.
content.title_en: Food Safety Reports 2011 : National reporting to the EU. National Residue Control Plan (NRCP) and Import Monitoring Plan (EDP)

content.text: The cooperative constitutional state - from culture and as culture: preliminary studies on a universal constitutional doctrine. These "pre-study" on a universal constitutional doctrine – only as subtitles is dared – go back to the book »The Constitutional State«, translated into many languages at the end of the 90s. Growth rings are similar, later studies were updated in 2012 and systematically integrated, so that they can identify a whole. Almost a hundred constitutions from northern Europe to South Africa, from Latin America to Asia, in particular in their development of texts in history and present. Peter Häberle works with the contextual thesis of 1979, the »cultural constitutional comparison« of 1982 and the textual paradigm as well as the juridical comparison as the fifth interpretation method of 1989. Here – new – the partial constitutions of international law are combined with those of the national constitutional state to form an ensemble that indicates the possible way to a universal constitutional doctrine.
content.title_en: The cooperative constitutional state - from culture and as culture : preliminary studies on a universal constitutional doctrine

content.text: Mentoring as gender-appropriate human resources development: effectiveness and limitations of a program in engineering sciences. Starting point for women's employment and equality -- Explanations of the underrepresentation of women in management positions -- Mentoring as an instrument of human resources development. Mentoring has a high economic situation. Whether in universities, business or politics, everywhere you find mentoring programs as gender-appropriate human resources development, which are intended to counteract the underrepresentation of women in management positions. But what really do mentoring programs bring? This fundamental question is not yet clear in the research to date, the input-output ratio difficult to grasp. Bahar Haghaniprous investigates this question by means of interviews with former participants in a mentoring program. It examines the sustainable effects of this specific measure and translates it into recommendations for action. The results show that mentoring is currently active at a psychosocial level, but demands on business and politics remain.
content.title_en: Mentoring as gender-appropriate human resources development: effectiveness and limitations of an engineering science programme

content.text: The successful management of green development projects. Environmental management.- Innovation management.- (Environmental) Competence.- Target design -- Green development projects -- Teamwork. . The emergence of successful innovations is considered essential for the preservation of the competitiveness of companies. Due to the over-use of the natural environment and the changing political, social and market-related framework conditions, the importance for companies to take new ecological paths in innovation production is increasing. In particular, products are in the focus of interest as they can be triggers of diverse environmental effects along their life cycle. Thomas Victor Kachler describes the requirements for successful management of "green development projects" and develops a model of successful development projects, which he empirically tests. The results show that especially the variables of the target design and the environmental competence in the team influence the "eco project success". The content of the operating framework for the promotion of green innovation Competence requirements and target design for green development projects Success determination of green development projects based on the characteristic number of the project - The target groups Lecturers and students of the business administration and business administration focus on cooperation.
content.title_en: Successful management of green development projects

content.text: The Mohazard Conflicts in the field of public administration and the local government, as well as the local government and the municipal officials, have been deciding whether to approve a mosque building project. But also influential representatives of local party divisions and civil society forces are developing a moderate or polarizing influence. Christoph Hohage is investigating a mosque conflict in Dortmund, which has been intensively involved in politics and media in the city since the early 2000s. The content of the research state: Mosque Conflict Methodology: Constructivist Grounded Theory Analytical Perspective: Advocacy Coalition Framework Mosque Conflict: An analysis from the perspective of the ACF Discussion of the results The target groups Dozierdeen and students of social and political science with interest in the field of public policy and the field of politics are: The M.A.D. and the M.A.D.
content.title_en: Mosque Conflicts : How Convincing-Based Coalitions Determine Local Integration Policy

content.text: Security ethics. Security ethics is a new field. This volume is the first to systematically address these issues. The need for a security ethics arose from the fact that ‘security' has become a guiding principle in the most diverse areas of society. This leitmotif has now taken the form of a fundamental value in both personal and social life. What consequences and implications have different understandings of security; how the interplay of contexts and security concepts is designed, how forms of political, social, personal and technological production of security are to be understood and evaluated, which people benefit from what form of security, are restricted or even damaged – these are only a few questions in the context of a security ethics. The content · Ethics and security · Basic questions · Forms of argumentation and application contexts · Social ways of action The target groups · Political scientists · Sociologists · Philosophers · Philosophers · Philosophers · Philosophers · Philosophers The publisher Prof. Dr. Regina Ammicht Quinn teaches ethics at the University of Tübingen.
content.title_en: Security ethics

content.text: Project organization and management in software engineering. Part I: Basics and Conceptualization -- Basics -- Procedure Models in Software Engineering -- Company and Project Organization -- Part II: Management in the project life cycle -- Project pre-run and initialization -- Project definition -- Project implementation -- Part III: Further topics -- Metrics and measurement -- Maturity models -- Tools -- Glossary -- Literature -- Index. Software Engineering aims to develop comprehensive software systems in an engineering way. Critical dimensions are costs, dates and quality. In addition to various topics in software engineering, software engineering also includes topics of project planning, project organization and project implementation, i.e. the management and organization of software projects. This book introduces the basic tasks and contexts of the organization and management of software projects. It addresses practitioners, professionals and students of computer science and covers the following topics: - Basics in software projects and their organization Procedure Models in software engineering - Company and project organization Project definition, effort estimation, supply and contract management - Project management and software management - The program management and control procedures are applied to the following topics:
content.title_en: Project organization and management in software engineering

content.text: New Field of Activity and Ideas Assessment: Methods and Processes in the Early Phases of the Innovation Process. A large number of companies today have a detailed process to efficiently translate identified ideas into products (stage gate process). The approach used to generate as many ideas as possible using creativity methods (quality from quantity) leads to the fact that many assessments and developments have to be carried out up to the stage of prototype development, which contradicts the idea of "clean innovation management". This book is dedicated to the topic of how the search fields for ideas are identified meaningfully ("Where should I look for new ideas/technologies?), and the best ideas can be filtered out to massively increase efficiency and to provide customer benefit through the use of impact-proof innovations.The content Core Competence Management Technical Limits Technology Monitoring Technology-Push- and Lead-User Approach Market-oriented Innovation Ideas Management Technology Transfer Management Identification and Evaluation of New Business The target groups of specialists and executives from the field of Corporate Development, R&D, Product Management and Marketing; Dozende und Management, die Mitarbeiterung der Innovations-Kreibung-Studien - Mitarbeiter-Studien - Innen-Studien - Bewerbung-Studien.
content.title_en: Search field determination and idea evaluation : Methods and processes in the early stages of the innovation process

content.text: The company must comply with the legal requirements for the protection of humans and the environment at all times. The requirements are strengthened by specific customer requirements. Only if the companies meet the corresponding developments can they use the resulting possibilities as entrepreneurial opportunities. In order to support companies with these requirements, a five-volume manual series on the protection of the environment was developed. In the area of water protection, employees have to have basic technological, scientific and legal knowledge. The manual on the protection of the water supply provides therefore an easy to understand overview of various topics of water protection and wastewater treatment. Using numerous graphics, an understanding of the requirements in the environmental medium "water" is awakened. The content of European water law - National water law - Natural science basics - Summarische Belastungsgrößen - Befestungsverhandlungsprozes - Process technology for wastewater treatment - Biological procedures for wastewater treatment The target groups Companies affected by water protection issues are Environmental Commissioners, auditors, water inspectors Students Environmentally oriented, technical and natural sciences degree programmes Persons with an interest in organic forestry.
content.title_en: Manual on the Protection of the Company's Waters

content.text: This book provides a structured overview of the various standards and specifications of media production for print, web and mobile devices. After a solid introduction to the basics of digital documents, their components such as texts, fonts, colors, vector graphics, pixel images and metadata are discussed in detail. The relevant standards and specifications for media production are described and illustrated with examples. The various XML/HTML5 derivatives for web and mobile devices as well as PDF are in the foreground for printing. The most important metadata formats such as JDF, XMP and EXIF are treated in the same way as the transformation of XML documents and document standards for e-books and apps for mobile devices. Here, not only the structure of the standards and specifications are explained but also their relevance for the practical work. The book is aimed at students and practitioners of media production. Basics -- Production Organization Forms -- Content and Metadata -- Layout -- Data creation for digital documents -- Data creation for printing.
content.title_en: Standards in media production

content.text: Questionnaire: A workbook. This book is a "practice book" in the truest sense of the word. It is intended to help researchers who want to use social science surveys in their empirical research. It is intended to help them develop their questionnaires in a concrete and detailed manner. The book simulates questionnaire advice, as the author has done for many years, very practically and so that readers can directly use the book when developing a questionnaire. After a brief introduction to the cognitive psychology and communication principles of the survey, a variety of methodological aspects of a questionnaire are worked out, all illustrated by examples from survey practice. The content • Cognition psychology basics of the survey • Questions and scales, survey aids • Interviewer and interview advice, questionnaire "Technology" Target groups • Social scientists • Practitioners • Students The author Rolf Porst was more than 25 years of scientific staff at GESIS - Leibniz Institute for Social Sciences in Mannheim (formerly ZUMA) and is responsible for all questions concerning the data collection in the empirical field of questionnaire research.
content.title_en: Questionnaire : A workbook

content.text: Reports on plant protection products 2012 : Annual report on plant protection control programme. In the Federal Republic of Germany, the authorities of the Länder monitor compliance with the regulations applicable to the placing on the market and use of plant protection products.The plant protection control programme is a nationwide harmonised programme for monitoring plant protection regulations. The implementation and reporting of the controls are carried out according to common standards of the Länder on the basis of a coordinated methodology manual.The determination of control stocks and the selection of farms is carried out by the Länder; in addition, there are national control priorities. The present report summarises the results of 2012.In 2,482 commercial establishments, traffic controls were carried out throughout Germany and 5,059 farms in agriculture, horticulture and forestry were carried out in the course of the monitoring of the regulation on plant protection products and plant protection equipment (Pflanogelschutzmittelverordnung) were also reviewed by official or officially recognised control bodies. 199 plant protection products were examined in terms of composition and physical, chemical and technical properties. 1 Summary -- 2 Introduction -- 3 Organisation of traffic and application control -- 4 Type and scope of controls - Status of operations - 6 Terms of use - Traffic Controls - 6
content.title_en: Reports on plant protection products 2012 : Annual report on plant protection control programme

content.text: In-house Management of Value-Creating Processes: A Configuring Approach of Distributed Artificial Intelligence using the example of Traffic Infrastructure Building. The advantage of intelligent software agents to optimize themselves even under incomplete information is often unused by strict protocols and voting procedures. Sitated agents who consistently align their actions to their environment are usually subject to simple stimulus reaction schemes. Ansger Jacob systematically uses economic theories to design a predictive agent model that enables the self-optimization of intelligent software agents even under incomplete information. The individual agent model is able to collect active and targeted action-relevant information and to use it for its decision-making. This enables the design of information systems of the Distributed Artificial Intelligence in weakly structured areas of application, in which a complete survey of the information situation cannot always be assumed. The Agent Model examines Ansger Jacob in a simulation experiment under the conditions of use of Traffic Infrastructure Building. The content of Process Control in the Construction Sector Control with Intelligent Software Agents The Simulation Experiment The Target Group, Dozende and the Student Analysis of the Field of Activity.
content.title_en: Control of value-added processes in the law of the Member States : A design approach of distributed artificial intelligence using the example of transport infrastructure construction

content.text: What the Industry at the Raw Materials Drop: The Fight for the Most Important Mineral Resources. Economy at the Raw Materials Drop Günter Pilarsky, one of the few German mine operators, explains what the issue of raw materials protection is all about, what promising approaches are to be found and what demands are to be made on politics, interest groups and society. Metallic raw materials are indispensable: without them there is no industrial value chain, without industry no innovations and without innovations no future technologies to solve the challenges of climate protection and the sustainable development of the economy. A secure connection between the mining of raw materials and their processing in the industry is therefore important. Only with a holistic approach are economics and politics able to meet both the demands of global technological developments and national individual interests. Günter Pilarsky thinks: We have no choice but have to face the struggle for raw materials now if we do not want to be among the losers in the future. The content of what rare raw materials have to do with our prosperity We strongly depend on raw materials on our future Where the Raw Materials Drop What must be done The target of decision makers and managers in the business ministries, business leaders, business leaders and business leaders.
content.title_en: Economy at the resource drip : The struggle for the most important mineral resources

content.text: The Universe of the Sun -- The Sun -- The State Sizes of Stars -- Star Atmospheres -- Star Formation -- The History of Astronomy -- The Sky Mechanics -- Astronomical Instruments -- The Physics of the Bodies of the Solar System -- The Physics of the Sun -- The Physics of the Solar System -- The Physics of the Sun -- The State Sizes of Stars -- Star Atmospheres -- Star Formation -- The Star Formation -- The Interstellar Matter -- The Galaxy -- Extragalactic Systems -- Cosmology -- Mathematical Methods -- Appendix. Astronomy and astrophysics are oldest and most modern science in one – they combine observational tradition and modern technology and observation methods at the same time. This introductory textbook is already published in the third edition and, as as astrophysics evolves very rapidly, all chapters have been expanded and supplemented. A new chapter on astrobiology, a very topical research area, has been added. The book is intended for physics and astronomy students (educational office, bachelor) but also for individuals interested in natural sciences - The Astronomy is taught as a mathematical and physical knowledge of astronomy.
content.title_en: Introduction to Astronomy and Astrophysics

content.text: Manual Robotics: Programming and using intelligent robots. The general aim of the book is to conceptualize the robot as a cognitive model and thus as a knowledge-based agent and to design this agent model through computer-based technologies in process and functional terms to a cognitive robot system. The aim of such an approach is to increase the systemic intelligence quotient (IQS) of the robot system. This goal is achieved by conceptualizing the concept based on a cognitive theory, the (off)implementation of these models by using the cognitive computing technology using the programming language Java and the validation of these robot solutions in simulations. The book is equally aimed at students, professionals of all disciplines as well as interested readers. By bridging the gap between standard knowledge and knowledge from neighbouring areas, such as cognitive science or computer science, this manual tries to provide a profound understanding of the complex topic "robotics." Despite this complexity of robotics and the extended access through cognitive theology, the book remains a prerequisite-free application - motivation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-implementation-proation-proation-proation-proment
content.title_en: Manual Robotics : Programming and use of intelligent robots

content.text: The convincing application: How you successfully market yourself. Basics of self-marketing -- Potential analysis -- Expectation profile -- Market requirements -- Written application -- Internet application -- Job interview: Preparation and procedure -- Special: Start-up of business. The right job after the study period - often not easy to find. The professional direction determines the study, but the industry and the exact task area must identify each graduate for themselves. How you successfully position and market yourself, how you approach an application confidently and successfully complete this compact work mediates. Strength-weak profiles and detailed checklists help you to balance your wishes and qualifications with the requirements of the job market and to deal with the pitfalls in the application process. The special business start-up also offers indispensable tips and suggestions for the alternative way into self-employment. The content Basics of self-marketing.- Potential analysis.- Expectation profile.- Requirements of the market.- Written application.- Internet application.- Presentation interview: Preparation and procedure.- Special: Start-up of business. The target group Graduates of all disciplines and all professionals. The business community.
content.title_en: The convincing application: How to successfully market yourself

content.text: Individualization in stationary retail: Economic analysis of electronic forms of customer communication. Today, commercial companies use wireless communication technologies such as radio frequency identification (RFID) to optimize warehouse and supply chain management. These technologies are also being tested for automation and individualization of communication with customers within shopping sites. Jens Strüker analyses these new forms of communication and derives operational applications from them. The focus is on the individual customer relationship, which has been characteristic of the "ante-emma-shop" form of operation, but is now also feasible for modern supermarkets. Against the background of intense price competition in the food trade, the considerable revenue potential is shown and discussed in particular on the basis of individualized purchase proposals and monetary incentives for certain customer groups. The author also deals with the limits of a policy of customer-specific treatment by examining and evaluating infrastructure costs and the vulnerability of privacy.
content.title_en: Individualization in stationary retailing : Economic analysis of electronic forms of customer communication

content.text: Prospective effects of cost savings in healthcare on doctors, patients and industry. The rising expenditure in healthcare has led to a variety of cost reduction measures in recent years. Based on standardized surveys, Verena Reichl examines the consequences for doctors, patients and the pharmaceutical and medical engineering industry. The statistical analyses confirm relevant consequences for all investigators. In the case of doctors, the austerity measures lead to a changed regulatory behaviour and in the case of patients they are reflected in payments. Overall, the surveyed persons are prepared to contribute significant sums. It is clear that the doctor as the most important partner of the patient can influence the willingness to participate in his medical treatment. Other relevant explanatory variables are the income structure and the level of education. The study shows the economic consequences of cost savings and gives important insights into the prevailing patient image of the companies
content.title_en: Prospective effects of cost savings in healthcare on doctors, patients and industry

content.text: Georessource Soil — Economic Factor and Ecosystem Service Provider : Recommendations for a bundling of scientific competence in soil and land management. Soil form an essential basis for human life. On them grow plants that serve as food and feed or as biomass, from which energy is derived. They also fulfil important functions in our ecosystem and are a key economic factor as the starting point of all bio-based value chains. Climate change affects both the production and ecosystem functions of the soil. These challenges must also be addressed by research on soil and land management. Acatech POSITION explains why German soil research should work together in a cross-disciplinary manner and identifies eleven necessary and new fields of action for this. acatech provides recommendations on how to combine scientific competence and maintain soil functions. Subject areas and challenges -- The research landscape -- Necessary and new fields of action -- Recommendations.
content.title_en: Georesource Soil — Economic Factor and Ecosystem Service Providers : Recommendations for Pooling Scientific Competence in Soil and Land Management

content.text: Learning environments : educational perspectives on school buildings and classrooms. In successful, good schools, teaching and learning are supported in the best possible way by the building environment – from school and learning spaces should therefore become habitats. To achieve this, educational, architectural psychological and architectural demands must be reconciled. Authors approach the topic of educational school room design from their respective disciplines and open up ways for optimal school and classroom design.
content.title_en: Learning environments : educational perspectives on school buildings and classrooms

content.text: The German Federal Government's Administrative Survey: The German Government's Administrative Survey: The German Government's Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The German Government's Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Administrative Survey: The Political Survey: The Journalists The Authors Dr. Florian Grotz is Professor of Political Science at the Institute of Political Science at the Federal Ministry of the German State of Germany. content.text: Technology, Strategy and Organization. content.text: Digital transformation of business models successfully: trends, impacts and roadmap. Digital transformation has long begun and presents companies with new challenges, but also offers companies opportunities to raise unused potential. This book presents the most important technological trends in the context of digitalization using three categories (concentration on people, smart machines, enabler technology). Subsequently, possible impacts on companies are discussed. The focus is on the elements of business models (e.g. customer segments, customer channels, customer relationships, products, services). The Roadmap, developed from practice and science, shows a structured approach to the implementation of the digital transformation of business models. The authors: Prof. Dr. Daniel Schallmo is an economist, business consultant, author and sought-after speaker. He is a professor at Ulm University of Applied Sciences, a member of the Institute for Digital Transformation and founder of Dr. Schallmo & team GmbH. Joachim Reinhart is an economic scientist and an experienced strategist. With digitalization, he has been intensively involved in various positions at Deutsche Telekom AG and as a management consultant. Evelyn Kuntz, with a focus on business management management in the field of business management, studying in business management and managing business.
content.title_en: Successfully shape digital transformation of business models : trends, impacts and roadmap

content.text: The book, based on the continuity equation, the Euler equations and the adiabate equation, first represents the hydrodynamics ideal fluids. The treatment of viscous fluids and the correspondingly modified basic equations are performed by means of the Navier-Stokes equations and the heat transport equation, which describe the energy dissipation in real fluids. In addition, diffusion processes in inhomogeneous fluids and in Brown's motion are also investigated. Diffusion also plays an important role in particle generation in relativistic collisions of lead nuclei at LHC. A Lorenz-invariant relativistic formulation of hydrodynamics is also presented. With this work, the author provides a brief introduction to the hydrodynamics in astrophysics and superfluides such as helium at low temperatures round off this introduction to a broad and modern research area. Test tasks at the end of the book are intended to motivate the reader to actively acquire the substance of the current research topic of Heidelberg University of Heidelberg.
content.title_en: Hydrodynamics

content.text: In each person, a very personal world emerges in his early childhood. In living with parents, siblings and other people, the consciousness of living in a common reality develops. But how real is this reality? This question approaches the author from the three different perspectives of philosophy, religion and imagination. In philosophy, the 'thing itself' is considered unattainable since Kant. So what is the claim to describe a reality? For believers, the world of faith is profoundly real. How does such a world relate to the worlds of sciences? In imagination, man experiences a reality of the fantastic. What is the significance of this reality in our lives? The author Hans Sillescu has been working as a professor of physical chemistry at Johannes Gutenberg University in Mainz since 1975. His main research area was the study of extremely slow molecular movements in polymers and in the transition area between highly viscous liquids and amorphous solid bodies. Since his emeritus in 2002, he has been enthusiastically giving universally understandable lectures and writing texts, among others on the topics of philosophy, robotics and cosmology.
content.title_en: Many Worlds in One World

content.text: The increasing demands on internal combustion engines, including the piston, do not stop at its core. For less weight, friction or even more wear resistance, deep knowledge of the internal motor processes as well as the suitable materials, design and machining processes for pistons, including the necessary testing measures, are necessary. Without such specific know-how, no expert in automotive technology can cope with any more, whether it is involved in design, development, testing or maintenance. This technical book answers these questions in a comprehensive and very clear and understandable manner. In this second edition, all chapters have been revised and expanded. The chapter "Motoric Testing" has been supplemented with extensive results on the subject of friction performance measurements and oil consumption measurements. Contents Piston function, requirements and construction methods Design guidelines Simulation of operating strength by FEM materials Cooling Component testing Motor testing The target groups Engineers with the field of tasks Engine development and maintenance Teaching staff and students from the fields of mechanical engineering, engine engineering and vehicle engineering Technology Interested The editor MAHLE is an internationally leading development partner of automotive industry. The group also covers the following components of the fuel and fuel cycle.
content.title_en: Piston and motor testing

content.text: Laser additively manufactured, air-permeable mesostructures: production and properties for application. Introduction -- Definition and process descriptions -- Problem definition and solution -- Production of air-permeable structures -- Determination of air-permeability -- Robustness of the structure against mechanical loads -- Heat transport through the air-permeable structure -- Application possibilities in technical applications -- Summary and outlook. This dissertation describes how an air-permeable mesostructure is generated by adjusting the exposure strategy. The author examines the influence of the geometry parameters on air-permeability, mechanical robustness and thermal properties. Finally, as a reference application, a compressed air ejection system for plastic injection molding tools is realized. This completely replaces the mechanical system and offers a plagiarism protection feature. For scientists, users and designers who deal with laser-permeable manufacturing, the book is of particular interest in the book.
content.title_en: Laser additive, air-permeable mesostructures : production and properties for application

content.text: Why there was no Islamic Middle Ages: the legacy of antiquity and the Orient. Islam has been stuck in the Middle Ages, missed Renaissance, Reformation and Enlightenment. This is the common diagnosis. But what if there was no Islamic Middle Ages? Thomas Bauer shows by numerous examples how ancient times continued in the Islamic world until the 11th century, convincingly refuting the established epoch boundaries and our image of a reform-needed "medieval" Islam. For centuries in the Orient, the ancient cities were alive, with baths, mosques and other stone-built buildings, while in Europe they fell into ruins. Doctors continued Galen's medicine, natural sciences and love poetry flourished. Copper coins, glass, roof tiles, paper: In the daily life of the Orient there were all ancient achievements, which Central Europeans only (again) rediscovered at the beginning of the New Age. Thomas Bauer vividly describes how the ancient culture of al-Andalus continued over North Africa and Syria to Persia and why the 11th century in all Eurasia, the small-scale masterpiece of the Western Europe, the Muslim population, and the Middle-Eastern population soon followed by the Islamic religion.
content.title_en: Why there was no Islamic Middle Ages : the heritage of antiquity and the Orient

content.text: The efficiency of the financial support measures in the new Länder: expert reports. The balance of three years of intensive support policy in the new Länder is mixed. A dynamic development process has so far only been initiated in parts of the East German economy, particularly stimulated by the state infrastructure programmes in the construction sector and the construction-related industrial and craft sectors as well as in the consumer-related industrial and service sectors. The international competitiveness of East German industry is not yet sufficient. In view of these circumstances, the state support measures are of great importance. The book gives an inventory of the state support policy. In the question of the efficiency of the support measures, model theoretical methods are used on the one hand, and a survey of companies in the new Länder and abroad (Japan) was carried out.
content.title_en: The efficiency of fiscal support measures in the new Länder : expert opinions

content.text: Photovoltaic Engineering: Manual for Planning, Development and Application. Introduction -- Solar Radiation Supply -- Solar Generator -- Components of PV Systems -- Dimensioning of PV Island Systems -- Energy Supply with PV Systems -- Energy Performance Assessment. This book describes the necessary methods for planning, development and application of photovoltaic systems in island operations, for grid feeding or for follow-up. The fourth edition of this recognized plant provides methods and planning aids for the dimensioning of photovoltaic components under realistic conditions. The author deals in detail with photovoltaic island systems, on-site quality control and energy yield forecast of photovoltaic systems for grid feeding. Radiation data for about 500 cities in 140 countries of all continents, including all states of the USA, make the book a valuable companion for all plant planners and operators of photovoltaics. The author Professor Dr.-Ing. Andreas Wagner studied electrical engineering at the University of Stuttgart. Dipl.-Ing. 1977. Until 1983 Researcher at the Institute for Electrical Engineering, University of Stuttgart, Germany, for the use of energy in the field of energy.
content.title_en: Photovoltaic Engineering : Manual for Planning, Development and Application

content.text: Statistics for economists: A real data-based introduction with SPSS. This textbook introduces comprehensive and practical into statistical methodology. Methods of descriptive statistics, explorative data analysis, stochastics, inductive statistics and multivariate statistics are provided in a clear and easy-to-understand manner on the basis of real data using the SPSS statistical program package. In its conceptual and content-related annex, the textbook is ideally suited as a compendium accompanying lectures and self-study supporting students in economic and social science courses. The fourth edition is based on version 22 of the IBM SPSS Statistics program package. All SPSS data files used in this textbook are available free of charge under the Internet address specified in the annex. The content · Basic statistical concepts · Data collection · SPSS Statistics · Data description · Stochastik · Statistical induction · Link analysis · Regression analysis · Time series analysis · Factor analysis The target groups at universities and universities use the socio-economic and social sciences of the SPSS program.
content.title_en: Statistics for Economists : A real data-based introduction with SPSS

content.text: Simulation of traffic in the city: The co- and counter-cooperation of different types of road users. Jörg Dallmeyer examines the simulation of urban traffic scenarios. Various types of road users are modelled and converted into efficient, valid simulation models. The road network is fully automatically modelled to simulate the traffic of entire cities. The author develops the traffic simulation system MAINSIM – MultimodAle INnerstadtische StraßenverkehrsSImulation and uses it for case studies: e.g. machine learning methods for analysis and influence of traffic. He examines the effects of exemplary, non-compliant actions of cars, bicycles and pedestrians. An artificial pheromone system is used for the distribution of traffic. Measured CO2 emissions are distributed by means of an atmospheric simulation based on real weather and terrain data in the Frankfurt area. The content · Traffic simulation models and systems · Modelling of traffic paths and multimodal traffic · Learning in traffic scenarios, non-conformism · Approximation of pedestrian effects · Amise-in-used binoculars and binoculars in the Frankfurt city of traffic.
content.title_en: Simulation of road traffic in the city : The co- and counter-reciprocity of different types of road users

content.text: Research field Catering: Basics – Attitudes – Consumers. Gastronomy as a research field -- The culinary basic attitudes of guests of Viennese gastronomy -- Change processes in the catering community with special consideration of the implementation of sustainable food plans -- Gastronomy and Culinary Tourism -- Wine offer, service and quality in Viennese food industry -- GBOO: Guest/visitor survey – open and online. In the present book, the young research field Catering is illuminated. The research field is narrowed down and defined. Based on this, innovative research projects in the catering sector are presented. For example, the culinary basic attitudes of guests of Viennese gastronomy are analysed or the implementation of sustainability in large kitchens are discussed. Further contributions are concerned with the delimitation of gastronomy and Culinary Tourism as well as the practical use of research results in catering. The content · Gastronomy as a research field · Culinary basic attitudes of guests of Viennese gastronomy · Change processes in the catering community field · Gastronomy and Culinary Tourism · Wine content.text: Natural and Biochemistry: An overview for chemists and biotechnologists. This essential provides a compact overview of the chemical basics of natural and biochemistry. Selected classes of substances with their biological and chemical functions and their reactions and synthesis are discussed.The main focus here is on the most important biomolecules such as carbohydrates, amino acids, lipids, terpenes and dyes.The content Introduction to the chemistry of biomolecules Chemical structures and occurrences The target groups Practitioners in chemistry and biotechnology Students of natural sciences Studies The authors Fabian Ebner is currently writing his master thesis in the field of organometallic chemistry at the Ruprecht-Karls-Universität Heidelberg. Linda Anna Michelle Gehre is a Bachelor student of the study programme Biochemistry at the University of Leipzig. She is also working at the University Hospital Leipzig at the Institute of Virology. Claudia Tallian is currently completing her master's degree in biotechnical processes at the University of Applied Sciences in Vienna.
content.title_en: Natural substances and biochemistry : An overview for chemists and biotechnologists

content.text: The findings of a pluralisation of security production and ubiquitousness of "security" in the discussion around the city can be attributed to the fact that the actors, their connections with each other, their tasks and techniques are less clearly fixed than in the past. The aim of this volume – at the interface between social and spatially oriented security research – is to illustrate the local diverse forms of security production and to show the conflicts, contradictions and consequences for life in cities as well as the field of urban security. Security is thus addressed in the field of tension between the materiality of urban space and higher culturally traditional interpretation patterns. The content of actors and rooms in the security discourse • Security images and security perception The target groups of researchers and practitioners from the fields of urban planning, sociology, cultural and police sciences The editor Jan Abt has been a scientific employee at the Institute for Urban and Regional Planning of the TU Berlin since 2005. Dr. Leon Hempel has been researching at the Zentrum Technik und Gesellschaft der TU Berlin since 1999. Prof. Dr. Dietrich Henckel has been teaching at the TUin Berlin since 2004.
content.title_en: Dynamic arrangements of urban security : actors, cultures, images

content.text: Real Estate Business - Safe by the examination of the bank specialist business. This book enables the systematic preparation for the IHK examination in the course of studies for bank specialist business. The clear structure makes it easy for students to consolidate the necessary knowledge about the purchase or the new construction of a property and the associated costs. Likewise, the candidates gain in-depth know-how in the field of debt and property law as well as in contract and enforcement law. They also train the ability to correctly assess the value of a property. The contents of the book are aligned with the Federal Audit Guide of the IHK for bank specialist business. Overviews, note sets and examples facilitate learning. The content • Basics of real estate finance • Customer talk in real estate financing • Financial needs analysis • Credit decision • Property assessment • Financing planning • Contract design in real estate business • Credit monitoring – Foreign-enforcement in imwegliche Wealth • Real Estate funds The authors Tanja Müthlein is a lecturer in the vocational training course in cooperation with educational institutions such as the Frankfurt School of Finance Management - The Management Officer for Real Estate Management - The Business Manager.
content.title_en: Real estate business : Safe by checking the bank manager

content.text: Social Innovations in Berlin-Moabit: On the communicative negotiation of new things through spatial planning in the urban context. Anika Noack investigates socially innovative orientations of civil society. She investigates the question of how civil society today legitimizes itself to go beyond existing and familiar things, or even claims to be socially innovative. While the orientation towards action towards innovation for economics, science and research has been researched for a long time, the research field of civil society-initiated social innovations has remained open. Using the example of spatial pioneers who are engaged in the field of social urban development policy in Berlin-Moabit, the author examines this topic and focuses on communicational processes for the generation of social innovations. The content · Society innovative? On the communicative genesis of the new · The communication dimension as an appendix of social innovation research · Extended process understanding of social innovations · Ethnography for the process-accompanying analysis of social innovations in the space · On the communicative genesis of social innovations and their spatial (re)constructive effects The target groups · Dociciendics and students of sociology, communication, communication and society and society.
content.title_en: Social innovations in Berlin-Moabit : On the communicative negotiation of new things by space pioneers in the urban context

content.text: Business economics challenges in the planning office: Quick access for architects and civil engineers. The right legal form for a planning office -- Qualified employees and customers win and hold -- Plan the future of the company – Objectives and perspectives -- Corporate Social Responsibility, Compliance. Dietmar Goldammer shows how architectural and engineering offices have to adapt to changing working environments, social responsibility and sustainability as new challenges. The author describes early warning systems, certifications and new organisational forms that help to shape the company's successor. This is how it is shown that social change has also arrived in the planning offices. It would be easy to believe that everything is going on there as it has been. Essential helps in short and concisely to initiate the right steps. The content The right legal form for a planning office Gain and hold qualified employees and customers The future of the company – Targets and perspectives Corporate Social Responsibility, Compliance The target groups Architects and construction engineers as owners of planning offices and their successors The business administration is the business administration's lecturer.
content.title_en: Business challenges in the planning office : Quick start for architects and civil engineers

content.text: C/C++ for study and profession: An introduction with many examples, tasks and solutions. Basics of programming with C/C++ -- Object-oriented programming -- Exercise tasks with solutions. This textbook introduces high-level language programming. The language C/C++ was chosen for this purpose because it has developed over the years into the most important universal language with a broad range of applications. This is not only true for system programming, but also for technical and scientific applications. The book corresponds to a two-semester introduction to programming. The range of hours is accepted with a total of 4 semester weeks of lecture and as many exercises. It is also suitable as a guide book for a corresponding compact course or self-study. Actually, it can be used by everyone who places importance on a systematic approach. A detailed chapter is devoted to object-oriented programming. Examples and exercise tasks enable the immediate practical application of the currently learned subject. The source texts of the sample programs as well as the solutions to the exercise tasks are available on the internet of the authors, which is named in the preamble. The content of the programming with the technician C++.
content.title_en: C/C++ for study and work : An introduction with many examples, tasks and solutions

content.text: Basics of evolutionary biology and formal genetics. Preface -- In brief the historical development of evolutionary research -- Life forms − DNA: Information storage, building regulations and instructions -- Variability − No evolution without diversity -- Family tree and genealogy -- Random and selection alter genetic diversity -- Concepts of species and species formation -- Evolution of species communities -- Molecular evolutionary clock -- Molecular anthropology -- Cultural and genetic evolution of behavior -- Environment, stress and genetics -- Search for genes -- Paternity and genetic identity -- Genetics of metabolic diseases and multifactorial diseases -- Epigenetics -- Statistical foundations -- Complex features and genetic statistics -- Correlation, regression and association -- Solutions to the tasks. The book presents the most important topics from evolutionary biology and formal genetics. In brief chapters, the authors explain the importance of selection and coincidence for genetic diversity in populations. Moreover, methods for the evaluation of genetic identity of individuals and populations are described, and with the help of family analyses, the search for genetics is explained by the basics of genetics and the basics of genetics.
content.title_en: Fundamentals of Evolutionary Biology and Formal Genetics

content.text: First aid to Burnout in organizations: A guide to managers and personnel managers. Term - Definition - Terminology and Diagnosis -- How does it come to a burnout? -- Prophylaxis -- Prevention and Intervention Ulrich Scherrmann describes the burnout syndrome in this essential, in order to investigate the causes based on a systemic burnout model. So far, too little attention is given to the operational causes of the overload of employees, the so-called organizational factors. The personal causes dominate, e.g. that people cannot say no or manipulate themselves into burnout through exaggerated ambition. In the practical part, the author presents possibilities of prophylaxis for both individual employees and managers and the whole organization. In prevention, among other things, the prevention is pointed out to dangers for companies (pattern recovery, presentation). Concrete possibilities for interventions round off this essential. The content term - Definition - Terminology and Diagnosis How does it come to a burnout? Prophylaxis prevention and intervention by the executives and executives of HR managers find the independent manager and executives of HR consultants.
content.title_en: First aid at Burnout in organizations : A guide for managers and personnel managers

content.text: Counter-Terrorism: Current Threat of Islamic Terrorism in Germany and Europe. Analysis of Current Threat of Islamic Terrorism in Germany and Europe -- Selected Special Threats by Islamist Terrorism and Institutional Answers -- Technical Means for Counter-Terrorism -- Institutional Combating Islamic Terrorism in Germany and Europe -- Radicalization in the Phenomena Area Islamism and Islamic Terrorism as well as Prevention. This book analyses possible means and measures for counter-terrorism in Germany and Europe. This includes the anti-terrorism actors. A dedicated analysis of possible counter-terrorism means such as video surveillance of public space is conducted. In addition, this book deals with the topic of Islamist threats, in which the categorization, deportation, surveillance and prevention programmes are analysed. Also, the fight against terrorist financing is examined. The content analysis of current threat by Islamist terrorism in Germany and Europe • Selected Special Threats by the Islamic Terrorism and Institutional Answers • Technical Means for counter-terrorism • Institutional Combating of Islamic Terrorism in Germany and Europe • Radicalization in the Islamic phenomenon Islamism and Islamic Terrorism Target Groups of the German Police, German Police, German Police and German Police.
content.title_en: Counter-terrorism : Current threat of Islamist terrorism in Germany and Europe

content.text: Ubiquitary electronic service provision for consumers -- Psychological reaction and trait reaction -- Model development, evaluation and interpretation -- Reflection of the findings. Christian Arnold works out that the use of context-sensitive electronic assistance functions is accompanied by the shift of decision-making skills in favour of the provider when service provision is directed by the provider and includes the partially autonomous preparation and/or implementation of communication and transaction processes. This can initiate consumer-side processes that aim at the restoration of decision-making space and are directed against the service provider or against the concrete performance delivery. The content Ubiquitary electronic service provision for consumers Psychological reaction and trait reaction Model development, evaluation and interpretation Reflection of the findings The target groups Dozierdeen and students in the field of marketing, consumer research, computer science and service management Consultants and executives with focus on e-, m- and u-commerce The author of the research is Dr. Martin Reckenfelder at the University of Leipzig.
content.title_en: Ubiquitous e-service for consumers : The perspective of the theory of psychological reaction

content.text: HEADS, KURS & Co. : Evaluation of surveillance concepts for particularly relapse-prone sex offenders. The monitoring concepts of the federal states aim to protect the general public from relapse-prone sex offenders and violent offenders, which is to be achieved mainly by good cooperation and good information exchange of the participating bodies. Precisely these structures and the procedure within the concepts were evaluated for ten federal states. Since the conceptions of the countries are to preventatively minimize the risk of relapse, a process evaluation offers a good opportunity to investigate the processes carried out towards their efficiency and effectiveness. In a subsequent country comparison, weaknesses and miscontrols are identified in total, in order to submit optimization proposals and initiate further research studies.With contributions by Anja Schiemann, Katharina Büchler, Inge Roith, Ilka Freyhat, Helge Risom, Thomas Heberer, Candy Sommer, Tina Beck, Sven Pahl, Christoph Dümmig, Maik Schröder, Daniel Sühling
content.title_en: HEADS, KURS & Co. : Evaluation of surveillance concepts for particularly relapse-prone sex offenders

content.text: Search engines understand. Introduction -- Introduction -- How search engines work -- How search engines are used -- The ranking of search results -- The content of search engines and how they are presented to us -- The search engine market -- Search engine optimization -- Alternatives to Google -- Exact search queries are provided with the extended search and operators -- Check sources -- The invisible web -- Research in social networks, question-answer services and operators -- Search engines and their role as intermediaries of information -- Outlook -- Glossary. The book considers the topic of search engines based on daily research and introduces the technical basics, research techniques and the social and economic conditions of search on the web. Search engines are today the most important tools to get information. We use search engines daily, mostly without further thinking about it. But how do these search tools actually work exactly? In addition to a detailed presentation of the ranking methods used in the well-known search engines, the user behavior is also extensively addressed, which in turn shapes the result representation. This is the basic consideration of the search engine market, the importance of search engine optimization and the role of search engines as a technical mediator.
content.title_en: Understanding search engines

content.text: Logistics 4.0: The digital transformation of the value chain. Conceptual foundations and technological prerequisites for logistics 4.0 -- Use cases in transport, storage and internal material supply -- Legal and societal implications. . The book provides an orientation in the conceptual world of logistics 4.0. It explains the technological foundations and establishes the references to related concepts such as "Industry 4.0" and "Internet of Things." The effects of the digitalisation of the value chain, in particular the comprehensive networking of the objects of the goods flow in the areas of transport, storage and production logistics, are presented. This is done using concrete examples that illustrate the interaction of the technological components of "Logistics 4.0" to design new or improved business processes. The final chapter deals with the legal framework conditions of data-driven business models. The content Conceptual foundations and technological prerequisites for logistics 4.0 Use cases in transport, storage and internal material supply Legal and societal implications The target groups of practitioners who are increasingly confronted with questions of digitalization in their company are lecturers and students of business sciences, especially in the areas of logistics and business management. The saik author of the faculty of the university of business and logistics.
content.title_en: Logistics 4.0 : The digital transformation of the value chain

content.text: HR-Excellence: Innovative approaches to leadership and transformation. Current challenges in leadership.- Working environment 4.0 / New Work.- Transformation management in companies.- Aging workforces -- Demographic management -- Human Resource Management. Profound expertise, current perspectives and perspectives of corporate practitioners and scientists in the areas of leadership, transformation, demography and human resource management are showing this editorial work. Companies must respond to the requirements of an increasingly digitized and technologized working environment in ever shorter cycles. The need for comprehensive transformation is increasingly taking the place of the cautious evolution of business models. Human Resource Management is transforming itself into a central strategy function within the companies. Well-structured into four content areas, readers receive directly feasible solutions for the central issues of corporate HR practice. The content: • Current challenges in leadership • Working environment 4.0 / New Work • Transformation management in companies • Alternating workforces • Demographic management • Human Resource Management The editor: Walter Jochmann is Managing Director of Kienbaum Management International and of Kien Management Institute of Leadership of Bögoholt International School of Management.
content.title_en: HR Excellence : Innovative Approaches in Leadership and Transformation

content.text: Embedded Controller: Basics and practical implementation for industrial applications. The book provides an insight into the architecture of embedded systems and the development process for the firmware they control. The requirements for an unattended running embedded system as well as their implementation are in the focus. All concepts are practically implemented using common components such as ARM® Cortex® M3 and M4 based processors, FreeRTOS or lwip. Practical tips for efficient and targeted use of debug, encapsulation and analysis tools complete the book. They help both the beginner and the experienced professional in the development of robust and maintenance-friendly firmware for microcontrollers in embedded environments. The content Basics ARM® Cortex® M3 and M4 core operating systems System design Time Synchronization (Host) Communication Watchdogs Bootloader Practical Tips The target groups Hard and software developers Professional Maker The author Rüdiger R. Ash is a long-standing freelance developer of firmware for industrial embedded controllers with special area communication architectures.
content.title_en: Embedded Controller : Basics and practical implementation for industrial applications

content.text: VIRUS! : Mutations of a metaphor. AIDS, Ebola and crashing computers; foreign bodies, parasites and sleepers; bio- and cyberterrorism, animal diseases and, most recently, SARS: Viruses are currently circulating in a wide variety of areas. The metaphorical of the word is as cross-border and mutating as the concrete objects. It is being sought to enforce threat scenarios and border-securing measures and at the same time serves as a model for resistance and subversive self-stages. No coincidence that the recent media debate about terrorist violence has once again caught up in these patterns. The volume »VIRUS!« examines the effects of the images of risky contacts, contagion and infiltration - not only on the production of »hard facts« in natural sciences and technology, but also on the design of the global world order.
content.title_en: VIRUS! : Mutations of a metaphor

content.text: The editors Stefan Gillich and Rolf Keicher address questions about conditions and cooperation partners for successful housing emergency assistance.The contributions range from aspects of livelihood protection and private charity (soup) to support specific addressees (consultation) and structural framework conditions as well as social rights and the enforcement of these rights (politics). Examples of successful cooperation as well as current research results are presented.The content Structural framework conditions of housing emergency assistance in practice Private charitable activity Social rights and legal enforcement The target groups Dozierde und Studierende der Sozialarbeit und –paedagogik, Sozial-, Erziehungs- und Politikwissenschaften PraktikerInnen der Wohnungsnotfallhilfe, PolitikInnen, Mitarbeiter der public administration Die Editor Stefan Gillich ist Deputy Chairman of the Evangelical Federation of Living Insurance and Participation (EBET) and Head of Division for Presence Protection, Poverty Policy, Community Deakonia at the Deakonia Hessen – Diakonisches Werk in Hessen und Nasssau und Kurbeh Besetzung – Besichts-Wörsten-Wörsten.
content.title_en: Soup, advice, policy : Requirements for a modern housing emergency

content.text: The basics of data analysis with R: An application-oriented introduction. This book provides an application-oriented introduction to data analysis with the free statistical environment R. It covers descriptive analyses as comprehensively as infertility statistical analyses. In addition to classical univariate methods, the book takes into account nonparametric tests, resampling methods and multivariate statistics. It also covers the many possibilities of preparing data and creating diagrams. The statistical methods are explained by examples and illustrated in many places with diagrams. In the third edition, both the innovations of R 3.1.1 and recent developments in the additional packages have been incorporated. At the same time, the book is being revised and significantly expanded in the areas of logistic regression and crossvalidation. The text now also deals with the ordinary, multinomial and Poisson regression as well as log linear models and the survival analysis. The book is aimed at all those who want to know R and use it in concrete tasks without having to have any previous experience with command-controlled programs or programming languages.
content.title_en: Basics of data analysis with R : An application-oriented introduction

content.text: Climate policy : goals, conflicts, solutions. Heat dead in Pakistan, floods in Russia, droughts in California, melting glaciers, crop losses and a century-old wine in Rheingau 2015: The effects of climate change can already be observed on all continents and in all oceans. International climate policy has created a unique body in the World Climate Council, which is fundamental to the agenda of politics. Still, humanity has little experience with the just and efficient use of global common goods. Therefore, climate policy is of particular importance, because it has a role model for international cooperation in many fields.
content.title_en: Climate policy : objectives, conflicts, solutions

content.text: The 21st century society, which is determined by knowledge, will have a different social structure than the 19th and 20th century industrial society. The book analyses the changing conditions of the working world, the structure of time and space and the religious content of society and designs the image of the lifestyle society. New groups emerge, belonging fluctuates, everything is currently in flux. There will continue to be social inequality, but this will not only determine material goods, it will be superimposed by symbolic differentiation. The book shows how society transforms itself, how old belongings dissolve into social groups and develop new ones. Lifestyles emerge alongside social layers and become more important
content.title_en: The Lifestyle Society

content.text: Lexicon for IT professions : Technical and commercial terms for training. The core competencies of a prospective IT professional include not only technical but also commercial skills. This includes the ability to classify old and new specialist terms in their respective contexts. The book helps you in all phases of your professional training: in project work, for exam preparation and for all professional questions.
content.title_en: Lexicon for IT professions : Technical and commercial terms for training

content.text: Real estate valuation with hedonic price models : Theoretical principles and practical application. Real estate valuation with hedonic price models In contrast to traditional real estate valuation, the method of hedonic prices does not depend on the object to be evaluated, but on the information available about the corresponding events and the real estate involved. "According events are e.g. real estate transactions, leases or real estate offers. Using statistical-econometric methods, the hedonic prices of the observable properties of the property are estimated from this information. On the basis of these hedonic prices, concrete objects can be evaluated, i.e. their traffic value. How this happens, is the subject of this book. Because the method of hedonic prices is based on solid statistical bases, it provides additional and, unlike traditional methods, also well-founded information about the quality of the forecast and its spread range. The content Introduction Understanding the data Distribution of Random Variables Regression - the foundations On the search for the best model – Fundamentals On the search for the best model – Example The authors Professor Dr. Gunther Maier is teaching at the Institute of the Regional University of Economics - Sydney.
content.title_en: Real estate valuation with hedonic price models : Theoretical basics and practical application
