ABDOS-Mitrichtungen, München, Nr. 1-2, 2004)

content.text: Biopolitics. Biopolitics responds to border crossings. It responds to the fact that marginal conditions of human nature, which were previously indisputably applied, become technically available. And it responds to the fact that culturally anchored interpretations of man are challenged by competing scientific concepts. The result are moral controversy and regulatory debates, in which the core question is the old question, whether we can, what we can. Should the new options that offer themselves for the technical handling of man be released? Or should the de facto limits of the ability now replace the limits of moral and legal tolerance? The analyses in this volume aim at this conflict arena and ask for the possible contribution of sociological enlightenment to the questions discussed there.
content.title_en: Biopolitics

content.text: Product planning in the Fuzzy Front End : Action support system based on Fuzzy Cognitive Maps. The Fuzzy Front End, i.e. the early stages of product development, is of central importance for product success. However, conventional methods and procedures of innovation management do not support it. In particular, approaches to systematically taking into account environmental information about markets and technologies and for the exploration, codification and use of existing knowledge are lacking. Antonie Jetter presents a novel Action Support System (HAUS) with which the system "development project" is modelled and its dynamics captured by simulation. The theoretical basis for the HOUSE provides research work of the action psychology. Methodically, the system relies on linked submodels of the development situation, which are created by the qualitative modeling process of the Fuzzy Cognitive Maps (FCMs). The construction and use of the HOUSE are concreteized using the example of a real development project and examined for its feasibility.
content.title_en: Product planning in the Fuzzy Front End : Action support system based on Fuzzy Cognitive Maps

content.text: Solutions for linear equation systems : Algorithms and applications. Simulation of technical processes usually requires the solution of linear equation systems of large dimensions. For this purpose, modern pre-conditioned iteration processes (e.g. CG, GMRES, BiCGStab) are derived and the algorithms necessary for the realization are described. For systems with structured matrices efficient direct solution methods are specified. In addition to linear equation systems with block structures, hierarchical matrices for the efficient description and application of fully occupied matrices are also treated. All methods are explained and discussed using simple examples.
content.title_en: Solution methods for linear equation systems : Algorithms and applications

content.text: Reform of the financing of higher education: A financial analysis. 1 Introduction -- 2 Fundamentals of the financing of higher education -- 3 Economic analysis of the financing of higher education -- 4 Design of a private financial participation -- 5 Empirical analysis of the financing of higher education -- 6 Final consideration. Although universities have a significant influence on the competitiveness and technological performance of a country through the training of highly qualified persons, German universities are in a critical state, characterised by, among other things, underfinancing and overfilling. Armin Wiesler examines the necessity and feasibility of reforming the financing of higher education. He analyses whether current funding can be justified by market failures or by distributive considerations, and in this context designs framework conditions and model of private financing participation. Based on an Internet survey, he reviews the attitudes of the population in general and specific groups towards reform of higher education funding. It becomes clear that the introduction of private participation in the costs of higher education from a financial perspective is sensible and politically feasible if the framework conditions of a financing reform are adequately designed.
content.title_en: Reform of the financing of higher education : A financial analysis

content.text: Statistical test methods, significance and p-values : Understanding general principles and interpreting results appropriately. This essential explains the basic principle of statistical test methods. The focus is on the importance of statistical significance and p-value. Often found misinterpretations are addressed. This shows what a significant result says and what it does not say. The reader is thus enabled to adequately deal with test results. The content The basic model for classical test theory in statistics The general principles of testing The meaning of errors 1. and 2. Kind, significance level, p-value Interpretation of test results The target groups Students and lecturers of social sciences, economics, psychology and medicine who are engaged in statistical methods Users who want to understand their research instrument and study results The author Dipl.-Statistician Irasianty Frost is a lecturer for statistics at the Fresenius University of Applied Sciences in Munich.
content.title_en: Statistical test methods, significance and p-values : Understanding general principles and interpreting results appropriately

content.text: Construction industry: Basics and methods. The 3rd edition of the book also covers topics that are relevant in the main construction and construction industry in professional practice such as organisation and management, pricing and controlling. The interfaces to adjacent industries (financial and real estate industry) are also shown to an appropriate extent. Particular attention is paid to the aspect of sustainability in the chapter "Sustainable business in construction companies".In particular, the practitioner is to be able to quickly read topics in order to better solve concrete practical problems by means of a theoretical reference.The content of the building industry participants and their tasks - construction market, pricing, marketing organization and management - investment and financing - business accounting and operational controlling - accounting - sustainable business in the construction company The target group construction contractors and merchants in the construction industry Students of the construction engineering, architecture and business management interested parties from the real estate industry - authors Univ.-Prof. em.
content.title_en: Construction : Basics and methods

content.text: Migration and Family: Historical and Current Analyses. The volume presents studies on the relationship between family and migration in current and historical perspective. It provides insight into new insights into family, religion and migration in the 18th century, historical caesuras and migration waves in the 19th and 20th centuries, on restructuring and (intergenerative) change from family, to migration processes and educational organizations as well as on questions of gender, law and politics. What role do families, relatives and their networks play in all stages of the migration process? Migration is often a family project, family networks can provide forms of support, but families are also torn apart and destroyed by migration processes.These questions are examined in current and historical perspectives from the 18th century to the present day in interdisciplinary perspectives.The content of family, religion and migration in the 18th century • Familial networks and family memory in migration • Restructuring and (intergenerative) change of family • Social bureaucracy, institutions and (pedagogical) organizations • Gender, law and politics The editors Dr. Meike Sophia Baader is Professor of Education at the University of Cologne University of Applied Sciences.
content.title_en: Migration and Family : Historical and Current Analysis

content.text: Telecommunications 2017: Building on competition! : Special reports of the Monopoly Commission pursuant to § 121 para. 2 TKG. In its 78th special report entitled "Building on competition!", the Monopoly Commission deals with regulatory and competitive issues in the telecommunications markets. In its report, the Monopoly Commission acknowledges, among other things, the decision of the Federal Network Agency on the use of vectoring technology and discusses the compatibility of so-called zero-rating tariffs with the requirements for net neutrality. The Monopoly Commission also makes proposals to improve the framework conditions for the private and publicly funded expansion of high-performance broadband infrastructures. In addition, the Monopoly Commission takes a position on the current proposals for the re-ordering of the European legal framework for electronic communications.
content.title_en: Telecommunications 2017: build on competition! : Special reports of the Monopoly Commission pursuant to § 121 para. 2 TKG

content.text: The Management Board of the Company (BilRUG – BALANCE POLICY Implementation Act -- Entry into the Balance Sheet Analysis using the concrete example of the GH Mobile -- Reduction of complexity in the concrete example of the GH Mobile -- Detailed analyses using the concrete example of the GH Mobile -- Analysis of the optimized figures. This book provides orientation in the Profit and Loss Account and the Balance Sheet. Whether according to HGB, IFRS or US-GAAP, the balance sheet is accounted for: GuV or balance sheet are of great significance, but much is not visible at first glance. Old (before the BilMoG) and new law (including BilRUG) are partially treated in parallel, so that comparisons and on the one hand, on the other hand, are possible to continue looking at historical accounts in longer time series. The new rules in the balance sheet law according to BilRUG are comprehensively treated in the fifth edition in a separate chapter. The content • Strategic and operational analysis of balance sheet positions • Improve value creation and payment capacity • Long and short-term asset analysis • Determining of the business • Improve the balance sheet management and use of the assets and capital.
content.title_en: Balance sheet analysis and key figures : case-oriented balance sheet optimization

content.text: Pre-course Mathematics: Theory and tasks with fully calculated solutions. This book contains a compact presentation of the theory (in particular analysis and linear algebra) which students should master in a natural or engineering study or refresh in the context of a pre- or bridge course. On the other hand, the book provides numerous tasks in close connection with the presented theory with fully calculated solutions, where the handling of the concepts can be practiced and routinely trained. The book is aimed at prospective students, who can thereby independently repeat their school knowledge, or use it as a preliminary or bridge course. In continuation of this preliminary course on mathematics, there are the two books
content.title_en: Pre-course mathematics : theory and tasks with fully calculated solutions

content.text: Big Data Practice Guide – Legal – Technology. This practical guide provides an overview of the possible application fields and legal frameworks of Big Data in the company. It shows how decision-making processes can be based on data and what possible applications can be made in different industries. The authors provide practical recommendations on how Big Data applications can be implemented under applicable law and how to keep technical and organisational effort as low as possible. It also explains how companies can protect their data stocks. The authors provide an overview of the technical requirements of Big Data applications to be met and show the possibilities and limitations of Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence systems as well as (semantic) search techniques. The content of application scenarios and trends Legal aspects of Big Data Technical requirements Opportunities and challenges The editor Joachim Dorschel is a lawyer and specializes in IT law, commercial and corporate law, corporate legal protection and copyright. The influence of Big Data on corporate culture and decision-making processes - Enterprise Architecture Management Applications - Data Protection Practice Guidelines - Data Protection Solutions - Data Protection Solutions - content.text: The architects were confronted with new operational possibilities in technical systems: buildings were calculated by switching diagrams, creativity and imagination were contrasted with the technical intelligence of thought machines. In the crosshairs of cybernetics, the architect himself was in the position of the architect. It was about nothing less than the continued existence of his authorship in a technological-scientific world. Today, we are experiencing how the once so heavy calculating machines lose weight, but gain power, how computers populate the environment, how their own digital ecosystems create and how they can no longer be told without big data. The new edition examines the effects of front maters -- Table of contents -- Introduction -- The universalization of the machine -- Map and escape plan -- Between automation and metatechnology -- Aesthetics, revolt and calculus -- Swinging Cybernetics -- Drawing machines and machine signs -- Individualization systems -- Return of the material -- An afterword -- Photo- Annotations --
content.title_en: Regulated relations : Architecture and technical thinking in the era of cybernetics

content.text: The German and Chinese students have been given a PhD in the field of architecture and the rehabilitation of buildings: the examination of conceptual and strategic transmission possibilities. Introduction -- Framework conditions for sustainable renovation -- Overview of rehabilitation projects in Zhejiang -- Overview of the basics and milestone projects in Berlin -- Study of selected sustainable renovation projects in Berlin -- Transferability of the rehabilitation measures to Zhejiang.- Final considerations -- Project register. Ji Zhang discusses the experiences of sustainable renovation of residential buildings in Germany and discusses its transfer possibilities to China. While the renovation of housing in Germany is already well developed, it is still in the beginning in China. The author first gives a brief overview of the framework conditions in both countries, then she analyses 31 outstanding Berlin renovation projects, broken down into five sub-aspects of energy, water, green, building materials and attractiveness. By means of energetic simulation of a reference building and discussions Ji Zhang examines the transferability of the measures applied in Germany to the Hot Summer Cold Winter Zone in China.
content.title_en: Sustainable renovation of residential buildings in Germany and China : Investigation of conceptual and strategic transfer possibilities

content.text: Weblogs and Language : Study of linguistic characteristics in blog texts. Christoph Moss and Jill-Catrin Heurich look at the phenomenon that blog writers develop their own language with specific forms of presentation, in an empirical study. Weblog texts, journalistic comments in online media and corporate blogs are examined for their linguistic characteristics. Weblogs have found their place in the communication canon. They are easy to understand due to their simple structured programming of search engines. This makes them both content and commercial attractive. The content Linguistic characteristics of linguistic stylistics of weblogs, corporate blogs & newspaper commentaries in blog texts The target groups Doziers and students of media and communication sciences Practitioners from journalism and corporate communication, bloggers and social media experts The authors Prof. Dr. Christoph Moss is Dean of the Department of Media & Communication at the BiTS-Hochschule Iserlohn. Jill-Catrin Heurich is a lecturer at the BiTS-Hochschule Iserlohn and doctoral student at the Universidad Europe de Madrid.
content.title_en: Weblogs and Language : Study of linguistic characteristics in blog texts

content.text: Business processes analyze and optimize : Practice tools for analysis, optimization and controlling of workflows. Andreas Gadatsch shows in detail what business process management is and how it can be used. To this end, the central aspects are explained and practical tools presented using examples.Easily facilitate the daily practice of analysis and optimization of business processes! The content From strategy to business process documentation (modelling) of processes analysis and optimization (restructuring) and controlling of processes IT support The target groups Students and practitioners interested in business process management and who want to learn the most important things quickly about the topic without working through extensive books The author Prof. Dr. Andreas Gadatsch is Professor of Business Economics, in particular Business Informatics at the Department of Economics at Bonn-Rhein-Sieg University of Applied Sciences in Sankt Augustin. Introduction -- Central Terms -- From strategy to business process -- Documentation and modeling processes -- Analysis and optimization of processes -- Controlling of processes -- IT support.
content.title_en: Analyze and optimize business processes : practical tools for analysis, optimization and controlling workflows

content.text: Szintillation detectors with silicon photomultipliers: prototypes for an extension of the myon trigger at the CMS experiment. Simon Weingarten describes the development of particle detectors for an upgrade project of the trigger system in the CMS experiment. Based on fast plastic scintillators and silicon photomultipliers (SiPM), the author develops a new myon detector that combines a high probability of detection with large signal unit. The influence of various module parameters, such as the optical coupling between scintillator and SiPM or the use of reflective scintillator windings, is systematically investigated.The content Description of the CMS experiment, Introduction to silicon photomultiplier Structure of the prototype and functioning of the front-end electronics Description of measurement setup, trigger logic, signal processing and analysis methodology Optimization of the prototype as well as determination of signal purity and detection efficiency The target groups Dozierde and students in the field of detector development of the Institute of Technology Research Simon-Mstudent Researcher in the field of particle physics at the University of Technology.
content.title_en: Scintillation detectors with silicon photomultipliers : prototypes for an extension of the muon trigger at the CMS experiment

content.text: Gender in the social context: Perspectives for social work. Gender and social work have many facets. Based on contributions from different areas of the research focus "Gender and transculturality" of the KFH NW, this volume presents important problems, highlights central positions, and shows perspectives. The Catholic University of Applied Sciences North Rhine-Westphalia is the largest private and at the same time state-recognised university in church-based sponsorship for the departments of social sciences, health care and theology at four departments in Aachen, Cologne, Münster and Paderborn. The university also focuses on addiction and the research focus gender and transculturality. The KFH NW offers approximately 3,500 students courses of study and further education oriented towards concrete occupational fields. The "KFH NW" writings gather monographs and editorial volumes from research and collecting works in the form of current events of the mentioned faculties and research priorities. Thus, the KFH NW provides impulses for science and insights into its own activities. The "KFH NW" publications are available via the publishing house, further information – also from the KFH's research focus on gender.
content.title_en: Gender in the social context : Perspectives for social work

content.text: Stakeholder Management: Brief guide Issue 5. This guide shows how a systematic analysis of stakeholders in relation to the performance picture, the honoring and commissioning of project management services in the construction and real estate industry contributes significantly to risk minimisation. In addition to the internal success factors of a project, external influences must also be taken into account. To this end, instructions and tools for analysis and strategy development are presented. Stakeholders of a project in the construction and real estate industry are groups or individuals whose sphere of interest and influence is affected by this project. For the application, the individual project-specific design is necessary, including the project objectives, the marginal conditions to be considered and the specific parameters. This short guide is to be seen in connection with the studies on the performance picture, the honoring and the commissioning of project management services in the construction and real estate industry, as this is recognized as a normative rulebook in project management practice. The content definition Stakeholder Management - Stakeholder Management and its conflicts - The necessity of stakeholder management - The basis of stakeholder management - The content of a stakeholder analysis in 9 stages The author Dr. David Krips received his doctorate at the TUV Stakeholder Management Award and the German Disciple of the German Association of the Stakeholder Management of the Disciple.
content.title_en: Stakeholder management : Brief instructions Book 5

content.text: Automotive Sensor Systems: Selected Sensor Principles and their Automotive Application. The editor Dr.-Ing. Thomas Tille studied electrical engineering at the Technical University of Berlin and received his doctorate at the Technical University of Munich in the field of integrated sensor evaluation circuits. He has been working in the field of electronics and sensor development at BMW AG for several years. Dr. Tille is also a lecturer in microelectronics at the Technical University of Munich and also heads conferences in the field of automotive sensor technology. The target groups The book is aimed at professionals in business and science, especially in the field of automotive industry, sensor manufacturers and research facilities. About the book The sensor technology plays an important and growing role in the automotive industry. In addition to the rapid developments in the field of automotive technology, more precise and robust sensor information is becoming indispensable. In addition to the complex control algorithms of vehicle electronics, this information is used in particular for engine control, driving stability, safety and comfort increase in the field of sensor technology.
content.title_en: Automotive Sensory : Selected Sensor Principles and their Automotive Application

content.text: Artificial intelligence – When do the machines take over?. Everyone knows them. Smartphones that talk to us, wristwatches that record our health data, workflows that automatically organize themselves, cars, aircraft and drones that control themselves, traffic and energy systems with autonomous logistics or robots that explore distant planets are technical examples of a networked world of intelligent systems. They show us that our everyday life is already determined by AI functions. Biological organisms are also examples of intelligent systems that have emerged in evolution and can solve problems more or less independently efficiently. Occasionally, however, nature is a model for technical developments. Often, however, computer science and engineering science find solutions that are even better and more efficient than in nature. Since their creation, AI research has been linked to great visions about the future of mankind. Does the "artificial intelligence" thus solve people? This book is a plea for engineering: AI must be considered a service in society. Introduction: What is AI? -- A brief history of AI -- Logical thinking becomes automatically -- systems become a social machine?
content.title_en: Artificial intelligence – when do the machines take over?

content.text: A short introduction to molecular psychology: Volume II: From candidate genes to epigenetics. Genome-wide association studies vs. candidate gene approach -- The Affective Neuroscience Personality Scales -- Monogenetic genetic diseases vs. polygenetic traits in molecular psychology -- Place environmental effects on molecular level: the study of epigenome. This essential is concerned, among other things, with the still young research areas epigenetics and molecular genetics. In this context, content-related research perspectives such as the candidate gene approach to decoding the molecular foundations of personality are of the utmost importance. In combination with magnetic resonance tomography, the influence of genetic variants on the brain and ultimately also on human behavior can be located (genetic imaging).A detailed glossary of basic concepts completes this essential.The content of genome-wide association studies vs. candidate gene approach The Affective Neuroscience Professor Personality Scales Monogenetic hereditary diseases vs. polygenetic traits in molecular psychology Environmental effects on molecular biology of the molecular molecule psychology of the university.
content.title_en: A brief introduction to molecular psychology : Volume II: From candidate genes to epigenetics

content.text: Gamification, Digitization and Industry 4.0 : Understanding and managing transformation and disruption successfully. This essential explains how gamification, digitalization and the fourth industrial revolution change society, corporate management and management. Numerous graphics and illustrations show the current industry developments in terms of virtual, augmented and mixed reality. Future technologies developed in the Games Industry and have an influence on other sectors such as the automotive industry or the healthcare sector. Value creation processes for cultural and economic goods are documented. The content The triad of technology development The importance of the Games Industry for other sectors Management and gamification The target groups Business founders, managers and investors Teachers and students in the field of games The author Dr. Lutz Anderie, author of the successful book "Games Industry Management – Foundation, Strategy and Leadership", is considered an internationally recognized industry expert in the games, media and entertainment industry and expert in digitalization.
content.title_en: Gamification, Digitization and Industry 4.0 : Understanding and managing transformation and disruption successfully

content.text: Refurbishment of facades, plastering, joints: procedures and legal aspects. This work aims to identify balancing possibilities on external components, to identify possibilities for renovation constructively and economically and to identify technological processes. The focus is on the latest findings of the combination of modern and historical materials and traditional and latest technological processes. An important focus is also on renovation work on timber-framed houses. Plasters are explained from the perspective of environmentally compatible plaster systems and the preservation of old craftsmanship techniques. A legal part complements the content. The content Refurbishment of facades - Refurbishment of plasters - Refurbishment of joints - Legal framework The target group – Civil engineers and construction technicians – Architects – Students of civil engineering – Builders The editor Dr. Michael Stahr, PhD engineer, author and study director of numerous degree courses for the reconstruction of buildings and author of other technical books and articles is active as an consulting engineer and lecturer in the construction industry. Refurbishment of facades - Refurbishment of plasters - Refurbishment of fugen - Legal framework conditions.
content.title_en: Refurbishment of facades, plastering, joints : procedures and legal aspects

content.text: The project is a collaborative success in clusters with a network character: An analysis of the success of coordination and relational sources. David Beyer demonstrates multi-theoretically that the design of specific coordination mechanisms at the enterprise and cluster level as well as relational sources at the relationship level significantly determines the success of a cluster. In this context, cluster management as a central coordination unit must define and implement concrete measures to optimally train relational sources. The empirical review is carried out using a structural equation analysis of the responses of 231 companies organized in German clusters. It shows that a successful cluster represents a competitive advantage for the participating companies. The content role of cluster management in achieving cooperation success in clusters Relational sources as a basis for achieving cluster success Coordination mechanisms for activating relational sources in clusters Recommendations for action for cluster actors The target groups Dozierende und Studieren der BWL with focus on cluster management, network management and cluster management Cluster and network manager, employees in cooperation and strategy departments, the business development and managing director of SME The author David Beyer is a student of the TU-Bethinung at the TU-Bethinung.
content.title_en: Cooperation success in clusters with network character : An analysis of the success effect of coordination and relational sources

content.text: Financial management with Excel : Basics and applications. This textbook deals with the basics of corporate investment, financing and distribution decisions theoretically based and application-oriented. A decisive difference to the introductory financing textbooks in the German language area is the consistent application of the basics of financial management with Excel. This prepares readers for the implementation of the contents in the companies, since working with programs such as Excel is indispensable for practical financial management.
content.title_en: Financial management with Excel : Basics and Turnovers

content.text: Industrial Services 4.0: HMD Best Paper Award 2015. Potentials of Digitalization in Industrial Service Business -- Industrial Services for Digitalised Machines and Systems -- Implications and Recommendations for Business Practice. Based on empirical data from 45 concrete application cases, this essential potentials of cyber-physical systems identify the service business of the manufacturing industry as well as in machine and plant engineering. The authors call implications and recommendations for action for business practice. Readers learn how the progressive digitalization and the skillful use of cyber-physical systems transform the service business of the manufacturing industry as well as in machine and plant engineering. This results on the one hand in new possibilities for efficiency improvement of existing processes. On the other hand, previously unimagined possibilities for the implementation of innovative, data-driven industrial services open up. The content Potentials of Digitalization in Industrial Service Business Industrial Services for Digitalized Machines and Systems Implications and Recommendations for Business Practice The target groups specialist and executives of IT, business computer specialists and IT lecturers Matthias M. Herterich works as a scientific assistant at the University of Applied Sciences and Services.
content.title_en: Industrial Services 4.0 : HMD Best Paper Award 2015

content.text: Controlling & Management Review Special Issue 1-2016 : Big Data - The turn of the time for controllers. The articles in this special issue deal with the trend topic "Big Data from various perspectives relevant to controllers. Renowned scientists, practitioners and consultants show how controllers use the new possibilities of Big Data for their own work and how they can assess whether investments in this area are worthwhile for their company. In addition, it highlights the impact Big Data has on controllers' tasks and what skills controllers need to build up to use large amounts of data and different sources of information for new application fields. How controllers can benefit -- Predictive Analytics properly use -- "We draw data live and in color to show it in the system." -- Using external big data to unlock new possibilities -- Value creation with Big Data Analytics -- New visualizations on the test stand -- How Big Data changes the controller's role -- The possibilities of Big Data to fully exploit -- Will the controller become a data scientist? -- Controlling and Big Data: Requirements for the methodological competence.
content.title_en: Controlling & Management Review Special issue 1-2016 : Big Data - Time change for controllers

content.text: Identity Management in Cloud Computing: Evaluation of Economic and Legal Framework Conditions. This book describes the requirements for identity management in cloud computing from a legal and economic perspective. Cloud Computing is becoming a basic technology of digital society. Accordingly, it is important to prevent unauthorized access to cloud services. Key factors here are identity management and the prevention of identity theft and identity abuse. The work represents the legal framework of identity management in cloud computing including the IT security law and develops quantitative models of technical attack scenarios and defense measures from an economic perspective for typical uses of cloud applications. Taking into account the legal and economic framework conditions, concrete legal obligations for the implementation of certain protective measures are identified and thus the legal requirements of identity management are concretely concretely implemented. Georg Borges, Introduction: Challenges to Identity Management in Cloud Computing -- Alexander Golland and Andreas Schilling, Cloud Computing: Use, Threat and Damage scenarios -- Andreas Schilling, Safe Identification and Aput Management for Cloud Computing - Alexander Scholling, and Abit Management for Cloud Computing.
content.title_en: Identity management in cloud computing : Evaluation of economic and legal framework conditions

content.text: The electrical engineering/electronics for mechanical engineers: Simple and practical. Electrical engineering basics -- Resistance. Condenser and coil -- Three-phase motors -- Three-phase drives with frequency inverter -- Dynamic drive with servo motor -- DC, step and linear motors -- Circuits in semiconductor technology. This textbook follows a project-oriented, practical procedure and clearly shows the correct structured procedure for selecting and dimensioning the components. To this end, it deals clearly with the legalities of the DC and AC circuits and explains the most important passive components. The main basic circuits for electrical measurement technology are presented and the necessary analog and digital measuring devices. Basic components from the field of power semiconductors are explained with their applications. The construction of DC, AC and rotary current motors with examples from the drive technology is explained in an understandable manner. The content - Electrical engineering basics - Resistance, capacitor and coil - rotary current motors - rotary current drives with frequency inverters - DC motors - DC motors, step and linear motors - Electrical engineering - Electrical engineering - Electrical engineering and technical engineering.
content.title_en: Electrical engineering/electronics for mechanical engineers : Simple and practical

content.text: I think it's hacking! : A look at the crazy reality of computers, smartphones and IT security. Internet, email, online shopping and social networks -- Money cards, ATMs and online banking -- Passwords, PINs and biometrics -- Smartphones, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi and Co. . With this book you will learn how to protect yourself and your computer and what you should know about our digital tricks and gaps. The technology that floods us today leaves us no chance to secure everything so that we are really safe. But get to know the weapons of your opponents and your own defenses. But don't worry, when looking into the IT poison box you don't have to be an IT professional at all. The fourth, extended and updated edition is equipped with many new examples from the technical everyday life. Technically outdated chapters have been deleted, new episodes e.g. to the security of Wischpass words or digital money have been inserted. The TV expert Tobias Schrödel writes to us and explains to all the following: "Sergebnisse" (Sergebnichten-Werbeschichten).
content.title_en: I think it hacks! : A look at the crazy reality of computers, smartphones and IT security

content.text: Electrical Engineering for Engineers 3 : Compensation Processes, Fourier Analysis, Four Pole Theory. A textbook and workbook for basic studies. This textbook deals in a comprehensive and systematic way with three chapters of electrical engineering that extend the basics of electrical engineering in volumes 1 and 2 and thus form the bridge to application subjects. For example, the Laplacetransformation for control technology, the Fouriertransformation for signal theory and the Four Pole Theory for communication technology. Numerous tasks with detailed solutions in the annex supplement supplement the theoretical papers and enable a good preparation of exams. A list of the writing methods, formulae and units used and additional recommendations for students facilitate the work with the book. The content Compensation Processes in Linear Networks Fourier Analysis of Non-Nine-Nine-Nine-Mine Alternable Sizes Four Pole Theory The target groups Students of Engineering and Natural Sciences, in particular Electrical Engineering, Technical Informatics and Physics at Universities of Applied Sciences and Technical Universities, Universities and Academics The author Prof. Dr.-Ing. Wilfried Weißgerber taught basics of Electrical Engineering, Theoretical Engineering, Higher Mathematics and High Voltage Technology. Compensation Processes in Linear Analysis of Linear Theory of Non-Inline-Inline-Inline-Inline Analysis of Electrical Engineering.
content.title_en: Electrical engineering for engineers 3 : balancing processes, Fourier analysis, Four-pole theory. A textbook and workbook for basic studies

content.text: This is the case with the prevention of flood prevention in ports and shipyards: the scope of the port development. The present study shows that the concerns of preventive flood prevention and port development can be reconciled with the correct interpretation of law. Thus, the scope of port development can be justified by planning and planning options, as well as by the level of individual planning permits. This study demonstrates that, following the principles of nature protection and planning, the issues of flow prevention on the one hand and port development on the other can quite easily be reconfigured. This allows design opportunities to arrive within the framework of the flow prevention and the decision of the decision of the decision of the decision.
content.title_en: Preventive flood protection in ports and shipyards : playrooms for port development

content.text: Optimizing production processes - with system! : Main methods, examples, practical tips. In recent years, the number of methods for production optimization has exploded: Lean, Six Sigma, Theory of Constraints Who should keep track of this process jungle?'Optimizing production processes: with system!' is a reliable guide that presents the sixty most popular concepts and tools for production process optimization clearly and compactly.It helps you decide which of the approaches are suitable for your company and which ones are not.This book is also a reference book and guide for in-depth knowledge. This will help you to optimize your processes and achieve your company's goals in the best possible way.
content.title_en: Optimizing production processes - with system! : Main methods, examples, practical tips

content.text: This is how we create it - a civil society in the process of departure: 90 groundbreaking projects with refugees. In the process of conflicting with refugees, German civil society has re-established itself. Between 2015 and 2016, about 15,000 projects have been created, in which creative responses to the many challenges of immigration have been found. They form an alternative to panic reactions that see the only way to escape in control and deterrence. This volume presents 90 exemplary projects. They show the potential for a new relationship not only in the way of dealing with immigrants but also within civil society.
content.title_en: This is how we do it - a civil society on the rise: 90 pioneering projects with refugees

content.text: Informatische Algebra für Wirtschaftswissenschaftler : With tasks and solutions. This textbook provides the reader with an easy introduction to the matrix calculation. Matrices and vectors form an essential basis of many quantitative models and methods in both economic research and industrial practice. Basic elements of matrix calculation are explained in detail and deepened by means of economic applications. Based on this, the book introduces into vector space theory and linear optimization. In each chapter, numerous exercise tasks are found with solutions. The 6th edition has been supplemented by a chapter on the application of the Simplex algorithm in MS Excel. The content of basic and secondary matrix calculation Economic applications of matrix calculation General linear equation theory Vector space theory Linear optimization in general and with MS Excel < The authors Prof. Dr. Christoph Mayer is Professor of Business Economics / Investment and Financing at the University of Technology and Economics Dresden. One of his research focuses is the stochastic modelling and Monte Carlo simulation of the chances and risks of companies to represent the overall impact of uncertainties on relevant target sizes. Dr. Carsten Weber has been working for over 10 years in various management functions of the business management management management management management management management.
content.title_en: Linear algebra for economists : With tasks and solutions

content.text: Building Physics - Building Physics : English / German with dictionary. This book covers all basic areas of the teaching of building physics as it is understood internationally. The textbook is aimed at international and national beginners of civil engineering and architecture as well as at international engineers in practice. The dictionary annexed makes the book a "interpreting" compendium for civil engineers working in practice. The bilingual presentation of complex building physics content in parallel columns enables the globally active practitioner to quickly read the subject content bilingual. By acquiring the German-English book, the reader also receives an e-book of German-English-Chinese, which can also be purchased separately.
content.title_en: Building Physics - Building Physics : German / English with dictionary

content.text: From Demonology to the Unconscious : The Transformation of Anthropology around 1800. Around 1800 demonology loses its hegemony of interpretation. Many psychic phenomena are no longer explained as the effects of demons and spirits, but as internal processes of the psyche, since the 1820s also as the effects of an unconscious – often understood religiously – unconscious. These transformations did not come from the dominant interpretation cultures, but document the importance of non-hegemonic groups for cultural innovations.
content.title_en: From Demonology to the Unconscious : The Transformation of Anthropology around 1800

content.text: PISA 2009 Scale Manual. This scale manual documents the questionnaires used in the main study of PISA 2009 (Programme for International Student Assessment) in Germany. In PISA 2009, pupils, parents of the pupils, school leaders and teachers of the German College of Experts were asked to understand the school conditions and learning opportunities in German teaching more specifically. In this scale manual, the texts and statistical parameters for the international questionnaires as well as for the nationally supplemented questions are reported.

content.text: The context of the entrepreneurial city -- review of current programmatics -- New strategies and methods. Text 4. Cover page (max. 1400 incl. spaces) The contributions of this volume address the effects of new management and utilization logics that can be summarized under the term "entrepreneurial city." Social work, which mainly acts in a district-related manner, is facing an increasing fragmentation of the city and is confronted with the displacement of socially weaker groups. Urban development policy acts as a support and control at the same time: location marketing strengthens the international competitiveness and programs of the district development counteract the collapse of the city. The authors discuss current programmatics, the topics of self-help, social movements and social policy and deal with the role of perceptions and imaginations in urban research.The target groups of the university's research community are: New Professors and Students of Social Work, Sociology, Architecture and Related Disciplines from Community Work, District Management, Urban Planning and Local Policy The social scientist is the current editor of the social research community.
content.title_en: Social work in the entrepreneurial city: contexts, programmatics, outlooks

content.text: Insurance and Incentives in the German Welfare State. The concern about the uncertain future and the desire for security unites all people in a country. But state protection also generates misincentives, so that people gain less prosperity and less distribution. Building on a short history of the German welfare state, Charlotte Bartels finds that the protection against income losses is more pronounced than the reduction of income differences. The uncertainty of labour incomes during the reform-intensive past three decades particularly for singles and low earners increased worryingly. Despite the dismantling of various state benefits, the German welfare state guarantees its citizens from 1983 to 2011 a nearly stable income profile, considering income after taxes and transfers. The aim of balancing income differences has been increasingly less and less achieved in the past three decades. The content · Theoretical consideration of insurance by family, market and state · Historical development of welfare state insurance in Germany · Insurance and redistribution of income in Germany and Great Britain · Insurance vs. Work incentives in Germany The target groups · Dozende und Studieren der Wirtschaftslehre und Geschichts · Praktiker in Arbeitsministeriums, Forschungsbehreinrichten und Forschungsbehörung in Deutschland.
content.title_en: Insurance and incentives in the German welfare state

content.text: The innovator's dilemma : why established companies lose the competition for breakthrough innovations. Based on successful and unsuccessful examples from corporate practice, Christensen presents in this book rules for successful handling of breakthrough innovations. These rules will help managers decide when it makes sense not to listen to existing customers, invest in less efficient products with low margins or enter even small but high-growth market segments.

content.text: Business Analytics: Effective use of advanced algorithms in corporate management. Using data to solve business problems effectively and efficiently. The importance of business analytics derives directly from the rapidly increasing availability of data resulting from the digitalization of all areas of life. But how do companies now translate this data into better products, new services, innovative business models or, more generally, better business decisions? In order to address the challenges structured, this book presents a business analytics process that is divided into the four sub-processes framing, allocation, analytics and preparation. It is the basis for developing and implementing a business-individual business analytics approach. Numerous real business examples provide inspiration for concrete approaches in their own companies: from the procurement of data through the selection of the optimal algorithm to the recipient-oriented visualization of results. On these questions, managers of the middle and top management of all industries find answers in this book. It supports in identifying urgent problems of business management and solving them using data. How is the placement of central algorithms in the focus of the business?
content.title_en: Business Analytics : Effective use of advanced algorithms in corporate management

content.text: Perception - Cognition - Aesthetics : Neurobiology and Media Science. Perception, cognition and aesthetics can be understood as different forms of processing and expression of a basic biological equipment of man. Whether these are stable or whether they are culturally overformed or even transformed, forms the central media anthropological question of the volume. In this process, it is examined what kind of reciprocal impulses are, which can lead to cultural and biological changes, what effect they have and what duration they have. These questions are not directed solely at processes of perception, cognitive or aesthetic habituation, but rather at the physiological conditions. With the participation of proven researchers from the fields of biology, medicine and brain research, this volume opens up Neuland in the border area of natural and cultural sciences.
content.title_en: Perception - Cognition - Aesthetics : Neurobiology and Media Studies

content.text: The Google society: from the digital transformation of knowledge. Discussions about the knowledge society are few. It is clear that at the beginning of the 21st century the way of dealing with knowledge changes radically. How we develop, change and disseminate knowledge today differs in many ways from earlier forms. The extensive volume provides a current inventory of the different dimensions of the internet-based knowledge society. In more than 50 contributions, practitioners, journalists and scientists take stock of politics and economics, education, media and art, and thus compare discussion and reality.
content.title_en: Google society: from the digital transformation of knowledge

content.text: How to unmask a chocolate thief : ... and other mathematical magic tricks. This book introduces you to the world of logic and mathematics with amazing magic tricks and comic clowneries. Numbers and spaces become a fascinating world of magic, flunking and laughter. Because, even if you hardly believe it, mathematics is ripe for the stage and charmingly beautiful. How can you finally get this sneaky chocolate thief on the edge? How do monks with a vow of silence find out who is sick of them? And is there really a trick to find his lady of hearts? This book contains lovingly designed detailed instructions on how to tinker and solve such puzzles – ideal for parents, grandparents, teachers and children. The author Carla Cederbaum studied mathematics, physics and computer science in Freiburg and Cambridge and received her doctorate in mathematics in 2011 in Berlin. In addition to her research and teaching in mathematics, she is also active in science communication and has been awarded several times for this. Since 2016 she has been Professor of Mathematics in Tübingen and received the 2017 Student School of Mathematics - Student's Award for Mathematics.
content.title_en: How to unmask a chocolate thief : ... and other mathematical magic tricks

content.text: Environmental controlling is a tool for information, analysis, planning and control, which is crucial for a long-term successful corporate strategy. By revealing ecological optimization potential, systematic environmental controlling also opens up considerable economic opportunities. A success factor especially for medium-sized companies. Environmental controlling also forms an optimal basis for the continuous change in operational environmental management. Companies face new challenges in the changing environment. The completely revised and extended new edition informs about current developments: from EMAS II to new instruments of environmental management to sustainable economics. Numerous examples from the operational practice, checklists and tables provide support.
content.title_en: Handbook on Environmental Controlling

content.text: Cryptography understandable : A textbook for students and users. Introduction -- Stromchiffren -- Data Encryption Standard (DES) -- Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) -- More about block ciphers -- Introduction to asymmetric cryptography -- The RSA cryptosystem -- The discrete logarithm -- Elliptical curve cryptography -- Digital signature -- Hash functions -- Message authentication codes (MACs) -- Key generation. The book provides a comprehensive introduction to modern applied cryptography. It covers almost all cryptographic processes with practical relevance. Symmetric methods (DES, AES, PRESENT, current ciphers), asymmetric methods (RSA, Diffie-Hellmann, elliptical curves) as well as digital signatures, hash functions, measurement authentication codes and key exchange protocols are presented. For all crypto procedures current security estimates and implementation properties are described.
content.title_en: Cryptography understandable : a textbook for students and users

Introduction -- Information from cybernetic perspective -- Z-Information -- V-Information -- Shannon-Theory -- Quantum Information -- How to deal with information -- Thermodynamics -- Summary. The term information is used today almost inflationaryly. It is only the information technology, our information age, the information technology, the power of information, the information flood, information and documentation as well as the media and archives. Unfortunately, "Information" is sometimes used intuitively and often quite individually. Horst Völz contrasts four typical information classes and explains the lifeless nature, the life, the human communication and the Shannonian communication technology. content.text: The Business Guide for Digital Banking. The Digitalisation in Banking – Strategic Trends -- The Starting Point: The Architecture of Bank-IT at the Threshold of Digitalization -- The Bank-IT of the Future: The Key Topics. There is hardly any industry that is as strongly influenced by digitalization as the banking sector. New technologies are changing the value chain in retail banking as well as in corporate and capital market business. Key functions such as risk management, finance, controlling and compliance as well as communication have to face the challenges of the digital age. In addition to young financial technology companies ("FinTechs"), technology and internet companies with innovative solutions also question traditional business models of financial service providers. The successful design of digital transformation is thus a decisive factor for sustainable successful corporate development. The handbook was written by leading experts and experienced practitioners and is aimed at specialists and executives who deal with the digitization in the banking sector. The Business Guide for Digital Banking 4.0 The Business Guide for Digital Banking 4.0 The Business Guide for Digital Business Solutions for Digital Business Solutions for Business Solutions for Business Solutions for Business Solutions for Business Solutions for Business Solutions for Business Solutions for Business Solutions for Business Solutions for Business.
content.title_en: Practical manual Digital Banking

The authors shed light on the requirements for the design of studies and teaching, especially for non-traditional students from the perspectives of didactics and the structure of studies, such as e-learning, the timing of studies, etc. There are impulses to be given, how in basic and consecutive study programmes their concerns can be taken into account. The content What social policy implications does the university opening have, which educational and university policy goals are linked to the university opening? What potentials do working students and students with care tasks contribute to a university study programme? What challenges do they face? content.text: Paperback of measurement technology : Focusing on sensor technology. This book focuses on the fields of measurement amplifiers and measuring oscillators, digital time and frequency measurement, sensors and sensor-specific measurement single processing and structures of analog and digital measurement and sensor systems. It thus provides the basis for the transformation from a previously rather component-oriented measurement technology to a computer-oriented measurement system technology.
content.title_en: Pocketbook of measurement technology : Focusing on sensor technology

content.text: The virtual society of the 21st century: Social change in the digital age. "No stone will remain on the other", says the prognosis of Heidelberg sociologist Achim Bühl on the social consequences of modern information and communication technologies. A relevant part of human life will be played out in cyberspace in the near future. This thesis is clearly and understandable for the field of work, production and distribution of goods and communication. The second edition of the work has been completely revised and greatly expanded. New additions are the chapters social structure, gender relations, law and the individual of virtual society. The transition from the industrial to the "information society" is now comprehensively illustrated. The challenges for politics and economics, culture and education, but also for the everyday life of the individual, are clearly illustrated.
content.title_en: The virtual society of the 21st century: Social change in the digital age

content.text: The cost-effective and efficient construction operation is characterized by the optimal use of the equipment in a process chain for the respective specified construction work tasks. The performance determination is the basis of a systematic and result-oriented calculation and construction site preparation of the greatest importance. This manual is intended to serve as reference work and formula collection for both students and practitioners in the AV and calculation of construction companies. It can be used to perform performance determinations in the construction enterprise. An analytical basic concept for the performance determination of construction equipment as well as the process chains of parallel and successively switched devices of different subprocesses is presented. In this case, usually no "standard values" are specified, but only the elementary analytical connections. In the annex, the reader finds on a CD-ROM the usual standard devices with technical information, which are usually sufficient in the supply phase and for the preparation of a construction site. Thus, the annex of the manual can serve as a machine-technical reference work in the construction enterprise at the same time.
content.title_en: Performance determination for construction machinery and processes

content.text: In this guide, Hans Bürkle, the Nestor of career consulting in Germany, presents his successful application methods and advice especially for the engineer from 40. Part of unconventional but tried-and-tested methods help the engineer to overcome career kinks, to profile himself on the labour market or to make himself successful independently. The numerous examples are based on real consulting situations from engineers of all professional sectors to the management or board level. Graphics and sample texts for applications as well as the possibility to be directly provided by the author via e-mail make the book a valuable treasure trove. Hans Bürkle has made a career as a board member in the industry, thus his tips have a concrete, authentic practical relevance. As career consultant, he has already led a variety of engineers and other executives to professional success.
content.title_en: Career strategy and application training for the experienced engineer

content.text: Handbook Mobile-Commerce : Technical basics, market opportunities and application possibilities. By supporting mobile users, the virtualization of the markets is given a further boost. Mobility and e-commerce/e-business merge into M-Commerce, i.e. services are used around the clock and at almost every location. The authors are interested in the business models as well as the technical basics and scenarios for M-Commerce. Furthermore, possibilities for applications are shown that enable and support the entry into the mobile economy from today's point of view. Many of these applications are only "invented" or "found" in the next few years, but the book not only helps to find a way of doing business in M-Commerce, but also actively exploit the market opportunities. This is a compelling prerequisite for all those who want to keep a clear head in the phase of euphoria as well as in the general disillusionment that has occurred.
content.title_en: Mobile Commerce Manual : Technical basics, market opportunities and applications

content.text: The new DIN 1045 (2001) will be introduced in 2002 with the construction supervision. This book will facilitate the entry into the new generation of standards for reinforced concrete and prestressed concrete construction. The numerous examples of application will help the practically active structural planner to clarify the implementation of the formal evidence. Therefore, the basics of the safety concept and the concrete technology are explained in this book. The proofs in the limit state of the load capacity for bending without longitudinal force, for transverse force, torsion and punching as well as for rod-shaped components with longitudinal pressure form the foundations of the design in the steel concrete construction. Furthermore, the design of prestressed structures, the proof of suitability for use, for fatigue, rod structure models and structural perforation are treated and illustrated by detailed examples.
content.title_en: Reinforced concrete and prestressed concrete structures according to DIN 1045 : Parts 1 to 3 (July 2001) Explanations and applications

content.text: Electrical machines and drives : Basics, motors and applications. Basic knowledge about the operating behaviour of DC, AC and DC machines and transformers is indispensable for the engineer in the field of drive engineering development. Furthermore, knowledge about electromagnetic-mechanical energy conversion is helpful. This textbook provides the basics for this. Numerous detailed calculation examples facilitate the understanding of the material. The presentation of the theoretical basics has been simplified to such an extent that basic knowledge of electrical engineering is sufficient to understand. The second edition contains, among other things, updated standards in particular on explosion protection, standard formulae marks, new examples on the section synchronous machines, DC motors and induction law as well as additions to the chapter asynchronous machines
content.title_en: Electrical machinery and drives : Basics, motors and applications

content.text: The German Federal Government has been a member of the German Federal Parliament and is one of the most important opinion leaders of ecologically oriented energy research in Germany. Hubert Weiger has been chairman of the German Federal Ministry for Environment and Nature Conservation (BUND) since 2007 – with around 500,000 members and sponsors of one of the largest environmental associations in Germany. He is a member of the German Federal Council for Sustainable Development. The German Federal Government has been a member of the German Federal Government's Council for Sustainable Development. The German Federal Government's Energy Transition is the most important joint organisation in the German post-war history. And it offers a unique collective learning field for how the social-ecological transformation can be implemented in practice. The German Government's Energy Transition is a success. The German Government's Energy Transition is a success. The German Government's Energy Transition is a success.

content.text: Service networks : Management, success factors and benchmarks in an international comparison. Although the importance of the service sector is also increasing with us, it has not gained importance as in other countries and the sector is not one of the "export world champions". This book shows that service providers, which are organized as a network, can improve their competitive position by combining customer proximity with efficient system background. After a conceptual overview empirical results of an international benchmarking study on the success factors of service networks are presented. Five success factors are identified and their implementation is processed in the form of "Best Practice Case Studies". These case studies present the most successful benchmarks internationally. The presentation of franchising and cooperation networks and reflections on the "ideal service work" form the conclusion of the book
content.title_en: Service networks : Management, success factors and benchmarks in an international comparison

content.text: Why do tea and coffee pots drop? How can you roast a steak? Why don't commercial aircraft fly faster? Should you turn off the heating in the house in the short time you are away? These are questions about four of 50 thermofluid dynamic everyday phenomena that are treated uniformly and systematically according to the following scheme: Description of the phenomenon / principal explanation / Further considerations. In addition, a detailed glossary helps in the physical understanding of the technical terms. The content of this article is related to the following categories: - House and garden - Food and beverages - Travel and leisure - Energy and environment The target groups - Natural scientists, engineers, interested lay people - Lecturers of thermofluid dynamics or of sub-areas of it The author Dr.-Ing. Heinz Herwig is a professor at the TU Hamburg-Harburg and heads the Institute of Thermofluid Dynamics.
content.title_en: Oh, that's how it is! : 50 thermofluid dynamic everyday phenomena vividly and scientifically explained

content.text: Energy efficiency in Germany - a meta-study : Analysis and recommendations. The Stuttgart Institute for Energy Efficiency in Production has developed the first meta-study "Energy efficiency in Germany" which provides figures, data and facts on the state of development and knowledge of energy efficiency in Germany. The study shows which contribution individual measures have made so far and which potentials are known but have not yet been raised. For this meta-study, more than 250 publications by research institutions, ministries, trade and industry associations with a focus on energy efficiency were identified and evaluated. It provides an overview of the state of development and is an important reference work for industry, associations and politics. Introduction -- Energy efficiency by sector -- Industry -- Buildings -- Transport -- Trends and forecasts -- Summary, outlook and final evaluation.
content.title_en: Energy efficiency in Germany - a meta-study : Analysis and recommendations

content.text: The formula collection for surveying. The compact and clearly designed formula collection contains all important surveying and mathematical formulas. The structure of the book with more than 200 illustrations guarantees a quick and uncomplicated finding of all the desired formulas. Whether for preparation for exams or for subsequent examination in professional practice - the collection is always a reliable help. The book is in its presentation unrivalled on the German book market. The 17th edition has been adapted to the current developments. The content General Basics - Mathematical Basics - Geodetic Basics - Surveying Basics - Angle Measurement - Tracking and Distance Measurement - Methods for Point Determination - Transformations - Altitude Measurement - Engineering Measurement - Compensation Calculation - Fundamentals of Statistics The target groups Students of the subject areas Civil Engineering and Surveying Systems Surveying Engineers Surveying Engineers Civil Engineers and Architects in Practice The authors Dipl.-Ing. Franz Josef Gruber is employed in the survey administration Baden-Württemberg. Prof. Dr.-Ing. Rainer Joeckel teaches at the University of Technology Stuttgart in the surveying and geo-informat basics- Geodology- Basics- Gestrung.
content.title_en: Formula collection for the surveying system

content.text: The main focus is on the theoretical foundations for state recognition and the definitions of the conditions as the basis of the state description. Further basic mediations are available for the individual pipe materials. EN 13508-2 is extensively explained in the structure, function and use and gives important information for programming. The book also provides the whole of the topics of interest to the practitioner: cause-effect principle for state recognition, state definitions, questions about technology, material specifics, inspection practices, documentation as well as instructions for the construction of a service directory. Also occupational safety and safety are not too short. This work in its second edition thus represents an extension of the loadable basis for the technically and technically correct execution of the channel identification and control according to relevant predominantly European standards. For the second edition the book was thoroughly revised and adapted to EN 13508-2 and other European standards. The essential contents of the first edition were deepened and new topics, such as the complete assignment and re-enclosure of the national standards were listed in the annex.
content.title_en: Channel inspection : detect and document damage

content.text: Programming for engineers and scientists : Algorithms and programming techniques. The aim of the book is to present the programming as a key qualification for students of engineering or natural sciences with numerous application possibilities. Great value is placed on a practical and understandable presentation. The author deals with the fields of application of operations research, medical computer science and automation technology. In addition to the presentation of object-oriented design patterns central programming concepts and advanced data structures are presented. Search algorithms, graphs, automatic machines and regular languages are taught to the reader in practice. The basics for image processing in the field of image filtering, registration and segmentation complete the book. Application areas -- Object-oriented design patterns -- Central concepts -- Search -- Graphs and networks -- Image processing -- Annex Index. .
content.title_en: Programming for engineers and scientists : Algorithms and programming techniques

content.text: The book examines developments in science that have been initiated in recent years by modern information technologies and the increasing availability of data. Based on these new approaches, a number of phenomena, for example from the social sciences or life sciences, are calculated, which were previously considered too complex for a scientific analysis. The volume gathers texts from a variety of different perspectives, from physics to social and cultural sciences to computer science. In addition to contributions that directly address current developments, other essays investigate central concepts in direct connection with complexity or information. The content of Big Data and the sciences The Board of Management is Complexity and Information Ethical and Political Perspectives The target groups for students and lecturers of philosophy, computer science and natural, social and cultural sciences. The editor Dr. Wolfgang Pietsch is a research associate at the Munich Center for Technology in Society (MCTS) The University of Munich's staff member Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr. Dr.

content.text: Science in Focus V : Basics of Biology in the Context of Evolution and Religion. This volume provides an insight into the current developments in biology. As part of the life sciences, biology has gained a special position in recent years, which it places increasingly in the context of evolution and religions. The processes in the animated nature are difficult to understand and more complex than anything that exists in the inanimate nature. Questions of a fundamental nature arise: Are the life processes merely special forms of physical-chemical processes, energetically fed by the sun, or do they require an additional, special "vibrational power", a vital dissolution with life? Natural sciences in focus is the five-volume series, which gives the reader an introduction to the natural sciences at a demanding level. Numerous illustrations, tables and formulas explain the respective subject matter vividly. Natural science is explained by its beginnings in the Greek philosophers in their classical disciplines of mathematics, physics, chemistry and biology up to the present. The content of biology - natural science: religion The target group of the natural sciences The author Dr. E.
content.title_en: Focus on Natural Sciences V : Basics of Biology in Context with Evolution and Religion

content.text: Mining and environment. Mining, which has been partially centuries old in Germany, is now predominantly stopped, but mining facilities closed for decades continue to affect the environment. In connection with the question of geogenic background values and anthropogenic over-emphasis, the topic of mining and environment has a special role to play in addition to the special problem of old-state loads. The collection of articles presented in this volume of the GUG series deals with long-term geochemical influences from mining plants, in particular aspects of pyrite weathering, hydrogeochemical reactions and the use of industrial residues. The book presents current research on these aspects and mainly addresses environmental geoscientists (geologists, geochemists, mineralogens) who are experts. However, environmental managers as well as landscape and spatial planners will also find important statements in this book.
content.title_en: Mining and environment

content.text: The physics of our environment: The atmosphere. This book is derived from a two-semester lecture on the physics of the atmosphere in the framework of the subject Environmental Physics and the University of Heidelberg. It is conceived as an introductory textbook and pursues two interlinked objectives: - It aims to make the functioning of the system atmosphere understandable. This purpose serves sections on the radiation and energy balance, on atmospheric dynamics, on circulations, on precipitation formation, on the water cycle and on similar topics. - It wants to work out, in a broad sense, environmental aspects of meteorology and atmospheric physics. To this end, a detailed presentation of diffusion and transport processes, numerous sections on the behaviour of trace substances, with emphasis on radiation-relevant trace gases and on suspended particles, and finally a discussion of climate developments and their evaluation. The present third edition is again completely revised, several parts are completely new written. Thus, e.g. the dynamics of the stratosphere has received a much greater weight, it has again proved necessary to grasp the chapter on trace gases and to include more extensive information on the physics of our students and the subject.
content.title_en: Physics of our environment: the atmosphere

content.text: European fossil deposits. This book on European fossil deposits is aimed at a wide readership. It shows the geological, biological and geographical development of the European continent by using the example of 25 major fossil deposits. In 5 chapters all geological ages are presented. This volume is the result of an international cooperation of more than 30 renowned paleontologists from 13 different European countries and is supported by the European Palaeontological Society
content.title_en: European fossil deposits

content.text: Climate evidence of Earth's history. Are we living in a climatic emergency state - from an earth-historical point of view? The extinction of dinosaurs about 65 million years ago marks only one of many events in the billions of years old Earth's history. The investigation of such events, the role of the oceans or geological evidence of climate processes are important aids in the reconstruction of climate events in the past of the Earth. The Earth has a variety of evidences about climate conditions in its historical past. Geoscientists can decipher these testimonies and make them usable for the future. A decisive step for the acceptance of the ecosystem "earth" lies in the inclusion of the modeling of complex systems and in the knowledge of the possibilities and limits of the assessment of models in general. A current literature directory and a detailed glossary can be found at the end of the book.
content.title_en: Climate Certificates of Earth's History

content.text: This textbook is now available in the 6th improved edition and addresses all those who want to penetrate the world of ideas of stochastics - equipped with basic knowledge of differential and intergrail calculus and linear algebra. Stochastics is the mathematics of chance. It is of utmost importance for the professional practice of mathematicians. In many schools it has found its place. The two main areas of stochastics are probability theory and statistics. In probability theory, random processes are investigated with fixed and controlled probabilities. This is of theoretical and practical interest. Moreover, the probability theory provides the basis for statistics in which conclusions are drawn about unknown probabilities and about appropriate behaviour.
content.title_en: Introduction to probability theory and statistics

content.text: Geoinformatics in theory and practice. The book is a broad-based methodological introduction for practitioners and students. The elaboration represents a broad basic work that explains various aspects of geoinformatics. Here, geoinformation systems are not the main focus (the work has a chapter GIS), but rather the basics of cartography and surveying are also shown. Here, a selection is made. Thus, not all map projections are explained, but principles are clarified, as far as they are important in the context of geoinformatics. This is intended to lay the foundations for working with coordinates. Similarly, the other contents are treated. In the second edition, all contents have been extended.
content.title_en: Geoinformatics in theory and practice
