content.text: Plant and energy industry : Cost and investment estimation and technical evaluation of industrial plants. The business and engineering aspects of the plant and energy industryThe sustainable and responsible use of raw materials and energy sources in production plants is an important principle of all companies. This requires a closer examination of the product development within complex value chains and process-technical process steps. In particular, the relationships between the materials used, the energy use and the quality requirements of the manufactured products are important elements of appropriate quality.
content.title_en: Plant and energy industry : cost and investment estimate and technical evaluation of industrial plants

content.text: Phainomena : Greek-German. The Greek philosopher Aratos (3rd century BC) describes not only the constellations but also the myths associated with them. For example, the story of the father of the gods Zeus, who immortalized the women who used to care for him as a child, as the constellation of the female bears in the sky. Or the one from the ship Argo, with which Jason moved out to rob the Golden Fleece.
content.title_en: Phainomena : Greek-German

content.text: Who organizes the "needs"?: Quarter designers in disadvantaged urban districts. Even though civil society is often hardly visible in socially disadvantaged neighbourhoods, there are important exceptions: quarter designers are active with tireless force of citizenship. In the book eight of these extraordinary people are presented in detailed portraits. How did they come to their role, what motives do they drive in their commitment, what values they represent? The study provides detailed insights into the functioning of civil society in socially weak districts. They mention obstacles and difficulties for the active people.
content.title_en: Who organizes the "necessary"? : Quarter designers in disadvantaged urban districts

content.text: Proton endodium of silicon: Investigation and modeling of proton-induced doping profiles in silicon. Johannes G. Laven describes the doping of crystalline silicon by means of proton implantations with energies in the range of less megaelectronvolts. This allows the production and modification of doping profiles in depths between micrometers up to well over 100 μm. The necessary, comparatively low thermal budget makes such doping profiles particularly interesting for the production of current power semiconductor components. The author explains the requirements and limits of proton endodiumization and displays an analytical model for the calculation of proton-induced dotier material profiles depending on the implantation parameters and the thermal budget. The content Basics of proton endodium processing and characterization methods Charge carrier profiles and parameter dependencies Radiation-induced interferences Modelling The target groups Dozierende und Studieren der Skonzertifiktoren und Stahlungstechnik Manufacturer of semiconductor devices The author Johannes G. content.text: Hydrogen and fuel cells: On the way with the cleanest fuel. Why is hydrogen an energy source? How do fuel cells work? How do we use hydrogen in future vehicles? How safe is the technology? The compact book describes the physical and chemical foundations of hydrogen technology in an understandable way and explains the expected technical solutions. It presents the problems and enables us to better understand the efforts of industry and research to implement this technology in a broad way. The authors explain clearly the functioning of the most important components in the transformation chain from renewable electricity to vehicle propulsion and demonstrate their technical development potential. Taking into account the reliability and economic efficiency, they evaluate the sustainability of the energy cycle that can be realized with the hydrogen energy source. 1 Securing mobility with renewable energies -- 2 fuel cells as efficient energy converters in modern propulsion systems -- 3 hydrogen as new fuel -- 4 hydrogen-powered vehicles -- 5 ways to sustainability with hydrogen -- Annexes: Historical overview -- Data from hydrogen and important energy sources -- Sources and further literature.
content.title_en: Hydrogen and fuel cells : On the way with the cleanest fuel

content.text: Lean and Industry 4.0: a digitalisation strategy based on the flow of value. Digitalisation in production – where it is worth it. Industry does a lot to digitize its processes and products and avoid waste through lean management. Here lies a great potential for efficiency gains and innovations. However, these efforts are not always so focused that the expected effect also occurs. In this book, the author describes which method can be used to solve this problem. The findings from real consulting projects flow in. Blocks of action are solved by first removing the obvious sources of waste. On this basis, smart products and smart services can be developed in the next step. In the end, you will hold all elements for your own digitization strategy, but always "Lean goes ahead of Industry 4.0". What the book brings you to learn: develop your own digitization strategy; design a customer-oriented guideline as a basis; use new technology only where it really serves the business objectives. With the help of this book, you avoid misguided paths and fruitless discussions of the project participants. Profit from the experiences of others and use proven tools to achieve a faster goal.
content.title_en: Lean and Industry 4.0: a digitalisation strategy based on the value stream

content.text: Basic course in computer science - the exercise book : 148 tasks with solutions. The exercise book was written by the author in such a way that it can be used without the "basic course in computer science". The exercise tasks cover a wide range of topics. In order to establish the relation to the practice, the examples are oriented towards operating systems, not taking into account the area of programming. After a short preface by the author follow the exercise tasks in the 2nd chapter. In order to achieve a better learning effect, the solutions to the exercises are in 3rd chapter. Recommended as a supplement to the main work and other textbooks. Exercise tasks are also to be found in other textbooks on individual topics, e.g. "Introduction to the information and coding theory", "Digital technology", "Basic course in theoretical computer science"
content.title_en: Basic course in Computer Science - the exercise book : 148 tasks with solutions

content.text: Smart Home with FHEM : individual and flexible open source home automation: [including tablet interface and voice control]. Individual smart home solutions with the open source system FHEM. Do you already have Smart Home components in use? Then you know the problem: There is a separate software for each hardware and the systems are usually not compatible with each other. There is chaos pre-programmed. But that's all that is now done! The open source software FHEM offers maximum freedom in designing smart home scenarios. FHEM can combine wireless or cable-bound components of any manufacturer. In this book you will learn everything you need to know to make your home with FHEM smart – with customizable and modular expandable solutions. The following topics await you: Configuration of the FHEM server program and operation of the web interface; Integration and grouping of smart home devices in FHEM; Event control through events; Measuring and visualizing in FHEM; Operation via web frontend, smartphone, tablet and voice input; Programming of your own FHEM modules. If you can master the use of the internet as well as the use of a variety of applications, you can find out of the use of the home radio systems.
content.title_en: Smart Home with FHEM : individual and flexible open source home automation : [including tablet interface and voice control]

content.text: All just bought? : Corruption in the Federal Republic since 1949. Corruption runs through the entire history of the Federal Republic. Even the decision for Bonn as capital in 1949 was bought. In reality, it would be impossible to imagine a democratic community without the combination of politics on the one hand and economy and money on the other. A banana republic, as often said in the wake of the Flick affair, has therefore never been Germany. Jens Ivo Engels, who was the first German historian to study the subject scientifically, analyses the most important corruption cases, embeds them in its social environment as in the international discussion on transparency and good governance and shows: the discussion of corruption in the public is an outstanding indicator of the respective political constitution of a state.
content.title_en: All just bought? : Corruption in the Federal Republic since 1949

content.text: In the shadow of Humboldt: a tragic story of German ethnology. From the high ideals of Alexander von Humboldt to the bitter dispute over the Humboldt Forum, a long and winding path leads through German history. Hardly anything illustrates him better than the ethnological collection of the Berlin Museum - with 500,000 objects one of the largest in the world. H. Glenn Penny describes in his illuminating book how this gigantic collection was created, what was behind it for motives and why its original idea is hardly considered today. His book is an indispensable contribution to the objectification of the debate about the colonial heritage of German museums.
content.title_en: In the shadow of Humboldt: a tragic story of German ethnology

content.text: Everything becomes different: the age of ecology. Species die, nutrition, and indeed our whole way of life and production become harder. Ecology is no longer a topic among other things, it becomes the central aggregate state of politics. Why is that so? In the unending summer of 2018, the citizens became aware of the weak ecological balance of the Merkel years. The Greens were therefore able to double their demographic values. In addition, climate policy increasingly often hours of truth stand in front of the: traffic turnaround, energy turnaround, agricultural turnaround - the interventions that are necessary to severely limit global warming are deep, the upcoming changes will have real losers and winners, they will have opportunities and pains. No wonder that the dispute is now moving into the political center and all other issues re-examined - from social justice to democracy and human rights. The political culture of the country is not prepared for this. Still, there is no search for a policy for the problems, but vice versa: the problems are so corrected that they fit the policies we know. This repression of ecological confidence can overcome this new situation, and the new freedom of speech is won by Ulrich.
content.title_en: Everything will be different : the age of ecology

content.text: Energy in plastics technology: Basics and applications for engineers. The book provides the necessary basics for the processing of thermal engineering questions in plastics like no other book. The subject areas are: thermodynamics (main principles, treatment of chemical transformations); fluid mechanics including the rationale of the theory of similarity; heat transfer (free and forced convection, stationary and instationary heat conduction, some aspects of heat transfer through radiation); thermal and caloric state behaviour, deformation and flow behaviour of plastics (rheology). The basics provided are applied - in the sense of exemplar calculations - to practical problems in the most important processing and processing processes: heating and cooling processes of tools, extrusion, blow forming, spray casting, pressing of Duro and Thermoplasts, calendering, etc. The focus is on the energy-economic and temperature-reducing of the plastics industry (the plastics industry and the plastics industry).
content.title_en: Energy in plastics technology : Basics and applications for engineers

content.text: Our Asian future. From an Asian perspective, the People's Republic of China often appears as an exemplary counter-project to a supposedly declining, morally exhausted and inflexible "West". The latter is also the tenor of the book by the Indian-born political scientist of the National University in Singapore. In the fact-rich and often provocative presentation, Khanna tends to attribute advantages in global competition to a vast but somewhat inaccurately described as "Asia". This concerns state-led capitalism and essentially technocratic, purely efficiency-oriented forms of government. The presented theses are not really new, yet this Asian perspective is recommended in addition to the discourse that prevails in us, for here China, or even "Asia", is considered to be a more or less threatening challenge for Europe.(2)
content.title_en: Our Asian Future

content.text: A thousand lines of lies: the Relotius system and German journalism. It was the biggest forgery scandal in decades: a reporter of the "Spiegel" had delivered reports and interviews from home and abroad, moving and often with the painting of the special. They were all examined and removed by the "mirror" and its legendary documentation, they were printed, and the author Claas Relotius was almost overwhelmed with prizes. But: They were - whole or part - free invented. Juan Moreno, rather involuntarily and against violent resistance in the "mirror", has revealed the fakes. Here he tells the whole story of the rise and fall of the young star journalist, whose reports were so perfect, so coherent, so beautiful. Claas Relotius always wrote exactly what his editors wanted. But nevertheless, it is to ask why these fakes could remain undetected for years. "Juan Moreno has been busy with the scandal around the fake reports of the Spiegel Best journalist Claas Relotius and the news magazine plunged into a deep crisis. Now he explains in his book story that the 2018 was not able to keep the story of the story.
content.title_en: Thousand lines of lie : the system of Relotius and German journalism

content.text: Manual series / Research Institute Geragogik, Fachhochschule Dortmund (ed.) ; Manual 3: Developing district networks with older people. The manual describes the process of district development with older people as (co-)producers, the control and (evaluative) support of the participatory, age-integrated district development, including the presentation of the implemented participation formats and instruments. It refers to experiences and findings made in cooperation with older citizens and other actors of the district and the city society. Therefore, it is addressed to network development and cooperation in the districts and beyond. The larger framework of the entire city as well as the specific development context are also included, which are based on the link between the real and the digital and the cooperation of science and practice.
content.title_en: Manual series / Research Institute Geragogik, University of Applied Sciences Dortmund (ed.); Manual 3: Developing district networks with older people

content.text: Manual series / Research Institute Geragogik, Dortmund University of Applied Sciences (ed.); Manual 4: Participative Technology Development : Methodology and Implementation Examples. In the form of an abstract book, Manual 4 describes "Participative Technology Development – Methodology and Implementation Examples" the opportunities and challenges of participatory technology development based on practical examples from the research and development project QuartiersNETZ. The topics range from the idea of a corresponding process for the development of a digital neighbourhood platform to legal aspects in the development of software to the technical possibilities of the connected home. In order to allow a broad audience access to the gained experiences and insights, a special attention is paid to a comprehensible and understandable explanation of the respective technical facts.
content.title_en: Manual series / Research Institute Geragogik, University of Applied Sciences Dortmund (ed.); Manual 4: Participative Technology Development : Methodology and Implementation Examples

content.text: The only book on the subject of the sampling of injection moulding tools. A standardized, structured and systematic procedure for the sampling of injection moulding tools is essential for a successful injection moulding process. Everything you need to know for a sampling process. The book accompanies you from the assignment of a sampling process to the transfer to series production. The complete sequence of the individual sampling steps, many background information, hints, practical examples, practical tips and the colored design convey in a simple way the procedure of the sampling. The main topics are the structured procedure of a sampling process taking into account the energy efficiency, documentation and communication, a sampling analysis, the optimal machine setting through strategic procedures and methods at the injection moulding machine, the process optimization with subsequent examination of the process capability and a Run@Rate process. The technical book was designed in such a way that it is perfectly suited for the practical user at the injection moulding machine as well as as as a textbook at professional schools, training institutions and universities. content.text: Functional safety in the automobile: the challenge for electric mobility and automated driving. Functional safety in the automobile. The second edition of this book has a completely different focus than the first edition, which is still closely oriented to the scope of ISO 26262. The reason for this are the precursors of a rapidly changing automotive market. Electric mobility is in the coming, the days of the combustion engine seem to be counted. Even the role of the driver is redefined or even challenged. The completely revised book deals with many questions about the safety that these changes bring with it: - Which laws are relevant in which market and for which mobility concepts? - What changes are accepted by society? - What methods and best practices are there? - What is the state of science and technology? - What is relevant and how can it be adapted for future concepts? - What experiences are there in other industries? Are we at the end all passengers in rolling or flying passenger transport systems only? All these questions go far beyond the safety concept of ISO 26262. In this book time, car operators want to offer safe aspects for the car operator.
content.title_en: Functional safety in the automobile: the challenge for electromobility and automated driving

content.text: The modern descendants of the indigenous people of Australia and Oceania are living together with the modern and modern world. The myth is not ‘irrational' but rather provides a rational basis for thinking and acting, by which they are ‘perfect' the modern world, and by which they are still the prerequisite for the success of the individual's life. The myth is not ‘rebuted by reality', but rather creates an idea of the reality, it illuminates and opens up their sense. In stories and liturgy, we would like to show the disrespect in the early days of the committed states of the foundation, the so-called dream time.
content.title_en: Mana, Power and Myths : Tradition and Modernism in Australia and Oceania

content.text: Moral responsibility of civil engineers: problem positions, perspectives, need for action. Introduction -- Basics -- Work and decision environment -- Problems in practice -- Perspectives of a new engineering responsibility -- School, study, profession -- Urgent need for action -- Summary The author discusses fundamental questions of action in everyday life of civil engineers, especially with regard to the importance, possibilities and obstacles to the perception of moral responsibility. Here he has gained considerable experience in the course of his past twenty-five years of professional activity, through which his technology fascination has gradually been clouded. In a gradual process of increasing thoughtfulness, problems in practice have become established that technical applications in the building industry can also generate doubts in all positive applications and beneficial advantages. Moral responsibility of civil engineers is more than ever demanded. The content Introduction Fundamentals Work and decision environment Problem situations in practice Perspectives of a new engineering responsibility School, study, occupation Pre-primary need for action Summary The target groups of technology and philosophy prospective teachers and students of civil engineering has been studying the philosophy of the profession, the professor has been studying the philosophy of the profession and the profession since 1960.
content.title_en: Moral responsibility of civil engineers: problems, perspectives, need for action

content.text: Exercise book Mathematics for economists : Task collection with detailed solutions. Tools for solving tasks -- Algebra -- Functions of a variable -- Differential calculation -- Integrated calculation -- Solutions -- Formula collection This exercise book offers an extensive collection of examples and tasks for economists in mathematics. From the basics of mathematics to more complex applications, numerous topics are addressed, such as logarithms, interest rate calculation or differential and integral calculation. For each task, a detailed solution is included in the book. In addition, PDF, maple and Microsoft Excel files are provided. These can be downloaded from the author's website. The authors Prof. Dr. Tilo Wendler, Hochschule für Technik und Wirtschaft Berlin Prof. Dr. Ulrike Tippe, Technische Hochschule Wildau
content.title_en: Maths for Economists: Task Collection with Detailed Solutions

content.text: Empirical Social Research with Python : Automatically Collect, Evaluate, Prepare. Introduction -- Understanding and Applying Python -- Processing Tabletary Data in Python -- Data Collection with Python using the example of Twitter and News Media -- Statistical Calculations with Python -- Visualizing Data -- Outlook -- Further Literature In times of "Big Data", it is increasingly important to automate data processes. In this book, the program language Python is used to automatically collect data, evaluate these data and visualize correlations. However, the examples are simple and can be transferred to own, more complex projects. Therefore, the book is suitable for all those who have not yet gained experience in programming. The content of Python understand and apply.- Processing tabular data in Python.- Data Collection with Python using the example of Twitter and News Media.- Statistical Calculations with Python.- Visualize Data The Target Groups Docators and Teaching Students The author Dr. Markus Feiks was a scientific assistant at the University of Tübingen.
content.title_en: Empirical Social Research with Python : Automatically Collect, Evaluate, Prepare

content.text: Holzmann/Meyer/Schumpich Technical Mechanics Kinematik and Kinetics. This well-established textbook provides a theoretically sound and at the same time practice-oriented introduction to kinematics and kinetics. The special feature of the didactic concept is that structured and intelligible theoretical introductions are illustrated and deepened by a variety of examples and tasks. This enables students to learn clearly and independently how to work on the material.The present edition has been supplemented by further examples and exercises and highlights the presentation of some important formulas.The content of kinematics of the point - kinetics of the mass point - kinematics of the body - kinetics of the mass point system - kinetics of the body - impact - mechanical vibrations - Annex: Solutions to the tasks The target group Students of the engineering sciences at universities of applied sciences and technical universities The author Prof. Dr.-Ing. Conrad Eller represents the teaching areas of mechanics and finite element methods in the department of mechanical engineering and process engineering of the University of Lower Rhine, Krefeld Kinematik of the point -- kinetics of mass points - kinematics - kinematics - vibration - vibration of the body - vibration
content.title_en: Holzmann/Meyer/Schumpich Technical mechanics kinematics and kinetics

content.text: In this essential, Fuzzy Management: Trilogy Part II: Use of blurred logic for business intelligence. Andreas Meier and Edy Portmann use fuzzy management to solve business problems in the digital economy. The blurred logic extends classic logic with the two values "true" and "false" and leads to more differentiated assessments. In addition to portfolio management, performance measurement, service level engineering and reputation management, Business Intelligence is enriched with soft factors to improve the decision-making process. The content Fuzzy Management and Portfolio Management Performance Measurement and Service Level Engineering Reputation Analysis and Business Intelligence The target groups Managers, Project Managers and Interested Persons in Business, Administration or Public Life, who would like to gain an overview of the potential of uncharpleasant logic in the digitization of business The authors Prof. Dr. Andreas Meier headed the Chair of Business Informatics at the University of Fribourg, Switzerland from 1999 to 2018. His research areas were eBusiness, eGovernment and Information Management. In the course of his research, Professor Edy Portmann is Professor of Management at the University of Human Management.
content.title_en: Fuzzy Management : Trilogy Part II: Use of the blurred logic for business intelligence

content.text: Methods of Political Science : an application-related introduction. This work is a practical introduction to the common methods of political science. The individual methods are not only explained theoretically, but also presented and illustrated by means of a political science example. In this way, abstract explanations break them down to exemplary, tangible examples and instructions.
content.title_en: Methods of political science : an application-related introduction

content.text: Interculturality and Waldorf education. In Germany, there are now about 19 million people with a migrant background. Especially the schools face the challenge of educating the social, linguistic, cultural and religious heterogeneity that has emerged – so far without any major success. Waldorf education is also required in this context, and the present volume shows the existing approaches and potentials. Thus, initiatives have already been developed that combine the personal orientation of Waldorf education, which aims at individual promotion, with the universal approach of salutogenesis and the pursuit of cultural diversity. These aspects also form the background for the internationality of the Waldorf School and Waldorf Kindergarten movement, which is now present on all continents.
content.title_en: Interculturality and Waldorf Education

content.text: The relevance of the study is not limited to the domestic work of development policy, but also to other areas in which learning processes and impact observation play a role, such as development cooperation, environmental education or political education. – Susanne von Jan, in: Zeitschrift für Evaluation 1/2020, p. 175f. The demand for a stronger impact orientation has also for some years been covered by development policy domestic work. The implementation of this demand is not trivial, because here education and awareness processes are the main focus, which depend on many influences and thus elude classical causal evaluation designs. Therefore, for a long time now, it has been discussed what can be understood in development policy domestic work under effect, and how these effects can be determined. Both questions are discussed within the framework of the research project "Effectives and methods of impact observation in development policy domestic work" which can be considered in the context of the project on the topic of impact and development.
content.title_en: Impact orientation in domestic development work

content.text: The mathematical basics of crystallography: for mathematicians and scientists. Introduction -- Geometric representation of macroscopic crystals -- Analytic geometry and vector calculus in crystallography -- Crystallographic group theory -- ANNEX -- Mathematical repetitorium -- Symbolics This book introduces into the mathematics of crystallography. Order and content correspond to the usual basic courses in systematic mineralogy or crystallography – in contrast to these courses, the book consistently focuses on mathematical observation, explanation and reasoning. The book thus forms a bridge between purely crystallographic and purely mathematical literature: mathematicians find here realistic applications of analytic geometry and linear algebra, group theory and projections. Crystallographers, chemists, geologists, mineralogen and physicists receive mathematical background information and explanations on the known rules of crystallography and mineralogy. All principles are illustrated by concrete examples and the learned can be established by exercises. The contents are already available in the first years of study. The mathematical analysis of geometry, the direct analysis of crystallography.
content.title_en: Mathematical foundations of crystallography : for mathematicians and scientists

content.text: Real-time systems: Basics of planning. Real-time systems are used to get processes to the right action at the right time. They are used, for example, for controlling production systems, automated car driving or even for voice transmission in worldwide networks. Literature on this topic has not yet been discussed here, although the book is already available in the second edition. The author is known through research on real-time systems and through the development of concepts and methods in this field. The book begins with the characteristics of a real-time model and then comes very quickly to the basic model of a real-time system. The focus is on methodological and technical foundations of real-time systems and basic planning procedures. Advanced planning methods (synchronized processes, multiprocessor systems, ...) are only briefly discussed. Many tasks (with solutions) and practical examples (including recording a truck toll on motorways).
content.title_en: Real-time systems : basics of planning

content.text: Introduction to Data Science : Basic principles of data analysis with Python. The book is a new edition of Grus, which now relies on the current version 3.6 of Python and introduces into the foundations of data science as an interdisciplinary field of science for the acquisition of new insights from very different data. The new edition should replace the old version with good use, as a downward compatibility of the new version of Python to earlier versions is only conditionally given. The author requires some basic knowledge from the reader. Thus, Python basic knowledge is only refreshed once more in a crash course. The actual entry begins with a scenario in DataSciencester, a fictional social network for data scientists. Also, new important facts about deep learning, statistics and language processing are taught compared to the first edition. Beginners who only search for a general overview should also be pointed out to A. Ng, who also deals with data science, but only shows using very simple and plausible examples and applications, what can be achieved in this way.
content.title_en: Introduction to Data Science : Basic principles of data analysis with Python

content.text: The dynamic company: how change of values, innovation and digitalization lead to success. Looking for a successful way for the digital transformation of your company and building on the strengths of your business? Then this book offers you a variety of future-oriented and practical solutions that you can apply immediately. The dynamic company combines an esteemed corporate culture and a high level of innovation with agile organizational structures - it makes change holistic and allows you to do so step by step. What you need to know is explained to you on the basis of current scientific studies and impressive case studies. The practical tools to this end make the immediate application in your company easy. Whether design thinking, future work concepts or new forms of collaboration: The authors have the strategies of the dynamic company with leading minds in Silicon Valley, experts at the German research tip, active start-up founders and leaders of innovation laboratories in German-speaking companies will benefit from this innovative solution variety.
content.title_en: The dynamic company: how change of values, innovation and digitalization lead to success

content.text: Manual Competence Measurement : recognize, understand and evaluate competences in company, educational and psychological practice. Competences are the key to future personnel management. How can they be recognized, recorded and measured? The manual covers a wide range of procedures for competence measurement and characterisation. The approach of competence measurement towards a general competence acquisition is extended. In the new edition, the manual was supplemented by practical measuring methods that represent self-organized action and the range of competences, including: Living Competence Models, BALI-F, KOMBI Runway Consulting and Talentkompass NRW. With an overview of all the competence measurement and acquisition processes used in Europe.
content.title_en: Manual of Competence Measurement : recognize, understand and evaluate skills in company, educational and psychological practice

content.text: Digitality and privacy: cultural, political-legal and social perspectives. Data protection remains a competitive topic in the context of the advancing digitalisation. The contributions of the volume explore the question of which forms privateness can take in a digital society and what opportunities and risks arise. Media-cultural questions arise about the normation patterns behind digital applications as well as the need to analyse, classify and evaluate digital usage scenarios.The interdisciplinary volume gathers cultural, social, media, legal and political perspectives.
content.title_en: Digitality and privacy : cultural, political, legal and social perspectives

content.text: This textbook provides a compressed overview of the law of corporate taxation and provides the basic structures of the most important tax types for companies. The book is addressed to students of law and economics and business law at universities, universities of applied sciences, administrative and business academies as well as to practitioners interested in tax law. Numerous illustrations and graphs as well as examples and exercises with solutions make the teaching material vivid and facilitate understanding of this demanding area of law. This makes the work particularly suitable for reading during lectures and for preparing for exams.
content.title_en: Basic principles of corporate taxation

content.text: The formula reading book: what formulas have to say to us. Formula and reality -- The aesthetics of formula: formulas are images -- The mathematical actors: 1 + 1 = 2, from which everything follows -- Here comes movement into formula: A small algebra -- Examples Folding text: difficulties with reading formulas? You know people who can read so much from a formula without effort? What is their secret? Quite simply: You know how to read a formula correctly. The formula reading book familiarizes you systematically with all the important aspects of reading formulas: questions of language, of the respective factual context and perception are answered just as much as your understanding of structural questions and formula specifics is extended. The formula is actually the focus of this book and the principle of how to "define" it properly - and continue to work with it: so that one learns what a formula has to say interestingly. And all this without higher mathematics but with concrete examples from physics, biology, geography, mathematics ... The formula and reality - The formula of the formula - Here are small formulas - The formula of the mathematics - The formula of the mathematics - The formula of the mathematics - The formula of the mathematics - The formula of the mathematics - The following formulas - The following: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The formulas: The
content.title_en: The Formula Reader's Book : What Formulas Have to Tell Us

content.text: Key figures for the construction and real estate industry - including work aids online. Raster measure, All Risk Yield, real estate interest rate: In the real estate industry, there are many technical terms that do not always immediately reveal their significance. Students, participants in education and training as well as practitioners must know what is behind them in this world of concepts and what lies behind them. This book gives you a sound overview of the key figures. It shows which calculation rules are behind them, which are the main factors influencing them and what you can conclude from the figure. In addition, you get the most important definitions from the real estate industry. New in the second edition: an additional chapter on the topic of real estate bubbles with their specific indicators. Contents: location and property analysis; valuation of real estate; financing forms and loan types; taxes and depreciation for real estate; calculation of management and maintenance costs correctly.
content.title_en: Key figures for the construction and real estate industry - including work aids online

content.text: Human collaboration management : Human resources managers as consultants and designers in a networked working environment. Networking and collaboration - these principles are increasingly at the forefront of today's corporate world. The book shows how personnel managers can take a new role in the context of this development: namely as drivers and companions of the change towards more collaboration. Based on concrete ideas, suggestions and examples, the author explains how the change towards human collaboration management can succeed, for example in terms of: culture and leadership style; processes such as assessment and remuneration systems; operational structures.
content.title_en: Human collaboration management : Human resources managers as consultants and designers in a networked working environment

content.text: Special business administration of the real estate industry. For practitioners as well as for the training, further and further training for real estate merchants: The "Murfeld" has long been indispensable for practitioners as well as for training and further training. The author team from renowned real estate experts does not leave any unanswered business-related question. The textbook deals with all planned innovations in rental law in its 8th edition. The updated edition contains new BGH-principles, the amended construction contract law as well as the training obligation for real estate managers and brokers. Contents: The entire real estate industry in 15 chapters, among others: companies and markets of real estate industry. Controlling and marketing. Taxes and insurance for real estate. Construction technical foundations. Real estate development, property financing and property management. Acquisition and sale, the broker as a service provider. In the new edition: All innovations to the rental law. Current BGH-principles. Changed construction contract law since 1.1.2018. The training obligation for real estate managers and brokers.
content.title_en: Special business administration of the real estate industry

content.text: Data protection in the housing industry - including work aids online. The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) replaces the previous EU data protection directive. In this respect, the Federal Data Protection Act (BDSG) has also been amended. This book represents the impact of the regulation on housing companies. It shows how the data of members or tenants should be treated in compliance with the law in the future. Attention: In case of violation, fines are threatened! Contents: Basic and principles of data protection; Overview of the changes by GDPR; Documentation obligations; Information obligations; Data protection officer; Data protection in individual business processes of housing companies; Information obligations towards persons affected; Compliance with technical and organisational measures and deletion concept.
content.title_en: Privacy in the housing industry - including help online

metadata.authors: Schweißguth, Harald; Hummel, David; Hoffmann, Jan Heiner; Schmidt, Fritz

content.text: Myth Gender: a world history of female power and powerlessness. Rich material of comparative cultural myths and ideas about the female body through the centuries, in which male dominance and feelings of powerlessness are shown and which still shape the gender relations today. A basis for today's gender debate. (2)
content.title_en: Myth Gender: a world history of female power and powerlessness

content.text: Human defense: fundamental questions of an embodied anthropology. With the advances of artificial intelligence, the digitization of the world of life and the reduction of the mind to neuronal processes, man appears more and more as a product of data and algorithms. We understand ourselves in the image of our machines, while, conversely, we raise our machines and our brains to new subjects. Against this self-requiring of man, philosopher and psychiatrist Thomas Fuchs sets a humanism of embodiment: our physicality, vitality and embodied freedom are the foundations of a self-determined existence, which the new technologies only use as a means instead of subjecting themselves to them.
content.title_en: Defense of Man : Basic Questions of an Incarnate Anthropology

content.text: Poor Economics : plea for a new understanding of poverty. The groundbreaking book of Nobel economic prize winners. A malnourished man in Morocco prefers to buy a TV than food. Absurd? No. The economists Esther Duflo and Abhijit V. Banerjee arouse worldwide attention because they show: Our image of the poor is a cliché. And we have to radically rethink if we want to solve the problems of inequality. For their research on the fight against global poverty, Esther Duflo and Abhijit V. Banerjee were awarded the Nobel Prize in 2019.(Verlagtext)
content.title_en: Poor Economics : plea for a new understanding of poverty

content.text: The climate-dirty lobby: how politicians and economic leaders sell the future of our planet. At the latest since "Fridays for Future" the topic of climate change has been recognized as one of the most pressing problems of our time. However, despite clear commitments to the goals of the Paris World Climate Agreement, we are far from achieving them - why? Their arguments are crude, their finances opaque, but their influence extends to governments. Climate change-ceptics and lobbyists of the fossil industry are active not only in the US but also in Europe. Their goal: torpedo climate protection laws, promote the burning of fossil resources and encourage states to exit the Paris World Climate Agreement. This book shows with which strategies, networks and arguments the climate protection brakes fight against European climate protection policy. The authors explain why Germany really misses its climate targets and which interest groups build our future.
content.title_en: The climate pollution lobby: how politicians and economic leaders sell the future of our planet

content.text: The digital education revolution: the radical change of learning and how we can shape it. In "Dichter, Denker, Schulverager" (ID-A 37/11), educational expert Dräger had already outlined "Ways from the educational crisis", now he is doing butter with the fish with colleagues Müller-Eiselt. Her credo: There is also "no stop button" in the education sector for digitization. Therefore, one must influence the development - in view of its shadows too -. The authors have changed themselves especially in the USA and generalize their findings for school and academic education. The advantages of digital education over traditional teaching forms: the simultaneous training of masses of learners around the world; the extreme individualization of content; online cooperation through networks: "WeQ instead of IQ". The authors also do not play down the dangers of big data, the revolutionary role of the teachers associated with digitalization has already been shown by the two media researchers who have influenced the wider world (U-R) on the basis of their digital education.
content.title_en: The digital educational revolution: the radical change in learning and how we can shape it

content.text: To the unknown: a journey into history. From the South Sea Islands to Baku, from Singapore to Cornwall, Haiti or New Zealand: this is a pearl of a history book, disguised as a travel book. Infinitely curious, with stupendous historical knowledge and at an age when he and his colleagues have nothing to prove, Davies is the most amusing travel companion on the streets into the history of our world.
content.title_en: To the Unknown: a journey into history

content.text: Genetic engineering in plants : opportunities and risks. Review (ekz): Focused presentation of the use of genetic engineering in plants. The authors explain the molecular genetic foundations and the essential methods of the production of transgenic crops; they also provide an overview of concrete projects in plant cultivation. An essential part of the book deals with the discussion of possible risks of genetic engineering. The authors, experts engaged in research and teaching, try to counter the often indisputable and emotional discussion with rational and differentiated considerations and to check fears for their factual relevance." (2001). For the 5th edition of this textbook (4th edition 2012, 3rd edition 2007) the author has revised all chapters and inserted new and improved, mostly colored illustrations. New is a chapter on genome editing, the last chapter on the future perspective has disappeared.
content.title_en: Genetic engineering in plants : opportunities and risks

content.text: Laravel : the comprehensive introduction : the framework for modern PHP development. Laravel is a powerful and flexible PHP framework and is considered one of the most popular. Nevertheless, it does not (yet) have the radiance like the well-known JavaScript libraries. This title is also the only one on the topic displayed here. The book offers an introduction at an increased level and also displays practical applications. The first chapters cover the basic components (routing and controller, templates with blade, databases and eloquent, front-end components and user inputs etc.). The following chapters then deal with rather unusual components (Artisan and Tinker, Request, Response and Middleware, Container, Data Storage, E-Mail, Collections etc.). At the end of the chapters there are tests and summaries. Prerequisite for a profitable reading are knowledge in an object-oriented programming language, especially PHP, basic knowledge of the Model View Controller (MVC) and experience in the work with template engines. Thus the relevant target group is smaller.
content.title_en: Laravel : the comprehensive introduction : the framework for modern PHP development

content.title_en: Elementary algebra and number theory

content.text: Digital Business Development: the impact of digitalisation on business models and markets. Digital Business Development - Managing the agility of the digital age -- Start-ups and companies at the time of digital disruption -- Digital Ecosystems -- Digital Business Innovation Culture – Focusing on people -- Design Thinking – A buzzword, or is there more behind it? -- Data as a driver of digital transformation -- Artificial Intelligence and the influence on business -- Digital Transformation – Transformation of companies in the digital age How are business models designed in the digital age to drive the development of companies and strengthen positioning in the market? How do companies prepare for the new business opportunities to remain successful in the long term? The book deals with these questions in the context of digital transformation. It is a good description of change management, examples of organizational models and design thinking that enable digital business development. This book links the knowledge of experts from practice and science who have accompanied many companies themselves. Business managers learn more about the targeted use of technological innovation and IT managers as a convincing way of perceiving their role as business driver systems in business business business.
content.title_en: Digital Business Development: the impact of digitalization on business models and markets

content.text: The EU is in crisis mode. After decades of success, the Union now seems to be threatened for the first time in its existence. But is the current situation really so extraordinary? Based on the latest research and archive research, Kiran Klaus Patel re-tells the history of European integration in the Cold War and thus also immerses the developments of the present. The EU's self-image could not be more radiant. It stands for peace foundation, economic growth, a policy oriented on values and an unstoppable growing Europe. And in retrospect, it seems that its predecessor organisations have created all this entirely out of themselves and almost inevitably. In his book, which is picked up with surprising insights, Kiran Klaus Patel questions this standard narrative and makes clear that this exaggerated self-image unnecessarily exacerbates today's crisis perception, because it is considered as new and threatening, which has always existed. A critical story that asks how the EU really emerged – beyond the wish-image of the political Sunday speeches.
content.title_en: Project Europe : a critical history

content.text: Deeper Learning in School: Pedagogy of the Digital Age. Deeper Learning describes an innovative pedagogy by which pupils become active designers of their learning in the context of the digitalisation of passive knowledge recipients. The book explains the learning-heoretical background of deep learning through vivid texts, graphics and examples. A model of deep learning developed for the German cultural area builds on existing school practice and consistently thinks about it with the possibilities and opportunities of the 21st century: After a first phase of knowledge acquisition on different channels, pupils work in a second phase co-constructively and co-creatively, then in the third phase to show authentic achievements that become visible not only in the classroom but also shape the world of life. Thus, the learners develop not only Agency, but also the 21st Century Skills communication, collaboration, critical thinking and creativity.
content.title_en: Deeper Learning in School : Pedagogy of the Digital Age

content.text: Digitalization: the HR management of the future. This volume forms the conclusion of the series "Kohlhammer HR Competence", which deals with current challenges of human resources. This volume deals from different perspectives with the digitization of the working world. The progressive digitalization also changes of course the personnel management. While classical administrative tasks are simplified, at the same time space for new strategic and value-added processes is created. However, in order to make this space really meaningful and objective, it is necessary to carefully plan strategically what effects digitalization has for leadership, development, personnel diagnostics and many other fields of personnel management. Only a reflective bypass with digitalization can also open up its possibilities. This volume provides suggestions for this reflection.
content.title_en: Digitalization : HR management of the future

content.text: The basics of school quality; 4: Teacher professionality and school quality. Teachers play a central role in the learning of pupils and have a lasting influence on their learning development. In this respect, the ›factor teacher‹ for quality teaching must be placed at the centre of the considerations. Volume 3 on teaching quality has already looked into the question of how teachers can design good teaching. In this volume, the focus is on the question of how teachers learn and how they can continuously develop their professionalism. In this context, the structural framework and social contexts as well as the support possibilities for professional professional training of teachers are taken into account.
content.title_en: Basics of School Quality ; 4: Teacher Professionality and School Quality

content.title_en: Semi-open composite corridors : ecological function, guiding principles and practical guidelines

metadata.authors: Boutaud, Estève; Matthies, Diethart; Nolte, Diethart

content.text: Understanding autism : External and internal views. The topic of autism has experienced a considerable economic boom in recent years. Not least, a wealth of autobiographical reports by those affected about autistic perception, thinking and acting has called into question the widespread clinical-pathologising view of autism. The book aims to understand the views of autistic persons and to compare them with scientific findings, especially from the field of neuroscience. Neuroscientific findings shed a completely new light on the abilities and intelligence of people in the autism spectrum. The characteristics developed here are then examined by autistic persons themselves - to some extent from the "inside view" -: perception particularities, unusual learning behaviour, focused thinking, difficulties in communication and social interaction etc.
content.title_en: Understanding autism : external and internal views

content.text: 26 April 1986: Chernobyl: Consequences of a catastrophe. The Chernobyl reactor accident of 26 April 1986 had an impact on the whole world. It strengthened discussions about the possibilities and risks of high technologies, among others. This is the main thread of this book. The author begins with the description of the technology used in Chernobyl, the causes and the course of the disaster in the vicinity. The following chapter on the international effects of the disaster, but above all on the reactions in the FRG and the GDR. Another chapter is dedicated to the devastating disaster of the Schweizerhalle near Basel, also in 1986. In this case toxic substances from the company Sandoz fell into the Rhine and caused a great fish death. The author comes back again and again to accidents with high technologies, such as Fukushima, Harrisburg, Bhopal or Schweizerhalle, and corrects misassessments and false facts. His book can only be a "moment recording" (the last word of the text) - because the discussions about the events of Chernobyl, especially their long-term consequences, will accompany several generations and accompany them for a long time.
content.title_en: 26 April 1986: Chernobyl: consequences of a disaster

content.text: The basic work for report makers and report recipients. It is not well-ordered for business communication. Managers are tormented by overloaded reports and bored in incomprehensible presentations. Some of them feel really bothered. The authors of reports and presentations, for their part, complain that their superiors do not bother to study their elaborations in detail. Be quiet about using themselves in the dashboards they design. Something seems to go wrong with business communication in general, if stations are not understood and recipients do not feel well-served. Business communication is too inefficient – both what is reported in writing and what is presented live. It is simply too tedious to refer to its information from reports, presentations and dashboards. Lack of standards in visual communication are an important reason for this inefficiency. Lack of notation standards result in every chart and table being different. The reader can't see how it works out in the future, and how the patterns are re-readed.
content.title_en: Filled, framed, shaved: how visual uniformity improves communication with reports, presentations and dashboards

content.text: Behind the border, before the law: an ethnography of the European migration regime. Behind the border, before the law is a sociological contribution to the debate about migration management and belonging. The study describes the handling and control of "unwanted" immigration, but also how the right of residence is applied, ignored, reinterpreted and idealized, and how law and law application allow and limit the scope for action of migrants alike. Responsibility is often difficult to locate in the dense regime of control bodies. The authors illuminate the perspectives of state actors, NGOs, people with precarious legal status and various institutions in eight European nations and come to the important conclusion that all involved actors are repeatedly trapped in cafkaesque time loops and formality and informality are not counter-poles in Western Europe, even in Western Europe.
content.title_en: Behind the border, before the law: an ethnography of the European migration regime

content.text: Generation Z in the four-country comparison: an empirical comparison of Germany, the Netherlands, Austria and Switzerland. Generation Z – born in the early 1990s – is currently entering the world of work, and is influenced by it, but also shapes it itself. This publication deals with the phenomenon of Generation Z – which is a survey of 3,610 young people of Generation Z in Germany, the Netherlands, Austria and Switzerland. This publication is based on the master's theses by Sabrina Eilers, Martin Elizen, Kathrin Meier and Claudia Karaca, written at the Chair of Business Administration, in particular Organization, Human Resources and Information Management at Saarland University in Saarbrücken. Among other questions, what does Generation Z expect from working life? - Why does it decide for or against an employer? - In which office does it want to work? - Does it really dream of the large-scale office and the desk sharing? - What are the dreams of life? - What does Generation Z expect from working life? - What should she decide for or against an employer? - What does she want to work? - What does she have fear? - What is the whole generation policy?
content.title_en: Generation Z in four-country comparison : an empirical comparison of Germany, the Netherlands, Austria and Switzerland

content.text: The essential introduces the essential concepts of modern algebraic geometry. This set can be provided with a topological structure; this is the concept of the spectrum, which is thus algebraic translated into topological data. Using the term of the sheaf one can recover the algebraic structure from this topological one. This rich interplay is captured in the concept of the scheme. Thus one can examine the basic objects of algebraic geometry, zero-pointed structures of polynomials, algebraic and vice versa geometrical methods on arithmetic questions. The content algebraic basics: Rings, bodies, ideals, primideal, local rings Spectra of rings and schemas The topology of specs R, Garben and schemas The target groups Students of mathematics Teachers of natural sciences The author Dr. Jürgen Jost studied mathematics as a professor of mathematics and mathematics at the University of Bochum.
content.title_en: Spectra, sheaf, schemes : A brief introduction

content.text: Introduction to the real process calculation of combustion engines: Modeling and calculation program. Introduction -- The zero-dimensional one-zone model for the real process calculation -- For characterizing combustion engines -- Comparison between calculation and measurement The real process calculation is an important simulation tool for detecting and evaluating improvements in combustion engines. Extensive measurements can be partially dispensed with. Calculation results can also be used for dimensioning components. The real process calculation here is based on the so-called zero-dimensional model. Material data and other piston-way-dependent sizes are approximated with simple polynomial equations. The combustion process and heat transfer are taken into account. Thus, for four-stroke motors, the thermal efficiency and pressure flow can be calculated in the working room. The calculation model is programmed in Excelâ VBA. The calculation program and the source code are open on the Internet. The content Introduction.- The zero-dimensional one-zone model for the real process calculation.- Characterization of combustion engines.- Comparison of combustion engines. The target groups The book and the calculation program are addressed to students of the technical disciplines, the engineering department of the Karlsruhe/Circombining company.
content.title_en: Introduction to the real process calculation of combustion engines : modeling and calculation programme

content.text: Modernisation of the tax procedure. Here you will find out everything that is to be implemented gradually in the period from 2017 to 2022 by modernising the tax procedure. The author explains the new procedures and the changes that arise, among other things, from ELSTER, when expanding the pre-filled tax return, electronic applications and when announcing tax rulings. The book shows clearly and in detail what companies and tax consultants must pay attention to when it comes to e-taxation.
content.title_en: Modernisation of the taxation procedure

content.text: Eagle, fish and forbidden fruits : Christian symbols discovered in everyday life. Whether the origin of unicorns can be found in the Bible? A unicorn in pink is opposite this question in this book, coupled with the explanation that such unicorn beings in Hebrew and Greek sources were anything but cute. It is the exciting roots and contradictions, contrasts, irritations and links between word and image, yesterday and today, which surprise here: with 52 short texts and images can thus be discovered week after week, but also completely independent of the course of the church year old symbols as familiar signs of our everyday life. Such symbols are symbols for something - and very much of them are present in profane language and sign use, without the cultural origins of it should be known to many. The clear structure comes without registers. - In this respect, this fresh and modernly made collection contains original photos and informative texts on the biblical backgrounds of amazing for many people, even in the case of cultural history, linguistic and folk-scundish interest.
content.title_en: Eagle, fish and forbidden fruits : Christian symbols discovered in everyday life

content.text: The lecture of the mathematics is especially interesting for the mathematics of the mathematics of the group: a computer-oriented geometric introduction. Introduction to the euclidean geometry -- Introduction to the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the mathematics of the group.

content.text: Therapeutic fields of work are increasingly shaped by cost-benefit relations. Psychotherapy should not only be effective, but also efficient! But how do effectiveness and efficiency in psychotherapy look and how do they influence the therapeutic relationship?The authors critically consider the effects that the desire for effectiveness and efficiency produces. As scientists and practitioners of psychotherapy and adjacent areas, they critically address their respective work requirements and develop partly provocative theses.With contributions by Wolfgang Baßler, Oliver Bilke-Hentsch, Oliver Evers, Konrad Heiland, Wiebke Hoffmann, Jürgen Junglas, Sabine C. Koch, Michael Küster, Uwe Labatzki, Mogens Nielsen, Ralf Pukrop, Eckhard Roediger, Michael Schonnebeck, Christian Schubert, Carsten Spitzer, Svenja Taubner, Sabine Trautmann-Voigt and Bernd Voigt
content.title_en: Efficiency and effectiveness in psychotherapy

content.text: Fridays lectures for future. Klappentext: The "Fridays for Future" movement has given new impetus to the environmental and sustainability discussions. Students demonstrate for more environmental protection. The focus is on CO2 reduction as a countermeasure to climate change that is recognizable worldwide and its consequences. To support the discussions on increased environmental and climate protection as well as more sustainability, this volume "Fridays Lectures for Future" presents fifteen lessons on the topic of environment and sustainability. It is a selection of topics that cannot, of course, reflect the whole, very extensive problem field. It remains the hope that the selected topics are an incentive for the interested reader to study intensively in order to explore further topics.
content.title_en: Fridays lectures for future

content.title_en: Geomorphology

content.text: Temporary disorder : 782 pictures from the Parliament building in empty space. What possibilities do photographers have to approach a historically charged magnificent building without risking being instrumentalized? Can photographs and artistic works in an empty building tell more than the fact that the building temporarily no longer serves its actual purpose? In a cooperation project of the University of Applied Arts Vienna with the Parliament Directorate of the Austrian Parliament, students of the Department of Applied Photography and Time-Based Media had the opportunity to examine the historical building at the Ring shortly after the Parliament was drawn and to find answers to these questions.
content.title_en: Temporary disorder : 782 figures from the Parliament building in vacancy

content.text: From augmented reality to AI: the most important IT topics you need to know for your company. Know, assess and use central IT topics for your own company! Big Data Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, Augmented Reality & Co.: In the IT environment, there are more and more developments that are considered critical for success for companies and that every manager should know about. Who sleeps a development here could soon disappear from the market. The central questions are: - What are the decisive trends? - What opportunities and challenges arise? - How can the trends be successfully used? - What can be considered during the implementation? This book provides answers! All relevant aspects about the central IT topics are pointed out and also presented to the laypersons intelligibly. Decision makers receive a guide with the work, which allows them to assess the importance and potential use of current IT trends for their own company and to initiate measures for the implementation of the IT trends relevant for their company.
content.title_en: From Augmented Reality to AI: the most important IT topics you need to know for your business

content.text: The Business Model Book : how to design and successfully implement innovative business ideas. The international success title now in German first edition! THE BUSINESS MODEL BOOK shows you in a simple and understandable way how to create, adapt and renew successful business models in any situation and for any company
content.title_en: The Business Model Book : how to design and successfully implement innovative business ideas

content.text: Java learns with BlueJ : Objects first - An introduction to Java. Java learns one of the most successful books on the market on this topic for years successfully introduces tens of thousands of programmers using BlueJ into object-oriented programming with Java. The development environment was developed specifically by the authors of this book for teaching and enables easy and fast programming success with Java. The reader should deal with objects first from the beginning and interact with the methods. Particular emphasis was placed on the improved visualization and interaction techniques, with the help of which e.g. class structures - especially in book- can be easily understood and clearly illustrated in color.This sixth edition is based on Java 8 and goes far beyond the mere addition of functional concepts to the new language constructs with the return of functional concepts. They enable parallelism to be efficiently automated and use several cores without much effort on the part of the programmer.
content.title_en: Learn Java with BlueJ : Objects first - An Introduction to Java

content.text: Introduction to automata theory, formal languages and predictability: John E. Hopcroft, Rajeev Motwani, Jeffrey D. Ullman. In this new edition of the standard work Introduction to automata theory, formal languages and predictability, the author's team John Hopcroft, Rajeev Motwani and Jeffrey D. Ullman conveys the foundation of theoretical computer science. Clearly structured and well structured, the textbook presents the basic knowledge of the topics of formal languages, automata and complexity theory as well as predictability including indecision - with special consideration also of practical applications. Many illustrative examples, illustrations and additional explanations facilitate the understanding of this difficult teaching material for students. Extensive exercise tasks at the end of the individual sections enable the immediate review of the material learned. The many content improvements and additional hints with adaptation to the local teaching form an ideal prerequisite for students to acquire this topic also within the scope of self-study.
content.title_en: Introduction to Automata Theory, Formal Languages and Predictability : John E. Hopcroft, Rajeev Motwani, Jeffrey D. Ullman

content.text: Methods of Behavior Biology. A bird sings in the morning because... - it becomes bright. - its hormone status changes. - it thus keeps rivals away from its territory. - partners are lured by the singing. Due to the variety of levels at which animal behavior is scientifically investigated, behavior biology becomes a very lively and modern discipline. In this textbook the authors explain the basic scientific methods of qualitative and quantitative recording of behavior. Here, descriptive and experimental experimental approaches are taken into account. The wide spectrum of modern behavioral biology is illustrated by examples from the current research. This second edition has been updated and didactically re-examined. An extended author team takes into account the numerous findings of recent years and highlights important topics in boxes briefly and pre-pregnantly. The authors Marc Naguib is head of Behavior Ecology at the University of Wageningen in the Netherlands. His research focuses on acoustic communication especially in songbirds, social behavior and influences of the conditions during early development on behavior. E. Tobias Krause is a scientist at the Institute for Animal Welfare and Animal Conservation of the Friedrich Loeffler Behifungs- Institute of Behinders- Behaviours- Behaviours.
content.title_en: Methods of Behavioural Biology

content.text: Game Design and Production: Basics, Applications and Examples. Prof. Gunther Rehfeld teaches at the Department of Media Technology at HAW Hamburg and conducts research on online computer games, dramaturgy and activating game formats. This basic textbook for prospective computer game designers first explains the general contexts of human play. The author also considers the transitions to the new networked media and communities in the so-called virtual spaces. In the course of the book, the state of the art regarding the production of computer games is described, whereby the game development (game design) is discussed as well as the programming, functioning and job profiles of the game industry. Here, the focus is on general principles, as computer technology is subject to a very rapid change. The book refers in boxes and comments to relevant literature, games and other media and is intended to stimulate the deepening of the area. In addition, the book provides an overview of the forms of online and offline games and clarifies core concepts of the setup of computer games.
content.title_en: Game Design and Production : Basics, Applications and Examples

content.text: Hegemony and Cultural Struggle: Linking Neoliberalism and Islam in Turkey. Frontmatter -- Content -- Preliminary remark and thanks -- List of Abbreviations -- 1. Introduction -- 2. Procedure and History of the Study -- 3. Four Theses -- 4. Procedure -- 5. The Historical Arch -- 6. Religious Places of Effect -- 7. Conclusion: Hegemony, Cultural Struggle and Sunni Privileges -- What Is Islamism? -- Literature and Sources Index Turkey is undergoing profound social change. While public attention is focused on political authoritarianism and repression, Errol Babacan looks at the cultural-terrorist dynamics. Based on a field study, he determines the governing party AKP as the carrier of a hegemony project that is linked with a growing layer of religious actors that successively expand their position.
content.title_en: Hegemony and Cultural Struggle : Linking Neoliberalism and Islam in Turkey

content.text: Python 3: the comprehensive manual. Everything about Python 3 in one volume! Introduction, practice, reference language basics, object orientation, modularizationMigration, debugging, interoperability with C, GUIs, network communication and much more.Discover the possibilities of Python 3. Whether you want to start working with Python first or look at your work - in this book you will find everything you need to know about Python. Starting with an introduction to language, it offers a language reference, the description of the standard library and detailed information on professional topics such as GUI development, web development, connection to coder scientific arithmetic. Here you will find detailed information on the main differences between Python 3 and previous versions. If you are still working with Python 2.x, the authors will help you in migrating your existing projects. From the content: Introduction to PythonSprach GrundlagenModularizationOrientationMathematic ModulesRegular ExpressionsDate and Time Functions to the Operating SystemThread ProgrammingNetwork CommunicationApplication of PythnologyProgrammtustration of PythnulationRegulationRegulationRegulationRegulationRegulation of this 
content.title_en: Python 3 : the comprehensive manual
