content.title_en: Basic knowledge Grammar : fit for study

content.text: Authenticity: the career of a longing. Authenticity is the catchphrase of the hour, the longing of the present. Politicians should appear authentically. Novels tell unfiltered about true life. And in the existence of the individual, authenticity promises genuine happiness. But what is the price? Do we really want to experience our bosses unrequited - or rather professional? If we are always looking for our 'true self', where does the desire for change and the ambivalence of life remain? And to whom do we want to give the interpretation authority about what 'authentic' German is? Erik Schilling follows the rise of the cult of authenticity in society and culture and shows that his dominance leads not only to boring art, lay-like politicians and unhappy people, but also to intolerance and division. By also discharging the ground of the longing for authenticity philosophically, he pleads for a free relationship with the contradictions with which the world and we all are afflicted.
content.title_en: Authenticity : Career of a longing

content.text: The strangest places of religions: hidden churches, magical trees and forbidden shrines. No one has the intention of creating a strange place. It simply happens. The oldest stone garden of Japan is overgrown by moss, trees suddenly prove to be healing, churches must be hidden from persecutors. The book leads its readers to 39 Christian and non-Christian places, which are like another star. «Shan-ti ... ooooooooooooooo!» Where the holy rivers Ganges and Yamuna collide with the invisible river Sarasvati, is the navel of the world. Whoever bathes at the right time in this «honey of immortality» can be redeemed. But beware: 100 million pilgrims want to do the same at the same time. In the Congo after lonely journey over Scotstripists reach the heavenly Jerusalem: a huge temple with 37,000 seats. Likewise remote is the sanctuary of the Difunta Correa, the truck driver of wedges, rims and whole trucks present a strange thing beside us. Johann Hinrich invites us to the Distillation of the Distillation or the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Distillation of the Di
content.title_en: The strangest places of religion : of hidden churches, magical trees and forbidden shrines

content.text: Politics in digital society: key areas of problems and research perspectives. The importance of digitalization for politics and society is a highly topical topic, which is increasingly being researched and taught in political science. The contributions of the volume gather programmatic positions that represent and discuss key aspects and perspectives of social science digitization research. These include research fields from the fields of participation and party research, governance of digitalization, methodological reflections on computational social science and the analysis of democracy and the public under the conditions of digitalization.
content.title_en: Politics in the digital society: key areas of problem and research perspectives

content.text: The research of the German School's educational quality: Final report of the DFG's major research programme. Helpful for readers is that the individual chapters have a common system of education. The rapporteurs start with the presentation of the current research status, formulate the research questions, present hypotheses, describe the research methods and instruments, present the research design, summarize the qualitative and quantitative results, interpret them against the background of the hypotheses and give an outlook on open research questions. – Gottfried Kleinschmidt in: Education Science and Occupation, 3. 2007. The final report on BIQUA has special relevance for school education and teaching quality and should therefore be in the teacher library of each school. – Gottfried Kleinschmidt in: ABB-Information, 59. 2007. The work can only be recommended to all teachers who value a school-repedagogically reflected teaching and do not ignore the results of empirical research. – Marcel Remmel in:lehrbibliothek.de Seven years ago the German Research Community (DFG) had established the focus program on school quality and the teaching quality of school. The program "Biqua" presents the information on the school's scientific topics and the research.
content.title_en: Studies on school education quality : Final report of the DFG Priority Programme

content.text: The German Education Action Council analyses the empirical data in the current report and examines the extent to which the German residence influences the provision of educational opportunities, participation in education and the achievements of the learners. Regional specificities for each educational phase are presented and evaluated over the entire life span. The Action Council on Education identifies educational phase-specific recommendations for action and addresses them to policy makers. The report also discusses the question of the role of the local education system in the context of the education system.
content.title_en: Region and education. Myth City - Country

content.text: Many actions of daily life (e.g. online shopping) are carried out via the Internet. The data used (e.g. bank data) are often of interest to criminals and therefore must be protected against spying. This topic is addressed by J. Steinberg: "Cyber security for dummies" (ID-A 25/20) or K. Mitnick: "The art of anonymity in the Internet" (ID-B 4/18). The book is addressed to readers without any prior knowledge, who often cannot assess whether, for example, when switching to a new version of the operating system or when switching to another operating system, the additional advantages offered are convenient, but perhaps with a loss of security. The same applies to data storage, e.g. in the cloud. The author gives extensive information on data protection and shows how a largely anonymous data traffic on the Internet is possible. Password protection and the use of voice assistants are also addressed in detail. Didactically well-structured. Many images are highlighted.
content.title_en: Unmarked on the Internet

content.text: OpenLDAP in practice: the manual for administrators. This book provides a detailed description of how to extend and perform your LDAP server's functionality by overlays, including a multi-master replication and the integration of Kerberos. All steps on the way to a redundant OpenLDAP IBM structure including the use of Kerberos IBM are described in detail. The main focus is on managing the command line. As you prepare for the upcoming OpenLDAP version 2.5, you can see a chapter on dynamic POSIX groups, which can be set up with OpenLDAP version 2.4 now, so you can use them in their full functionality in version 2.5. In a separate chapter we will look at the subject of monitoring, because a service like LDAP should never remain without monitoring.
content.title_en: OpenLDAP in practice : the manual for administrators

content.text: Windows Server for Dummies. Windows Server is a Microsoft server operating system based on Windows 10; the importance for modern computerization lies in the assurance of Microsoft that the delivery with security updates is guaranteed until January 2029. Literature on Windows Servers has been discussed here only rarely, to mention among others Carlo Westbrook: "Windows Server 2019", Thomas Joos: "Microsoft Windows Server 2019", Jörg Schieb: "Windows Server 2019" and Peter Kloep: "Windows Server 2019". Existing titles show how to work well with Windows Server and sets priorities at GUI (graphic user interfaces), console and PowerShell. In addition, readers learn how to set up an Active Directory, what to do with group guidelines, how to create a domain, how to virtualize with Hyper-V, and how to secure data and monitor processes. - The book here does not require any special prior knowledge and is therefore suitable for beginners*
content.title_en: Windows Server for Dummies

content.text: Light and Shadow : Cinema Diary 1929-1945. Victor Klemperer's diary notes about his visits to the cinema at the beginning of the Tonfilm era. From the beginning, the Cineast is witnessing how the technical innovation in 1929 is entering Germany. He often goes to the cinema several times a week. First critical, he is soon caught up in the new possibilities. But the National Socialists are continuing to collect the medium, Klemperer finally banished completely from the cinema houses by the cinema ban for "non-Aryans" 1938. But even that can't keep him away. The passionate confession of a cinemaman who shows us the sound film as a mirror of German history with all the light and shadow sides.
content.title_en: Light and Shadow : Cinema Diary 1929-1945

content.text: Pest and Corona : Pandemics in history, present and future. Learning from past pandemics to be better positioned for future with new ideas, so that trade, change, contacts and communication as life elixirs of the (global) communities remain in these times of crisis, the authors demand (historians, doctors). (2 S)
content.title_en: Pest and Corona : Pandemics in history, present and future

content.text: The psychology of the pig dog : In 6 steps from good intent to new habit. Daniela Bernhardt works as a lecturer in the teaching of study competences and has compiled this book from the findings of her "pig dog seminars". After a short introductory chapter in which the inner pig dog is defined and demarcated by procrastination, a very detailed theoretical part follows, in which various psychological aspects of the pig dog are explained vividly and with many examples. The final part offers a practical step-by-step guide, favorable habits and thinking methods to establish. The chapters can be worked through chronologically, but can also be used to look at individual aspects. Summaries, reflection questions and further sources (both as literature data and QR codes that lead directly to online sources) complement the chapters. The book is explicitly aimed at students, but the presented methods can also be transferred to any other professional or private situation, therefore recommended for acquisition. (2) Katrin Wieckhorst
content.title_en: The psychology of the pig dog : In 6 steps from good purpose to new habit

content.text: The world after Corona: the risks of capitalism, the side effects of the state of emergency and the society to come. Also in the year two of the Corona pandemic, the virus, which has now cost more than 1.5 million people their lives, determines the political, economic and social reality in many parts of the world. The crisis of the world economy triggered by the lockdowns is no less serious. The situation is very different: in some countries of Asia and Africa the virus has been successfully stopped, often at a high price. Europe and the USA try to control the second wave of infections with massive emergency measures, while in some countries of Latin America COVID-19 is raging almost unlimited. At the same time, the hope is growing that vaccines could herald the beginning of the end of the pandemic - even if doubts are appropriate here, not only in terms of global accessibility.
content.title_en: The world after Corona: from the risks of capitalism, the side effects of the state of emergency and the society to come

content.text: GANs with PyTork themselves are not discussed: a comprehensible introduction to generic adversarial networks. Literature on the new algorithm GAN (Generative Adversarial Network) developed in 2014 for the field of deep learning has hardly been discussed. Only D. Rao mentions this topic on the sidelines, but the focus is on program creation with PyTork. This book is aimed at readers who want to familiarize themselves with the basics of the new algorithm by simple examples. It is clear that GANs are based on two neural networks (generator, discriminator) that compete against each other, mostly with the aim of generating realistically-looking photos, videos or texts. These products are generated by the generator and checked by the discriminator and rejected in poor quality. The author starts with an introduction to the PyTork and then puts a focus on the creation of human faces. The book is well-structured, closes almost every chapter with a formulation of learning objectives. The contents of the book was tested with a group of developers. All tools are available for free.
content.title_en: Programming GANs with PyTork: an understandable introduction to Generative Adversarial Networks

content.text: The last mile: definition, process, cost calculation and design fields. This essential discusses the basics of the last mile in logistics, its problems and business design fields. The last mile is the process of handing over consumer goods to the end customer. This term is defined by many practical examples of distribution logistics and a typology of last mile situations is carried out. It is shown that the last mile is expensive. However, the severity of this problem depends on concrete tour images, the applied distribution process and the delivery parameters of the tours. This results in design fields that decision-makers should work on on the last mile. The content The last mile from the point of view of distribution logistics The last mile decisions on the last mile Design fields for the last mile The target groups Practitioners from the logistics Business Administration The author Dr. Christian Brabande holds a PhD in the Chair of Controlling and Logistics at the University of Regensburg. His teaching and research focuses are transport logistics, distribution systems and inventory management.
content.title_en: The Last Mile : Definition, Process, Cost Accounting and Design Fields

content.text: Citizens to power: how our democracy works better. The political system in Germany is increasingly suffering from a lack of reform and the resulting problems. This leads to a growing political discontent among citizens. Above all, the omnipotence of the parties causes growing displeasure. Jörn Kruse analyses the problems of our political system and derives from them catchy, profound reform proposals. In his Democratic Reform concept, he advocates the strengthening of the division of powers and a clear limitation of party power. Citizens directly elect the parliament, the government and a newly established citizen's Senate. The Bürgersenat takes over the role of the Second Chamber in the legislation and appoints the heads of non-political state institutions. Kruse succeeds not only to uncover central systemic problems but also to point out a well-founded solution. (publisherswerb)
content.title_en: Citizens to power: how our democracy works better

content.text: Injection Molding Tools compact: a practical book for beginners. Dipl.-Ing. Harry Pruner is Managing Director of Pruner Marketing Services GmbH. Wolfgang Nesch has been working as a toolmaker master for over 30 years in the field of injection molding tools at Ferromatik Milacron. The specialist book "Spritz Molding Tools compact" provides a comprehensive and practical knowledge of injection molding tool technology including numerous special procedures. It is aimed in particular at beginners, professional beginners, merchants and young technicians in training. The texts are clearly structured and easily understandable. The specialized book is designed in such a way that it provides complete basic knowledge of injection molding tools in chronological design and provides daily help as a guide. Especially helpful for the beginner who wants to acquire the knowledge of injection molding tools are the numerous colored illustrations that make a quick understanding of the contents easy. The description focuses on the thermoplastic tools. Disparate processes for thermoplast and elastomer tools are explained at the end of the respective chapter. The book is recorded the current state of the art and the authors's work has been updated continuously.
content.title_en: Injection Molding Tools Compact : a practical book for beginners

content.text: Mobile apps with SAP Cloud Platform Mobile Services. For consultants, software architects and developers, it has always been important to know and train on current technologies and trends. The challenge of creating and operating mobile software solutions includes various aspects: from data integration, to potential network topologies, security and authentication issues, to an appealing user experience (UX) and the actual programming of the app. This guide provides you with a detailed insight into mobile application development in the SAP context. SAP presents a wide range of services for the agile development of smartphone apps around the SAP Cloud Platform Mobile Services. You will get an overview of the possibilities of this platform for hybrid and native apps and their integration into the traditional IT system landscapes. The author pays special attention to the configuration of the SAP Cloud Connector as well as the SAP Mobile Cards app and the native SDKs for iOS and Android. The SAP Mobile Development Kit for the cross-system creation of apps completes the plant. Setting up the SAP Cloud Platform Mobile Services Micro-Apps with SAP Mobile Cards Apps for iOS/SDDroid and the SAP Cloud-Data
content.title_en: Mobile Apps with SAP Cloud Platform Mobile Services

content.text: Patient safety: the guide to prevention and improvement. To ensure patient safety is not just a catchword, but a reality that is lived! Patient safety must be the top principle of any medical institution! However, treatment procedures are becoming increasingly complex, overcrowded ambulances are leading to hectic and stress or knowledge is not being used. These and many other reasons can endanger patient safety. In this plant, the top health care risks are presented and concrete indications are given about their best possible prevention. Among other questions, the following questions are answered: Which instruments and measures can be used to promote patient safety? How can patient safety be sustainably changed? How can patient safety be measured? What must an organisation do to promote patient safety accordingly? What can employees in the healthcare system contribute to supporting patient safety? What must be done to ensure that students are already confronted with this issue? What can patients and their relatives contribute to increasing their safety?
content.title_en: Ensure patient safety : the guide to prevention and improvement

content.text: Optics and Photonics. Completely revised new edition of the authoritative basic textbook on optics and photonics - comprehensively revised and expanded with a new chapter on metamaterial optics. Optics is one of the oldest and most fascinating sub-areas of physics and firmly anchored in the curricula of physics studies. It deals with the spread of light and phenomena such as interference, refraction, diffraction and optical images. Photonics includes optical phenomena, which are primarily based on the interaction of (quantized) light and matter, and deals with the understanding and development of optical components and systems such as lasers, LEDs and photonic crystals. In a proven manner, the completely revised and extended new edition of the "Saleh/Teich" gives an introduction to the basics of optics and photonics for students of physics and related sciences. Detailed explanations, about 1000 illustrations and the mathematics necessary for quantitative penetration enable a deep understanding of all sub-areas of classical and modern optics. * Comprehensive and understandable: all basics of optics and photonics are united in one work. * Written by outstanding didactics with extensive research of the visual phenomena are extended with a broad scientific approach.
content.title_en: Optics and photonics

content.text: C++ programming : Learn C++ - apply professionally - use solutions. The 6th edition of the comprehensive manual for the object-oriented programming language C++, which was thoroughly revised to version C++ 20, is mainly image- and text-identical compared to the pre-press ("The CC++ programmer"), and the content structure has been retained - some small sub-chapters have been added. This textbook is suitable for beginners and advanced students (pre-knowledge of advantage) and can be used as reference work. The contents are clearly arranged with solutions using 150 practical programming solutions and 101 exercise tasks. For expanded stocks next to T.T. Will: "C++" and complementary to A. Willemer: "C++ for Dummies" and T. Theis: "Entrance into C++". The pre-press may remain conditionally in the inventory. Recommended for inventory renewal or supplementation as well as for initial purchase. (2-3)
content.title_en: C++ programming : C++ learning - professional application - using solutions

content.text: Pandemic! : COVID-19 is a shock to the world. Our planet has been captured by an unprecedented global pandemic. Who could better understand its deeper meaning, better point out its dizzying paradoxes and speculate more strongly about the consequences and scope of their consequences than the influential Slovenian philosopher Slavoj Žižek IBM and the breathtaking, sweat-driving way? With his lively writing style and tendency to popular cultural analogies (Quentin Tarantino and H.G. Wells meet here at Hegel and Marx), Žižek delivers an as sharp as provocative snapshot of this crisis, which is spreading more and more and captures us all. (Editor)
content.title_en: Pandemic! : COVID-19 shakes the world

This essential research examines psychological, economic and practical aspects for the management of employees and working in the home office. Here, the perspective of the management (How do I lead my employees in the home office?) and of the company (What framework conditions must be considered?).The content Future trends: Leadership on distance; Future of work; Generation Y and Z Advantages and disadvantages of home office workstations Motivation, justice and performance measurement Leadership, preparation, qualification and support in the home office The target groups Practitioners in HR departments, management and executives The author Prof. Dr. Miriam Landes is Professor of Business Psychology at the University of Applied Management and Managing Director of the Institute for Corporate Control & Change Management (UVM) in Munich. Prof. Eberhard Steiner is Professor of Accounting and Controlling at the University of Munich and the University of Applied Management. content.text: The basic knowledge of mineralogy is presented in a concise and understandable way. As students of mineralogy, geosciences, materials/material sciences and neighbouring disciplines, the essential physico-chemical foundations are presented in this textbook. As graduates, this short compilation serves you excellently to look up the most important facts. Four major areas are covered: crystallography, from the basics of symmetry to the Bravais grids to the real building of crystals. Crystal chemistry, with the basic principles, chemical variations and selected concepts. Mineral physics, with an overview of the physical properties of crystals. Phase theory with geometrical observation and interpretation of non-aryan, binary and ternary systems of a general nature.
content.title_en: Physical-chemical mineralogy compact

content.text: Bioeconomy in self-study: value chains and innovation potential. This volume discusses the economic sectors involved in the value chains of the bioeconomy from raw material to the end product. The focus is on the biomass producing industries and the diverse manufacturing industry including waste management. This is followed by an analysis of how far the bioeconomy is already established in the various sectors and in which sectors it has future potential. By 2050, the change in raw materials from fossil to sustainable raw materials is to be largely completed in accordance with the Paris climate agreement. Companies still based on fossil raw materials will therefore increasingly have to adapt to the coming bioeconomy. Participants will learn to recognise the challenges herein, but also the great potential for innovation and the improvement of competitiveness, which lies in the link between the value chains involved. 1 Introduction and terms -- 2 sectors of the bioeconomy -- 3 value chains -- 4 Competitiveness and innovation potential.
content.title_en: Bioeconomy in self-study: value chains and innovation potential

content.title_en: Effect in coaching

content.text: State and Constitution in the digital constellation: selected writings on the change of politics, state and constitution through the Internet. Digitization is changing society, but also the state and constitution. In eight chapters, Ingolf Pernice captures the essential aspects that shape this change. The essays from 2013 to 2020 are devoted to the structural change of the public and politics, the change in the relationship between the state and citizens through the opening of statehood and the new role of state and constitution in global society. The background is the emergence of a »constitution of the Internet« as a result of the development of the »people's law of the network«. Digital instruments could help to facilitate democratic normization on the global level. The final attempt to reconstruct the state in the »digital constellation« leads to reflections on how self-determination can also be organized as global citizenships.
content.title_en: State and Constitution in the Digital Constellation: Selected writings on the change of politics, state and constitution through the Internet

content.text: Religion in public space : Division or cohesion of society?. With the 13th volume of the Leipzig lectures on law and politics, the inaugural lecture of Prof. Dr. Thomas de Maizière at the University of Leipzig is published. This contribution by the member of the Bundestag and former Federal Minister is dedicated to the state church law. After an introductory presentation of the fundamentals of the topic, current examples on religion in public space are also examined. The topics are not only dealt with legally: Due to his long-standing work in legislative and executive fields, Prof. Dr. Thomas de Maizière also knows the political problems that follow from the interaction between state and religion.
content.title_en: Religion in public space : Division or cohesion of society?

content.text: Schindler's list. With courage, cunning and intrepidity, the South German factory owner Schindler saves the lives of 1300 Jews who were subordinated to him as workers during the war in Krakow and Moravia.
content.title_en: Schindler's list

content.text: Lake Constance : Natural wealth at the edge of the Alps ; nature guide through one of the most diverse landscapes in Central Europe. This volume from the publishing house specialized in nature travel guide is a contribution to the Lake Constance environmental protection project (träger: Deutsche Umwelthilfe), funded by the German Federal Environmental Foundation. It is intended to serve to get to know the natural and cultural landscape of Lake Constance in its diversity, taking special account of the nature protection zones and the animal and plant world and to sharpen awareness of the need for its preservation. Well structured and richly illustrated, it offers an easily accessible overview; practical hints (hiking and nature experience tips, museums etc.), a detailed further bibliography and 2 registers also increase the information value of the volume, to which there is no competition in this handy form and with this current topic. (2) (Hans Ulrich Katzenmayer)
content.title_en: Lake Constance : Natural richness at the edge of the Alps ; nature guide through one of the most diverse landscapes in Central Europe

content.text: Patents in practice: Introduction for engineers and scientists in the first handling of technical patent rights. Patents and utility models are indispensable tools in the daily work of engineers and scientists. They play an important role in protecting technical innovations and publish technical knowledge. This book provides an insight into the exciting world of technical patent rights. After a short introduction, it explains the structure of patent specifications to the reader. This enables him to read them purposefully and to evaluate them in a short time. Further topics are aimed at persons who wish to acquire further knowledge in the patent system, e.g. in a specialist department or a company without a patent department to take over further tasks. The content - Introduction to patenting and important terms - Overview of the development of technical patent rights - Further topics about the industrial patent system The target groups - technicians, engineers and scientists with contact to patents and utility models - (aspiring) patent officers in specialist departments or SMEs - Technology and innovation managers, employees in marketing, manufacturing or general management - Students technical-natur science courses The author Stefan Basler has worked in research and development of industrial companies. In the course of the patent rights, he evaluated over twenty years of the construction and over twenty.
content.title_en: Patents in practice : Introduction for engineers and scientists in the first handling of technical property rights

content.text: Methods of microbiology: a practical manual. Isolation and cultivation of bacteria -- Identification and differentiation of bacteria -- Mushrooms -- Molecular biological methods -- Light microscopic methods. This textbook provides answers to questions such as "How does this microbiological method work in a practical way? How can I extend my research with a useful method?       , Comparable to a cookbook are ingredients and individual handles clearly listed and provided with practical tips and hazard warnings. Whether on fluorescence microscopy, genomics or isolation and cultivation of bacteria, archaeae and fungi - experienced microbiologists find here just as fast hints as cross-inductors who want to expand their work area microbiologically. The expert practitioners Astrid Brandis-Heep, Erika Kothe and Timo Zimmermann have clearly compiled practical methods and advice for the laboratory everyday life, which - microbiological basic knowledge presupposes - master students, doctoral students, postdocs and advanced working groups both in everyday life and for a new orientation of your research.
content.title_en: Methods of microbiology : a practical manual

content.text: Quantum Physics and Sociology in Dialogue: Considerations on time, observation and interlinking. Whether in quantum physics, cognitive science or sociology – the problem of the observer and the inclusion of non-knowledge and indeterminateness have been created in various scientific fields not least for empirical reasons. The theoretical concepts associated with this bring nolens volens aporien or paradoxes with them. Not least for this reason, the comparison of quantum physics and sociology promises new insights into the achievements as well as problems of world descriptions that do not want to exclude self-reference per se. The dialogue takes place on the basis of selected problem fields. Here are some examples: The object subject-section cut-off; the question of what is (for whom) information, the observer dependence of concepts such as probability, causality and indeterminability, the modelling of extrinsic properties, the handling of complexity as well as the relationship of sense, object and interpretation. With a view on the work from the environment of Anton Zeilinger, the renowned physicist and sociologists enter into a dialogue in this project, which besides epistemology of the faculty of the faculty of biology, the faculty of the faculty of the subject.
content.title_en: Quantum Physics and Sociology in Dialogue : Considerations at Time, Observation and Interlinking

content.text: History: an introduction. What is history and what does it research? How does it make and convey knowledge? Beginners receive a compact and easy-to-understand introduction to history. They learn everything they need for BA studies about the questions, methods, theories, working methods, structures and the understanding of science of this exciting subject.
content.title_en: History : an introduction

content.text: Federal Democracy : Governing in the field of tension between interdependence and autonomy. In the comparative doctrine of government, the "federal democracy" is not considered as an independent type. Therefore, the relationship between federalism and democracy remained largely unexplained. This book defines this relationship as a field of tension. Democratic legitimacy sets the autonomy of the rulers, in federalism requires coordinated governance. In comparison with various forms of federal democracy, the author analyses the causes and consequences of these tensions. He shows which institutional conditions trigger self-enhancing dynamics and which enable actors to adapt their strategies and learn to deal with tensions. Starting from his concept of federal democracy, he criticizes a technocratic interdependence management and populist ideas of "unbundling" and pleads for democracy-compatible forms of coordination in federalism.
content.title_en: Federal Democracy: Governance in the Interdependence and Autonomy

content.text: AutoCAD 2021 and AutoCAD LT 2021 for architects and engineers. Introduction to the most important operating elements Design examples from architecture, crafts and technology. Numerous practical examples and exercises. This basic and textbook shows you the possibilities of AutoCAD 2021 and AutoCAD LT 2021 using concrete practical examples from architecture, crafts and technology. In particular, AutoCAD newcomers offer a thorough and practical introduction to CAD. Also the basic deviations in the user interface of the Mac version are presented. With the book and the 30-day trial version from the Autodesk website you can start immediately and create your first drawings. They work from the beginning with typical construction tasks from study and practice. To each chapter you will find exercises, test questions and solutions. Numerous commands are explained in detail, such as: Drawing with LINIE, KREIS, BOGEN, PLINIE, Schraffur and further editing (VERSETZ, STUTZEN, DEHNEN and further), handles, properties manager, arrangements with REIHE commands, change with STRECKEN, VARIA, BLIENK COND.
content.title_en: AutoCAD 2021 and AutoCAD LT 2021 for architects and engineers

content.text: The cradle of Islam: Mohammed, the Koran and the ancient cultures. "The renowned ancient historian Glen Bowersock, in his small masterpiece, says goodbye to the image of warlike Muslims from the Arab desert who storm the Old World. He shows how much Arabia has long been part of the ancient world, and in brilliant close-ups he draws a refreshingly different picture of the birth of Islam. Ancient Arabia was fiercely fought between Christians, Jews and polytheists, and the three great powers Ethiopia, Byzantium and Persia took advantage of this rivalry. Thus, the Byzantine emperor probably supported Mohammed's Hijra from Mecca to Medina, where Muslims should keep the Persian-friendly Jews in check. When Muslims came to Jerusalem in 648, they were opened without battle to defend the Christian hegemony over the city against Jews and Persians. But why did Byzanz see the Muslims on his side? In one chapter we approach the prophet Musaylimagance, one of the many competitors Mohammeds. Why did the Christian leaders of the latter leave behind the Christian leaders?
content.title_en: The cradle of Islam : Mohammed, the Koran and the ancient cultures

content.text: The Bauhaus : Workshop of Modernism. The Bauhaus - today a synonym for architecture and design of classical modernism - was founded in Weimar in 1919 by Walter Gropius. Among the members were Wassily Kandinsky, Paul Klee, Oskar Schlemmer and Ludwig Mies van der Rohe. They all contributed to developing a holistic concept to combine art and design, craftsmanship and technology. Winfried Nerdinger is knowledgeable about the central ideas and the form of teaching at the Bauhaus and vividly presents the most important persons and products as well as the political and economic contexts.
content.title_en: The Bauhaus : Workshop of Modernism

content.text: Internet linguistics: a textbook and workbook. Rapid technological developments, the expansion of digital communication and its effects on language and interaction create a dynamic data pool for one of the most exciting areas of modern linguistics: Internet linguistics. The aim of this textbook is to provide comprehensive information on this lively research area and to show how language and communication science methods can be combined in a meaningful way to analyse the peculiarities of linguistic-communicative action on the Internet. In a reader-friendly way, current research results are prepared didactically with numerous application examples and exercises. The book is conceived as an introduction and is equally suitable for seminar design and self-study. About the 1st edition: "Description and analysis of Internet-based forms of language use are always linked to concrete visual material, so that conceptual and illustrative material enter a successful synthesis here as well.
content.title_en: Internet linguistics : a textbook and workbook

content.text: Digitalisation with work and vocational training is a sustainable way of shaping the work and vocational training. What is the significance of digitalization for the education and training of the electrical, information, metal and vehicle professions? The use of digital technology leads to a major change in the activities and workflows. At the same time, the employees of these professions are particularly involved in these changes by using and manufacturing digitally innovative products. The present collection is divided into three parts. The section on resource-focused technical work is about the design of sustainable production, service and repair processes: How can digital technology be used to work resource-efficiently and efficiently? Under the heading "Smart Learning", the authors discuss the success of didactic transformation and new teaching methods for commercial-technical schools. Furthermore, the volume deals with computer science as a cross-cutting discipline of all digitization processes: How can computer education be designed in vocational education and training, although computer science is not a binding subject?
content.title_en: Making digitalization sustainable with work and vocational training

content.text: The New German School - Phenomena and History : Sources and comments on a central music aesthetic controversy of the 19th century. Berlioz, Wagner and Liszt are considered protagonists of the so-called "New German School". This phenomenon formed the crystallization point of a paradigm shift in the 19th century, which had an impact on European cultural history from the point of view of music criticism to the point of European cultural history. In an unprecedented way, the meaning of music and society were linked, bundled into large utopian designs and – constructed history. - The present edition of the sources gathers contributions from contemporary German, English and French-speaking music magazines from the mid-19th century. The polemic debate surrounding the "New German School" is documented and comprehensively commented on with over 150 articles. The period from 1845 to the death of the ideological initiative force, Franz Brendel, was opened up in 1868. The polarity of the "Fortschrittspartei" and "Conservative" that still exists today, as well as the self-intelligibility of the term "New German School" are critically questioned, differentiated and presented in new light.
content.title_en: The Neudeutsche Schule - Phenomena and History : Sources and comments on a central music aesthetic controversy of the 19th century

content.text: Continuous power-based textile technologies for lightweight structures in large series: Results from the BMBF composite project KonText. The book presents the final report on the KonText joint project. The main concern of the joint project was the reduction of the costs of FVK components by providing a textile manufacturing process and the subsequent production of power-driven thermoplastic fibre composite components. The entire process chain was provided by the C-Faser optimization, through the production and structural simulation of power-flow-compliant textiles as well as plant development and testing up to the production of components using classic large-scale series technology "Reforms". The joint project was carried out within the framework of the research campus initiative "Open Hybrid LabFactory". The editor Prof. Dr.-Ing. Klaus Dilger studied mechanical engineering with a focus on manufacturing technology at the TU Munich. After his diploma in 1987, he was a scientific assistant and academic council member of the Chair of Joining Technology at the TU Munich, where he has been involved in research and teaching with the entire manufacturing process. In 1997, Prof. Dampiltechnik was appointed to the University of Applied Sciences and Technology.
content.title_en: Continuous textile technologies for lightweight structures in large series that meet the requirements of the flow of power: Results from the BMBF-Verbundprojekt KonText

content.text: Practical guide Cooperative learning and heterogeneity : activating class guidance for inclusion and common learning : large collection of methods for successful teaching. Many teachers feel overwhelmed in the implementation of inclusion into teaching practice. The guide by Bastian Becker and Tanja Ewering, teacher with a Gymnasial or Special Pedagogy background, aims at expanding the repertoire of actions and further developing the range of methods for practical coping with inclusion and heterogeneity in everyday school life, for example with ideas for cooperative learning, with suggestions for activating class guidance, with practical tips for internal differentiation of teaching or with suggestions for dealing with class teachers' activities. Matching the models and concepts, the author and the author also offer reflections, instruction examples and very precise instructions for implementation in everyday teaching. For all teachers who have to teach pupils with special educational support needs, also in addition to the numerous relevant teachers' help. (2)
content.title_en: Practical Guide Cooperative Learning and Heterogeneity : Activating Class Guidance for Inclusion and Joint Learning : Large Collection of Methods for Successful Teaching

content.text: - Onboarding for executives: s you start up in a new leadership role. How to start a new leadership role? The author presents in this book methods and processes of an optimal onboarding, which have proven themselves in its numerous leadership roles and in the consulting. It shows in a very practical and easily feasible way how executives create strong trust relationships in teams from the first hour. This leads in a short time to a high intrinsic motivation and is indispensable prerequisite for maximum performance and good cooperation. Explaining passages alternate with concrete recommendations of action. A practice-oriented work with many tips on how optimal onboarding succeeds relatively easily, supported by tools, methods, checklists and practical examples. A valuable guide for young executive talents who stand before their first leadership role, be it as team leader or pre-laws), developed from a team or as a new leader of another team, but also for executives who strive in their own company into a greater leadership responsibility. The author Herbert Reiß is a lecturer, executive coach and consultant for leadership and executives remain an executive executive member.
content.title_en: Onboarding for executives: s to start a new leadership role

content.text: Diversity and security in the neighbourhood: Conflicts, trust and social cohesion in European cities. The quality of life in cities is shaped by their diversity of social situations, lifestyles, values and cultures. In cities, strangers encounter each other in close spaces and are forced to deal with each other. When social fault lines and processes of social disintegration are shown, social diversity can question valid norms and values and be linked to uncertainties and conflicts. The danger is that conflicts of use and intergroups as well as everyday irritations and different behaviours experienced in urban districts are perceived and discussed in public discussion too quickly as regulatory disruptions or even threats to security. This volume therefore combines contributions from scientists and practitioners from urban planning, housing management, community and integration work, and regulatory and security authorities for a positive and productive approach to issues of diversity and security with examples from Belgium, Germany, Finland, the Netherlands, Austria and Portugal.
content.title_en: Diversity and security in the neighbourhood: conflicts, trust and social cohesion in European cities

content.text: Therapeutic landscapes: Landscape and health in an interdisciplinary perspective. Joachim Rathmann presents the interdisciplinary relation between landscapes and health. Nature is to be regarded as an elementary health resource, because movement in a natural environment has proven positive influences on human health and is summarized in the concept of "Therapeutic landscapes" in many ways. Natural spaces offer an important, economically measurable resource for strengthening health, especially for an ageing society. The author prepares natural, social, and humanities studies for a broad range of readers understandably, vividly and clearly. At the same time, he provides suggestions for a conscious use of the sensitive resource landscape and for regular nature observation. The content Therapeutic landscapes, introduction to a concept of health-promoting places On the landscape and health concept Human-place-binding Landscape preferences, landscape and forests as a health resource The target groups of students and lecturers in the fields of landscape planning, nature conservation, geography, health sciences and environmental psychology, medicine as well as -pedagogik Professionals in these areas and landscape architecture, environmental economics as well as gerontology Therapeutic landscapes Therapeutic landscapes of the forest community of Augsburg and the University of Augsburg teaches of Germany have a PhD.
content.title_en: Therapeutic landscapes : landscape and health in an interdisciplinary perspective

content.text: Sizes, units, formulas: Helps to create scientific texts. You have to write a scientific-technical essay and are now faced with the problem of wanting to correctly present their few formulas and equations? You already have books on the topic of "writing a scientific work", but you also want to know how to create certain special characters? You already know how to write in matter quite well, but you want to write in accordance with rules? This essential provides you with answers in compressed form. In addition to general tips, you also get information on how to work with MS Word and beyond, on how to handle MS Excel, MS Powerpoint, OpenOffice and LibreOffice. The content An overview of text elements and highlighting possibilities in texts Inserting special characters High and low figures correctly specify sizes, units, formulas correctly format notes on certain characters and their use Chemical and mathematical formulas Basic to tables and diagrams Tables with special characters, conversions and shortcuts Since years the target groups Students of natural and engineering sciences in the main and secondary subject Teachers and Trainees in natural science is a leader in scientific science lab staff in many chemical laboratories and for chemical engineers.
content.title_en: Sizes, units, formulae : Helps to create scientific texts

content.text: The study of data analysis - The analysis of data is a good example of the practical application of data analysis methods. The analysis of the sample data is carried out using Excel and the analysis of the data can be carried out using exercises. In addition, you can follow the calculation steps in online videos and calculate them in parallel in Excel. This book not only provides you with the basic knowledge of data analysis necessary for scientific practice, but also provides the foundation for a sovereign handling of the relevant instruments. This book supports thus natural scientists, physicians and engineers in studies and practice and offers a slight introduction to statistical data analysis and its application in Excel. The author Mario Schneider is a chemist and has already recognized as a student that a sound data analysis is one of the cornerstones of scientific work. After his bachelor's degree in chemistry and biotechnology at the University of Lower Rhine, he specialized in the field of bioanalysis of the bioanalysis.
content.title_en: Data analysis for scientists, physicians and engineers

content.text: The basics of data analysis with R : an application-oriented introduction. This book provides an application-oriented introduction to data analysis with the free statistical environment. It also covers descriptive analyses as comprehensively as inferential statistical analyses. In addition to classical univariate methods, the book takes into account nonparametric tests, resampling methods and multivariate statistics. It also covers the many possibilities to prepare data and create diagrams. The statistical procedures are explained using examples and illustrated in many places with diagrams. The book is aimed at all those who want to get to know R and use it in concrete tasks without having to have previous experience with command-controlled programs or programming languages. For the fifth edition, the book has been fully updated: It now refers to version 4.0.0 of R, and the selection and presentation of additional packages used has been adapted to the dynamic development. In addition, the section on data preparation has been revised in particular: For the more years of data science applications, he presents the package dplyr in detail, contains an extended presentation of R-Markdown documents and provides an analysis of the guidelines for frequency analysis.
content.title_en: Basics of data analysis with R : an application-oriented introduction

content.text: The new discontent with the culture of memory is an intervention. A foreign country is considered to be a success story and a model. However, within the country it is increasingly the subject of discomfort and discontent. The new book by Aleida Assmann reacts to these critical voices and takes them as an occasion to rethink the past and future of the German culture of memory. The more contemporary witnesses die, the more the interpretation power of the '68 generation fades and the more open Germany understands itself as an immigration society, the more the established memory of crimes and guilt of the Germans is put to a test. Aleida Assmann takes a stand on the local debates and also focuses his gaze on other countries and their dealings with the past – an intervention at the right time. "With a plethora of institutions, initiatives and museums the Germans think of past times. Now more the fighting titles against the culture of memory are being removed, but it is not so easy to contemplate a new book of memory. "In their new book, Alida, they say the same thing about the past, and they say the same thing about the past.
content.title_en: The new discomfort of the memory culture: an intervention

content.text: Thermodynamics: Physical-chemical basics for scientists and engineers of thermal process engineering. Basics of thermodynamics -- Thermodynamic properties of pure fluids -- Thermodynamic properties of homogeneous mixtures -- Phase equilibriums of multi-component systems. This book presents the basics of thermodynamics, deals with the thermodynamic properties of pure fluids, homogeneous mixtures and heterogeneous balances as well as their applications in natural science and thermal process engineering. The abstract and difficult-to-reach relationships are clearly and comprehensiblely presented, references to the application are shown and examples calculated. Mastering the digital transformation successfully: - Create prerequisites and enable business agility - New disruptive or evolutionary business models - Win race for products and markets of tomorrow.Start fast boats and capture them in an orderly manner -Design your organization and processes lean and digital; Use proven best practices. content.text: Urban building physics: basics of climate and environmental cities. Introduction -- What is urban building physics -- Climate -- Comfort -- Urban atmosphere and climate -- Urban development -- Urban emissions -- Smart city -- Problems, challenges, measures. The textbook describes the aspects and tasks of urban building physics, describes the relationship between people, building and environment and shows the urban construction physical features in cities. It provides the reader with tools for the analysis and implementation of a climate-friendly city for sustainable climate protection. Target group: Students of construction and related study programmes Urban and urban habitat planners Content: Introduction - What is urban building physics - Climate - Comfort - Urban atmosphere and climate - Urban development - Urban emissions - Smart city - Problems, challenges, measures The author: Prof. Dr.-Ing. Schew-Ram Mehra, Fraunhofer Institute for Building Physics and Institute for Acoustics and Building Physics of the University of Stuttgart.
content.title_en: Urban building physics : Basics of climate and environmental cities

content.text: The genome evolution of plants: dynamics in plant genetic material. The plant genome and its inheritance -- polyploidization and its effects on the plant genome -- Structural chromosome mutations -- Repetitive elements and the plant genome -- The genome size of plants is dynamic -- In the age of genome sequencing and pangenomics -- Glossary. The cells of each living being contain the genetic information in the form of DNA, also called genome, which is determined to a large extent by the appearance and function of an organism. Also in plants, this is not different. The genetic information is not static, but changes with great dynamics. In this essential you get a broad overview of the processes that change the plant genome during evolution. What is polyploidy and why can it promote the development of genes with new functions? Why are some plant genomes huge and others tiny, though they contain almost equal numbers of genes? And what insights does the age of genomic studies in the variation and flexibility of the genetic substance provide us with information about the genetic genome polyploids and their working groups of gene gene disorders.
content.title_en: Genome evolution in plants : dynamics in plant genetic material

content.text: Gentrification and displacement: current theoretical, methodological and political challenges. In view of the increasing situation in the housing and real estate markets for years, gentrification has become one of the most important concepts to describe the social changes in the big cities. The contributions of the volume provide current diagnoses of German-speaking gentrification research and consider the latest developments from a variety of case studies from different perspectives. As in a distilled glass, it allows us to observe and understand social changes, social conflicts and political negotiation processes of urban and housing market development.
content.title_en: Gentrification and displacement : current theoretical, methodological and political challenges

content.text: Microscopics are simple: the introduction to microcosm. Unchanged reprint (old edition: 2008) of this practical, compact and easy to understand workbook, which makes it easy to get started in microcosm, even for young people. The guide informs about the most common microscopes and their functioning, explains all necessary dyeing solutions and reagents, shows the correct production of own preparations and cuts as well as the successful preparation of own permanent preparations. Many colored illustrations serve to illustrate the visuality, important information is highlighted in color. The appendix contains an updated list of microscopic associations and a literature list. - More information: "The Great Cosmos Book of Microscopy" (2020) by the same author
content.title_en: Microscopicalization simple : the introduction to the microcosm

content.text: The search for Paulie Fink. Caitlyn's new school is very strange. It is taught in an old villa, the plant-covered sports field is mutilated by a horde of goats, and none of her ten classmates can stop talking about a student named Paulie Fink. Depending on who you ask, he was a hilarious class clown or an relentless troublemaker. But one thing is certain: the boy was an absolute legend. Now he has disappeared, and Caitlyn is elected a juror in a competition where a worthy Paulie replacement is to be found. With every new challenge, Caitlyn tries to meet the person she never met. But most of all, she surprises what she finds out about herself.
content.title_en: The Search for Paulie Fink

content.title_en: Organize Animals : an Illustrated History of Zoology

content.text: Digitality in school and teaching: a guide to practice: all levels of school. The social pressure on schools to develop digital teaching offers has increased – not least due to the Corona crisis. In many places, the technical possibilities for digital teaching need to be created or further developed. However, even where presentation media and end devices are available, suitable digital communication platforms are needed that are appropriate to the needs of the school's assignment and everyday school life. Moreover, schools build concepts that can deal with digital forms of communication. Moreover, the media skills of teachers and learners have not been systematically developed in recent years. The book is aimed at all participants in the process of redesigning our schools. It brings transparency into the complex set of conditions, from social pressure, educational objectives and the options for action of individual schools, which are very different. This is not about contributing to the social, political and educational-didactic discourse, but about the perspectives for the design and development of school practice in times of digitalization.
content.title_en: Digitality in school and teaching : a guide to practice : all levels of school

content.text: Manual of Nature Spatial Education. Nature is now a recognised educational place. In this book Anke Wolfram provides sound background knowledge as well as practical examples of how forest and meadow can be used as an educational place. Equally, prerequisites and framework conditions for the design and management of forest kindergartens or forest projects are described in control facilities.
content.title_en: Manual on Spatial Education

content.text: Textbook Methods of Social Work. What are the basics of methodologically supported action that should distinguish professional social work? The introduction provides an overview of the methodological arrangements that are to be applied as a textbook, whereby a subject-oriented attitude must be the basis of any action that meets the circumstances with which social work has to be dealt with. As a textbook, the basic text introduces the central concepts and concepts of methodological action, as a workbook, the volume contains additional materials, hints on further literature and tasks that serve to deepen in self-work or self-organized group work. (Verlagsinformation)
content.title_en: Textbook Methods of Social Work

content.text: 2030 : the world of tomorrow. Facts-saturated analysis of global demographic, geopolitical and technological trends that will change the world in the near future. In doing so, it is attempted not to look at these developments in isolation but to understand them in their interactions. (publisher information)
content.title_en: 2030 : the world of tomorrow

content.text: Covid-19: In the food industry, it's safe to use the pandemic: transmission routes, protective measures, labour law, occupational safety, communication and training. Since the beginning of 2020, Corona has been the focus of attention. In addition to other industries, food processing and processing companies are also heavily affected. Production processes are to be reconsidered and optimised, behavioural adjustments and training staff.All with the aim of protecting your staff and reducing the spread of Covid-19. This practical guide helps you to optimally and safely align your business:Review and view of the case numbersProperties, transmission routes and control measures of SARS-CoV-2Work protection during the Corona pandemicRequirements in quarantine casesRights and obligations in labour law: for employers and employeesPractical Corona measures in the companyRaw procurement and securing supply chainsSuccessful quality assurance in the pandemic Expansion of the hygiene conceptIFS, BRC and FSSC: What can you do if the audit cannot take place?

content.text: The creation of a digital twin: An introduction to Simcenter Amesim. Introduction -- Signals and Mathematics -- The Mechanical Twin -- The Thermal Twin -- The Hydraulic Twin -- The pneumatic twin -- Conclusion -- Disclaimer. The creation of the first digital twins should be intuitive. In this book, twins from different areas are presented, which can be built without any prior knowledge. The reader is taught a sense of how to handle Simcenter Amesim by practical examples. Without profound mathematical skills, for example, ventilation and tank systems, solar collectors or a simple jack of cars are reconstructed. Each calculation example concludes with work suggestions to train the handling of the twin. The content The first start of Simcenter Amesim The mechanical twin – How a cable train cools bodies for electric generators location selection of solar collectors design of the ventilation system for a building The target groups of students, students of engineering science and persons interested in technology are also working on the development of innovative solutions for the automotive industry.

content.text: Humanökologie. Historische und erkennttheoretische Grundlagen -- Ecological-Organismische Grundlagen -- Soziologisch-Humanökologische Grundlagen -- Environmentalethische Grundlagen -- Encyclopädisches Grundlagen -- Humanökologie. The essential summarizes the three main strands of human ecology as a science of material and idea-based interactions between humans and their environment as systemic overview knowledge: - The natural science foundations describe the ecological determinants of human existence, their dependence on ecosystem services and resulting environmental problems. - Social action gives a brief scientific historical outline of sociological human ecology and presents exemplar negotiation processes between actors and implementation strategies. - The environmental ethical foundations cover the gap between real use of nature, environmental ethics and environmental policy implementations.
content.title_en: Human ecology

content.text: Geography of coloniality : Stories of global inequality of the present. Colonialism is a historical theme, a contemporary theme and a geographical theme. The contributors of the volume combine these three perspectives and show the relevance of spatial and social power relations of colonialism in the present. This "coloniality" is shown in the production of knowledge, in public debates, in the shape of European cities, in local struggles and international politics. The volume combines contributions from geography and urban research, which refer to research approaches of the Black Studies, Postcolonial Studies and Decolonial Studies.
content.title_en: Geography of Coloniality : Stories of Global Inequality of the Present

content.text: Development and construction of plastic parts: application-oriented work documents. Calculation and design of cylindrical press connections Mr. Meyer is a chemical engineer for plastics technology (Ing.-Schule Fürstenwalde), a graduate engineer for mechanical engineering and manufacturing technology (TU Dresden) and has a diploma in technical school education (TU Dresden).
content.title_en: Development and design of plastic parts : application-oriented working documents

content.text: 8. The AI in the job: Guide to successful human-machine collaboration. This book is a practical guide for the use of artificial intelligence with motivated employees in companies and organizations. You will learn what the prerequisites are for people to be able to look forward to productive cooperation with "intelligent machines". This is the only way to raise the full potential of AI. To do so, you will get an overview of how and where AI can be used in companies and how you can identify the right fields of application for AI in your company. This book will focus on the following question: Which tasks will be taken over by AI and which ones will continue to be carried out by employees. These decisions change processes and tasks and require practical change management and motivation. In this book you will learn how you can motivate and inspire people for these new tasks, so that the steps to use AI in the working environment can be made as best possible. To the author: Prof. Dr. Andreas Moring is Professor of Digital Business, Innovation & AI at the International School of Management. He is the founder and director of the JuS.TECH Institute for AI and Sustainability, Co-Foun of the Hamburg Art-Dia-Diactive Cooperation for human.
content.title_en: AI in the job: Guide to successful human-machine cooperation

content.text: Autonomy and responsibility in digital cultures: privateness in the web of law, media and society. The increasing complexity of networked systems raises fundamental doubts about self-determination in digital. Foreign-determining algorithms and practices of self- and foreign-dates raise questions about protection and endangering autonomy and freedom of opinion. Nevertheless, the legal, political, ethical, social and economic responsibility for the consequences of digital transformation processes for societies, collectives and individuals remains unexplained. In this field of tension, this interdisciplinary band wants to stimulate a discussion on responsibilities and impact assessments. Problems within digital cultures are explored, possible control possibilities discussed and conflicts of economic, political and social systems discussed. With contributions by Anna K. Bernzen, Barbara Büttner & Carsten Ochs, Stephan Dreyer, Hans-Christian Gräfe & Andrea Hamm, Hermann Jakobi & Elizaveta Saponchik, Thomas Krämer-Badoni & Jens Crueger, Wulf Loh, Tim Raupach & Phillip Siedenburg, Caroline Richter & Christian Lenk, Alexander Schär, Julia Schröder Witt
content.title_en: Autonomy and responsibility in digital cultures: privateness in the web of law, media and society

content.text: Manual Contract negotiation and contract management : Planning, negotiation, design and execution of contracts. Planning, negotiation, design and execution of contracts. How to design even the most difficult contract works without errors, negotiate sovereignly and systematically lead to the desired success is always learned from this book. Uniform and manageable basic structure for contracts, standardized construction system for contracts, tips for optimal contract negotiation of negotiation professionals, negotiation abroad, quality management of contract projects. With many checklists, formulation suggestions and examples.
content.title_en: Manual Contract negotiation and management : planning, negotiation, design and execution of contracts

content.text: New work and digital natives are the current keywords. A few years ago, it was assumed that employees need a strong hand, that they need a clear goal and, above all, the way to it. The new leadership approaches, however, take into account that certain freedoms and independent action can lead to the specified goal more efficiently. Classical leadership theories and concepts combine leadership success primarily with the behaviour and characteristics of the superior. New approaches, on the other hand, allow a broader perspective on leadership by focusing more on the interaction process between managers and employees, the importance of employees and the organizational context. The author not only explains the differences between the classic leadership approaches and the New Work concepts, but also shows how both "worlds of leadership" can be reconciled.
content.title_en: Human Resources Management in Digital Change : from the classic leadership approaches to the New Work concepts

content.text: Building with paper : Architecture and construction. The natural material paper is currently the subject of research and testing in construction practice. It is cost-effectively manufactured, consists of renewable raw material and is completely recyclable. The focus of the use is on temporary use, for example in transition buildings for schools, emergency shelters or microhomes. The material is properly protected from wet and fire, and the architectural claim is not too short, as examples of Pritzker prize winner Shigeru Ban show: the Chengdu primary school, the Paper Concert Hall in Aquila or the Cardboard Cathedral in Christchurch were each a sign of hope after devastating earthquakes. The introduction explains the foundations of building with paper and shows exciting applications.
content.title_en: Building with paper : Architecture and construction

content.text: Science, Space, Society: an overview of the social generation of knowledge. The volume introduces fundamentals into science theory and the central concepts, theories, as well as philosophical, scientific and spatial theoretical positions and approaches. Additional questions via app: Download the Springer Nature Flashcards app for free and use exclusive additional material to examine your knowledge.The content Introduction · Logical Propädeutik · Science Theory – Philosophical Foundations and Positions · The Contextualization of Science I: Time · The Contextualization of Science II: Social Bondedness · Space Understandings and Theories on Spaces · Development Lines and Breaks in Geography – Sketch of a History of Discipline · Conclusion The authors Prof. Dr. Olaf Kühne, Research Area Geography (City and Regional Development), Department of Geoscience, Eberhard Karls University Tübingen. Dr. Karsten Berr, Research Area Geography (City and Regional Development), Department of Geoscience, Eberhard Karls University Tübingen.
content.title_en: Science, space, society: an overview of the social production of knowledge

content.text: Printed - Gefunkt - Posted : Media Change and Media Education of Civil Society. The book provides a genealogically oriented reconstruction of media change and media education positions. In addition to discourse formations, an economic analysis perspective is integrated into the reconstruction. Thus, a transdisciplinary access to a media-scientific and media-educational understanding can be opened up, which integrates the socio-cultural and economic dimensions reflexively. Against the background of this analysis, a profile determination of contemporary media education is developed. The author Dr. David Kergel is Professor of Social Work at the IUBH Dortmund and Coordinator of the international research group "Diversity and Education in the Digital Age".

content.text: Leadership in product management : how you effectively lead stakeholders and development teams. This guidance, which is aimed at the qualification of leadership in product management, is applicable not only in the business but also in the private sector because of its general validity. Those who are responsible as product managers or as product owners (scrum) get here, as nowhere else better or profound practices with which they can lead and manage teams. The specificity in product management depends on the agile requirements, so the manager should be familiar with the basic frameworks such as Scrum, Kanban or agile practices. However, the focus is on strengthening the competence of a team leader. It is about confidence formation, goal, communication ability, conflict resolution, decision-making and negotiation techniques, the careful handling of itself included. Insights according to M.B. Rosenberg: "Violence-free communication" as well as from the Buddhist teaching are very convincingly applied. A good addition to S. Reupke-Sieroux, which deals more with the management page. (2-3)

content.text: The study examines and evaluates the mandate of selected control bodies and institutions to examine in detail the range of mechanisms for monitoring the implementation and compliance of multilateral criminal law conventions. To this end, the analysis examines and compares control mechanisms from virtually relevant criminal law conventions of the United Nations, the Council of Europe and the OECD, and discusses their impact on their legal implementation and practical effectiveness. The analysis focuses on control mechanisms that have been established in the criminal criminal fields since the turn of the millennium in the fields of organised crime, corruption and trafficking in human beings.
content.title_en: Transnational Criminal Law Treaty Implementation Control

content.text: Solar thermal energy : how sun becomes heat. What contribution can solar thermal energy make to the energy transition? What costs solar heat and where are its limits? After a brief overview of the possibilities of regenerative heat supply, the authors introduce the physical foundations of solar radiation and radiation conversion. Then they explain the functioning of solar collectors and the most important plant-technical components on the basis of numerous illustrations. Further chapters shed light on the possibilities of use and also the cost-effectiveness of solar thermal systems - from drinking water heating and heating support to cooling and power generation. The book also gives the layperson a good start to this important technology and essential for the conversion of the energy system. History of solar thermal use -- Solar radiation -- Collector technology -- Plant technology -- Cost, proceeds and economic efficiency -- Development lines.
content.title_en: Solar thermal energy : how sun becomes heat

content.text: The topic of diversity : shaping commonalities and differences. The topic of diversity, commonalities and differences IBM is dedicated to this current topic of social reality. The new volume on humanistic pedagogy and psychology is being discussed in the context of challenges and opportunities in pedagogical contexts. The work approaches the complex topic of various approaches: In addition to fundamental theoretical debates on diversity, diversity-related topics are being problematized in an exemplary manner by means of the different categories of disability and migration. A look into pedagogical fields of action from primary school to adult education shows the importance of the topic for different age groups and educational contexts. The conclusion is an implication for teachers' education, in which the importance of professionalization processes for a reflexive thematicization of diversity and its design in practice fields becomes clear.
content.title_en: Thematize diversity : shape similarities and differences

content.text: Hegau : Geology of the Volcanic Landscape between Danube and Lake Constance. "This new volume from the collection of geological guides combines proven and new. It is a completely new and substantially expanded version of volume 62 of the Geological Guide 'Hegau and Lake Constance to the west' (1976). Under new title 'Hegau - Geology of the Volcanic Landscape between Danube and Lake Constance', he describes the geological structure and the history of the development of the extensive volcanic landscape of the Hegau region, between the southern edge of the Swabian Alb and the Upper Danube to the north-western Lake Constance. The characteristic volcanic cones, among them the well-known Hohentwiel near Singen, are the erosion and glacial over-presence of former volcanic structures. The introductory part, after short references to vegetation, soil science and archaeology, convey a detailed description of the geological conditions and the rocks found in the Hegau. A reference to natural hazards and the raw material situation complete it. Below, 63 excursion points are described; additional to this, the position of natural causes are added to the various excursion points.
content.title_en: Hegau : Geology of the volcanic landscape between the Danube and Lake Constance
