content.text: Geography is destiny: Power struggle between Britain, Europe and the world - a 10,000-year history. Who are we, where do we live, what do we have, how do we protect ourselves and who does the rules? These questions have always been driving humanity around, and they are all determined by the geographical situation. This is shown by historian, archaeologist and best-selling author Ian Morris with a view to Britain, the former empire. He tells the story of his changing relations with Europe and the world, from the physical separation at the end of the Ice Age to the first beginnings of the United Kingdom, the struggles around the Atlantic Ocean and the rise of the Pacific region.Based on maps, images and latest archaeological finds, Morris examines how geography, migration, politics and new technologies worked together and produced inequalities that are still characteristic to the present day. Where does Britain and where does Europe stand when the world stage is moving eastward? A global challenge, as shown in a flash glass. Ian Morris is considered a pioneer when it comes to making world history interesting and understandable?
content.title_en: Geography is fate : Power struggle between Britain, Europe and the world - a 10 000-year history

content.text: Metzler Lexikon literarischer Symbolen. Preface -- Preface to the 2nd edition -- Preface to the 3rd edition -- Directory of new articles -- Alphabetical Article Directory -- List of articles by subject -- Selection bibliography -- Directory of authors -- Siglen and Abbreviation Index -- Articles A–Z -- Register of meaning. 500 articles from "Evening" to "Cypresse": This lexicon gathers the most important symbols of Western literature and traces their history at exemplary reference points. Numbers, colors, plants, animals, places, spaces, things, day and seasons, and much more, are described in their central symbolic meanings from Greek-Roman and biblical to contemporary literature. The third edition, along with 30 new articles, has a detailed register of meanings that allows to determine the symbols used for these purposes, starting with meanings.
content.title_en: Metzler Lexicon of Literary Symbols

content.text: Old farmhouses: Renovate and rebuild. Old farmhouses to new life brings 25 25living in the countryside, in an old house with a lot of atmosphere. This is the great dream of many people. This book shows how it can become a reality. It presents around 30 converted farmhouses, stables and barns as well as former houses and artisans' houses on the village. The projects offer a wealth of inspiration for the possibilities of reconstruction and renovation - from the monument-friendly renovation to the loft-like transformation to the installation of a passive house in an old remise. The examples come from Germany, Austria and Switzerland: from the North Sea to the Chiemgau, from Berlin to Tyrol, from North Rhine-Westphalia to the Black Forest to the Engadine. All buildings are comprehensively described with plans, photos, understandable texts and information on constructions and materials. 25 25An introductory section explains all important steps: How do I find my dream house? What must I consider when buying what is needed in the renovation and conversion planning? What tips are available for the design of the rooms and gardens?
content.title_en: Old farmhouses : renovate and rebuild

content.text: Spectacular machines: an affect history of technology. Already the Icarousage tells of man's desire to do it like God, and of his fear of being punished for it. This indissoluble contradiction of longing and fear determines the Western man-machine ratio to this day - a heart-raising miracle and frightening monster, unsightly magic and coldly calculated mechanics: What is it that we have created there? While the theater machines, which brought life to the stage as mechanical songbirds, floating deities or artificial wind, produced soothing showers in the audience, the mechanical loom and other useful machines seemed to subdue man. The machine enthusiastic medieval monks, who invented time with the clock, and came upon the rejection of the popes, who could not tolerate a time independent of God. Machines banish our attention and are able to change everything by means of the machine, as we think, how we love. "Daniel Strassbergs wonderfully instructive" is to cast down the book, the machine's focuss on the fear, the thought of the mind, the mind of the machine is always directed by the mind.
content.title_en: Spectacular machines : a history of the affect of technology

content.text: Chemistry of biology : Basis and origin of evolution. The material basis of all living organisms are chemical compounds, which are usually composed of several elements. The periodic table of elements, in which the elements are arranged in a characteristic structure, contains a small number of artificially produced elements besides the 94 naturally occurring elements. In nature there is only a small part of these elements, besides carbon, it is mainly oxygen, nitrogen, phosphorus, sulfur and a few metals. This results from the electron affinities, ionization energies, electronegativity, oxidation numbers and the geometry of the associated compounds. This also results in the presence of the various natural substances, their reaction possibilities and thus ultimately also the evolution. The authors, a professor of organic chemistry and a teaching force for chemistry didactics, want to put the fundamental role of chemistry in the center with their book. A short appendix includes literature notes and a factual register. - recommended for students and teachers of natural sciences.
content.title_en: Chemistry of Biology : Basis and Origin of Evolution

content.text: Modelling the expertise of teachers in particle physics (volume 315). Particle physics as a sub-area of modern physics is becoming increasingly important in school physics teaching. In this work, the knowledge required by teachers is modelled for the first time on particle physics, whereby expertise is understood as part of the profession knowledge. As a focus on the content areas and the types of knowledge, for which subfacets are identified and precisely described.After a review of the essential ideas of particle physics, the work presents the successive modelling of the expertise in a qualitative and quantitative Delphi study. In three surveys between 35 and 65 international experts from the field of particle physics related research (specialist science and didactics) and public work (including science journalism) as well as experienced teachers on the relevant topics of particle physics relevant for the expertise were interviewed.Empirical analyses of the survey rounds revealed that the dimension of content areas in the declarative knowledge were made up of ten particle physics topics (e.g. particle physics journalism) and experienced teachers were asked about the topics of particle physics relevant for the expertise.
content.title_en: Modelling the expertise of teachers in particle physics (volume 315)

content.text: Productivity Management 4.0 : Practice-tested approaches to the use of digitalization in industry. This open access book describes current practical examples and recommendations for the design of work and productivity in the digitised world. The examples were developed by companies and scientific institutes in several research projects and tested in practice. Each practical example includes concrete needs and goals, a step-by-step approach, the impact on work design and productivity as well as the success factors to be considered. This describes current design solutions for companies that demonstrate the potential of digitalization for the working world and productivity management in practice.
content.title_en: Productivity Management 4.0 : Practice-tested approaches to the use of digitalization in industry

content.title_en: Excel tips and tricks for dummies

content.text: The authors introduce the concept of "theoretic" to the topic of urban development. They use application-related systemic approaches to use them, systematically linking them with knowledge-theoretical currents that can be assigned to the Luhmann system theory. The understanding of society of this theory of social systems is a very good starting point for understanding urban development and urban complexity. From this perspective, urban development can be seen as a process in which organizations and individuals with their own expectations and perspectives are involved, in which contradictions and conflicts seem unavoidable and the future cannot be clearly predicted. Decisions in cities and communities are therefore always linked to risks, irritations and unexpected consequences. With the Potsdam approach of "theoretic" Rolfes and Wilhelm represent a more dimensional approach to managing urban development processes. The approach of "the term of "diversity" is presented to the University of Potsdam.
content.title_en: System[theoret]ische Stadtentwicklung : the Potsdamer Leitsternansicht

content.text: The future of the commercial vehicle in times of transformation: analysis of challenges and success factors. In a work-sharing, flexible and connected economic system, road freight transport is and remains the driving force for growth and prosperity. However, both the demands of society on the transport sector and the needs of transporters, which must prevail in a world of highly rationalized transport chains, are currently only slightly underdeveloped. At the same time, the technical potentials that offer automation, digitalization and electrification are only being exploited. In global competition, those manufacturers who assume the need for change early on and bring new technologies with high unit numbers and comparatively low unit costs into the market. To achieve this, the commercial vehicle industry must transform not only its products, but also its leadership behaviour and overall its classic business model. The author describes which changes in the more conservative industry are not only possible, but also necessary. The content of the commercial vehicle as investment goods The commercial vehicle market between continuity and change Technological change: The commercial vehicle of the future transformation of an established business model Vision 2030+ The author Andreas Renschler is among others. Teaching officer at the Technical University of Munich (TUM) After the company No.
content.title_en: The future of the commercial vehicle in times of transformation: Analysis of challenges and success factors

content.text: A tent roof for Munich and the world: the realization of an idea for the 1972 Olympics. Behnisch & Architekten was involved in the construction of the tent roof of the Olympic Stadium in Munich
content.title_en: A tent roof for Munich and the world : the realization of an idea for the 1972 Olympics

content.text: Introduction to wind energy technology. Third edition of the introductory textbook on the use of wind energy in electricity generation (here last ID-G 6/13). Compared to the direct predecessor (2016, not discussed here), one chapter was completely redesigned, all others thoroughly revised and brought to the current state of play. 12 authors, all experts from research and practice are involved. The text is illustrated with many, often coloured diagrams, graphics and photos, literature information can be found after each chapter. Practical examples and practice tasks complement the presentation. The target group are students and practitioners in education and training. - The topic of wind energy plays an increasingly important role in the energy transition, therefore the volume is a meaningful acquisition for appropriate stocks and at university locations with suitable study programmes.
content.title_en: Introduction to wind energy technology

content.text: A competence-oriented perspective of the craft in the digital age: Tech, non-tech and meta skills as fundamental factors of strategic enterprise development. Introduction -- The nature of the craft -- Crafts in the change of time -- The triad of the craft -- Craftsmanship -- End of the book shows a detailed model of the craft skills as a basis for the development of the personal and entrepreneurial skills of the employees and employees of craft enterprises in the digital age. Based on a historical examination of the transformation of the craft trades, the author defines the craft skills by means of a structural model as tech skills (craft - technical and technological competences), non-tech skills (mouthwork - social and communicative skills) and meta skills (headwork – thinking about the thinking, behaviour and acting). Finally, the development of skills as a process model in a context of the production of scientific-technical-technological inventions, knowledge and procedures is described by the head of the business of the craft in the change of time.
content.title_en: A competence-oriented perspective of the craft sector in the digital age: Tech, non-tech and meta skills as fundamental factors of strategic business development

content.text: Multivariate data analysis : methodology and application in chemistry and related areas. 1 Introduction -- 2 Main component analysis -- 3 Cluster analysis -- 4 monitored classification -- 5 Methods of multivariate linear regression -- 6 Three-way main component analysis -- 7 Basics -- Annex: Datasets -- Literature. The application of multivariate statistical methods to extensive datasets, mainly from analytical chemistry, is the central theme of the book. The author's team - chemists and mathematicians - presents the classical and modern methods and their combination for solving analytical and physico-chemical problems in practice. The book is equally suitable for beginners and experienced practitioners, because it represents the complex facts consistently descriptive and mathematically theoretical. In addition, the book offers the possibility to test many of the presented methods using the computer programs (Turbo-Pascal 5.0) provided with the source code and also provided or own datasets.
content.title_en: Multivariate data analysis : methodology and application in chemistry and related areas

content.text: The unequal university: diversity, excellence and anti-discrimination. Continuing inequality among students, barriers to university professorships, growing precarization among young academics: universities are in permanent criticism – despite scientific and university reform measures, or precisely because of that? Universities are more than institutions for education and research. Socially, they also bear responsibility for promoting social justice and social inclusive structures. Current university reforms have given university leaders more power of design. Nevertheless, equality is only slowing down, and anti-discrimination measures are not sufficient to open universities socially and culturally sustainably. In addition to established power structures, the reasons for this are the developments promoted in the context of scientific and high-school reform efforts such as excellence policies, competitive orientation and deregulation of employment. These developments contribute to a sharper struggle for good work and professional prospects at universities. Here again, those groups that have been clearly underrepresented since time immemorially. The book refers to these developments and leads to current high-school-related debates on sexism, racism and professional perspectives.
content.title_en: The uneven university : diversity, excellence and anti-discrimination

content.text: The book of paperbacks for electrical engineering: Basics and electronics. The compact reference book for the basics of electrical engineering and electronics offers far more than one collection of formulas: it covers the fields of DC, electric and magnetic fields, alternating current and three-phase current, power supplies. In addition to chapters on the topics of electronics, digital technology, switching signs, basics of electrical measurement technology as well as signals and systems, the book also contains a section on the Laplace transformation and a detailed annex with tables on basics, electrical engineering and electronics, sizes and units of measure.
content.title_en: Paperback of Electrical Engineering : Basics and Electronics

content.text: Review - Online reviews and cultural education. Online reviews of artistic artifacts can trigger educational processes. Both in the productive examination of a work and in the preparation of this experience in a reviewive text and for a specific audience there is a high potential for cultural participation and overcoming educational barriers. But which processes, content and contexts play a role in this? The interdisciplinary research project Rez@Kultur was dedicated to this question, whose results are presented here for the first time.
content.title_en: Review - Online reviews and cultural education

content.text: - The book contains a compilation of the most famous classical arithmetical text tasks, selected tasks from mathematics competitions and many new, never-published problems. The book ranges from numerical puzzles about jokes, kinship and age chores, time calculation, transit problems and much more to the basics of combinatorics and number theory. The book is intended for children from 10 years of age, their parents and those teachers who want to show the practical benefits of mathematics and promote creative logical thinking. For the second edition it is completely reviewed and revised. The author Tatiana S. Samrowski was born in Smolensk (hem. Soviet Union). She only habilitated as the first woman at the Institute of Mathematics of the University of Zurich. Since then, she has been researching and teaching at the Zurich University of Applied Sciences and directs the Junior Euler Society for Mathematics of the University of Zurich. content.text: For all of the topics of physical science, the Department of Physics is a multi-stage app: Ideas for Physics with the Smartphone. For all of the app What apps are suitable for using smartphones or tablets for physical research and viewing? This question is posed by the physical interest group as well as by teachers. This book provides a quick and comprehensive overview of suitable apps and presents many practical examples of how to physically use smartphones and tablets. The authors are interested in a wide variety of applications: from prefabricated simulations to physical games to augmented reality applications, where virtual objects are displayed in the image of the real world. In addition, apps are presented that collect measurement data with internal sensors or external auxiliary devices, retrieve it from a database or by using photo and video cameras. In each individual section, a different app is presented in a short and comprehensive manner and the applicability of the mobile studies in schools and/or colleges and/or for their own entertainment are explained in one example.
content.title_en: An app for everything : ideas for physics with the smartphone

content.text: The BIM method is used in sustainable construction: the status quo of applications in practice. The integration of sustainability requires a paradigm shift in the life cycle of buildings. By using the BIM method, aspects of sustainable construction can be integrated more strongly into processes and workflows. Information is recorded across life cycle, consistent and structured and made available to all involved. This essential defines the status quo of applications for the application of the BIM method in sustainable construction. The aim is to promote a fusion of BIM and sustainability by demonstrating essential requirements for BIM processes and models, workflows and their added value. The content Definitions on Sustainability and BIM BIM Application Cases for Sustainable Construction Methods for Implementation Data Exchange Requirements The target groups Architects, Specialists, Sustainability Advisors and BIM Manager Students of the Construction and Real Estate Industry The authors Niels Bartels completed his doctorate at the Institute for Building Operations at TU Dresden and works as Innovation Manager at GOLDBECK GmbH. Jannick Höper completed his doctorate at the BIM Institute of Wuppertal and heads the Sustainable Group of the BIM.
content.title_en: Application of the BIM method in sustainable construction : status quo of practical applications

content.text: Perfect 3D prints with Simplify3D. This textbook provides a sound and practical introduction to the topic of electromagnetic compatibility. Due to increasing circuit complexity, increasing integration density and higher frequency signal components, the requirements for developers grow if they want to present a technically flawless and electromagnetically compatible product. The book shows which technical requirements to meet, which methods can be used to analyse coupling paths and which interference measures are possible. The aim is to provide a comprehensive overview. Initially, the physical-technical phenomena of influence are discussed in detail. The focus is on the field-theoretical tool for analyzing and optimizing the EMC of a device. Subsequently, the authors describe the verification by the laboratory test and the underlying standard landscape including its complex approval processes. From the content: basics and concepts, spreading of interference signals, components and concepts for improving the EMC, guidelines, norms and approval processes.
content.title_en: Perfect 3D prints with Simplify3D

content.text: Theoretical Computer Science. This textbook provides an understandable but yet compact introduction to theoretical computer science. The topics covered form the basis for further topics in theoretical computer science and are also fundamental for the formal work in the whole computer science. Due to a variety of tasks with solutions, this book is very suitable for self-study
content.title_en: Basics of Theoretical Informatics

content.text: Java - the new features in Version 17 LTS, 18 and 19 ?Java IBM the new features in Version 17 LTS, 18 and 19 ? covers all the major changes in the current Java versions. One focus is the description of a multitude of syntax improvements. Examples are the more concise syntax for switch as well as the multi-line strings and records, which facilitate the definition of value classes. Also the increasingly popular pattern matching for instance instance for instance in the stream API is presented. Not only in the syntax, but also in the APIs there are some new features, such as HTTP/2 support and various detail improvements, for example in the stream API. Finally, significant innovations are described in the JVM, including Direct Compilation, the JShell for interactive trial, JMH for creating microbenchmarks as well as jpackage for preparing installable distributions
content.title_en: Java - the new features in version 17 LTS, 18 and 19

content.text: Social robotics: a social science introduction. The textbook provides a systematic, social science introduction to social robotics. This sub-area of research into artificial intelligence aims to develop human-like robots that are intended to enter into social relations with people. Three parts shed light on the most important aspects of social robotics. The first part focuses on the history of AI research, illuminates the 'dream' of artificial humans and finally traces how sociology has been observing the topic since the 1980s. The second part opens up a sociological perspective on the production of social robots in the laboratories of engineering sciences and the social consequences of the development and establishment of social robots. Finally, the third part focuses on social theoretic perspectives that address the question of sociality of social robots and show how this question can be answered by means of exemplary case studies.
content.title_en: Social robotics: a social science introduction

content.text: Cultural Sociological Urban Research: Basics, Analyses, Perspectives. This volume formulates the basics of urban research conceived in a sociological way. The focus is on how a cultural-scientific view of cities can help to re-answer classic questions of urban sociology. Through the focus of their analysis on key cultural structural categories such as gender, class and race, the authors succeed in expanding the sociological debate on the topic of city by a feminist and postcolonial perspective. Furthermore, their reflections show how a cultural sociological approach can help to analyze cities in the context of current social and ecological challenges.
content.title_en: Cultural Sociological Urban Research : Basics, Analyses, Perspectives

content.text: Care work spatial thinking : feminist perspectives on planning and development. Describes the situation in Switzerland. The thesis of this book is that care and a "caring" attitude produce other forms of living together, of business and household, other forms of private, political and entrepreneurial action in this world, and that these in turn involve other institutional, built and spatial structures.
content.title_en: Care work spatial thinking : feminist perspectives on planning and development

content.text: Gender differences in educational context: from scientific studies to impulses for teaching practice. Are girls more motivated in reading? Are boys more interested in mathematics? Again and again studies show gender differences in interest, motivation and career plans of pupils – and this has social implications: more men than women in STEM professions, unused potential, wage inequality. But how do these differences arise, which have such a great impact on important life decisions? And what can teachers, school leaders and other actors contribute to educational practice to reduce gender differences? The subject book examines these and other questions. To begin with, the authors provide detailed theoretical background information on the causes of gender differences and their occurrence in student characteristics such as interest and motivation. The core of the issue is a synthesis of research that deals with the promotion of these characteristics. Here, the authors analyse the extent to which the impact of the support measures for girls and boys differs and from which students benefit most in general.
content.title_en: Gender differences in educational context: from scientific studies to impulses for teaching practice

content.text: In modern times, the belief that the world could be shaped and progress could be made more or less automatically to provide a better tomorrow. Warming up, the crisis of growth and subjective overloads have shaken this optimism. Today, the main issue is to mitigate the catastrophe. And even if this is successful, we will have to deal with change. Questions of self-preservation then superimpose those of individual and collective self-development. Adaptation becomes the guiding motive of society. The Corona pandemic has also shown that, in the face of interdependence and ecological dangers, we can no longer worship the boundless emancipation. Instead, according to Philipp Staab, the next society will be concerned primarily with stabilizing a precarious order. However, this results in a crisis of self- and time relations, to which the left must also find an answer.
content.title_en: Adaptation : guiding principle of the next society

content.text: Climate racism: the struggle of the right against the ecological change. The authors investigate the relationship between right-wing parties and the deniers of climate change. In this context, racist ideas are linked to the fear of social changes. And these connect with the representatives of fossil energies that fear money and power. (publisher information)
content.title_en: Climate racism: the struggle of the right against the ecological change

content.text: Design and artificial intelligence: theoretical and practical basics of design with machine learning systems. Machine intelligent systems are no longer science fiction. Machine learning is widespread: Design tasks are taken over by algorithms and the user experience is modified by intelligent systems. These applications for artificial intelligence (AI) face a gap in theoretical reflection of intelligent design. -- The book shows how task, role and understanding of designers expand when the machine takes on design decisions when the concept and practice of what is called creativity is fundamentally modulated. Thus, it provides the knowledge of how designers: inside machine learning can make productive use of. -- Relevant models and processes of artificial intelligence in design. Systematic consideration of intelligent design tools in the design process. Principles of good and ethically correct design with machine learning. Six case studies with special discipline focus and a chapter for practical applications. Designing with intelligent application
content.title_en: Design and artificial intelligence : theoretical and practical basics of design with machine learning systems

content.text: The new discovery of the world: how geniuses led the sciences from their deepest crises into modernism. Breaking findings and deep crises, revolutionary discoveries and refutation of until now intransigible beliefs IBM the years between 1870 and 1950 are characterized by scientific achievements of numerous geniuses and young thinkers. Insights that have almost overturned the understanding of the world, of space, time and infinity, of life and humanity, logic and predictability almost overnight. Some of the actors, such as Georg Cantor or Ludwig Boltzmann, but also Albert Einstein and Kurt Gödel have become almost crazy about it. Lars Jaeger illustrates how closely interrelated in these 80 years of genius, intuition and crisis, and how an inferno of spiritual revolutions shapes our present-day life and thinking. This goes far beyond physics with its quantum theory and relativity theory, whose revolutions are often depicted then, but also relates to biology (evolution theory and genetics), chemistry (molecular structures), psychology (the unconscious) and other scholarly disciplines that first of the scientific science were embodied in the scientific theory of how to be described in terms of science.
content.title_en: The New Discovery of the World: How Genius Leads Sciences From Their Deepest Crises to Modernism

content.text: Blue. As a central theme in art history, BLAU lets the epochs enter into a dialogue: from Egyptian murals to the frescoes of Giotto and the Star Night of Van Gogh to the sensational monochromes of Yves Klein. Discover the history of BLAU's colour in art with 40 iconic representations and their backgrounds: a precise selection of works that are partly indispensable, partly surprising. With comprehensive information in chronologies, maps, graphics, info boxes, anecdotes, as well as well-founded texts on the individual works, but also on the outstanding influence of BLAU's colour in the history of art. (Verlagstext)
content.title_en: Blue

content.text: Author and author are concerned with the concept of giftedness and then examine in detail how educators, but also parents, can recognize different talents, be it music-artistic, verbal or cognitive, and what a promotion can look like. In between there are ideas and examples from pedagogical practice as well as tasks and targeted questions; they are intended to provide incentives for reflection on what is read. Further practical examples are figures from literary texts - quite unconventionally. For teachers, educators and social workers, and also for especially committed parents.
content.title_en: Recognizing and Promoting Gifts of Children

content.text: My limit is your stop: children lovingly say stop. What can parents do in a concrete way if they almost freeze their feet on the playground and their child does not want to go home despite all the friendly requests? How can they accept and accompany the frustration of their angry child without crossing their own borders? Nora Imlau is one of the most important voices in the German-speaking educational landscape. For one of the focal points of need-oriented education, she offers new, surprising solutions. She shows that borders need neither hard nor authoritarian and that to maintain them does not automatically mean coercion, but above all soothing clarity. And both for parents and their children. Autonomy phases, stress during shopping and at school, social pressure when parents express boundaries as they think it is right IBM supports the education expert mothers and fathers with many tips and exercises as well as background knowledge from psychology and science.
content.title_en: My limit is your stop : children lovingly stop saying

content.text: The online boom, initiated by the Corona pandemic and the resulting political restrictions, had a lively discussion in science and practice about the meaning and nonsense of various digital offerings in social fields of work. With the lockdown and the associated disappearance of various forms of presence of social work, the digital space was finally brought into focus, including for formats of biography work. In this book, numerous possibilities of digital setting for biography work are thoroughly examined and presented using concrete practical examples. The focus is deliberately on the opportunities that are offered; it is about the "how", not the "whether". But also challenges and limits of the shift into the digital space of biographical work are addressed.
content.title_en: Practical Handbook Biography Work Online : Meeting Life Stories Digitally

content.text: Discovering learning : places of remembrance of the victims of Nazi crimes. In the past four decades, many memorial sites have been created in Germany and abroad to commemorate the persecuted people of National Socialism. When Detlef Garbe published the volume "Die verforgesten KZs?" in 1983, this development was not to be expected. The present volume takes into account numerous of the places and the associated social enlightenment projects, examines memory landscapes and reflects on questions of memory culture. The contributions make clear how much an active memory culture was dependent on a broad and critical social commitment and remains
content.title_en: Discovering Learning : Places of Remembrance of the Victims of National Socialist Crimes

content.text: Cultural Atlas of TÜbingenness : small maps from the large TÜbiverseum. TOverview -- TÜbiverseum -- Everyday cultureTÜr -- MobiliTÜt -- NaTÜr -- T Survival -- TÜberlegeung -- MulTÜsensorik. TübingenAtlas visualizes and comments on cultural and social geography aspects of Tübingen and promotes surprising and sometimes not very serious insights. The maps gathered in the Atlas deal with peculiarities and quirks of the old university city, but also provide more classic representations of settlement development. Dr. Olaf Kühne, the leading researcher, is Professor of Urban and Regional Development at the University of Tübingen. Dr. Corinna Jenal is an academic counsellor in the research area Geography (City and Regional Development) of the University of Tübingen. Dr. Timo Sedelmeier is an academic counsellor in the research area Geography (City and Regional Development) of the University of Tübingen.
content.title_en: Cultural Atlas of TÜbingenness : small maps from the large TÜbiverseum

content.text: The maths course for economists. The arithmetic with real numbers -- Potences -- Roots -- Logarithms -- Number sequences and series -- Functions -- Differential calculus -- Integral calculus -- Linear algebra -- Supplements to financial mathematics -- Solutions of exercise tasks. This textbook repeats in compact form the most important statements of school mathematics for the start of the study and simultaneously transfers to selected contents of the initial semesters. It is aimed at students of economics at universities, universities and vocational academies alike. The presentation does not involve formal rigour, remains vivid and offers numerous calculated examples and exercise tasks from various areas of business and economics. All motivations and application examples are taken from the economic science field. Solutions to all exercise tasks complete the book. For the 9th edition, the book was completely revised and updated as well as supplemented by a short chapter on descriptive statistics. The authors Prof. Dr. Walter Purkert is Professor in retirement at the Mathematical Institute of Bonn University, where he is particularly concerned with the history of mathematics.
content.title_en: Bridge course Mathematics for Economists

content.text: - Energy Change in Germany: Challenges - Solutions - Future Perspectives. Folding text: How can one implement climate protection successfully on the ground? After more than 20 years of climate protection policy, authors take stock of how climate protection can be implemented under unfavourable conditions. The versatile compilation of the contributions is intended to help readers to recognize the economic and technological and above all socio-political changes of this time and to draw lessons from them for the future of climate protection and energy transition. Climate protection is currently gaining great popularity through the "Fridays for Future" movement. The next generation wants to know what needs to be done differently so that it can be better in the future. In addition, the editor Udo Sahling was brutally confronted with what the high import dependence of fossil fuels means and that there is only a renewable path. The work addresses these aspects and is intended to encourage the participation in an emission-free future design.
content.title_en: Climate protection and energy transition in Germany : Challenges - Contributions to solutions - Future prospects

content.text: Antisemitisms : Explorations in the field of education. What prevention options are there in the field of education for the prevention of antisemitism? How can future teachers be qualified for the handling of antisemitisms? What can be done if an anti-Semitic incident occurs at a school or university? In this volume experts from a wide range of disciplines answer such and other important questions. They use their relevant research results and rich practical experiences. The overview of all contributions opens up new perspectives and shows how teachers: inside, teaching, schools and universities can take on their social responsibility against antisemitism.
content.title_en: Antisemitisms : Educational Exploratory Studies

content.text: The famous sentence from the novel Der Leopard is something like the unofficial motto of moderate conservatism. Parties like the CDU arranged with changes and proved to be anchors of stability. Today, it is no longer certain whether the right centre holds: continue to put their representatives on balance and cautious modernization? Or on polarizing cultural struggle? In the Federal Republic of Germany, the last Merkel years were marked by union-internal conflict of direction. But not least, Donald Trump's rise has shown that the identity crisis of the right centre is not an exclusive German phenomenon: in Italy Berlusconi and radical right-wing parties like Giorgio Melonis Fratelli d'Italia filled the vacuum created by the implosion of the Democrazia Cristiana. In France, the Républicains between Macron and Le Pen hardly play a role anymore. content.text: The new concept of freedom is a radical expression of a passionate voice of contemporary philosophy. Rarely was freedom discussed as intensively as in the pandemic: freedom to travel, to move freely, to meet people where you want to. But how future-proof is such a spatially defined concept of freedom, since we are looking at times when the places where it can be lived are dwindling and climate crisis or wars make whole regions uninhabitable? The philosopher Eva von Redecker thinks freedom completely new: as the freedom to live in a place where we could stay. Freedom of stay unfolds temporally. As a future-liveable freedom, it not only puts the preservation of our basis of life in view, it also reduces the distance between the freedom of the individual and her community. Freedom of stay can only be established together. And it grows when we share it. IT basic knowledge should be available.
content.title_en: Dummies database systems

The main thing is to get a job in the classroom. The main thing is to get a job in the classroom. The main thing is to get a job in the classroom. The main thing is to get a job in the classroom. content.text: The physical internship / Jörn Große-Knetter and Peter Schaaf ; Volume 2. The handbook 2022/23 is the "Guide to the physics internship for students of physics at the Georg-August-University Göttingen. The internship for the Bachelor of Science in physics is conducted in conjunction with the lectures Experimental Physics I...IV and comprises a total of 25 experiments. The content-like basic internship for the two-faced Bachelor comprises a total of 15 experiments. This volume deals with 14 experiments on the topics of waves, optics and quantum physics.
content.title_en: The physical internship / Jörn Große-Knetter and Peter Schaaf; Volume 2

content.text: Adult education in an international perspective: Limits and opportunities. The volume deals in two ways with the internationalization and internationality of adult education. On the one hand, an internal perspective on the research landscape is taken by the fact that specific internationalization phenomena of adult and further education find a contextualized presentation. On the other hand, externally induced research questions are addressed and discussed under the perspective of their internationality. The contributors make visible both reactive and anticipative movements and dynamics as well as opportunities and limits of internationalization. This volume addresses internationalization and internationality of adult education in two ways. On the one hand, it takes an internal perspective on the research landscape by contextualized specific phenomena of internationalization in adult education and learning. On the other hand, externally induced research questions are addressed from the perspective of their internationality. Both-reactive and anticipatory dynamics as well as limitations of internationalization.
content.title_en: Adult education in an international perspective : Limits and opportunities

content.text: About mobility: Historical aspects of techniques, cultures and utopias of movement. The history of mobility in the 20th century has always been characterised by fascination and hope for the future. Kurt Möser's essayist texts show this for many aspects of automotive mass motorization as well as for amphibious vehicles or electric airships. His cultural-historical perspective strongly explains why mobility cannot be reduced to the formula, how one gets from A to B at a low price. Möser's case studies illustrate how emotionally charged the use of mobility machines has always been - and indeed also in terms of their "dark" aggressive sides. The long line of mobility history, as it is developed here, provokes doubts as to whether current concepts for a mobility turn adequately take into account the cultural dimension of mobility.
content.title_en: About Mobility : Historical about techniques, cultures and utopias of transportation

content.text: Social policies against poverty. Even if the consequences of the unification have not least worsened the framework conditions for effective poverty prevention and poverty reduction, alternative strategies for a needs-based poverty policy are now more urgent than ever. The contributions of this volume focus on the analysis of traditional structural deficits and the changing framework conditions for social policy interventions on the poverty problem at national and local level. On the other hand, they outline strategic approaches and instruments for a more effective policy on poverty reduction and avoidance for various social policy areas and discuss their conditions and implications.
content.title_en: Social policies against poverty

content.text: Digital Capital in Use : an Ethnography on the Transformation of Digital Practices in Art Education. For some time now, the education at art universities has been increasingly discussing questions about the relationship between digital and analogue practices, between technical know-how and artistic idea, as well as between university offerings and individual orientations for action. Using theses in art, design and art mediation, the authors investigate which digital practices students use, on which skills and knowledge they use and how their use is evaluated. In this way, they show potential connections between the discourse on digital transformation and the educational opportunities of art students.
content.title_en: Digital Capital in Use: an Ethnography on the Transformation of Digital Practices in Art Education

content.text: Webdesign : Interface design - Screendesign - Mobile web design. This volume of the "Library of Media Design" deals with the conception and design of web applications with a focus on screen and interface design for mobile devices. For this library the topics of the compendium of media design were restructured, completely revised and brought into a handy format. Guidelines were the adaptation to the developments in the advertising and media industry as well as the consideration of the current framework plans and study regulations as well as examination requirements of the training and study programmes. The volumes of the "Library of Media Design" contain numerous practical tasks with sample solutions and are suitable as teaching and work books at schools and universities as well as for self-study. Preface -- Introduction -- Writing technology -- Interface design -- Screendesign -- Mobile web design -- Index.
content.title_en: Webdesign : Interface design - Screendesign - Mobiles Webdesign

metadata.authors: Sinner, Dominik; Bühler, Peter; Schlaich, Patrick

content.text: The volume includes the educational scientific discussions and research perspectives that open up in the tension between normalization and pathologisation within the school. Considerations and studies on processes of individualization or social debates on school heterogeneity and social inequality are included here as well as the relevance of medical-psychiatric and psychological discourses for pedagogy. This results in diverse questions on general aspects of educational science in the context of conceptual education, the (ethical and political) discussion about participation, equal opportunities or educational equity as well as current debates about the institution of school and education systems – for example in the context of inclusion – and about understanding of professions.
content.title_en: School and pathology

content.text: Professional recognition in the system of institutional day care for children: contexts, processes, evaluation. Recognition of qualifications acquired abroad is seen as an important tool in current scientific and policy debates to remedy the shortage of skilled workers in day care for children. However, the challenges associated with this have so far been examined only marginally in the specialist discussion. The volume starts here and addresses the recognition of international degrees in the field of day care for children in different contexts and from different perspectives, which largely result from the evaluation of the project »Vielfalt welcome« of the Robert Bosch Stiftung.
content.title_en: Professional recognition in the system of institutional day care for children : contexts, processes, evaluation

content.text: The Department of Sports and Sports Education is a number of subjects of the Department of Sports and Sports Studies. The Department of Sports and Sports Education is a group of the Department of Sports and Sports Education. The Department of Sports and Sports Education is a group of the Department of Sports and Sports Education. The Department of Sports and Sports Education is a group of the Department of Sports and Sports Education. The Department of Sports and Sports Education is a group of the Department of Sports and Sports Education. The Department of Sports and Sports Education provides a comprehensive overview of the central medical, movement and training science topics in sports. The Department of Sports and Sports Education is aimed at the general public of the specialists, teachers and scientists in sports, sports science and health professions. The Department of Sports and Sports Education is a comprehensive and competent overview of the state of science. The Department of Sports and Sports Education replaces the Department of Sports and Sports Education.
content.title_en: Exercise, Training, Performance and Health : Handbook Sports and Sports Science

content.text: Knowledge-based science, how to use knowledge in the enterprise with the help of artificial intelligence, and how to use knowledge in the enterprise. The future workplace is increasingly shaped by knowledge work. Knowledge-based science deals with concepts, methods and processes for systematically generating, extracting, storing and providing knowledge to solve problems, and can thus be assigned to knowledge management. Cognitive assistants ensure that the right knowledge is provided at the right time in the right way to their users. In order to achieve this, numerous methods of artificial intelligence (AI) are now used to support different tasks of knowledge management. The contentHow can AI methods support knowledge-based knowledge-based knowledge-based knowledge-based management in companies? This book characterizes the workplace of the future and highlights the importance of knowledge and its management. The aim is not to replace people with AI, but to use cognitive assistants to best support them in their work. Which areas of the enterprise can be optimized or completely transformed by artificial intelligence methods? Which steps are both organizationally and technically necessary and how individual methods are actually used in this field of knowledge analysis?
content.title_en: Knowledge Science – Case Studies : How Artificial Intelligence Supports Knowledge Security and Use in the Company

content.text: In the last 20 years, new forms of cooperation have been developed in the framework of youth assistance with »coordination centres«, »partnerships« and »interdisciplinary advisory bodies« in various cities and counties. They aim to establish sustainable working alliances in the helper system on the one hand and to develop flexible settings that the young people can endure. Often, innovative projects are also created in this context, which enrich the youth support landscape. In the book, practitioners present the organizational models they have developed, report on the cross-media work on cases and show innovative effects of these cooperations with a view to the youth support structures. The editorial team reflects and comments on the contributions. Renowned scientists contribute the results of their first evaluations.
content.title_en: Crisis in educational aid: cooperation, risk partnerships, responsibility communities

content.text: Biographies in Germany: sociological reconstructions of lived social history. German contemporary history in the 20th century is also the history of the appropriation of the various forms of society in life stories. The emergence of social and state systems, their transformation and decline is supported and reflected in biographies in Germany. The collection combines research work of sociological biography research and discussions immediately after the unification of Germany by scientists from the old and new federal states.
content.title_en: Biographies in Germany : sociological reconstructions of lived social history

content.text: Individual action and common good : an interdisciplinary theory of action in the context of freedom, responsibility and artificial intelligence. In the case of conflicts in the private or professional context and in social or military conflicts, there are always certain questions: Why does someone do something like this? What motives and thoughts play a role in this? Could another action have improved or prevented the situation? Gerhard Tulodziecki designs an interdisciplinary theory of action to get closer to answering such questions. In this context, it is also about freedom of decision and responsibility in action - also in view of the increasing use of artificial intelligence. Thus, there are various suggestions for the assessment of action in everyday life, occupation and politics as well as for the reflection of one's own action.
content.title_en: Individual action and common good : an interdisciplinary theory of action in the context of freedom, responsibility and artificial intelligence

content.text: The AI was! : from absurd to deadly: the pitfalls of artificial intelligence. That algorithms decide about people and their future seems inevitable - we are all long ago exposed to the judgments of artificial intelligence: more and more companies are automatically evaluating applications, and more and more people are getting information or information prepared by machines. However, not all of these algorithmic decisions are correct, there are always cases in which AI discriminates, innocents are accused of a crime or even endanger life. Katharina Zweig, a widely excellent computer science professor, explains entertainingly and with exciting current cases how we can recognize wrong decisions and resist them. Because we should know what we need to be careful about, so that algorithms play according to our rules and not according to their own. Where artificial intelligence is mistaken and why it is committed to us allGermany's leading socio-informatics specialist explains by means of many examples of our everyday life, how we can recognize false software decisions - and how we can resist them 2023 will be able to adopt the artificial intelligence act at EU level - and how the digitally-based branch should be adopted by us - 25.
content.title_en: The AI was : from absurd to lethal: the pitfalls of artificial intelligence

content.text: Building sites of the nation: what we have to change now in Germany. It crumbles at the foundations of our state. Whether with the degraded infrastructure, the catastrophic deficits in the education sector or the little-hearted energy transition: Germany has slept and slowed down reforms and investments for years. Philip Banse and Ulf Buermeyer describe the most important problems and outline solutions: What must happen to ensure that the wind power expansion finally succeeds? How do we catch up with the backlog in digitisation? How do we make sure that Germany's roads and schools no longer literally crumble, that the railways function reliably again and that the pensions are finally really safe?
content.title_en: Building sites of the nation: what we need to change now in Germany

content.text: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning with R: Applications in the field of business analytics. In a VUCA world that proves to be increasingly unstable, uncertain and more complex, it is important for companies, organizations and states to respond promptly and adequately to the respective situations. Making decisions based on past experiences is less successful than an accurate understanding of the current conditions in these times. The importance of empirical sciences, the permanent observation of the environment, the timely analysis of effects and the resulting gain of new insights is increasing. From this it is possible to derive which measures are suitable with a predictable probability for achieving their own goals, e.g. the price of an offer generates the desired demand or the marketing measure reaches a desired target group. Where classical statistics for calculations and predictions were used earlier, today allow free (open source) tools such as R data in various formats and from any number of sources for analysis, for example, to be read and analyzed with the help of artificial intelligence and machine learning methods. Where classical statistics were used for calculations and predictions, the results can then be perfectly visualized by the use of the term of the term, and the term of the term of the term is effectively achieved by means of the term of the term.
content.title_en: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning with R : Applications in Business Analytics

content.text: All and nothing to say: the state of debate in digital modernism. Is a liberal society pulling away the ground on which it should stand? An essay on what digital mass communication does to people in the interpersonal world. Nothing has changed living together as extensively as digitalisation – we think, feel and argue differently since we are permanently connected and overinformed. The effects affect everyone, no matter how much they use the new media at all. It is a stress test for society: the abundance of knowledge, speed, transparency and indelibility is unchannelled, no value in itself. Democracy-politically important this becomes in the much-intoxicated debate culture. Because the forms of dealing with the so-called social media have long since passed over the other arenas, politics and journalism play already according to the new, merciless rules. Previously recognized authorities are being cleared up in the dozen without new ones coming after the better argument, because the narrow delegitimization of the opponent has been replaced by the short-terms. A functioning public – as a marketplace of opinions and place of social clarification – there seems to be a break in Eva's, and an essay, and a lot of questions are still being addressed.
content.title_en: All and nothing to say : the state of debate in digital modernism

content.text: Technology as consolation : promises of artificial intelligence. Promises of artificial intelligence (AI) are speculative ascriptions of meaning and promises of salvation that make AI a collective comfort project - according to Stefan Selke. In a meta-study he compares four prototypical narratives of the future and draws on sources from technical texts to science fiction. His socio-scientific 360-degree view of the opaque phenomenon AI makes clear: promises play a central role in the future, technically shaped world design. Thanks to the innovative approach to the subject, not only scientists are addressed, but all those who have an interest in AI and other transformational topics as well as an expansion of the discourse.
content.title_en: Technology as comfort : promises of artificial intelligence

content.text: New Networking: the smart way to digital visibility and sovereign networks. Wake-up call, encouragement and guidance for better visibility in self-determined work and networks. Beautiful new (working) world? Rather not. Kathrin Koehler often experiences reservations in her coachings about the "self-presentation" on internal and external digital platforms such as LinkedIn, Instagram, etc. She hears the voices of the inner critics: inside and she experiences over-stress and discouragement day after day. Therefore, her mission is to encourage the new working world as well as the communication channels associated with it to understand as an opportunity for personal development and to use as a stage of professional communication. In this book Kathrin Koehler directs the context of New Work and New Networking and explores in interviews the overcoming of blockages, smart tactics for introverted, content development and design, time management, handling with multi-consistency by a multitude of active networkers in the company and much more. She then takes the reader: in a step-by-step guide for better professional positioning with a learning journey to develop the new network potential in the process of communicating and communicating.
content.title_en: New Networking: the smart way to digital visibility and sovereign networks

content.text: Preface About the author 1 The cleanroom provides an industry 2 Odyssey 2023 – Planlos in den Reinraum 3 Mensch oder Maschinen: Who dominates the cleanroom of the future? 4 Cleanroom technology contra germs 5 Cleanroom technology contra particles Index This book gives an overall overview of modern cleanroom technology. Written by a leading expert and pioneer in this field, it is intended as a reader-friendly introduction for newcomers and as inspiration for experienced practitioners. The book deals with the historical development as well as the most important aspects of planning, personnel and training. Subsequently a wide range of applications are discussed, including those where microbiological exclusion is required (hospital, medicine, pharmaceuticals, food) and those where a particle exclusion is required (automobile, semiconductor, plastics processing, space technology).
content.title_en: Location advantage cleanroom technology : with know-how of today to the technologies of tomorrow

content.text: Digitalization of building: The basis for a sovereign, sustainable and knowledge-centered application of IT. The book provides planners, engineers and decision-makers with a guide on how to use the possibilities of digitalization in the construction sector in a confident and meaningful manner. Opportunities, challenges and risks are demonstrated, the IT principles and techniques are summarized and their application explained by practical examples. In order to use the associated methods as a construction worker, application scenarios and the design of digital measures are deepened. This enables the reader to quickly adapt and apply open technologies. The content Global challenge and eco-centricity Industrialization, digitalization and social trade Data management, information technology and communication infrastructure Project management, planning processes and problem solving strategies Integration of different system levels and components Application examples and building of competences The target groups Architecture and technical planning offices, executive companies, operators and service providers of construction systems Scientists of construction and adjacent disciplines The author Dr.-Ing. Fabian C. Schmid is a professor for digital. design and production at the Augsburg University of Applied Sciences and Humanities and builds the study program of the digital construction master on the international front page.
content.title_en: Digitalisation of construction: the basis for a sovereign, sustainable and knowledge-centered application of IT

Each phase is clearly defined and stored with tried and tested tools. The aim is to implement improvements (Six Sigma according to DMAIC) or to the development of new solutions (Design for Six Sigma according to PIDOV).
content.title_en: Apply Six Sigma : Zero Error Management in Practice

content.text: Historical production logics of technical knowledge : Helmut Maier on his 65th birthday. The contributions gathered in this volume are dedicated to Helmut Maier on his 65th birthday. Maier has opened up pioneering perspectives for the history of technology, the environment and science with numerous widely received monographs and manuals. This applies especially to his fundamental research on the history of the engineering sciences in the first half of the 20th century and his interest in specific and collective biographies of the actors involved. The contributions of this commemorative publication take up these impulses of Maier under the title ›historical production logics of technical knowledge‹ and develop them further for the topics of an interdisciplinary panorama of current research fields.
content.title_en: Historical production logics of technical knowledge : Helmut Maier for his 65th birthday

content.text: Optics. The standard work of optics for over 25 years: Readers appreciate this textbook mainly because of its balanced didactic concept. It explains the mathematics of wave movement in an easily understandable way and deals in detail with both classical and modern methods of optics. The author's aim is to standardize the optics within the framework of a few, overarching concepts, so that students get a coherent picture in themselves. The 8th edition is rounded off by numerous, didactically excellently prepared illustrations and many current photos. Over 800 exercise tasks of various difficulty levels, which are largely available with complete solutions, enable the student to independently check his knowledge.
content.title_en: Optics

content.text: Cities are starting off at the road. Places and cities have developed along roads. In recent decades, the constant expansion of motorized individual traffic and the structural response to its noise have strongly shaped the spatial structure along the roads and, in many places, together with the lack of quality of residence have led to inhospitable urban spaces. This finding is based on urban development starting at the road and is trying to remedy it. The book, which has emerged from many years of research by the Institute Urban Landscape of the ZHAW in Winterthur, shows ways in which the roads become a backbone of local and urban development from the problem case. Using analyses and photo documentation, today's qualities and challenges are discussed. With concrete examples from Switzerland, Germany and Austria, the book shows strategies on how the challenges of climate adaptation, mobility, noise and the relation to the district structure can be thought integrally and roads can become quality-filled public spaces again.
content.title_en: Urban planning starts at the road

content.text: Education for a digital future. The volume summarizes research on the digitalization of the German education system. It deals with the function and meaningful use of digital media for teaching and learning, and also with the distinction between educational processes that are designed using digital media, and educational processes that are addressed by digitalization. The editors Dr. Katharina Scheiter is Professor of Digital Education at the University of Potsdam. Dr. Dr. h.c. mult. Ingrid Gogolin is a senior professor at the Faculty of Education at the University of Hamburg. Digitality and Learning: Digital Writing Promotion in an Educational Context -- Digital No-Man's Land? An Inventory of Digital Education at German Children's Days Institutions -- Use of Digital Media for Bilingual Learning Arrangements in the Submersion. Opportunities, Challenges and Researchdesiderata - Digitality and Learning Competence: A systematic review of research investigating teachers-related supplies on ICT reality in Teacher Education From 2010 to 2020 - Research perspectives on the handling of teaching in a digital future.
content.title_en: Education for a digital future

content.text: Ethicals of the appropriation: cultural appropriation. White musicians with dreadlocks, Indian costumes in carnival, European models in kimono – under the slogan of "cultural appropriation" – are the adoption of practices, styles and expressions from other cultures taken and criticized. Is this to be understood as over-grid, even racist – especially when profit is being made from it? Again and again prominent artists and artists, but also persons in their everyday activities, are accused of using the cultural property of other groups, usually marginalized. What basic assumptions are behind this accusation, and how can it be assessed? Jens Balzer shows that both sides often make themselves too easy in this debate. Thus, those who raise the accusation of cultural appropriation would often have little understanding that any culture is based on hybridity and practices of appropriation. On the other hand, there is no indication of any reproach in this direction, often the insight that cultural appropriation is actually made, the situation is problematically acceptable, the situation is based on ethics, the approach of the abuser, the approach of the abuser, the approach of the abuser, the approach of the abuser, the approach of the abuser.
content.title_en: Ethics of appropriation : on cultural appropriation

As a good news editor, the business manager has become more active and more active. content.title_en: Modern software engineering : developing better software faster and more effectively

content.text: IFRS made easy: an introduction to the International Financial Reporting Standards. Here, the International Financial Reporting Standards are presented in an easily understandable and proven case-oriented way. From the content:– Accounting and financial statements according to IFRS – related and capital market-oriented companies – Initial and subsequent valuation – Accounting of assets and liabilities – Financial instruments and leasing relationships. An indispensable learning aid for the exam, but also support in everyday work.
content.title_en: IFRS made easy : an introduction to the International Financial Reporting Standards

content.text: Digital transformation is not only a technological challenge, it is a pervasive process and the overall organisation of the hospital: diagnostics and therapy, processes and procedures, documentation and communication will change radically. In addition to numerous opportunities, digital transformation also involves risks that require new rules of play in the handling of data and technology. Not least, uncertainties arise when assessing and solving difficult decision-making situations – not only in technical but also in ethical and legal dimensions. "Digital hospital" provides the responsible persons with tools for action and knowledge to optimally shape the process of change. Accordingly, technological basic knowledge is conveyed as well as the entire practical knowledge for all relevant areas in which decisions about the implementation of IT infrastructure and process modifications can be made, as well as investment and personnel decisions. In addition, digital transformation is also addressed in its social, ethical, psychological and not least economic dimension. By its very nature, data protection and information security, including the legal regulations as well as the influence of digitalization on the role of the patients and their digitalisation, requires a high degree of behaviour and participation.
content.title_en: The Digital Hospital

content.text: Packing is seduction: Decryption of the packaging code. Customers buy packs, not products. Packing is intended to increase the attractiveness of products, signal rational and emotional benefits and lead them to purchase. Discover the possibilities of the various packaging codes in this book and use their potential.The author refers to insights from psychology for packaging design and describes the methods chosen to pack and charge goods with meanings.Known examples from the consumer goods and food industry illustrate the value increase that can be achieved with the right packaging.Contents:Material and social basic codes: Material, size, shape, male, female etc.Design and staging options for packagingEffectiveness of packaging: Aesthetics, differentiation, fascination, benefits of cognitive psychology for packaging designExcursions in the semiotics: How do we communicate?Checklist for the analysis of the packaging codeNew in the second edition:The code of sustainability and environmental awarenessTraum of eternal youth – Food supplementsHealth-related sweets and supplements in the online book.
content.title_en: Packaging is seduction : Decryption of the pack code

content.text: Architecture Psychology Perspectives: Volume 3 Design and Process. How does the encounter of psychology and architecture take place during the design and planning process? In which planning phase is architecture psychology knowledge relevant and usable? What insights does urban architecture psychology provide for urban discourse? In this book, renowned experts from Germany, the Netherlands and Switzerland bring their pioneering knowledge from the disciplines of architecture, psychology, urban design, color design and communication psychology.The content Architecture psychology as a co-designer: A new approach in architecture Participation in design planning, important building block user-oriented design experience and design color as a design tool: The design of the effect of light and surface colors in relation to the experience and behaviour of man in built space Emerging and growing: A phenomenal view of man and space Emotional quality of cities: His The target groups Architects, psychologists, city designers, environmental designers, architects, students and all interested in architecture psychology The editor Martina Guhl is an architect, architectural psychologist and author of the subject of the study of the study of architecture psychology established the concept of the concept of the concept of architecture psychology and the concept of the concept of the concept of the concept of architecture.
content.title_en: Architecture Psychology Perspectives : Volume 3 Design and Process

content.text: General schools in migration society: diversity-sensitive approaches and perspectives. Migration is a fundamental factor in our society and contributes significantly to the diversification of society. This influence is not least evident in educational institutions. The second volume of the series "Migration, Diversity and Education" outlines current challenges for the field of action of general schools in migration society and derives scientific, educational and educational policy choices from them. Educational professionalization is also taken into account. The volume provides an overview of central current discourse fields as well as empirical findings in individual fields of action, on topics such as the representation of migration-social aspects in the curricula, the social relevance of teacher formation, on racialism-critical perspectives on language, on the transnationality of pupils and the need to take into account various religious-world-viewal orientations of young people in schools.
content.title_en: General education schools in the migration society : diversity-sensitive approaches and perspectives

content.text: Digitalization in the teacher: Digital design of practice. Inter-divisional perspectives: Media education in school and teachers:Internal education -- Basic information skills for all teachers -- Digitalization-related diagnostic skills -- Specific perspectives: Digital skills in the education and further education of special education:Inside -- Training of digitalisation-related competences for teaching in heterogeneous learning groups -- Digital competences for addressing teachers in the natural sciences Promote specialist knowledge-related skills of teaching staff -- Professional digitalisation-related competences of teaching staff students -- Application scenarios: Planning and implementation of e-assessments -- Digital historical collections as a format of history teachers:Internal education -- Digital pupils:Internal feedback as a basis for data-based evaluation of teaching in English -- Outlook: Distributing digitalisation-related competences between university and school. The volume discusses cross-disciplinary concepts and structures for the anchoring of digitalisation-related competences in the teaching staff of the university.
content.title_en: Digitalisation in teachers: In-school education : Digital design of practice

content.text: ChatGPT in History Class. Is ChatGPT a game-changer for history class? What challenges need to be considered? How can ChatGPT strengthen history consciousness and promote the ability to historical analysis? This book shows how AI technology can enrich teaching by enabling learners to conduct interactive dialogues with historical figures or simulate historical events. With practical instructions, methodological-didactical classification and ready-to-use copy templates, the band offers concrete suggestions to successfully integrate AI in teaching, thereby personalizing it and thus enabling a deeper understanding of history.
content.title_en: ChatGPT in History Classes

content.text: The children's adventure of the game are the children's adventure of the day of the environment. The children's adventure of the day of the environment are the main challenges for the education. To overcome them, a wealth of methods is needed. This volume offers such a treasure. It enables them to playfully set off on the path and to sensitize themselves to nature as well as to interpersonal dynamics in the group. Its central concern is to awaken curiosity and fascination and to revive. This is the basis from which a growing commitment to life in greater harmony with nature arises. In the introductory part you will find detailed information on the target group-oriented selection and presentation of the games, on the organization of the difficulty, on the reflection of the group process and on other questions of the game management. In the main part you will follow 124 illustrated game descriptions on 15 different topics such as "Nahrungsnetze", "Die Welt der Insekten" (Life on the water), "Verkeitung der Verfolfen Lebensformen" (Mübelheits) or "Mübelbehung" (Biological Day) - The following topics are considered in the topic of the topic of the topic of nature.
content.title_en: Adventure Nature in the game : a collection for experiencing, discovering and learning together
