content.text: Theory and method in religious studies : contemporary approaches to the study of religion. This book presents psychological, sociological, social and cultural, anthropological, historical and phenomenological approaches in the field of Regligionology. Also covered are myths and other religious texts as well as the study of religions in its full breadth and in a global context.
content.title_en: Theory and method in religious studies : contemporary approaches to the study of religion

content.text: The peace movement wants to become a serious voice in social debates again, and it must urgently reform itself. The peace-ethical and political issues in the course of the Russian war of aggression against Ukraine, as under the fire glass, have led them to the dead end: the ideological legacy of the past, the lack of scientific knowledge and the drifting away into populist discourses. On the basis of a critical location determination, Johannes Ludwig shows what reforms are needed to make the peace movement sustainable.
content.title_en: Farewell to pacifism? : how the peace movement can reinvent itself

content.text: This class or educational media is one of the central categories in the self-description of modern societies, whose individual and social dimensions are repeatedly discussed, questioned and defended. But what is understood by performance in historical perspective and in the face of current transformations? And how did and becomes the category in school and educational media become effective? To this end, the band gathers answers that draw on a variety of theories, stories and methods to reflect the complexity, ambivalences and tensions of the topic. It becomes clear that the category of performance, although deconstructed, cannot be easily abolished and overcome. Performance is one of the central classifications in the self-descriptions of modern societies, who individual and social dimensions are repeatedly being affected, asked and defended. But how is performance under historic or in the sensitive aspects of education.
content.title_en: Transformations of performance in school and educational media

content.text: The retrained left-handed or the node in the brain. R. W. Meyer (BA 4/92) is based in his current advisor, except for A. Zuckrigl (BA 6/92) and B. Olsson (ID 33/89) on J. B. Sattler, psychologist and head of the advisory and information centre for left-handed and retrained left-handed, Munich. Here the author herself, who, after many years of research and experience, based on the data of thousands of helpers and counselors, presents the result of a profound examination of the retrained hubridness in dependence on brain hemispheric lateralization: "The conversion of innate hubridity is one of the most massive interventions in the human brain without bloodshed, without pathological under-supplies with oxygen and nutrients or addition of toxins." Comprehensive, basic work, fascinating thanks to the examples of practice. (2) (Heidi Lotter)
content.title_en: The Retrained Left Hand or The Node in the Brain

content.text: Task Collection Technical Mechanics 2. This book is dedicated to elastostatics, i.e. the determination of tensions and deformations in elastic bodies, and provides a comprehensive collection of tasks with complete solutions. Students are thus able to approach the topic using calculated examples and to solve it independently on the basis of engineering tasks of elastostatics. The book is addressed to students at universities of applied sciences and universities of those degree programmes in which elastostatics play a role. The target group The book is aimed at students of engineering at universities and universities. The author Univ.-Prof. Dr.-Ing. habil. Christian Mittelstedt has been head of the department "Light Construction and Structural Mechanics" at the Department of Mechanical Engineering at the Technical University of Darmstadt since August 2016.
content.title_en: Tasks Collection Technical Mechanics 2

content.text: Integral leadership skills : Action strategies for uncertain times. Uncertainty characterizes the everyday business, both in the economic context and at the level of operative leadership. Many years of research show that leaders typically use four action strategies in uncertain times. Based on these action patterns, an integrally effective strategy is developed. This shows four competences with which leaders can work successfully in uncertain situations - this approach is independent of personality, learning and teaching, and is now successfully validated by the author. The work thus provides a concise and precise action instruction, which is particularly suitable for practical use.
content.title_en: Integral leadership skills : strategies for unsafe times

content.text: Augmented Reality in Marketing : Create customer experiences along the customer journey. Augmented Reality – the expansion of reality through digital elements – in e-commerce is a diverse application. The course of customer journey offers a useful structure to demonstrate a systematic classification of different augmented reality applications. Thus, it is clear from diverse examples that the possibilities of this technology are still far from exhausted and have great potential for many companies. The content Augmented Reality – Development and Technologies The customer journey and its specificities Augmented Reality applications in the various phases of customer journey use cases: Lego and Adidas The target groups Scientists and students who want to get an introduction to the topic AR Practitioner who wants to gain a systematic overview of AR applications The author Vittoria of Gizycki is Professor of General Business Economics, especially Marketing, at the University of Economics and Law Berlin (HWR). Moreover, she takes on teaching assignments on the topic of e-commerce and digital media. Her particular interest in the development of the market is the reality of the market.
content.title_en: Augmented reality in marketing : creating customer experiences along the customer journey

content.text: Death and taboo in the pandemic : Cultural economic lessons from the Covid-19 policy. Crises shake social thinking about life and death. In the COVID-19 pandemic, the individuality of the human being was protected by the taboo of collective death. The virus forced politics to take sides for the elderly in the balance between health and freedom protection. Ernst Mohr provides a cultural economic autopsy of the Covid-19 policy with lessons for the future. He focuses on the self-protective host organism human and develops a crisis rationality that meets existential crises. A concissant view of an event that will not have been the last of its kind - and a plea for the breaking up of taboos
content.title_en: Death and taboo in the pandemic : Cultural economic lessons from Covid-19 policy

content.text: Didactics in a culture of digitality: powerful media didactics, forward-looking educationals. This is not going away again. The fact that digital change is irreversible in our society underlines the need for intensive examination of digital technologies in schools. However, when evaluating the use of digital media, the argument of learning success is often used exclusively. This is not in line with the changes that result from the transformation of leading media. How can the effectiveness of a media didactics be determined, what are the aspects and criteria of effective media didactics and how can they be legitimized? Only a theoretical and practical approach that relates to the new possibilities of digital teaching leads us to a forward-looking educational system. This collection volume should be a contribution to supporting teachers and educators in the integration of digital media in teaching and to using new opportunities for future-oriented educationals. We want to stimulate reflection on previous approaches and to highlight new possibilities for digital education to contribute to better school education.
content.title_en: Didactics in a culture of digitality : Powerful media didactics, forward-looking pedagogy

content.text: Sound Design: the virtual sound world of the film. In the mid-1970s, the aesthetic vocabulary of the film sound began to change conspicuously. Suddenly, screaming jets swarmed over the heads of the audience and helicopters through all four quadrants of the cinema space. Newly, the Dolby stereo logo and the professional title Sound Designer appeared on the screen. A generation of sound-sustained directors such as Francis Ford Coppola, George Lucas and Martin Scorsese had also recognized the suggestive potential of total sound. Sound Design - the virtual sound world of the film analyses the latest sound aesthetic developments of American mainstream film. The book illuminates conventions and apparent self-evidentness and opens the door to the complex architecture of the filmic sound track
content.title_en: Sound Design : the virtual sound world of the film

content.text: Basic knowledge Inductive statistics: with tasks, exams and solutions. Inductive statistics offers numerous applications in practice, including estimation functions, hypothesis tests and samples from real aggregates. In a compact way, the book presents the basic knowledge of inductive statistics: it conveys the relevant terms, methods and problems. It also shows in which context the inductive statistics are applied in the economic and social sciences. A formula part, tasks with solutions and sample exams help to deepen the learned knowledge quickly.
content.title_en: Basic knowledge Inductive statistics : with tasks, exams and solutions

content.text: Joint task Climate protection in schools : a guide : with e-book inside. This book offers a guide for more climate protection in schools and brings school leaders, teachers and pupils: in the boat together – because climate protection is a joint task. The »Whole School Approach« initiates the holistic implementation of climate protection activities in school development and facilitates them at school level. The aim is to strengthen teachers: in their design skills for more climate protection – this is done by concrete proposals for working with pupils: in schools. Participative methods of participation are to give pupils: empower and teachers ideas to increase their own self-effectiveness, but also those of the students: inside. The central message is: a climate protection project at school is essential for the structural anchoring of education for sustainable development in school life. The guide gives • suggestions for teaching design • suggestions for the development of a climate protection guide image, • instructions for building management, • ideas for the integration of the school environment.
content.title_en: Joint task Climate protection in schools : a guide : with e-book inside

content.text: Review of Facility Management : An audit guide. Facility management covers the entire life cycle of buildings and related outdoor facilities. Vulnerabilities in operation or late integration into the design of real estate can quickly affect the costs of investment, use and operation. This guide, developed by the DIIR working group "Construction, operation and maintenance", systematically looks at the many audit approaches to facility management: - Governance and operator responsibility, IKS and risk management - Technical building management: Technical object management, maintenance, conversions and modernizations, energy management, supply and disposal - Infrastructural building management: Cleaning, outdoor facilities, security, area management and other services - Commercial building management: Contracts and procurement, controlling, insurance, etc. The all-round updated 2nd edition of the practical book supports you with many hundred possible audit questions on all risk-relevant areas.
content.title_en: Review of Facility Management : An Audit Guide

content.text: Object-Oriented Software Development with UML. - For all those who want to deal with the workings of software development - Compact representation of object-oriented basic principles - Use of the current standard of UML - Discussion of agile and collaborative methods - Additional material: Solutions to the tasks; Source code in Java, C#, Eiffel, Pascal and Python; All images and interesting links - Your exclusive advantage: E-Book inside when buying the printed book The book provides an introduction to the object-oriented specification with UML (Unified Modeling Language), a standard for object-oriented software development. In addition to the use of the language elements of UML, methods for user-centric software development are presented and discussed. This starts with the analysis of requirements and their specification by scenarios and application case models. The idea of the design patterns is presented and the notation possibilities in UML are discussed. Examples of much used design patterns and their application in programming are supplemented by the content. Both state and activity diagrams are presented in detail. In addition, possibilities are also shown how the D-Input and Insurance are not listed in the UML-Input-Input-Input-Input-Input-Input-Input-Input-Input-Input-Input-Input-In.
content.title_en: Object-oriented software development with UML

content.text: Climate change in Germany: Development, consequences, risks and perspectives. This open access book describes the impact of climate change on the economy and society in Germany. It provides a well-founded, interdisciplinary basis for decisions in relation to climate change. How can we mitigate the consequences of climate change and how can we prepare ourselves? The national study presented here presents the current state of research on climate change comprehensively for all topics and social sectors. A total of 165 authors from all over the German-speaking world express themselves in 39 chapters on topics such as observed and future changes, weather disasters and their consequences. Expectations for the future, opportunities and risks as well as possible adaptation strategies are identified in tangible, open questions. Five chapters on mitigation and zero emission strategies show further possible ways out of the situation. The texts are written in comprehensible language and the most important thoughts are illustrated by graphics and tables. All contributions have been scientifically assessed several times. With the 2nd, revised and extended edition of climate change in Germany, the first comprehensive review on the topic complex from 2017 was updated and improved, seven chapters were added. The work focuses on a readership of the basic understanding of all the activities of climate change and the German economy.
content.title_en: Climate change in Germany : Development, consequences, risks and perspectives

content.text: Between the port and the horizon: world history of the seas. Here, historian North presents a 3,000-year history of seafaring on the oceans. The overview is supplemented by chapters on "Dangers and Endangers" (cruising, overfishing and fertilisation). Review: North is a historian at the University of Greifswald. With this hardcover he presents a 3,000-year-long history of seafaring. He has assigned individual chapters to the various world seas, supplemented by those on globalization and "Dangers and Endangers" (cruising, tanker, overfertilization and fishing). Unlike, for example, S. Winchester: "The Atlantic" (2012), this publication is prosaic and without excursions to other scientific disciplines. The text is generally understandable and satisfies scientific demands (sources, registers). The book provides a good overview, hardly refers to individual famous ships, explorers or sea wars. Black-white illustrations and maps are taken from the volume. The image material goes right to the present (the bathing guests are present).
content.title_en: Between the port and the horizon : World history of the seas

content.text: Politics with memory: Memorial sites in the dispute over the Nazi past. Public memory of the Nazi era is often controversial, especially when it is fixed on symbols such as memorial sites, memorial sites or rituals of memorial days; sometimes a dispute with sharpness and bitterness, such as the recent Holocaust memorial in Berlin. The Hamburg political scientist examines such a dispute about the memory culture on selected examples and thus draws on his book "Der schöne Schein des Thirte Reichs" (BA 8/91). Monuments: among others Krieger- und Antikriegsdenkmal Hamburg, Börneplatz Frankfurt; memorials: KZ Buchenwald, Dachau, Neuengamme u.a.; memorial sites: Berlin with Wannsee-Villa, Neuer Wache, Deutschem Historisches Museum etc.; memorial days: calendar memory and political scandals. Brisant current report on a central piece of German life and consciousness history. (2)
content.title_en: Politics with memory : Memorial sites in the struggle over the Nazi past

content.text: Your poverty is puking us! : Solidarity in the crisis. Klappentext: With the growth euphoria of the economic miracle years, the instruments of the welfare state have also come into crisis. No one was prepared for mass poverty and permanent unemployment. The reactions are often fantasies and heartless (site debate, dismantling of the welfare state) or even brutal ("Get out of sight! Your poverty is puking us!). This volume looks for answers that respond with ingenuity and sense of responsibility to the current crisis of solidarity.
content.title_en: Your poverty is puking us! : Solidarity in the crisis

content.text: The main features of the parking plan are: (i) the financing and management of parking spaces (ii) the promotion and financing of university parking spaces (iii) the calculation of the full cost of parking spaces (iii) the management of university parking spaces (including the function and effects of parking space management). (iv) the basics of the parking plans at universities (iii) the planning and approval procedures for the local authority (iv) the standard design procedure (iv) the building-related measurement and the design according to the balance of the location 5. the different design procedures 6. the special situation in the new countries). - Part D. the country reports (PHF/ Übern.)
content.title_en: Pitching at universities : basics of building regulations and their handling

content.text: Pollutants in the environment: chemical bases for the assessment of air, water and soil pollution. A textbook that, carefully worked on for German conditions, transports up-to-date data and investigation techniques. It deals mainly with basics: transport and behaviour of pollutants in the environment, their analysis and monitoring as well as, in the main part, the individual inorganic and organic pollutants with their chemical properties and toxic effects in air, water, soil. It also contains a short outline of German pollutant law and a separate chapter from U. Förster on common environmental analysis methods (reduction and avoidance of pollutant emissions). Clearly structured, with many tables and graphs. - In addition to C. B, "Environmental Chemistry" (BA 5/95) and A. Heintz: "Chemistry and Environment" (4th edition: BA 6/96). Especially indispensable for libraries at university sites. (2) (Helga Lüdtke) presents the organic and inorganic pollutants with their chemical properties and toxic effects; together with an outline of German pollutant law. (Helga Lüdtke)
content.title_en: Pollutants in the environment : chemical bases for the assessment of air, water and soil pollution

content.text: Small world : an academic romance. Satirical novel from the world of learned literary professors, which from one congress to another jettisons on the hunt for attention, erotic adventures and scientific fame.
content.title_en: Small world : an academic romance

content.text: The threatened future: are we endangering our fertility and survival?. Klappentext: The horror vision of a human-free earth could become a reality faster than we imagine. The zoologist and pharmacist Theo Colborn and her co-authors provide comprehensive information for the first time on a previously unknown consequence of global pollution: the dramatically decreasing fertility of humans and animals worldwide. An exciting science report, which also seeks solutions.
content.title_en: The threatened future: are we endangering our fertility and survival?

content.text: Global environmental protection as a distribution problem in the North-South conflict : Causes and solutions presented by the example of the grubbing-up of tropical rain forests. Klappentext: After an overview of the different concepts of "Sustainable Development", the author presents the example of the use of tropical forests, which sectors cause environmental damage and which macroeconomic contribution these sectors make. Subsequently, the causes of environmental damage in developing countries are discussed, e.g. sectoral incentives of economic policy, lack of property rights, population growth, poverty and debt. Subsequently, the efficiency and effectiveness of national and international policies are examined with the help of general equilibrium models.
content.title_en: Global environmental protection as a distribution problem in the North-South conflict : Causes and solutions presented by the example of the grubbing-up of tropical rain forests

content.text: For the biographie of the Moon, the biographie of the Moon is presented in detail. For the biographie of the Universe, the biographie of the Universe, the biographie of the Universe, the biographie of the Universe, the biographie of the Universe, the biographie of the Universe, the content.title_en: Biology of the Moon : Moon Periodics and Life rhythms

content.text: Energy : physical foundations of their production, transformation and use. Scientific and physical background information on the topic of energy. Compared to the preliminary edition of 1983 (see ID 47/83), the chapters on renewable energies and on the current and future use of energy have been changed and expanded. In addition to students, the target group is mainly specialist lighting from politics and business. (3) (LK/K: Holtz)
content.title_en: Energy : physical foundations of its production, transformation and use

content.text: How system theory is "systematic organizational consulting"? : newer consulting concepts for organisations in the context of Luhmann's system theory. In this work the potential of sociological system theory for organizational consulting is developed and shown how it can be used by consultants.
content.title_en: How system theoretical is "systematic organizational consulting"? : newer consulting concepts for organisations in the context of Luhmann's system theory

content.text: The book of the Russian mediect on the world view and culture of the simple people, published in Moscow in 1990, is a complete and methodological addition to the book of the Russian mediectist on the world view and culture of the "simple people" to "The world picture of the medieval people" 4th edition, E-ID 9/90) and "Medieval People's Culture" (ID 1/88), individual aspects were discussed in "Votes des Mittelalters" (ID 3/94) and "Individuum im europäischen Mittelalter" (BA 1/95). No simple matter, because there are no written sources for thought, ideas, beliefs of the population majority of the time, the sub-classes; but oral traditions can be found here in feedback, from penitentiary sermons, heretic and witch processes, literary monuments of time. He would not dare to reconstruct a world picture in connection with his historical knowledge: however, what he presents here in "piece work" is methodologically exemplarily, exemplarily and masterly designed. (3) (Friedra)
content.title_en: Silent witnesses of the Middle Ages : World view and culture of the ordinary

content.text: The main focus of this book is on the development of user interfaces from software-ergonomics to the development of a consistent process and the general context of software engineering. The second part deals with modern implementation tools that have already proven themselves in industrial applications. A special focus of this book is on the development of user interfaces under software-ergonomical aspects. For this purpose, a consistent process is presented and placed in the general context of software engineering. The second part is on the development of software-enhancing software-enhancing software-based information systems.
content.title_en: Operational information systems : basics and tools of methodological software development

content.text: Wenceslas Mushroom : Roman. Dr. Kurt Wenceslas has developed a fungus that allows acid-resistant trees to grow. But suddenly its growth slips away from any control
content.title_en: Wenceslas Mushroom : Roman

content.text: Statistically speaking, basic ideas of statistics are easily explained. A general introduction to the ideas underlying statistics has long been lacking! Conventional introductions are almost exclusively oriented to methods, which ultimately only interested students and practitioners. Here, however, for a wider reader circle, stastic concepts such as frequency distributions, position measurements, dimensions of dispersion, correlations, statistical interference, Siginificance, reliability without recourse to mathematical methods and formulas are explained. The focus of the book is on the presentation of data collection and the conclusions that can be drawn from the data. Application examples from the social sciences complement each chapter. The book is to a large extent what the Americans call "comprehensible" and therefore suitable for self-study for interested parties. (2) (Jürgen Plieninger)
content.title_en: Statistically speaking: basic ideas of statistics easily explained

content.text: Formula 1 engines : the era of suction engines, the revolution of turbos, the new suction cups, all Formula 1 engines from 1966, technology and data. First the development of Formula 1 engine technology, then a description of the designs, finally a collection of data and construction descriptions in systematic arrangement, with black and white photos and sketches. New edition 1985 (BA 4/86), which was extended and updated. Still applicable to technically interested laymen and professionals. (2) (LK/N: Pleuß)
content.title_en: Formula 1 engines : the era of suction engines, the revolution of turbos, the new suction cups, all Formula 1 engines from 1966 onwards, technology and data

content.text: The responsible practitioners from different companies report on their experience with the environmental audit, through to the validation and registration of the site at the competent chamber. Barriers that have occurred in this way are presented as well as successes and goals. The reader receives suggestions and valuable information on the EC eco audit system and the practical implementation of the regulation. Decision-making aids show whether participation in the EC eco audit system is also worthwhile for your company.
content.title_en: Tested environmental management : experience reports and practical examples

content.text: Basics of hypermedia learning systems: [Theory - Didactics - Design]. Multimedia and hypermedia are considered here from the interdisciplinary perspective of computer science, psychology and didactics. Topics are among others the author systems, the instruction design, the intelligent Tutorial Systems and hypertext. Learning software is critically discussed and the change from pure instruction to new concepts, which bring learning in the social context to the center. The book ends with a plea for the didactic imagination, a call to the readers to develop more meaningful and creative learning software than the analyzed school directions have provided so far. (HOF/Text übernehmen)
content.title_en: Basics of hypermedia learning systems : [Theory - Didactics - Design]

content.text: Wall bricks as historical building material: a material guide and guide. Very interesting description of the history and technique of bricks, in which the importance of bricks for and in construction technology becomes clear. Even today, bricks (not only in the northern German area) are valued building material; the promotion of the use of historical bricks is the subject of this work. The main topics: brick architecture from antiquity to the present; the history of brick production; terms, dimensions, standards, rules; bricks for reuse. An annex lists possible references for historical bricks, bricks for monuments, institutions for material testing and brick research, museums and technical monuments as well as a glossary and literature notes. Good addition to the "Lexikon der Ziegel" (BA 1/96; 2nd edition 1995) and to "Auf der Suche nach historischen Baumaterialien" (BA 10/97), another deserving publication by the publisher. (2) (Leo Prawitt)
content.title_en: Wall bricks as historical building material : a material guide and guide

content.text: Dictionary of Physics : English-German, German-English. The dictionary of physics contains about 30000 basic physical terms from about 30 physical subjects in the languages English/German and German/English in alphabetical order and clear word clustering for physicists and scientists.
content.title_en: Dictionary of Physics : English-German, German-English

content.text: Computer interfaces and bus systems. Buses are electrical connections between the basic units of a computer; via defined interfaces they also serve to connect different internal and external peripheral units. The author presents here a revision of a technically oriented monograph with the same title, which was previously published in Markt & Technik (K. Dembowski: ID 7/94). The current state of the art is taken into account, especially interface techniques with plug & play. The focus is on PCs based on Intel and compatible microprocessors. Indications of standards and standardizations, numerous detailed drawings. Information on the structure and operation. Comparison between market-oriented products. On enclosed CD-ROM test programs for the analysis and programming of interfaces and peripheral circuits. Thus not only reference work, but also practical book for technical freaks, which deal with the construction of interfaces. The previous edition should only remain temporarily in existence. (3) (LK/PB: Barckow)
content.title_en: Computer interfaces and bus systems

content.text: The topic: Design web pages: [Use software, incorporate animations, creative design of layouts]. From the many books on page design with HTML, graphic inclusion and editing and other effects (running font, animations, etc.) this volume is one of the most vivid and therefore also very helpful for the beginner. Numerous pages from WWW are shown, then the source texts are analyzed and commented, moreover, each is shown how one achieves the desired effects with a number of editors (HotMetal Pro 3 and Frontpage 97) and word processing programs (StarWriter and WinWord 97). The author also gives many general tips and suggestions. The CD-ROM contains HotMetal 2, WebEdit, Internet Explorer 3.01 and test versions of other programs. (2) (Martin A. Lobeck)
content.title_en: To the topic: Design Web Pages : [Use Software, Embed Animations, Design Layouts Creative]

content.text: Chemistry in agriculture: how we poison the environment and food. R. Carson had already pointed out in her best-selling book "The silent Spring" (last BA 1/97) in 1962 to the effects of agricultural chemicals on the biosphere. The author of this booklet shows that agriculture destroys its own basis worldwide by using agricultural chemical products that affect the geoecofactors climate, soil, plants and animals sustainably. Cost-effective mass production leads to multiple environmental damage, the remedy of which must be paid expensively by the general public. Long-lived pesticides, which have long been banned in the industrialized countries, are exported to developing countries and added together with the food products imported from them to our food chain. - The topic is interesting for many consumers. A wide spread is contrary to the form of scientific discussion and the anti-consumer price. (3) (Hans-Ulrich Struck)
content.title_en: Chemistry in agriculture: how we poison the environment and food

content.text: Concepts and models for the integration of resettlement workers. How can the integration of resettlement workers in Germany be achieved? When can we talk about successful integration at all? The goals and tasks of integration are often defined differently. The different perspectives and the practical consequences associated with them are described. The author presents concrete projects that aim to integrate immigrants on the housing and labour market as well as socio-cultural integration, and he gives suggestions for the realization of new projects.
content.title_en: Concepts and models for the integration of resettlement

content.text: Space technology for the environment: environmental satellites, space energy, disaster protection, climate and weather, Mars ecology, artificial suns, social environment; with 18 tables. Somewhere in the grey zone between popular non-fiction and semi-scientific publications, the volume provides a vast amount of figures, data and facts, which the author largely binds in a generalized form, but also an extremely subjective plea, which is now and then promptly degenerate in in indissatisfaction (e.g. when it comes to reducing the greens on the way to progress by environmental protectionists). In this respect, what has been gathered here in arguments for space travel is certainly very discusive and often convincing even without such slippages: from satellite technology to disaster prediction to real visions of the future (nuclear power stations in space, Mars colonisation ...). The central chapter, however, is another: "The evolutionary dimension" is intense and highly interesting with social, cultural and "cosmic aspects" (Egarl) - generally recommended.
content.title_en: Space technology for the environment : environmental satellites, space energy, civil protection, climate and weather, Mars ecology, artificial suns, social environment ; with 18 tables

content.text: The first part of the book covers the business and business management principles of corporate real estate management. In the second part, a presentation of the main legal, tax and accounting frameworks of management of corporate real estate. In the third part, five extensive case studies are presented, written by renowned practitioners from the German-speaking countries. For the first time, a case study of real estate management was also included by the public sector. The second part includes a presentation of the main legal, fiscal and accounting conditions of management of corporate real estate. The third part presents five extensive case studies, written by renowned practitioners from the German-speaking countries. The second part presents a case study of real estate management by the public sector. The second part includes a presentation of the main legal, fiscal and accounting conditions of management of corporate real estate. The third part presents five extensive case studies, written by renowned practitioners from the German-speaking countries.
content.title_en: Handbook corporate real estate management

content.text: Proposals to ensure good scientific practice : Recommendations of the Commission "Self-control in Science" ; Memorandum of recommendation of the Commission on Professional Self-Regulation in Science. These 16 recommendations are the result of the Commission's work "Self-control in Science". The explanatory memorandum and comments contain suggestions for implementation. They are followed by a brief overview of the problems in the scientific system with which the Commission has dealt with them and of the approaches to solutions abroad, the knowledge of which was important for the preparation of the recommendations. (HoF/Text adopted)
content.title_en: Proposals for good scientific practice : Commission recommendations "Self-regulation in science" : Recommendation of the Commission on Professional Self-regulation in science

content.text: Azulejos in Portugal : Tile decor in palaces, gardens and churches. Over 500 years, a specific form of wall decoration has developed in Portugal, which preferred painted tiles instead of the wall painting known here. A rich art documented in the illustrated book with numerous coloured photographs. And which uses an introductory text to follow the techniques, traditions, influences up to the current forms. A sound volume that sees itself as a tribute to a unique contribution to art history in Europe. A fairly manageable bibliography proves how little attention has been paid to the subject so far. (3) (Bettina Scheurer)
content.title_en: Azulejos in Portugal : Tile decor in palaces, gardens and churches

content.text: The changes in the structure and shape of the cities and regions of the new Länder, which are linked to the current processes of social change, are both changing living conditions and quality, and altering the familiar identity of places as well as the usual patterns of use, meanings, handling and attachment to space. The globalization of the market is a factor in the sharpening of the situation and the resulting conflicts. The realization of these processes and the recognition that the quality of life, environmental conditions and development opportunities of urban and regional habitats cannot be grasped by economic indicators alone has led, in recent years, to the awareness that the uniqueness and peculiarity of cities and regions are also and, in particular, to the characteristic characteristics of their territorial, phenotypical, functional, social-spatial, milieutypical and historical development, and to take this into account to a much greater extent than previously in urban and regional development.
content.title_en: Space and identity : potentials and conflicts in urban and regional development

content.text: For a new social contract: a political response to the global revolution. In time for the election year 1998, the new programmatic paper by the green thinker and top politician appears. When Fischer in "Risk Deutschland" (BA 1/95) primarily focused on foreign policy issues and Germany's position in world politics, the new title focuses on the economic and social problems raised by globalisation. His answer to globalization and its consequences (loss of power of state and politics towards the economy, international markets and corporations) is a plea for a new social contract, for a social ecological reform policy, which includes, among other things, an ecological tax reform. An understandable and readable title, whose programmatic statements are also of interest beyond the current debate in the election year. (Ingrid Wrase)
content.title_en: For a new social contract: a political response to the global revolution

content.text: Lucky, Logic and Bluff: Mathematics in the game - methods, results and limits. Powerful chess computers point to the close relationships between mathematics and game, less known is the intensive occupation of many Nobel laureates with simple and complex games such as Nim, Hex, Mastermind (= Superbrain), Reversi or Domino up to Backgammon, Chess and Go. In this material and thought-rich, richly illustrated volume you can not only find many sources of mathematical representations and evidence from many areas of game theory; important thought courses are also described in detail. Even mathematical shy players get their money's worth, for example because they find precise value figures for all streets at "Monopoly" and also contain numerous concrete clues to game descriptions by Martin Gardner or in German game books. Demanding, but very stimulating. (2) (Martin A. Lobeck)
content.title_en: Happiness, Logic and Bluff : Mathematics in the Game - Methods, Results and Limits

content.text: Intercommunal and regional cooperation : variables of their function. With this volume, experiences about intercommunal cooperation in the north-west German region are evaluated. The interest in knowledge was directed towards the organization and procedures of the formation of cooperative processes of regional development policy: how are cooperation processes organized and managed? The structural, political and informational restrictions of cooperation are essential aspects of investigation. In this context, a distinction is made between project-oriented and region-related cooperations. The project-oriented form of cooperation is concerned, among other things, with commercial parks and areas and with housing concepts. The regional cooperation aims, among other things, at urban and regional networks and at the establishment of regional development concepts.
content.title_en: Intercommunal and regional cooperation : variables of their functioning

content.text: The technique of the "oven-shaped" glass is very different from that of the glass bubble: it is started with solid glass, which is manipulated in the oven, melted, moulded, poured. History and developments of the oven-shaped glass, which was already known in antiquity, are described here by the well-known glass artist, but above all the techniques of the production phases, including the release agents and castings, are explained with many illustrations. The list of furnaces, melting cycles and control systems leading to the refinement of the glass are listed with their technical data; with them sources of supply, health precautions and safety. Many examples of glass artists illustrated also deepen the explanations sketches and tables. No comparison titles are known. (2) (Gudrun Reindl-Scheffer)
content.title_en: Furnace moulded glass : History - Techniques - Objects

content.text: The book of fine paper. The book gives an overview of the paper: history, production, storage, treatment, protection and preservation, paper types.
content.title_en: The book of fine paper

content.text: Castles and noble houses in England & Wales. 32 of the more famous noble country houses in England and Wales (see also "Castles and noble houses in Scotland" in this No.) from the large building epochs are presented in this volume, among them as prominent as Blenheim Palace and Castle Howard (the location of the filming of E. Waugh's "Resemblance with Brideshead"), whose exterior appearance, surrounding gardens and decorative interiors are shown in numerous photographs. The accompanying texts are not architectural inventories, but atmospheric text on the history of the house, its interiors and not least its inhabitants. Applicable, for the bidding of very inexpensive picture book, which can be widely used. (2) (LK/HL: Ittekkot)
content.title_en: Castles and noble houses in England & Wales

content.text: The path to the Basic Law : Foundation of Democracy in West Germany 1945 - 1949. A highly revised new edition of the book published in 1974 and partly "Democracy Foundation in West Germany" (ID 23/74). The author examines the prehistory of the Federal Republic of Germany from 1945-49 as a process of democracy foundation, in contrast to publications in which occupation policy and/or state foundation are the focus. This is about then discussed concepts of democracy, especially the ideas of the parties and the discussions in the Parliamentary Council. Due to new research results and since then published sources the work has been revised. New topicality gains it on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the founding of the Federal Republic. - Again widely recommended. (2) (LK/HAM: Wilms)
content.title_en: The path to the Basic Law : Foundation of Democracy in West Germany 1945 - 1949

content.text: Biochemical paths : Biochemistry Atlas. Based on the world-famous "Biochemical Pathways", the "Boehringer poster", this book was created. Contributions from renowned scientists cover all relevant topics in the field of biochemistry/molecular biology on the current state of research. A variety of 6-colour (!) graphics illustrates the extremely complex biochemical processes. This creates a bridge between textbook material and original literature: as a valuable reference work, as an overview of the connections in a highly dynamic field - a treasure trove for all who have to stay up to date in the life sciences. Over 1 million times the so-called "Boehringer Poster", an overview of the entire biochemistry, was sold. Now the material - of course completely revised and updated - is available as a user-friendly book.
content.title_en: Biochemical paths : Biochemistry Atlas

content.text: Theology today : a lecture series of the Bavarian Radio. Belief, Confession, Decision / Ernst Wolf -- The Faith as Knowledge and Action / Heinrich Fries -- The Christian Message and the Problem of Their Demythologisation / Günther Bornkamm -- Myth and Revelation / Josef Rupert Geiselmann -- The Importance of Manuscript Findings from the Dead Sea for the New Testament / Kurt Schubert -- Nature and Grace in Reformation Theology / Karl Gerhard Steck -- Nature and Grace according to the Teaching of the Catholic Church / Karl Rahner -- Church and Office in the Discussion of Protestant Theology / Hanns Rückert -- The Church's Office in Catholic View / Otto Karrer -- Eschatology, the The Theology of Last Things / Hans Urs von Balthasar -- Christianity and the World Image of Modern Biology / Paul Overhage -- Christianity and Politics / Klaus von Bismarck -- The Church and the Churches / Rudolf Shälin -- The One Christianity and the Many Churches / Michael Schmaus.
content.title_en: Theology today : a lecture series of the Bayerischer Rundfunk

content.text: Collecting old books: a practical guide through the history of books and the world of antiques. This guide is unique for the book friend and collector from the daily practice of an antique book. Not only the indispensable knowledge of books is provided here competently, but also the questions dealing with many antiquarians are answered honestly. - All interesting facts about book history: development of typography, explanation of printing methods, explanation of graphic illustration techniques. Insight into the basis of calculation of trade and the usages of auction houses. Dissolution of cryptic abbreviations of more than 650 reference works, which leave the uninitiated user of antiquarian catalogues at a loss.
content.title_en: Collecting Old Books : a Practical Guide to Book History and the World of the Antiquarians

content.text: The Wuppertal House: Building and living according to the Mips concept. Editor Schmidt-Bleek, former vice-president of the well-known Wuppertal Institute, is co-initiator of the project "The Wuppertal House", in which the consistent application of the MIPS concept to the construction sector is the topic (see BA 7/98; BA 6/97). MIPS (material input per service unit) is a new measure to calculate environmental pollution in the form of material streams, so-called "ecological backpacks" for products, services, etc.. Living and building is considered part of the ecological problem, as a sector where a rethinking of optimal resource productivity and ecological cost reduction is necessary. The book documents the exhibition and the interdisciplinary work of architects, designers, construction engineers. The result of the new thinking approaches and ideas are experiments and visions at the limit of the technically feasible, e.g. in the case of renovation concepts, low-energy residential units or "solar city 2001", a housing settlement in the quarry. Numerous illustrations, tables and calculations make the results comprehensible.
content.title_en: The Wuppertal House : Building and living according to the Mips concept

content.text: The book series of EXPO 2000 / Idea, Conception and Realization: Peter Felixberger ; Vol. 2: Beautiful New Workplace : Vision: World Civil Society. Klappentext: Our working culture is increasingly resembling that of developing countries, according to the well-known sociologist Ulrich Beck. A new social model - that of a committed civil society - is for him the only chance to secure welfare state and democracy in the next century.
content.title_en: The book series of EXPO 2000 / Idea, Conception and Realization: Peter Felixberger ; Vol. 2: Beautiful New Workplace : Vision: Weltbürgergesellschaft

content.text: Presentation techniques in architecture. Handbook for architects and graphic designers, which presents various artistic possibilities of architectural drawings: pencil, ink, crayons, felt pens, water paints, spray gun, foils, CAD drawings - each with material science, design instructions, exercises and examples. The book is not a comprehensive drawing theory, but a practical comparison of the different techniques and their particularities. Newly added compared to the first edition of 1990 (ID 16/91) is the foil technique, newly revised the chapter on CAD programs - the other chapters are unchanged. As a replacement for used copies recommended. (3) (LK/KA: Nibbrig)
content.title_en: Presentation techniques in architecture

content.text: KDE: Application & Programming. Folding text: Unix systems are still said to be hard to use and only for computer freaks. The K Desktop Environment, a free graphical work interface for Linux and Unix derivatives like BSD or Solaris, wants to be a remedy here. Matthias Kalle Dalheimer, who has worked intensively on the KDE project from the beginning, and his wife Tanja Dalheimer show in this book how you can adapt the desktop to your needs and make daily work much easier with KDE. In the second part the authors show that it is not so difficult to develop their own KDE programs, from CD player to email program and user management. Of course, it is also described how you can install the KDE packages on various Linux distributions. In the second part the authors show that it is not so difficult to develop their own KDE programs. Interested here are the main features of KDE programming and the use of the KDE KDE management program with K++ class of the KDE software.
content.title_en: KDE : Application & Programming

content.text: Geometrical principles of architectural representation. The textbook's theme is geometry as the basis of architecture and its two-dimensional representation as well as the training of spatial imagination and thinking. The introductory chapter deals with basic tasks of geometry in architectural representation, visual communication and development of spatial conception. This will then explain in detail the different imaging methods of the presenting geometry: parallel, central projection, axonometrics, table projection, representation of curved surfaces and bodies, listed projection. Each method is illustrated in detail by photographs of built architecture and corresponding drawings, sometimes with step-by-step instructions for geometric construction. Sober, compressed representation for students of architecture, civil engineering, urban and spatial planning as well as practitioners in these areas. A comparison title with this special orientation is not known. For libraries with this user circle recommended. (3) (Elke Nibbrig)
content.title_en: Geometrical foundations of architectural representation

content.text: New time-use structures and their consequences for spatial planning. Everyday life is increasingly taking place in communication systems and less in regional systems. Disspatialization and temporalization are two sides of the same coin. The ARL has commissioned an expert on this innovative research topic, the results of which are contained in this volume. The study provides a detailed overview of the topic "time" and its significance for today's society. A comprehensive description of the emerging time patterns and time-use structures is given with the help of new definitions of working time and leisure time and the current methods of recording are critically questioned. Furthermore, the connection between temporal changes and the change in spatial and settlement structures is presented. In order to meet the changed time structures and to protect the resource "space" from subsequent increased use, solutions are developed and the factor "time" is integrated into a first attempt in different planning.
content.title_en: New time-use structures and their consequences for spatial planning

content.text: Hand-Lexikon des Straßenverkehrs : [Definitions of terms and explanations for the freight transport of A-Z with important regulations in the annex]. Review: Organisation and law of road freight transport in alphabetical list. New edition of "Handlexikon des Güterkraftverkehrs" (BA 9/84) with clear definitions and practical explanations. In the annex a collection of regulations and addresses (fees catalogue, EC directives, auto courts etc.). Has been thoroughly revised and now includes about 2000 keyword entries. The old edition has to be replaced. (2 A) (LK/N: Pleuß)
content.title_en: Manual dictionary of road freight transport: [Definitions and explanations for A-Z freight transport with important provisions in the Annex]

content.text: Linear algebra with Mathematica and Maple : Repetitorium and tasks with solutions. The text is based on the theoretical foundations provided in Strampp: "Heighter Mathematics with Mathematica 1" (BA 10/97). The respective mathematical terms and sentences are formulated once again without any evidence at the beginning of each section. This is followed by broad examples and tasks with hints for the possible use of Mathematica and Maple. Further material can be obtained via the Internet. The topics are the spatial analytic geometry in vector form, introduction and geometry of complex numbers as well as the general linear algebra up to the theory of the own values. The tasks and examples however are limited to real and complex vector spaces of small dimensions. The volume, which partly reaches the school material, is particularly suitable for the preparation of appropriate preliminary diploma or intermediate examinations. (2 S) (Wolfgang Grolz)
content.title_en: Linear algebra with Mathematica and Maple : Repetitorium and tasks with solutions

content.text: The electronic sea chart: the basics, possibilities and limits of a new navigation system. Starting from the state of the introduction of the electronic sea chart, its components, various systems, data structures and their use are presented in the map function. The overcoming of the lack of "officiality" is discussed. Here, the ECDIS navigation information system (Electronic Chart Display and Information System) and its tasks and content are widely appreciated. Special annexes and a CD with demo software are included Hydrographic, economic and legal aspects as well as the navigatory functions of the electronic sea chart, the integration with other navigation systems as well as the correction and safety of these maps. Aspects of the sport navigation are included.
content.title_en: The electronic sea map: basics, possibilities and limits of a new navigation system

content.text: The epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of the epitome of
content.title_en: The emotional foundations of thinking : design of a fractal affect logic

content.text: The digital madness. Software : Notes on the meaning and design of the technology that makes the computer a universal instrument / Ulrich Klotz -- Logical depth and friendly surfaces : new myths of everyday life / Walter Bauer-Wabnegg -- Emotions in the digital : a phenomenology of electronic devices / Volker Fischer -- Tumble cinema : on the psychophysiology of image worlds from the computer / Rainer Schönhammer -- The digitization of the office : on the reconstruction delusion of objectivity / Uta Brandes -- Soups without plates : on conventions in the handling of products / Volker Albus -- Thinking on the model : Design in the context of forming science / Peter F. Stephan -- Interface agents : the change in human-object communication user-friendly systems / Wolfanf Henseler -- Learning by surfing? : digital learning myths and knowledge illusions / Hans-Dieter Kubler -- The digital madness / Bernhard E. Bürdek
content.title_en: The digital delusion

content.text: The crisis of human nature : the history of a concept. Rolf Peter Sieferle: "The crisis of human nature". About the history of a concept. Suhrkamp Verlag. Frankfurt am Main 1989. 250 pp., br., 14,- DM
content.title_en: The crisis of human nature: the history of a concept

content.text: Abrasion grit: designation, sampling, analysis, testing ; standards. Contains: DIN 848-1:1988 ; DIN 848-2:1988 ; DIN 51550:1978 ; DIN 66111:1989 ; DIN 66160:1992 ; DIN ISO 565:1997 [Draft] ; DIN ISO 2395:1998 [Draft] ; DIN ISO 3310-1:1992 ; DIN ISO 3310-2:1992 ; DIN ISO 3310-3:1992 ; DIN ISO 6344-1:1997 [Draft] ; DIN ISO 6344-2:1997 [Draft] ; DIN ISO 6344-3:1997 [Draft] ; DIN ISO 8486-1:1997 ; DIN ISO 8486-2:1997 ; DIN ISO 9136:1996 ; DIN ISO 9137:1996 ; DIN ISO 9138:1996 ; DIN ISO 9284:1996 ; DIN ISO 9285:1998 ; DIN ISO 9286:1998
content.title_en: Abrasion grit: name, sampling, analysis, testing; standards

content.text: Documents of electrical engineering : Standards. Contains: DIN 2425-7:1983 ; DIN 6771-5:1977 ; DIN 40719-10:1981 ; DIN 40719-11:1978 ; DIN 40719-2:1978 ; DIN 40719-2,Side sheet 1:1978 ; DIN 40719-5:1983 ; DIN 40719-6:1992 ; DIN EN 61082-1:1995 ; DIN EN 61082-1,A1:1996 ; DIN EN 61082-2:1995 ; DIN EN 61082-3:1995 ; DIN EN 61175:1995 ; DIN IEC 3B(Sec)101:1993 [Draft] ; DIN IEC 3B/146/CDV:1996 [Draft]
content.title_en: Electrical engineering documents : standards

content.text: Cable between art and consumption : plea for a cultural media policy. Markus Schöneberger, Dieter Weirich: Cable between art and consumption - plea for a cultural media policy. VDE-Verlags GmbH, Berlin and Offenbach 1985. 304 pages, 38.50 marks
content.title_en: Cable between art and consumption : plea for a cultural media policy

content.text: Chernobyl and worldwide consequences. Wolfgang Kröger and Sabyasachi Chakraborty: "Tschernobyl and worldwide consequences". Verlag TÜV Rheinland, Cologne 1989, 208 pp., numerous tab. and diagrams, born, 88 Mark
content.title_en: Chernobyl and global consequences

content.text: The North Sea is in danger. No natural ecosystem can withstand such a heavy burden of many human influences as pollution, fishing, shipping, natural gas and oil extraction and much more. The warning signals are there. This book helps with contributions by 50 scientists. (Further literature)
content.title_en: Warning signals from the North Sea : scientific facts

content.text: Writing and publishing in the natural sciences. F. H. F. Ebel, C. B. Delivered: "Writing and publishing in the natural sciences". VCH Verlagsgesellschaft, Weinheim 1990. 442 pp., 35 fig., 6 tab., 48 DM
content.title_en: Writing and publishing in the natural sciences

content.text: The Fourth Reich : Germany's later victory. Klappentext: The unification of the two German states creates a new heavyweight in Europe. The position of Germany as the third economic power in the world is strengthened and its supremacy in Europe is expanded. The fears of our neighbours and the former victorious powers expressed since the autumn of 1989 are hardly heard in frenzy of unification, often ignored as high-ranked.
content.title_en: The Fourth Reich : Germany's later victory

content.text: The ecological Marshallplan. Lutz Wicke/Jochen Hucke: The ecological Marshallplan. Ullstein Verlag, Berlin 1989, 336 pages, 34 DM
content.title_en: The Ecological Marshall Plan

content.text: With knowledge, resistance and wit : Women for the environment. Short biographies, better portraits of 15 mostly well-known women who have committed themselves to the environment, among them: Rachel Carson, Petra Kelly, Bärbel Bohley, Dana Meadows. The contributions are by various authors, but very similar, even in scope (about 10 pages), they emphasize above all the human sides, tell about their heroines full of admiration and without any critical restriction. Basically there is hardly anything common among the portrayed women, except that they fight for a good cause. But that is certainly enough to address interested readers. (2) (Klaus Bock)
content.title_en: With knowledge, resistance and wit : Women for the environment

content.text: Soviet Union 1980 - 1991 : Balance of recent years. The Soviet Union, with some 290 million inhabitants and a total territory of 22.4 million sq km, was the largest contiguous territory of the world. This Soviet Union no longer exists, it dissolved at the end of 1991. Other countries wanted to establish economic contacts with the new states or even to find out about the territory.
content.title_en: Soviet Union 1980 - 1991 : Balance of recent years

content.text: The second social reform: 27 pleas. Here too, the 1994 election year is the reason for O. Negt (cf. ID 32/92 and 37/93) to ask him whether a change of government was necessary and to make programs and proposals for a social reform. He has to complain about the restraint in the new countries, because of 30 people who were only 5 were willing to contribute. In addition, 22 authors from the West. 5 topics have emerged, which allow a good overview of improvements in all social areas. New of these are little, such criticism and alternatives exist in many treatises on individual aspects. The value lies in the overall overview, in the topicality, sometimes also in the originality and with the interesting authors (old father, Duden, Mahrenholz, Staeck and many others). The crowning conclusion is a conversation with G. Grass - politicians were not asked for their assessment. (2) (Elke Günther)
content.title_en: The second social reform : 27 pleas

content.text: The causes of prosperity and poverty: an analysis of the economic factors. Walter Stahlmann: The causes of prosperity and poverty. An investigation of the economic factors.
content.title_en: Causes of prosperity and poverty: an analysis of economic factors

content.text: Urban renewal in the new countries: two years of model city program. The texts included include the following model cities: Stralsund, Brandenburg, Halberstadt, Weimar, Meißen, Güstrow, Cottbus, Naumburg, Mühlhausen, Jena and Görlitz.
content.title_en: Urban regeneration in the new countries : two years of model city programme

content.text: Praise of lies : Deception and self-deception of animals and humans. Volker Sommer: "Lob der Lüge". Deception and self-deception of animals and humans. Verlag C. H. Beck, Munich 1992. 240 pp., 24 ills., born, 44,- DM
content.title_en: Praise of lies : Deception and self-deception in animals and humans

content.text: The 1950s: interior design and living design. The theme smells of nostalgia. But the author, an architect teaching at the University of Wuppertal, is far from maintaining false reminiscences. The political, social and creative surroundings of the 1950s are illuminated with knowledge. The achievements of the time are presented in portraits of 12 outstanding designers and companies who have implemented artist designs. One of the merit of the book is that not only companies such as Braun or Arzberg, designers like Jacobsen or Wagenfeld are listed. The illustrations, mainly black and white photographs, are selected and printed without exception; the texts are scarce but very informative and easy to read even for first-interested people. The book is undoubtedly one of the best publications on the subject. Despite the prize, it is also recommended for medium-sized holdings. (2) (Bettina Scheurer)
content.title_en: The 1950s : Interior design and living design

content.text: Tiepolo and the intelligence of painting. Alpers and Baxandall invite you to rediscover Tiepolo, or to express it more precisely, to show how his paintings are to be viewed, to recognize the means employed by the artist, the extraordinary of his paintings. Using the numerous mostly colored illustrations, the reader and the authors follows the process of creation Tiepolo from the first pen drawings to small oil sketches to the large frescoes.
content.title_en: Tiepolo and the Intelligence of Painting

content.text: Biotechnology for the Third World: a developmental perspective?. Progress in modern biotechnology opens up a wide range of applications and accordingly seems promising considerations to contribute to the solution or at least to the relief of key problems of developing countries. On the other hand, their commitment also combines the concern that the technological and economic gap between poor and rich countries could deepen further. In order to assess the potential of modern biotechnology for developing countries, this study analyses, based on the state of biotechnological research and its current possibilities of application, the expected consequences for the economic, ecological and social situation of the states of the Third World. A subsequent evaluation of biotechnology in the light of developmental policy objectives serves as a starting point for drawing conclusions for future German development cooperation.
content.title_en: Biotechnology for the Third World: a developmental perspective?

content.text: The new teaching structure in the framework of the university's virtual learning activities is presented in the framework of the new teaching activities. The new teaching activities in the framework of the new teaching activities are described in the framework of the new teaching activities. The new teaching activities in the framework of the new teaching activities are described in the framework of the new teaching activities. The new teaching activities in the framework of the new teaching activities are presented in the framework of the new teaching activities. The new teaching activities in the framework of the new teaching activities are presented in the framework of the new teaching activities in the framework of the new teaching activities. The new teaching activities in the framework of the new teaching activities are presented in the framework of the new teaching activities in the framework of the new teaching activities in the framework of the new teaching activities in the framework of the new teaching activities in the framework of the new teaching activities in the framework of the new teaching activities in the framework of the new teaching activities in the framework of the new teaching activities in the framework of the new teaching activities in the framework of the new teaching activities in the framework of the new teaching activities in the field of the new teaching activities in the field of the field of teaching and in the field of the new teaching.
content.title_en: Learning and science on the Internet: guidance and reflection on new learning, research and advisory structures

content.text: The FARGonauts : about analogy and creativity. If I receive a book from Hofstadter for review, I am overwhelmed by a bittersweet feeling of joy and resignation: an important work is always to be shown, which cannot even be read in the prescribed time; too many too interesting topics are treated, one constantly stops to pursue a thought. The author is just extraordinarily creative together with the employees of his institute. It does not even remain room here to sketch the ideas on intelligence and artificial intelligence, e.g. on pattern recognition and analogy formation (and also on other topics, for example on the design of fonts), which are spread over 600 pages in narrow sentences ... (1) (Martin A. Lobeck)
content.title_en: The FARGonauten : about analogy and creativity

content.text: Local Justice in Germany : Studies on the Distribution of Educational, Occupational and Health Goods. The book contains three detailed empirical studies on the distribution of important but scarce goods: places of study at universities and universities of applied sciences, workplaces in companies and donor organs in transplant medicine. By analysing concrete legitimization-sensitive decisions, which sometimes pose very difficult weighing problems, the authors of social science justice research give new impetus - and thus challenge the social philosophy to a redefinition of their concept of justice.
content.title_en: Local Justice in Germany : Studies on the Distribution of Educational, Occupational and Health Goods

content.text: The GDR 1945 - 1990. Ten years after the fall of the Berlin Wall Hermann Weber presents a new edition of his volume on the history of the GDR. It becomes clear that the GDR, which existed almost as long as the German Empire, is by no means only a by-product of the Cold War. The now accessible files in the archives of the former GDR provide new information about the course of events and their backgrounds. In the research and literature section, the author also gives an overview of the flood of literature that has arisen since the end of the East German state. Hermann Weber, who has been researching the history of the GDR for decades, revised and expanded his standard work (first edition: ID 12/88) in 1993. A brief presentation of the GDR history follows a chapter on basic problems and tendencies of research and a bibliography, which is divided into 20 chapters, which lists over 2100 titles. This volume from a series, which is in the first line to students and teachers of history, but with a view of a larger reader circle, should be available as entry literature as far as possible. (2) (Claus Baumgart)
content.title_en: The GDR 1945 - 1990

content.text: Paving with natural stone : 20 tables. The design possibilities with plaster made of natural stone in entrance areas and entrances, at terraces, garden paths and forecourts were particularly important. The practical feasibility by step-by-step photos, numerous drawings, formulas for calculating the material requirements etc. were presented. Tools, materials and measuring instruments are presented. Installation moulds, patterns and ornaments for different purposes proposed, tips on underlaying and drainage given. Overall, a relatively expensive, but well-proven title for professionals and ambitious laymen. Comparative titles such as M. Kirschner: "Moving the way and pavement itself" (BA 8/98) and "Terraces, paths and places pavers" (BA 2/98) also treat the processing of concrete, clinker and similar and are primarily aimed at homeworkers. (2) (LK/MS: Ebert)
content.title_en: Patches with natural stone : 20 tables

content.text: Balkan war: the destruction of Yugoslavia. Review: A comprehensive analysis of recent developments in former Yugoslavia from a Marxist point of view was missing. Now, crisis and war are primarily explained as a result of economic distortions and dependences and geopolitical considerations, especially of the USA and Germany. When considering Yugoslavia as a "ball of play" of capital and the western world, the authors do not deal with dagger-boiling, but rather complain about losses already under and after Tito and crimes under Milosevic, but set accents against the one-eyedness of anti-Serbian views alone and Western media monopolies. This is accompanied by a polemic, which is partly also provided with (ideological) blinds. Overall, however, an important collection of contributions, especially since some topics (like Balkan history with a focus on 20th century, the reflections on war roots and course) are particularly sloppy, compressed and manageable also for the few familiars and, moreover, the Kosovo crisis are already documented and characterized in detail (until August 1999). (2) (Gert Kreusel)
content.title_en: Balkan War: the destruction of Yugoslavia

content.text: Immigration to Germany : Structures, effects, perspectives. Despite the opposite position of the Federal Government, Germany has become one of the most important countries of immigration in post-war history. This book provides a comprehensive account of the causes, structures and effects of displaced persons, migrant workers, resettlementists and asylum seekers and is also a plea for making German citizenship easier to access for the growing permanent proportion of foreigners.
content.title_en: Immigration to Germany : Structures, effects, perspectives

content.text: The ecology of fear: Los Angeles and life with disaster. From 1992 to 1994, Los Angeles experienced a mass of devastating natural disasters, along with civil war-like street battles. These disasters are avoidable, according to urban sociologist Davis, who also wrote about his city in the "Stadtbuch Stadt" (BA 7/99). He describes the disintegration of the landscape, a "growth eruption", a disregard for any environmental political reason, inadequate fire and earthquake protection measures. Another topic is social conflicts and racist violence. In the chapter on the fictional destruction of Los Angeles Davis presents 138 disaster novels and films, and he examines the fears and fantasies of this genre subliminally. A thoroughly researched work that impressively highlights the consequences of environmental destruction and failing urban planning. With registers of persons and persons. (2) (Joachim Renkhoff)
content.title_en: Ecology of Fear : Los Angeles and Life with the Catastrophe

content.text: Food on prescription : how functional food changes our diet. Entertaining and informative guide through the jungle of food lies and diet fairy tales. Probiotic yoghurt, rolls with omega-3 fatty acids, with vitamins puffed up rubber bears - what about "Functional Food"? Can genetically manipulated or/or enriched with supposedly healthy substances really compensate for eating sins or should it better be: on risks and side effects ask your baker or vegetable dealer? Biochemist M. Brian, editor at the Eco-Test magazine, exposes the false promises of the food industry and displays alternatives. Important title for all those who mistrust advertising slogans and want to know what comes on their plates. With factual register and literature directory. (1) (Birgit Jacob)
content.title_en: Eating on recipe : how functional food changes our diet

content.text: Strength training with the Thera band : the best exercises. Strength training keeps you fit and healthy, it shapes your body and leads to a good posture. The Thera band has established itself as the smallest fitness center in the world in all areas of training and rehabilitation, it costs little and fits into any bag. It is the ideal training device for all, whose goal is to carry out an effective strength training with simple means and with little effort. With the Thera band and the exercise program of this book, everyone can perform an optimal strength training with little effort with fast successes and gentle exercises, the most important muscle groups are optimally trained and better blooded through. The result is an all-round adequate muscle growth.
content.title_en: Strength training with the Thera band : the best exercises

content.text: Revenge : Roman. The cruel misery, the destruction by fire and bomb hail, death, the hopeless fate of the buried and aimless wanderings is symbolically projected by the author (1921-99) in an air attack by the Allies on a German big city. - First issued: 1956.
content.title_en: Retribution : Roman

content.text: The legal basis for the reform of the German law is the EC Consumer Goods Purchase Directive, which was implemented until the beginning of 2002. § 459 ff. BGB is therefore faced with a total reform. The work, one of the first works on the Consumer Goods Purchase Directive, raises the question of how legal users of Member States can deal with imprecisely formulated standards of Community law. It poses their problems in connection with the recent discussion on Community Private Law. A legal analysis is devoted to the question of which regulatory techniques promise practical and legally safe decisions according to experience. The investigation is directed at legal scientists as well as civil judges and lawyers. The author is a scientific assistant at the Institute for Roman Law of the University of Cologne and a lecturer at the local Administrative and Economic Academy.
content.title_en: Internal competition for claims for damages under European law: the role of the judge in coordinating legal acts

content.text: Automotive and Automobilism. Klappentext: For us all, the car stands in the midst of private desires and ideological arguments. This volume presents above all sociological, social-historical and cultural-scientific texts on automobile and automobilism. (Reading test on amazon.de)
content.title_en: Automotive and Automotive

content.text: Introduction to object-oriented programming with Java. The authors apply the present textbook to first-year students and introduce gradually into general concepts of structured and object-oriented programming. Java serves as a vehicle for the practical application of concepts based on example developments. In these example developments, almost all constructs of the language Java are presented and used, so that the book also allows a first start in Java. Of course, not all areas of Java can be covered in this type of presentation. Thus, for example, graphical user interfaces, applets, but also questions of security and aspects of networks are not discussed. The focus of the work is on object-oriented realization of algorithms. Extensive consideration is also given to primitive types and fields, conditional instructions, iteration and recursion, inheritance, abstract classes, exceptional treatment and incidentalness. Clearly structured representation, many practical examples, practice tasks. Annotated literature advice. (3) (Klaus Barckow)
content.title_en: Introduction to object-oriented programming with Java

content.text: Fiscal crisis: spatial characteristics, effects and reactions. Public budgets at all levels of the Federal Republic of Germany are in a long-term structural crisis.
