The discrepancies between the financial needs considered to be indisputable and the possibilities of generating revenue are constantly growing. The result is a diminishing fiscal scope and a decreasing fiscal flexibility. The volume deals with spatial structural, regional economic effects and political reactions to this fiscal crisis of all federal levels, federal, Länder and municipalities. An assessment of the spatial policy of the analyses is decided by the volume.
content.title_en: Fiscal crisis: spatial characteristics, effects and reactions

content.text: The SS : Elite under the skull; 30 CVs. In the 30 CVs of the highest and highest SS leaders of this volume, a multifaceted picture of the elite-conscious "order under the skull". This group of men of different origins held high positions in the complex rule machinery of the Nazi system under Reichsführer SS Heinrich Himmler. The alphabetically ordered CVs (among others by Bach-Zelewski, Best, Eichmann, Hausser, Heydich, Himmler, Höss, Kaltenbrunner, Müller, Pohl, Schellenberg, Wolff) are written by historians of international origin and competence only give an external picture of the respective life stations on a few pages, together with bibliographical references, but hardly any information about motivations and mentalities: No biographical essays, however, as "Who's Who" of the SS elite, they provide useful information in a factual manner. (2 A) (Friedrich Andrae)
content.title_en: The SS : Elite under the skull ; 30 CVs

content.text: Information can be found on the Internet: Guide for targeted online research. The Internet makes information from all areas and on all topics accessible to all in principle. But: With the ever-growing wealth of information it is not always easy and fast to find exactly what you are looking for. The book systematically describes and evaluates the performance and suitability of the most important tools for searching for information on the Internet. The authors convey strategies for the correct combination of search aids, tips for quick evaluation of the information found and possibilities to be found as an information provider on the Internet. - - Communication and protocols on the Internet - Basics of targeted information search - The fast search - Global search engines - Subject catalogues, index catalogues - Special and thematic search engines - Metasuchers and intelligent search engines - Search for search entry points (search engines) - Tips for targeted search - Tips for information providers The Internet makes information from all areas and on all topics accessible in principle. One only has to find what one is looking for. However, with the ever-growing wealth of information this is not always easy and quickly possible. The authors describe and systematically evaluate the most important tools for finding information in the online tool for the ability to find a suitable tool for a quick evaluation.
content.title_en: Information can be found on the Internet : Guide for targeted online research

content.text: Access - the disappearance of property: why we own less and spend more. Klappentext: The Internet boom and the rapid stock market development make no doubt: the industrial age is finally over. Capitalism is changing radically - and with it our whole life. The formula of the coming age is: access, access, access. The rapid access to ideas, goods and services counts already more than permanent and cumbersome possessions. This does not remain without consequences for social coexistence. Jeremy Rifkin shows in his brilliant analysis how in the new access age everyday life, work, leisure and consumer behaviour radically change. He introduces us to a world in which everything we need is possibly only available as a paid service. Rifkin warns: If we leave the field entirely to the economy, the foundations of our society are in danger.
content.title_en: Access - the disappearance of property : why we own less and will spend more

content.text: Berlin: Monuments for Parliament, Government and Diplomacy 1990 - 2000. Ten years after German unification, parliament, government and diplomacy have established themselves in Berlin. They have started their work in historical buildings, including buildings from the time of Frederick the Great, from the 19th and 20th centuries and also those that served as state functions during the Nazi era and in the GDR. The history of construction and use of buildings, planning and the result of their exploitation for the new capital functions are presented in this volume by directly involved parties in the historical aspects as a review of the capital's migration.
content.title_en: Berlin capital : Monuments for Parliament, Government and Diplomacy 1990 - 2000

content.text: Between the Elbe and the Baltic Sea : on the origin of the Schleswig-Holstein and Mecklenburg-Vorpommern waterways. The author describes the development and development of inland waterways in Schleswig-Holstein and Mecklenburg-Vorpommern on the basis of numerous illustrations and graphics. Besides the crossing of the Jutischen Peninsula and the "Salzfahrten" between Lüneburg and the Baltic Sea region, small river roads such as Warnow and Peene are also duly taken into account. Most of the space, however, is occupied by the North-Ostsee Canal and the Elbe-Lübeck Canal. Interested in professional and sport shipping, for waterway and water management administrations, but also for all readers interested in traffic history and technology. (I. Hanewald)
content.title_en: Between the Elbe and the Baltic Sea : on the emergence of the Schleswig-Holstein and Mecklenburg-Vorpommern waterways

content.text: The attractiveness of technical and engineering subjects in the choice of young women and men in the study and career of young men: a presentation by the Academy of Technology Assessment in Baden-Württemberg. Why are fewer and fewer young people studying natural and engineering sciences in Baden-Württemberg? The need for engineers is obviously high today, but the number of students starting an engineering study has been falling for years and has only recently stabilised somewhat. The authors examine the structural, demographic reasons and the motives of students and students for the choice of subjects. Amazing for all: Not career prospects or job security are the main motives for choosing the subject, but rather the personal interest in the subject, their own inclination and recommendations by the primary reference group, such as parents, teachers and friends. Structure: 1. Introduction. - 2. Problem position and starting position in the mirror of statistics. - 3. The examination design. - 4. Empirical findings on the choice of subjects. - 5. Occupational orientations - an approach to the choice of subjects? - 6. Summary (HoF/Text taken over)
content.title_en: The attractiveness of technical and engineering subjects in the choice of young women and men in the study and career: a presentation by the Academy for Technology Assessment in Baden-Württemberg

content.text: Einstein and the diced God : at the limits of knowledge in science and theology. The author puts the theories Einstein, Bohrs, Cantors, Darwins, Hawkings, Lorenz', Monods, Weizsäckers to the test of history and shows: Not all reality is nature. Einstein's world picture is broken, hardly anyone has noticed.
content.title_en: Einstein and the diced God : at the limits of knowledge in science and theology

content.text: The volume is the result of a working group of the Academy of Spatial Research and Planning, which has tried to compile typical planning strategies of the GDR period. The aim is to look at the ideas and planning intentions of that time both sectorally and at different levels and to provide sources. The volume is devoted to case studies of territorial planning in relation to work priorities and working topics, territorial and site planning at the district level, the working group on settlement and population geography, the question of tourism, structural development and gives a breakdown of planning in the former GDR.
content.title_en: Sources of space research in the former GDR

content.text: The German aviation: book series on the development history of German aviation technology / edited by Theodor Benecke in Zsarb. with the German Museum (Munich) ...; 29: Der deutsche Luftfahrt 1955 - 2000 : Weltverkehr, Liberalität, Globalisierung. 29. Volume of the renowned series. The first volume on the topic (German Air Transport 1926-1945) has already been discussed (BA 6/99, further titles of the series can be found e.g. in ID 18/99, 5/96, BA 6/00, 2/97). All reviews have a common assessment: a standard work on the subject. The present volume, which in part 1 covers the development of air transport in Germany from the post-war period and the beginnings of Lufthansa AG to the globalization in our days and in part 2 covers technical questions in the broadest sense, certainly does not make any exception. Only what is listed in the appendix on statistics on airlines, aircraft, air cargo, air mail etc., makes the work indispensable for the professional - from the usual expert and comprehensively designed part (encrew by the personal and factual register) to the absolute existence of the medium-sized-range-range-requirequirequirelation-relation-requirelation-relation-of-of-of-relation-of-relation-of-the-of-the-the-the-of-of-the-the-the-of-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-of-the-the-the-the-of-of-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the-the
content.title_en: German Aviation : Book series on the development history of German aviation technology / edited by Theodor Benecke in Zsarb. with the German Museum (Munich) ... ; 29: German Air Transport 1955 - 2000 : World Transport, Liberalisation, Globalization

content.text: Pictures from Dora : Forced Labor in the Rocket Tunnel 1943-1945. "The exhibition is based on extraordinary images: secretly in Dora itself or after the return from deportation, drawings of prisoners, a colour reportage, British aerial photographs and photos made for Hitler in 1944, made by the Americans during the liberation of the camp in 1945. ... All documents date from a period of ten months. Individually, they do not say much. Together, they show the extent of what was at stake in Dora, the atrocities that took place there, and the extremely cynical end. The sideline also shows beyond their symbolic or emotional value, how photos allow us to assess history."
content.title_en: Photos from Dora : Forced Labor in the Rocket Tunnel 1943-1945

content.text: Only the most beautiful survives: the aesthetics of man. A fascinating text that adds a new aspect to social-critical such as N. Wolf's "Myth Beauty" (BA 8/91), social-psychological such as E. Drolshagen's "The Body of New Clothes" (BA 11/97) or sociobiological such as D. Buss' "The Evolution of Desire" (BA 11/97). Etcoff reflects the nature of beauty and "which part of our being makes us receptive to beauty". She describes beauty as a biological adaptation, according to our effort to create beauty, to imitate the seductive "beauty of the adult adult couple" (in Brazil there are more AVON advisers than army members! In the United States more money is spent on beauty than on education or social services!). Excitingly the evidence of time- and culturally-crossing patterns and pre-loves that assign to every beauty detail its (biological) meaning. It pleads for envious enjoyment of youthful beauty, to make it enjoy only a beautiful coast, to make it "the best of a local song."
content.title_en: Only the most beautiful survive: the aesthetics of man

content.text: - Violence and Conflict in a Globalized World: Festschrift für Ulrich Albrecht. After the end of the East-West conflict and the epochal upheavals in Eastern and Eastern Central Europe, the world has by no means become more peaceful. Rather, the indications of distortions and distortions of conflict axes are condensed. Also, the obvious gap in economic, social and cultural development in the various regions of the world leaves serious doubts about the world's social added value of globalization. This volume - a Festschrift on Ulrich Albrecht's 60th birthday - is devoted primarily to the conflicts that have finally arisen in the globalized world, as well as the problem of violence, which in many forms accompanies globalization. Authors from home and abroad analyse facets of the new global types of conflict, civilization tendencies and forms of violence and discuss possibilities for action of the induction of violence and conflict. - Transformation into the shadow realm or: the economic cycle of the informal economy - globalization and social peace by means of Jamaica - conflict forms in world society - Organized violence and the meaning of social norms - globalization and the consequences of Europe's birth-space conflicts - About the concept of the world- of conflict
content.title_en: Violence and Conflict in a Globalized World : Festschrift für Ulrich Albrecht

content.text: Dictionary of Information Technology and Media: English-German, German-English. Dictionary, which - according to the author - has set itself the goal of offering a suitable word set for the areas IT, multimedia and media (from the classical print media to e-commerce and web design). With about 35,000 terms in each language direction, the offer is extensive, in the compilation are also included in the secondary areas. The translations are scarce, however, they often do not limit themselves in part English-German to the pure word-for-word transmission, but also offer very short explanations. The volume, whose selection can be described as successful, meets well the self-selected claim to turn to "all users who work in IT and media professions" - that includes computer users and computer scientists, advertisers, in graphic or AV media professionals, etc., but also excludes librarians, book dealers, educators, etc. Given the importance of the English language in the areas covered by the high price recommended (2) (Roland).
content.title_en: Dictionary of Information Technology and Media : English-German, German-English

content.text: Environment - Ethics - Law. Ethics and Law have traditionally been almost exclusively concerned with human relations between themselves The protection of the natural environment represents a new and important challenge. It is therefore important to examine the relationships between ethics, environment and law in more detail. The book's contributions are written by experts from law/biology, philosophy, theology and politics who address moral and juridical issues of environmental and nature conservation. In addition to fundamental considerations on the relationship between ethics and law, the ethical dimension of "sustainability" and "biodiversity", the anchoring of environmental protection in the Basic Law and the inclusion of the term "dignity of the creature" in the Swiss Federal Constitution are discussed. The contributions are related to each other, and are interdisciplinary. The volume provides a good insight into a complex and increasingly important discussion.
content.title_en: Environment - Ethics - Law

content.text: Leo Kaplan : Roman. Just before Leo Kaplan, like the author of a Dutch writer of Jewish origin, takes on his father's great inheritance, his life seems to be transformed into a pile of pieces. Leo has not only played off his marriage with Hannah with his numerous affairs. He also suffers from a writing barrier. During the PR tour for his last novel he encounters his childhood love in Rome surprisingly. This first reunion in almost 20 years makes him realize what a mistake he made with all his love relations. (Günther Brandorff) The writing does not want to succeed the son of a "Trödeljuden" from Den Bosch, who lives in Amsterdam for two years. Always looking for balance in personality and relationships, his marriage breaks down. - Strongly autobiographically coloured novel by the Dutch author. (Günther Brandorff)
content.title_en: Leo Kaplan : Roman

content.text: Basic studies in biology / Katharina Munk (ed.): Genetics. The five-volume "Basic studies in biology" is now completed except for "Zoology" (see "Biochemistry, Cell Biology, Ecology, Evolution", ID 16/01; "Botanics", ID 42/01; "Microbiology", BA 4/01). To the content: nucleic acids, chromosomes, genome structure, DNA replication, transcription, meiosis, recombination etc. as well as methods of molecular genetics. The didactic preparation (overview, definition of terms on the margin column, schemas, graphics, black and white micror images last however not convincingly repro quality) is again very good. For students of the biosciences the questions relevant to the examination (with answers) are useful, to this literature list (with Internet sources) and index. Besides W. Hennig (2nd edition, BA 10/98) for libraries at universities actually indispensable. (3) (LK/F: Lüdtke)
content.title_en: Basic studies in biology / Katharina Munk (ed.): Genetics

content.text: Characterization of laser beams and laser optics : Standards. Contains: DIN EN ISO 11145:1995 ; DIN EN ISO 11145:1998 [Draft] ; DIN EN ISO 11146:1999 ; DIN EN ISO 11151-1:2000 ; DIN EN ISO 11151-2:2000 ; DIN EN ISO 11254-1:2000 ; DIN EN ISO 11254-2:2000 [Draft] ; DIN EN ISO 11551:1997 ; DIN EN ISO 11554:1999 ; DIN EN ISO 11670:1999 ; DIN EN ISO 12005:1999 ; DIN EN ISO 13694:2000 ; DIN EN ISO 13696:1999 [Draft]
content.title_en: Characterization of laser beams and laser optics : Standards

content.text: Chemical detection in the sea : Collaborative projects ; Subproject 1: Submersible GC/MS system : Final report ; as subproject 1 of the joint project ; Collaborative project: "Trying chemicals in the sea". Underwater mass spectrometer, sinker, havarie, rapid analysis, remote control, seawater probe, mobile GC/MS, marine environment
content.title_en: Chemicals in the sea : Collaborative projects : Subproject 1: Submersible GC/MS system : Final report ; as subproject 1 of the Collaborative project : "Protocol of chemicals in the sea"

content.text: Natural stone flooring: Installation technique: the practical book for planners, stonemasons and tile laying. Natural stone has its special appeal as a floor covering. The variety of material also causes problems when laying. The book therefore begins with extensive basic information on suitable cements, mortars and natural stones, as well as the preconditions for laying with checklists on underground tests and organizational questions. In the second part, various laying techniques and the types of the supply are described. The annex contains tables on laying agents and samples for tendering texts. The book is specifically addressed to professionals such as craftsmen and processing companies. The very well-equipped volume is recommended for larger technical holdings and libraries near vocational schools. (3) (Burchard Bulling)
content.title_en: Floor coverings made of natural and concrete brick: Installation technique : the practical book for planners, stonemasons and tile laying

content.text: The population weighting at the country level in the country financial compensation: [Experts commissioned by the Länder Baden-Württemberg, Bavaria, Hesse and North Rhine-Westphalia]; with a supplementary report from the Centre for European Economic Research (ZEW). Empirical study consists of three approaches, an input- and an output-oriented and an econometric approach. Furthermore, a theoretical analysis of the question of spillover effects is carried out. The present study was conducted in the research area "Public sector" of the ifo Institute in cooperation with Prof. Dr. Bernd Huber of the LMU Munich and Dr. Karl Lichtblau of the Institute of German Economy and concluded in January 2001. The study focuses on the population weighting at the country level in the country financial compensation. The starting point is the judgement of the Federal Constitutional Court of 11 November 1999, which requires an empirical review of the existing population refinement of the city states as well as a possible increase in the need for sparsely populated land countries.
content.title_en: The population weighting at country level in the national financial compensation : [Experts on behalf of the Länder Baden-Württemberg, Bavaria, Hesse and North Rhine-Westphalia] ; with a supplementary report of the Centre for European Economic Research (ZEW)

content.text: From the Abakus to the Internet: the history of computer science. "Informatics", a term that still still shimmers a little, is understood here as a translation of "computer science", i.e. as a technical science. Naumann loves paragraphs of baroque length, he also lovingly and extensively addresses the prehistory of electronic computing forces, mechanical computing machines and even describes the development of numerical systems. The early computer development is traced, especially the pioneering performance of Zuse, also the storage media are considered (ferrite core memory, magnetic plates). The stormy progress of the last decades is often described only in a cursory manner, mostly for individual countries (including Eastern Bloc), but the autocatalytic backlash of the increased computing power on the development only indirectly. Annoying is the absence of a factual register. As a starting point or a lure for the more precise approach to individual topics, the volume offers a variety of suggestions. (3) (Martin A. Lobeck)
content.title_en: From Abakus to the Internet : the history of computer science

content.text: From the perspective of gender research in politics, the book provides insight into current developments in education policy: What opportunities and risks do the "new education policies" have for women and girls, how do they affect gender relations? The combination of previously separate discourses on school, vocational education and higher education in this book shows gender inequality as a structure that is consistent with all three "education pillars". The comparison of the German educational situation with that of other countries (Sweden, the Netherlands, the UK, the EU) documents "best practice" worth following. The authors present a variety of innovative projects and measures that have been successful in reducing discrimination between girls and women in education and the labour market and open up political-practical paths into gender-democratic education policies.
content.title_en: Education policy and gender: a European comparison

content.text: Literature in the Knowledge Society. Note International Hölderlin Bibliography: pp. 72-91 (75-77): The Asylum of Art and the Power of the Mediocracy
content.title_en: Literature in the knowledge society

content.text: Windows 2000 commands - short & good. The book provides quick access to information about all Windows 2000 commands and the Resource Kit commands. The commands are presented in a clear and compressed form and are sorted by function groups. In addition to listing all commands, this reference contains a summary of the Windows 2000 script language as well as a collection of helpful web addresses and software archives. (MOD)
content.title_en: Windows 2000 commands - short & good

content.text: Differentiating in teaching. Paradise (see also BA 1/97 under Greving, Johannes) and Linser present didactic instruments for the differentiation of teaching and show their possibilities for use in secondary schools I and II. In addition to the overviews of M. Bönsch (BA 4/96 and ID 35/00) and the practical guidance of H. Meister (BA 4/01) for teachers and teacher students. (3 S) (LK/DU: Heckmann)
content.title_en: Differentiating in class

content.text: Society and State in Africa. The author is a professor of sociology (see his "History of Sociological Theory", BA 4/94) with a focus on development sociology and with teaching experience in Nigeria. This very informative, scientific book is both a presentation of the historical development in the broad spectrum of societies and states in Africa as well as an (too) intensive examination of the (Western and African) literature on the subject (with about 400 literature references). There were indeed "societies without state" and "tribes" are often "constructs of Europeans oriented on the pattern of the nation state". Red thread is the important question of how and by whom the surplus value was acquired before, during and after the colonial period, beyond the cost of reproduction. The main diagnosis for today is "Prund Capitalism". With (whole but usable) registers. (3) (Siegfried Lörcher)
content.title_en: Society and State in Africa

content.text: The Duden: in twelve volumes; the standard work on the German language / ed. from the Scientific Council of the Dudenredaktion: Matthias Wermke ... ; Vol. 12: Duden - Quotations and pronouncements : [Origin and current use; about 7500 quotations from classical antiquity to modern advertising language]. When quoting: If already, then right and skillful! For all those who want to refresh their knowledge about winged words and common utterances and search for points for their texts and speeches, there is the Dudenband "Zitate und Aussprachen". The 960-page volume presents around 7 500 generally known and frequently used classical and modern quotations. As for example: The dice have fallen (Julius Caesar), Carpe diem! (Horaz), Last, but not least (Shakespeare), Beam me up, Scotty later! (Star Trek), Schaun mer mal (Franz Beckenbauer), Ich bin in (Boris Becker) or Man gönnt sich nichtsbei stimbst (Schlagsträchen, die Aussprachen, die Beschübung) and das Beschrägung ist.
content.title_en: Der Duden : in 12 volumes; the standard work on the German language / ed. by the Scientific Council of the Dudenredaktion: Matthias Wermke ... ; vol. 12: Duden - Quotations and pronouncements : [Origin and current use ; about 7500 quotations from classical antiquity to modern advertising language]

content.text: In her 30-year work in favour of adoption applicants and adoptive children, Swientek is increasingly looking for their parents and their identity. Based on her book "Who tells me whose child I am?" (BA 1/90), the author quotes reports and gives help to those affected to look for their biological mothers and fathers. She also speaks to passing mothers who are looking for their child and adoptive parents. Swientek's conclusion: No anonymous adoptions (i.e. no baby flaps), but the greatest possible openness from the outset, because "Adoption is not a repair operation ... but an emergency measure for parents without children". In the appendix: addresses for written searches (also abroad) and contact possibilities to self-help groups. The title above does not need to be exchanged. (2) (Susanne Rieken) Testimonials, advice and help for those who want to know their parents. (Susanne Rieken)
content.title_en: Adopted in search of ... : ... their parents and their identity

content.text: "Spended" textiles: umbrella - dress - canopy - pneu - tent ... : Teaching and teaching material on housing for children and adolescents of the 1st - 6th classes of textile, art and material instruction. In the book Tacked textiles are presented for children and young people of the 1st to 6th classes free working materials on topics such as: yurt, black tent, circus tent, pneuhallen, bed tents, umbrellas etc.. The children and young people can self-act and inspire their tense textiles by pictures, stories and ideas. Textile material as a span, envelope and space-forming form is the focus, but the contents are discussed far in design, artistic, cultural, ethnological, religious and technical fields. A cross-disciplinary teaching offers itself to individual subject areas. In a didactic accompanying text for teachers anthropological reasons to the difference between nomadism and sesssity of the house is discussed, the meaning-giving aspects of tense textiles for children and young people can be discussed and the forms of form of form of flexible textiles is presented to the young shuddly-scrapist.
content.title_en: "Spended" textiles : umbrella - dress - canopy - pneu - tent ... : teaching and teaching material on housing for children and adolescents of the 1st - 6th classes of textile, art and material lessons

content.text: Women explore the world : discover, research, report. Review: The detailed literature at the end of this beautifully made book of pictures makes it clear: There is a wealth of literature on the subject "Women explore the world". In this richly illustrated picture/text book they are all listed: well-known and less well-known explorers from the 1st century A.D. to our time. 84 exciting life stories are presented here: from the Chinese poet Wen-Chi, who immortalized her involuntary journey as a Hun Prince's wife in the "eightteen songs of a nomad flute", to the American astrophysicist Jill Cornell Tarter, who with her colleagues at the SETI Institute interprets signals from space and investigates the question "whether we are alone in this world". The volume appeals to repeated reading and leaves and, above all, to read more and is therefore highly recommended for libraries with a significant stock of research and discovery literature. He has only one disadvantage: quality has its price. (2) (Marianne Possmann)
content.title_en: Women explore the world : discover, research, report

content.text: Marx, we need you : why you have to change the world. Jean Ziegler, Uriel da Costa: Marx, we need you. Why Marxism is not dead. From the French by Inge Leipold. Verlag Piper, Munich 1992. 156 pages, 26,- DM
content.title_en: Marx, we need you : why you have to change the world

content.text: Windows Script Reference: [the comprehensive reference for system administrators and programmers]. The author is known for a book on scripting with the WSH (Windows Scripting Host), where he uses many examples to automate and simplify workflows (BA 2/00). H. Schwichtenberg goes beyond the possibilities of WSH in his work via Windows and BackOffice scripting and explains COM command extensions (ID 7/01). This line is now taken up by the author and is also a good example of COM command extensions, ADSI command extensions and WMI command extensions (COM - Component Object Model, ADSI - Active Directory Service Interface, WMI - Windows Management Instrumentation). ADSI and WMI have been a fixed part of the operating system since Windows 2000 and are addressed to system administrators and programmers, where good VBScript knowledge is required. Hundreds of Sript modules are presented that can easily be integrated into the user's own hardware management.
content.title_en: Windows Script Reference : [the comprehensive reference for system administrators and programmers]

content.text: Handbook on Right-wing radicalism: Persons, organizations, networks from neo-Nazism to the middle of society. The weighty volume combines 15 essays on very different topics of right-wing extremism with a lexicon part about persons, organizations and musicians of the right-wing scene and an address directory of actors against right-wing. Detailed literature directory, register. The essays are, with few exceptions with rather technical theoretic content, generally understandable, the theme selection is quite broad (among others East/West comparison, right-wing women, right-wing extreme music, right-wing esoteric, clothing). An essay collection on the topic, each with a little different weighting, was last "On the Way to the Civil War" (BA 4/02) and "Tut was! Strategies against Right" (BA 8/01). Already long ago there are publications with Lexika e.g. "Handbook on Right-wing extremistism" (BA 1/95) and "Handbook on German right-wing extremist" (ID 6/97), both now obsolete. As a reference work for many stocks, at least the Lexika part is suitable for all-wing groups.
content.title_en: Handbook on Radical Rights : Persons, Organizations, Networks from Neo-Nazism to the Center of Society

content.text: The decision of the psychiatrist: a review of a life's work. Lectures and discussions of the great Italian reformer of psychiatry, Franco Basaglia (1924-1980), which he held in Brazil in 1979 and which are considered his legacy. The "Brasilian conferences" outline once again the theory and practice of Basaglia, whose name is linked to the dissolution of the madhouses in Italy and its main works "The Negated Institution" of 1971 and "What is psychiatry?" of 1974 were also widely discussed in Germany especially in the context of the 68 movement and had influence on the mental hospital ferom in that country. The remarks of Basaglia are framed by contributions from one of the first German volunteers in Trieste, Klaus Hartung (see "The new clothes of psychiatry", 1980) and a close employee of the psychiatrist reformer. The volume is intended as a start to a new reception of the "anti-psychiatry" especially for social workers and psychiatrists working among completely different Auspizien/H.
content.title_en: The decision of the psychiatrist : a life's work

content.text: The design of scientific works: a guide for house, seminar and diploma theses as well as dissertations. (Department for the 2nd edition 1999)Compact, practical and above all clear guide for the content and formal design of scientific works. In 4 chapters planning and conception, form and formatting (using the word processing software Word), literature research (including databases on CD-ROM, Internet and electronic library catalogues) as well as the citation rules are presented in detail. The numerous examples are based on Austrian circumstances, but this hardly leads to any restrictions on the use of German students. To supplement. (3)
content.title_en: The design of scientific work: a guide to house, seminar and diploma theses as well as dissertations
Bitumen : Requirements, testing ; standards

content.text: The Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of the Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphragm of Diaphthia Diaphragm of Diamdiaphragm Diaphragm Diaphragm of Diaphthia of Diaphthia Diaphthia Diam Diam Diam
content.title_en: Knowledge Popularisation : Concepts of Knowledge Dissemination in Change

content.text: New media and urban development: expert contributions. The German Institute for Urban Studies (Difu) held an expert hearing in Bonn in 2001. A workshop on the same topic was preceded by a future workshop organized by the Institute for Future Studies and Technology Assessment. The expert contributions of the hearing and the report on the future workshop are documented. The results of both events, together with results of a survey of urban developers and city planners in the German cities with 50 000 and more inhabitants and extensive literature and document analyses, were incorporated into a report to the BBR and the BMVBW, which is intended to show the state of urban development between virtualization and the development of new spatial patterns and which has also appeared in the series "Difu-Materialien".
content.title_en: New media and urban development : Expert contributions

content.text: What we think is who we are - orientations about this are communicated by the media. Newspapers, television and the Internet offer the horizons of meaning in which people determine their world view and views of life. What does this mean for church and theology? Do they have to be mute in the abundance of the media sense offering? Is the Church a sense agency of yesterday? In refreshingly clear analysis, Wilhelm Gräb opens his eyes here to the change of the religious in the media society and shows how the practice of the Church, its speeches from God, the world and the people can respond to it.
content.title_en: Sense of the Infinite : Religion in Media Society

content.text: Coloured iron grids of the Baroque era: contributions to history and function, corrosion and conservation; model-like application and further development of protective coatings and corrosion inhibitors for the preservation of the environmentally damaged baroque choir grid in the Osnabrücken Cathedral; a project of the German Federal Foundation for the Environment. The diverse technologies of metal polychromia have so far been only fragmented researched. The knowledge of corrosion and the preservation of such objects is extremely low. The focus of this work book is on the model project "Conservation of the environmentally damaged baroque choir grid in the Cathedral of Osnabrück" as well as on the corrosion of iron and the problem of possible protective measures. For the restoration it was possible to consider and adapt the latest research results and experimental series of the Department of Monument Protection/Material Science of the German Mining Museum Bochum. Helpful for each practitioner are also the contributions on the rich stock of contained baroque grids in Switzerland, the restoration of wrought iron grids in Stift Heiligenkreuz (Lower Austria) as well as the experiences in handling the serious corrosion graffling conditions in the cast iron grids.
content.title_en: Coloured iron grids of the Baroque era : contributions to history and function, corrosion and conservation ; model application and further development of protective coatings and corrosion inhibitors for the conservation of the environmentally damaged baroque choir grid in the Osnabrücker Dom ; a project of the German Federal Foundation for the Environment

content.text: Fashion: a fashion history from the 18th to the 20th century; the collection of the Kyoto Costume Institute. Attractive colour photographs illustrate the cultural history and the change of fashion in the last 3 centuries. (Margit Seeger-Meier) Opulent heavyweight picture/text book, which illustrates the development of fashion from the 18th century to the present. The basis is the world's most extensive collection of clothes of the "Kyoto Costume Institute" in Japan. In the museum are representative garments, mainly women's dresses, but also men's fashion, shoes, underdresses and accessories from 3 centuries. The chapters are arranged after the centuries, the 20th century is divided into 2 halves. Above each is reported about the change of fashion in the context of the time, followed by meaningful color photos, which are explained by a companion text at the edge again. Here are the focus not the individual designers, which are of course exemplary represented, among others Chanel, Dior, Saint Laurent, Vivienne Westwood, Jil Sander, but the (indiger/Kulturturturen) of the fashion houses.
content.title_en: Fashion : a fashion history from the 18th to the 20th century; the collection of the Kyoto Costume Institute

content.text: Environmental History : Topics and Perspectives. The environment as a basic historical catagory, i.e. the still young environmental history in its different approaches and research fields (Ruhrgebiet, Westfälisches Industriemuseum, Landschaftsbewusständigkeit u.a.), is the starting point of this collection of proven environmental historians (e.g. Brüggemeier, Sieferle, Radkau). The introductory essay of the two editors gives information about the beginnings and finally establishment of this subject area (see also "Environmental History: Fields of Work, Research Approaches, Perspectives"; ID 45/02). With literature information and selection of addresses (museums, studies etc.), schema drawings, black-and-white photos. (2)
content.title_en: Environmental History : Topics and Perspectives

content.text: The downfall of the East: why the Islamic world lost its supremacy. Lewis, British Old Master of the Orientalists, has repeatedly occupied himself in his work with the encounter of the Orient and Occident, the mutual influence of cultures (see "The Breath of Allah", lastly BA 4/02, or "Emperor and Caliphs", ID 7/97). In this volume, which was based on a lecture series held in Vienna in 2001 (published as "Culture and Modernization in the Middle East", here not reviewed) and on earlier publications since 1980, he describes how and why the Ottoman Empire lost its predominance since the end of the Middle Ages and was confronted with the increasing civilizational superiority of the Christian West by an enormously dynamic movement. Understandable, appealingly formulated, documented by examples and quotations, but not new. (3) (Elisabeth Mair-Gummermann)
content.title_en: The Fall of the Morning Land : Why the Islamic World Lost Its Power

content.text: Lexicon of famous vehicles: from Apollo 11 to Zeppelin. A sober technical history of Eichborn? Certainly not. The lexicon rather combines as different means of transport as the Andrea Doria, the Borgward Isabella, the Concorde, Jim Knopf's locomotive Emma, James Dean's Porsche Spyder, the Paternoster or the Wuppertaler Schwebebahn: numerous vehicles are known as James Bonds Aston Martin, the Ferraris in various series or the spaceship Enterprise from film and television, which is not surprising with the author (see Tesche: "Sean Connery", BA 11/00; "The Great James Bond Book" last BA 3/00 and others). Most articles go over several pages, with shorter sections mostly referring to references. The loosely written, detailed book will hardly be a look-up, but will probably serve for a pleasant reading and can reach good loan numbers. Pictures can be found no, but a register of objects and persons. (2)
content.title_en: Lexicon of famous vehicles : from Apollo 11 to Zeppelin

content.text: The author first analyses the role of the mathematician Carl Johannes Thomae (1840-1921), who has been teaching in Jena since 1879, and shows the important role this discipline gained for the Salana in the last quarter of the 19th and beginning 20th centuries. Thomae, with whom modern function theory was introduced in Jena and with which Salana not only won an excellent academic teacher, who successfully made this novel mathematics known in textbook form to young researchers in school and science, but also a broad recognition, is presented in the monograph in detail in his academic career as well as in his achievements in teaching and research. The author thus also provides an important building block for the history of the development of natural sciences in the last third of the 19th century. Above all, the implantation of the institution of the seminar also in mathematical discipline is reflected as an integral part of a highly successful transformation process of natural sciences.
content.title_en: Carl Johannes Thomae and the development of mathematics at the University of Jena from 1879 to 1914 : Foundations and influences

content.text: The concept of democracy is based on two central questions: (1) When is a political system to be understood as a democracy? (2) How democratic is an existing democracy? The work is divided into three parts. The first chapter aims to develop an appropriate model of democracy that allows to assess its quality in intercultural comparison. In the second chapter, the approach of operationalization is determined by the inclusion of institutions. It is necessary to examine the extent to which these "informal institutions" are compatible with democracy or need to be evaluated as indicators of disruption. In the third chapter, the focus is on the question of the limits and possibilities of democracy measurement. On the basis of the discussion of the common measurement concepts (Polity, Freedom House, Vanhanen, democratic audit) a separate proposal for measuring the measure and quality of democracy in its dimensions is developed. The work thus pursues three fundamental objectives: (1) The construction of a democracy model for the identification of an informal democracy - the definition of an interdisciplinary democracy.
content.title_en: Democracy and Democracy Measurement: a conceptual basis for intercultural comparison

content.text: Build attractively with a small budget: with systematic planning at low costs. Cost-effective construction requires particularly thorough planning and carefully considered rationalization measures. In 3 parts the author (last BA 3/91) provides the necessary information and considerations for saving costs and areas in his completely revised recast of the "Building Cost Savings" (BA 10/86). Introducing 5 relevant strategies for low construction costs are presented: small construction / simple construction / in sections construction / common construction / even construction. Among these premises the individual phases of construction planning and construction development as well as the individual components and construction technology are discussed in detail. The numerous photos, floor plans and calculations of houses offer an inspiring collection of cost-effective alternatives, including unconventional solutions for facade design, ground plan layout or interior construction. Very understandable advisor for builders, also for architects and planners, which enables them to assess what is important and what is most important. Before E. G. Brehmer (BA 8/00), the sober word is formulated.
content.title_en: Build attractively with small budget : with systematic planning at low cost

content.text: The healthy house: materials, techniques, costs. Compact guide - also suitable for looking up -, the builders informed about environmentally compatible building materials and ecologically reasonable house technology. Structured by building materials, ceiling systems, floor structure, roof covering, windows and doors, insulation materials, plasters, binders, paints and house technology, the properties, advantages and disadvantages of the individual building materials are presented in a concise and understandable manner and evaluated from ecological points of view (freedom of living, disposal possibility, primary energy during production etc.). With numerous colour photographs, construction drawings, additional background information and partly cost examples. Finally, information on subsidies, addresses, company certificates. Under "www.ein-gesundes-haus.de" the author offers an Internet portal with company addresses on the topic of building ecology. Referring to ecological building materials no current comparison title known, "Buildering biologically naturally" (BA 4/00) is more detailed and twice as expensive. "The ecological building order" (BA 1/02) and "The book from ecological building" (BA 2/00) set other priorities.
content.title_en: The healthy house : materials, techniques, costs

content.text: The educational system is characterised by fact fetishism. In the future knowledge society, knowledge of facts is not required, but multi-layered problem solving skills and mental mobility. Learning learning becomes a key factor. Tailor-made and transversal learning is of high importance. Non-linear learning, root-like learning structures (rhizome) and interactive learning programs (blended learning) not only contribute to life maintenance (qualification), but also to life development. Using the example of different target groups (child garden, extra-school education, school, and university), a computer learning concept based on sensual aesthetic criteria is developed. Learning environments are presented that document how computer education is understood as a critical, self-conscious and action-oriented appropriation of the concrete world of life, but can be demonstrated above all that learning processes are particularly successful, when "learning" is understood as a "passport".
content.title_en: Navigation Education : Self-directed learning through new media

content.text: The eternal war for eternal peace: how America reaps the hatred it sown. Like no other, Gore Vidal (most recently "Essays", ID 48/00) understood it to be again recently with almost the entire political, intellectual and media establishment of the USA. With N. Chomsky (ID 19/02) and some other intellectuals he is one who attacks the official interpretation pattern of the "Eleven-O-Nine". Since 1945, according to the Incoming essay, the USA has overlaid the world with numerous military actions in search of eternal peace, acting on the simple pattern of demonization: "You the evils, we the good!". Also for Vidal, terrorist acts are terrorism, but not the fruit of unmotivated malice, but are causally linked to the action of the state, government and economy. Thus, also in the case of the Oklahoma bomber T. McVeigh, which is the subject of the 2nd part. Desse Tat was the immense case of the Defian-Sedal-Seract.
content.title_en: Eternal War for Eternal Peace: How America Harvests the Hate It Sowed

content.text: Basic course on statistics in the social sciences: an easy to understand, application-oriented introduction to the social science necessary statistical knowledge. This introduction to statistics for social scientists is limited to what is usually taught at universities as a course on "Statistics I": description of distributions, basics of probability theory and beginnings of correlation and regression. The book is extremely readable, mathematics is limited to a minimum, the examples are vivid (as taken from ALLBUS data), the reference to SPSS as the most common software in this field is not missing and the conversion of statistical numbers and facts into graphics plays a major role. The book is even more vivid than the title of S.-M. Kühnel and D. Krebs (ID 22/01), therefore highly recommended for university locations, perhaps even for school libraries. (3) (Jürgen Plieninger)
content.title_en: Basic course on statistics in the social sciences : an easy to understand, application-oriented introduction to the necessary statistical knowledge for social science

content.text: Opinion on nine large scale scientific research equipment and on the further development of investment planning of large scale equipment. Structure: Preface. - Recommendations on nine large scale scientific research equipment. - Part I: Comprehensive opinion. - Part II: Opinions of sub-groups on the individual large equipment (HoF/Text adopted)
content.title_en: Opinion on nine major basic scientific research equipment and on the further development of investment planning for large equipment

content.text: Fire, water, earth, air. The contents of this unique book are the "System Earth" from the core of the Earth to the edge of the magnetosphere. The individual topics were compiled from public lectures on the "Year of Earth Sciences" in 2002 under the themes Earth, Air, Fire and Water. It is generally clear that aspects of numerous scientific special fields, the tasks, methods and activities of geoscientists, oceanographers and meteorologists are described. The benefits of these works and many interesting and amazing research results are briefly presented. Topics include the origin of the Earth and the Moon, origin of earthly life, plate tectonics, climate history, greenhouse effect and the role of water. The individual contributions are loosened up by graphic graphics, photos, text blocks, quotes from philosophers and writers and interviews with researchers. Unfortunately, there is no cross-reference between the contributions. It is annoying that neither index, nor glossary or literature directory are included. (2 S)
content.title_en: Fire, water, earth, air

content.text: Fans : aerodynamic design, sound prediction, design ; with 42 tables and 7 examples of exercises. Publisher's text: This textbook combines design and design of radial and axial fans with the problem of noise development and its calculation and solution at the stage of fan development in a special concept.
content.title_en: Fans : aerodynamic design, sound prediction, design ; with 42 tables and 7 examples of exercises

content.text: Women, Men, Gender Trouble : System Theoretical Essays. Verlagsinfo: System Theory and Gender Studies have been more out of the way so far: while the system theory approach avoids normatively charged theories, the opposite is the case for the mainstream gender research. The consequence was that two of the central theoretical areas of the present have exchanged mutually incompatibility formulas and made a discussion difficult. Meanwhile, this situation has changed: System Theoretically inspired observations of the gender question set new, surprising accents in this debate. This volume takes up the thread with the polemic contribution Luhmann's women, men and George Spencer Brown from 1988 and pointed out recent contributions.
content.title_en: Women, Men, Gender Trouble : System Theoretical Essays

content.text: Measuring, controlling and controlling with TCP/IP : basics and practical examples for implementing MSR applications with WinSock and Delphi; [on CD-ROM source texts, tools, data sheets and documentation]. From the content: basics of TCP/IP protocols, basics of programming WinSock in Delphi, queries of switches and switching with relays, transfer of logged environmental parameters, rules with setpoint values over the network, transmission of video images, security aspects, dynamic IP assignment, automatic setup and separation of dial-up connections, gateways and routers
content.title_en: Measuring, controlling and rules with TCP/IP : Basics and practical examples for implementing MSR applications with WinSock and Delphi; [on CD-ROM source texts, tools, data sheets and documentation]

content.text: KulturSchock: with different eyes see : Life in foreign cultures; [Egypt, China/Taiwan, Germany, India, Italy, California, Mexico, Russia, Tanzania, Thailand, Turkey]. In this collection are reproduced some cases of "culture shock": language students in Taiwan, for example, who no longer endure the continuous observation and pack their bags, or excellently prepared, understanding and liberal contemporaries, who after some time turn to intolerant flaws. The best known is the three-phase theory explained in this volume in a post: One comes curiously and open into a new cultural environment, perceives everything through the "pink glasses" and romanticizes even circumstances that repell one in his own country. In the second phase the locals begin to "nerve" one. It sets disappointment and frustration. Only in the last phase one is capable of a somewhat balanced judgment. This very simple model is sometimes questioned in the other contributions, partly and partly refined. In them the experiences are described in German, but also in German.
content.title_en: CultureSchock: See with different eyes : Living in foreign cultures ; [Egypt, China/Taiwan, Germany, India, Italy, California, Mexico, Russia, Tanzania, Thailand, Turkey]

content.text: The IT-Requirement-Book for optimal software procurement: [from the software evaluation to the conclusion of the contract; decision aids for the selection of application software; model contracts and exemplary obligations, also on the CD to the book]. Revised new edition of the manual for the procurement of computer programs in the operational environment (1st edition: BA 6/99), now with CD-ROM to the book (includes sample contracts, checklists, flow diagrams, analysis schemes, standard examples etc.). Not least due to technological progress, it is absolutely advisable to purchase replacements, the pre-condition should be makuliert. (2)
content.title_en: The IT-Requirement booklet for optimal software procurement: [from software evaluation to contract conclusion; decision aids for the selection of application software; model contracts and exemplary specifications, also on the CD to the book]

content.text: Schools in Germany : New building and revitalization. Publisher's text: A well-designed school lays the foundation for education, study and work and is an expression of public building culture.
content.title_en: Schools in Germany : New building and revitalization

content.text: Peter Joseph Lenné : with a short history of the landscape garden from his English role models to the Volkspark. Biography of Peter Joseph Lenné in the series "Berliner Kaufen". An earlier edition of the work was published in 1981 by Stapp Verlag (not discussed here). The author, journalist and author of numerous biographies describes the life story of the director general of the royal Prussian gardens, who created numerous garden art works and park facilities in Germany in about 50 service years and also worked in urban planning. The author focuses in his book on Lenne's work in the Berlin-Brandenburg region. The biography is supplemented with a contribution about the "Volksgarten". Lenne suggested the Volksgarten as a place of bourgeois construction. In the appendix a time table, biographical data, literature information and register. With some small-format black and white illustrations. Text. Flüsssig vernariert, mit Quotieren verenenenen biographie über den begünstigten Gartenartist und Organiser Lenne. (2) (LK/K: Weber)
content.title_en: Peter Joseph Lenné : with a short history of the landscape garden from his English role models to the Volkspark

content.text: Regional networks as a source of innovation: the concept of the "Learning Region" in Europe. Klappentext: Globalization poses major challenges for European nations. In the long term, these can only be tackled if regional cooperation structures and local interfaces are created in all life and policy areas. An essential hope for innovation in European politics is therefore the concept of the "Learning Region". The volume describes the forms, opportunities and difficulties of these new regional networks, based on examples from all over Europe.
content.title_en: Regional networks as a source of innovation: the concept of the "learning region" in Europe

content.text: Cybernetic anthropology: a history of virtuality. Cybernetics had begun to reconcile the "two cultures" of the humanities and natural sciences in the context of a new attempt to explain. Concepts such as "regulation" or "self-control" were transferred to humans with the aim of enabling a "kybernetic anthropology" with the help of which a final uniform determination of man was to succeed. Stefan Rieger deciphers in his material-rich study this draft of an anthropology as epistems in the sense of Foucault, in whose center the concept of "image" is to bundle all the explanatory concerns: the status of man, his position in the cosmos, his delimitation of animal, machine and environment. Man depends on images and image types, and this structure becomes a definition of virtuality. In the name of virtuality, man of the 20th century is once again given the attempt to determine a physical destiny.
content.title_en: Cybernetic Anthropology : a History of Virtuality

content.text: The 13-18 year olds : Introduction to the problems of adolescence. New edition of the last title published in 1993; outdated examples replaced, chapter for example youth sexuality extensively updated; replaced by 3rd edition at the latest... (ID extract).hy
content.title_en: The 13-18 year olds: Introduction to the problems of adolescence

content.text: The book of proofs. From the reviews: "A magnificent, extremely carefully and lovingly designed book! Erdös had the idea of the Book, in which God wrote the perfect proof of mathematical sentences. ... The book of Aigner and Ziegler succeeded ..." Mathematical semester reports 1999 "... The proof itself, its aesthetics, its point goes into the history book of the Queen of Sciences. Their grace is revealed in the successful and skillfully illustrated book about the Book. To be able to enjoy it, it is worth catching up on the little math that we have forgotten or that was kept from us by the school." The time, August 13, 1998 "...a fireworks of mathematical spirit flashes. ..." World Week 16/02 This second German edition contains two new chapters, on partition identities and about card mixing. In addition, there are a large number of extensions and improvements, such as a surprising new method of counting the positive breaks. TOC:Preface.- Number Theory.- Geometry.- Combinations.- Combinations.- The Dictionary Theory.- The Dictionary.- The Dictionary.
content.title_en: The Book of Evidence

content.text: The digital recording studio : practical help for digital recording studio technology ; technology, formats, compatibility ; with practical tips and many examples. Publisher's text: In the field of sound technology there is rapid technical progress, especially in computer applications and digital technology. The book "The digital recording studio" therefore offers an easy-to-understand introduction to the functional principles of digital audio technology and a description of the most important interfaces for the exchange and transport of digital audio data. The audio quality criteria are discussed in practice as well as the meaningful compilation of devices to complete function groups. The tips and suggestions range from simple digital overplays between two devices to the extensive digital sound studio with its complex cabling.
content.title_en: The digital recording studio : practical help for digital recording technology ; technology, formats, compatibility ; with practical tips and many examples

content.text: Peter Monadjemis Windows XP Hackers Guide: [safe on the Internet]. The topic of Internet security is in everyone's mouth and given the rapid ageing of current issues is also very desirable. The author, known by numerous publications (lastly BA 10/03), pursues the goal of "clarifying the most important dangers from the Internet and (the readers) being able (to) protect himself from these dangers effectively". Instructions for hackers as they might suggest the title are expressly excluded. Target groups are home users who use the operating system Windows XP Home. This significantly restricts the addressee circle, but also passes on targeted information. The chapters focus on the following topics: types of Internet hazards, security settings, firewall, secure email, protection against dialers, anti-virus programs, Explorer settings, backup program and user accounts. There are no statements on encryption.
content.title_en: Peter Monadjemis Windows XP Hackers Guide : [safe on the Internet]

content.text: Long-term archiving: methods for preserving digital documents. The volume describes very carefully and extensively many of the current or future-usable methods of document storage, as well as possibilities of migration or emulation of previously used recording or storage programs, use of PDF, XML, etc. Some attempts, projects and initiatives on the subject are also discussed, which were mainly developed in Australia. In addition to the technical difficulties one must also think of the often incomplete transfer of knowledge (the silence post problem). To this end, metadata of a data capsule should keep everything important for dating, emulation and other related circumstances. Here the "shrink image" is pushed to compare: if necessary, the presentation of the metadata soon requires a comment by new metadata, etc. - Many of the incalculable difficulties are mentioned in the text (proprietary formats, insolvent manufacturers of old programs or copy protected CDs etc.), a Sisyphus work is ahead. The volume will not only stimulate librarians and documentaries to think intensively. (2) Theory, practice and thought for permanent storage or conversion into new formats of documents.
content.title_en: Long-term archiving : Methods for preserving digital documents

content.text: PowerPoint 2003 : 2000/2002 ; [2000/XP; create professional presentations with animations ; present on screen in print and on the Internet ; sample projects from all business areas ; look up, directly implement them ;]. PowerPoint is part of Microsoft's Office package and is almost worldwide standard for professional presentation for the screen, the screen or on foil/paper. Without a preface, but with advertising, it starts directly. Starting with a concept in the 1st chapter (already advertising again) it goes on. All further work steps are very extensively illustrated and well structured. Unfortunately no colored pages, no CD-ROM (with exercises or solutions), no test questions. For that time and again: advertising. Schade. With Christian Schmidt (BA 12/01) or M. Zocholl: "PowerPoint 2002 - klipp & klar" (BA 5/03), both to PowerPoint 2002, one is better served. Above all: without advertising! (3) (Rainer Burghausen)
content.title_en: PowerPoint 2003 : 2000/2002 ; [2000/XP; create professional presentations with animations ; present on screen in print and on the Internet ; sample projects from all business areas ; look up, directly implement!]

content.text: Right on the Internet. If you build up a web presence, you easily overlook that a variety of laws are to be observed on the Internet, both those that only concern right-hand traffic on the Internet and those that apply just as well outside the Internet, only the specific features of the Internet must be observed when applying them. The aim of this qualification unit (QE) is to sensitize you to the legal problems associated with the creation and operation of your own Internet services. You will learn to recognize typical problems and answer simple legal questions independently.
content.title_en: Legal information on the Internet

metadata.authors: Jaschinski, Martin; Brexl, Oliver; Biere, Sebastian

content.title_en: Construction / ed.: DIN, German Institute for Standardization ; 5: Earth and Basic Construction : Standards

content.text: What happens when the rain falls? : Introduction to hydrology ; 1 Table. The contents of the volume refer exactly to the question posed by the title, i.e. it follows the "way of the drops of water from the clouds to the earth and back again". The water cycle is presented as the result of a variety of individual processes, as a closely linked network of various causes and effects. The textbook chooses a "flowing organic" way to introduce into its knowledge area, deliberately abandoning the otherwise usual theoretical-systematic form of representation. With reference to special publications, the application-oriented, water-economic part of hydrology has been omitted. (3) (LK/UL: Kiener)
content.title_en: What happens when the rain falls? : Introduction to hydrology ; 1 table

content.text: Web-based application development : the most important technologies for web applications at a glance. This book is intended for all those who want to be fundamentally and comprehensively involved in the development of web-based applications. Based on a seminar series of the same name, the author introduces you to the respective technologies that can be used in a modern 4-tier application. The aim is to provide you with a comprehensive understanding of the development of so-called enterprise applications, which is profound but does not go too deep into the matter. At the end of each section you know which technologies are available, how these technologies work and what technology has what advantages.
content.title_en: Web-based application development : the most important technologies for web applications at a glance

content.text: A new house of books: [Architecture competition for the 4th extension of the Deutsche Bücherei Leipzig]. Founded in 1912, the Deutsche Bücherei Leipzig - together with the Deutsche Bibliothek Frankfurt am Main and the Deutsche Musikarchiv Berlin - collects all German-language publications without any problems. Its holdings grow every day by 24 shelf meters of books. Since the magazines are used up, an extension building for the new additions of the next 20 years is now to create space and host the German Book and Writing Museum. In a Europe-wide competition of over 200 participants, Stuttgart architect Gabriele Glöckler won the prize with a city-building, architectural and functionally convincing design. Her concept "Content-Hülle-Umschlag" is the now fourth extension of the Deutsche Bücherei. The book portrays the current building and its surroundings, documents the architectural competition and its results and presents winners in detail in text and image.
content.title_en: A new house of books : [Architecture competition for the 4th extension of the Deutsche Bücherei Leipzig]

content.text: Task collection on the basics of electrical engineering : with solutions and detailed solutions ; the proven help for students of electrical engineering and other technical courses starting from the 1st semester. Publisher's text: This extensive task collection, which is now available in the 11th edition, is a proven help in understanding the basics of electrical engineering.
content.title_en: Tasks on the basics of electrical engineering : with solutions and detailed solutions ; proven assistance for students of electrical engineering and other technical courses from the 1st semester

content.text: Black box - white cube. "Among the different pairs of contrasts that have structured the culture of the twentieth century, there is also the contrast between gallery space and cinema room. One belonged to the high culture, the other to the mass culture. Under the economic primacy of art production - individual artists create unique works - the artists spent a lot of energy experimenting in the twentieth century with what could be placed in the neutral setting of the White Cube: they said themselves off the flat right-angled frame by opening the third dimension; they covered the floor with their works, they attached them to the ceiling, etc. In other words, to try an analogy between the artwork and a digital computer, one could say that in modern art both the "physical interface" and the "software interface" of the artwork were not defined, but were released for experiments." (Lev Manovich) Lev Manovich, professor of media art and theory at the Visual Arts Department of the University of California, San Diego (USA).
content.title_en: Black box - white cube

content.text: Training program for the prevention of depression in adolescents : LARS&LISA: A desire for realistic vision & lightness in everyday social life. The manual describes a ten-session group program for the universal prevention of depression in adolescence. LARS&LISA (a desire for realistic vision & lightness in everyday social life) serves to build functional cognitions and promote social skills. Both are important resources in dealing with stress, as they are especially seen in puberty. A lack of these skills increases the probability of the occurrence of depression and other psychological problems. Through its primary preventive approach, LARS&LISA can be carried out with all adolescents aged between 12 and 16. The training program consists of the building blocks »Formulation of personal goals«, »Cooperation between cognitions, emotions and behaviour«, »Exploration and change of dysfunctional cognition«, »Self-security training« and »Training of social competences«. Numerous working materials and detailed instructions for the implementation of the training facilitate the implementation into practice.
content.title_en: Training program for the prevention of depression in adolescents : LARS&LISA: A desire for realistic vision & lightness in everyday social life

content.text: Springer Engineering Tables. Reference work with basic information (definitions, memoranda) and diagrams, formulas and tables on important areas of engineering. Finely structured data collection for repetition and re-examination. Is less and more compressed than "engineering knowledge" (BA 10/04) and can usefully complement the compendium (older table collections are outdated). For a wide range of specialist readers in study and practice. (2)
content.title_en: Springer Engineering Tables

content.text: Computers have not only penetrated modern life as universal machines, but also changed all kinds of communication and thus organization and workflows due to their diverse functionality. Multi-layered knowledge of modern information technologies has become indispensable. In this book, this knowledge is taught in a solid and high level. In particular, the basic technologies from the fields of computer architecture, networks, distributed systems, programming languages and software engineering as well as the database systems, from whose understanding many current keywords of technical developments and trends can be derived. This carefully developed work is directed primarily at decision-makers in technology management and professionals in the IT industry who want to acquire a profound understanding of central basic technologies. content.title_en: Compendium of information technology : hardware, software, client server systems, networks, databases

content.text: Modelling with UML : Language, concepts and methodology ; with tables. Two current trends are emerging in the continuously growing portfolio of developmental techniques. On the one hand, UML dominates as a modeling language. On the other hand, "agile" methods are being used in ever new areas. This book is an introduction to the development methodology that combines UML with elements of agile methods. The tutorial describes how UML is used as a modeling language. Class, object, sequence diagrams, state charts and OCL are introduced systematically and comprehensiblely using many examples. This introduction is particularly suitable for practitioners who want to use the core concepts of a modern modeling language without being too much defined by a standard.
content.title_en: Modelling with UML : Language, concepts and methodology ; with tables

content.text: Introducing the report explains how incorrect ventilation, heating and thermal insulation lead to moisture problems in the interior and what a qualified research on the causes is. Then the causes for moisture in the masonry, repair of damp cellars, handling moulds etc. are discussed in detail. (Elke Nibbrig) The author is known by DIY books (last BA 10/94) and offers a book on the causes of moisture in houses and apartments as well as useful possibilities for damage elimination. Introducing the report explains how false ventilation, heating and thermal insulation lead to moisture problems in indoor spaces and how qualified cause research looks like in case of damage images by moisture. Extensive treatment is given to the causes of moisture in the masonry, repair of damp cellars, handling of moulds in indoor spaces and the dangers of house sponge. Based on practical case studies, both correct and unusual rehabilitation measures damage;1 4027151-1 Reconditioning:11Requiretor
content.title_en: Moisture damage in the house : Identify causes - Remove damage
