content.text: The botanical excursion : step by step towards herbarium. The creation of a herbarium is part of some training and study programmes such as pharmacy, botany or agriculture and forestry. Also at high schools and schools for pharmaceutical-technical assistants are sometimes herbaria part of the curriculum. The present book (DIN A 5) is aimed at this group of people. There is help to plan botanical excursions professionally, to proceed systematically during collection, to find good plant material, to bring it home in as unharmed a state as possible and to dry there so that the characteristics of the plants are preserved. The handling of the different requirements for pressing and drying the plant material is treated by typical representatives of important families. (2)
content.title_en: The botanical excursion : step by step to the herbarium

content.text: Evaluation of political education : is impact measurable?. The importance of educational programmes for democracy and tolerance education has increased considerably in Germany in recent years. But how can their impact be assessed? The volume "Evaluation of political education" presents exemplary methods, opportunities and difficulties of evaluation of training programmes for social learning and puts them to the discussion
content.title_en: Evaluation of political education : Is impact measurable?

content.text: Architect of illusions. The Mies van der Rohe Prize winner has become known through numerous spectacular projects throughout Europe. As an architect of illusions he dedicated himself to great panoramas. He created a breathtaking panorama of ancient Rome in the time of Emperor Constantine. At the world exhibition EXPO in Seville he presented his space installation Orbit 2000, at the Biennale in Venice the design of the Ponte del Accaademia bridge was to be visited on the Canale Grande, in four rotundas he delighted in Berlin 285 000 visitors with his city vision. Berlin 2005, which showed plans of Alexanderplatz, of Potsdamer, Pariser and Schloß Platz visually implemented. On the Hansepanorama Asisi united the medieval cities that had joined together in the Hansebund, and transferred 110,000 visitors to Stunnen. In New York he realized a project to Ground Zero and in Leipzig, his last large company, meanwhile, over 230 000 visitors took the fascination that emanced from the highest mountain of the world, home by taking his project 8848. Everest 360° to an old gasometer of the city, on a 35 meter high and highly sophisticated exhibition of the artist.
content.title_en: Architect of illusions

content.text: Hotels in Germany. Publisher's text: The publication Hotels in Germany focuses on the contribution of German architects and designers to the current dynamic development in hotel design. On about 300 pages, with about 350 colored illustrations and short texts, 80 are sometimes very different concepts of hotel architecture and
content.title_en: Hotels in Germany

content.text: Life despite death. The subject of "life after death" has lost its attractiveness, even for Christians. On the other hand, the great question of how the struggle for life before death and in the face of life-threatening situations can be endured has become increasingly important. At this point, the contributions of the book "life despite death" are used. It is not a question of reflecting on the theological depth dimensions (...) but of developing the very concrete strategies that biblical theologians (...) develop, how they re-enlighten hopeless or fatal situations and thereby awaken new courage for life.
content.title_en: Life in spite of death

content.text: Strategies for urban regions in the 21st century: Recommendations for a field of action of national importance. Urban regions are centres of economic power, locations of research and development, focal points of living and focal points of cultural and social change. They are the carriers of economic growth, technological innovation and social development in Germany and Europe. For a new orientation and concentration of state and municipal spatial development policy, the urban regions have to assume a decisive role. In recent decades, urban regions have been able to support regional and even transnational balances through growth surpluses. However, structurally-induced growth weaknesses, demographic changes and the crisis of public finances have fundamentally changed the situation. A working group of the Academy of Spatial Research and State Planning and the German Academy of Urban Planning and State Planning call for this writing and the theses to initiate the necessary changes to the institutional reorder of the urban regions and to combine this strategic reorientation with a reform of the financial constitution at all levels.
content.title_en: Strategies for metropolitan regions in the 21st century : Recommendations for a field of action of national importance

content.text: Theoretical optics : an introduction. Starting from the fundamentals of electrodynamics, this book offers a short but comprehensive introduction to modern theoretical optics, to topics such as quantum optics, interactions between light and matter or nonlinear phenomena.
content.title_en: Theoretical optics : an introduction

content.text: Scientifically working with PowerPoint: [from PowerPoint 2000 to PowerPoint 2003]. Introduction to the course of scientific work with Microsoft PowerPoint 2000, 2002 and 2003 in a revised edition. It is not only shown which program features such as foil master and foil layouts are helpful in scientific work, but also which cliffs need to be re-routed to bring the work safely and successfully to the goal. During the course of the book a seminar lecture is developed gradually and implemented ready for presentation. Among other things, it includes: data backup and data recovery, images for Word documents, graphics scan and save in a presentation-oriented manner and technology of electronic presentation. Clear structure, thus also possible cross-entry. Should be acquired in all libraries with appropriate target audience. (2) (LK/SFB: Green) The daily guide for working with PowerPoint for students: it guides the students through typical tasks that occur during diploma work and dissertations. Classifications help in the search. In this book it is both about PowerPoint presentations in a text as well as about preparing independent lectures.
content.title_en: Scientifically working with PowerPoint: [from PowerPoint 2000 to PowerPoint 2003]

content.text: The theory of measurement and integration is now available in a fourth, corrected edition. It provides the reader with a solid basic knowledge of how it is indispensable for wide areas of mathematics, especially for real analysis, functional analysis, probability theory and mathematical statistics. Thematic focus is on product dimensions, Fourier transformation, transformation formula, convergence concepts, absolute stability and measurements on topological spaces. The highlight is the derivation of Riesz's representational set with the help of a continuation result of Kisynski and the proof of the existence and clarity of the Haarian dimension. It is also a section on convergence of measurements. The text is relaxed by numerous mathematical-historical excursions and short portraits of mathematicians who have provided important contributions to the subject of the book. A variety of exercise tasks deepens the substance. TOC:Sigma algebras and Borel's sets.- Content and measures.- Measurable functions.- Livesgue integral.- Product measurements of absolute measurement and conversion formula.- Composition.- Composition.- Composition.- Composition.- Composition.- Composition.
content.title_en: Measurement and integration theory

content.text: Golden Rules of Game Programming : Methods for efficient programming of computer games. This book provides a wealth of best practices with its "Golden Rules" that contain useful clues as the game developer optimizes and refines his techniques in programming. All rules build on each other. Through it, the game programmer learns to make his work and thus the team of developers effective, so that the process of game development becomes less error-prone and at the same time faster. Topics are dealt with e.g. Effective Search and Spatial Separation, Finite Elements, Geometric Forms, Matrices, Data Optimization, Compilation, Heredication and the use of Script Languages. The book provides the reader with a profound understanding of the basic techniques and processes of game development. Thus, it is an ideal companion for all developers who want to do more intensively game programming, but also for professionals who want to expand and refine their advanced knowledge. On CD-ROM: All source code for integration into their own projects Full version of the compression library Zlib
content.title_en: Golden Rules of Game Programming : Methods for efficient programming of computer games

content.text: No beautiful country: the destruction of social justice. A settlement with a policy that has forgotten what the Basic Law says: "the Federal Republic is a social rule of law". The consequences are to be foreseen: People's parties are alienated from the people, the voters run away in masses. Then the hour of the populist beats. (publisher text) *** This title is intended for the ekz storage. It can be noted for you from now on. The extradition by the ekz takes place immediately after the date of publication - regardless of the subsequent bibliographical review
content.title_en: Not a beautiful country: the destruction of social justice

content.text: Multimedia and interactive learning spaces. This book describes the user-oriented and task-oriented design of multimedia and interactive learning spaces. Design methods, models and processes are also illuminated as well as learning characteristics, interaction and dialogue paradigms. From the content: learning spaces; cognitive foundations of multimedia learning; hypermedia and multimedia learning spaces; virtual reality as learning space; animated pedagogic agents; storytelling; distributed teaching and learning; computer-supported cooperative learning; knowledge management; conception of learning spaces
content.title_en: Multimedia and interactive learning spaces

content.text: Compressed air compendium. History, physics, areas of application of compressed air with special consideration of compressors and their components. Created in cooperation with a compressor company. In a generally understandable way, supplemented by numerous illustrations, but closely printed, was revised compared to the first edition 1997 (ID 19/98) (operating costs section), the basic information is still valid. Can be used as a low-cost, current alternative to M. Bahr (ID 8/00). The old edition should be replaced as far as possible. (3)
content.title_en: Compressed air compendium

content.text: Fire Tweezers - Witnesses of the early days: [483rd meeting on 4 February 2004 in Düsseldorf]. From the introduction: Fire Tweezers or hyperthermophiles are bacteria and other microorganisms that optimally (most rapidly) grow at temperatures from 80° to 106°C. Although these fire Tweeds cannot multiply at moderate temperatures, they are able to survive in a kind of cold rigid for years. This report gives an overview of the hyperthermophiles, their habitats and requirements, food methods and their development history.
content.title_en: Fire Twerge - Witnesses of the Ancient World : [483rd meeting in Düsseldorf on 4 February 2004]

content.text: Basics of structural design - Safety concept and design rules for the construction of constructional engineering : Explanatory notes to DIN 1055-100. Within the new DIN 1055 "Impact on structural structures" the Tei 100 "Safety concept and design rules" illustrated here represents an important link between the future national impact and design standards. Thus, the publication supports builders, design and structural planners and construction managers in important practical considerations relating to structural constructions
content.title_en: Basics of structural design - Safety concept and design rules for the construction of constructional engineering : Explanatory notes to DIN 1055-100

content.text: Commercial vehicle technology : Basics, systems, components ; with 52 tables. Rez.: Basic specialist on trucks and special vehicles for engineers and technicians in training and practice. Brings short information on historical development, puts the content emphasis on the description of the components and their conception. Has been extended compared to the first edition 2000 (ID 21/01) by approx. 20 pages (particle filter, four-wheel drive) and adjusted to new guidelines. Suitable for current addition (a replacement of the editions is not yet necessary). (3) (LK/N: Pleuß)
content.title_en: Commercial vehicle technology : basics, systems, components ; with 52 tables

content.text: Windows XP: [intelligible answers to the most common questions" ; important tips on Service Pack 2: optimally configure and fix problems]. Apparently nothing better could happen than the appearance of the "Service Pack 2" for Windows XP or 2000, because this is reflected in numerous new advisors (further information will be discussed here soon). For the present volume of a new Data-Becker series (see Alexander Moritz: "Nero 6" in this no.) a large amount of questions and problems about the operating system were apparently collected, arranged and answered in a clear manner. The whole thing is differentiated - here in 17 chapters - divided and well solved, all questions and problems are already mentioned in the detailed content register. Many topics from the hardware and software area (the Service Pack 2 appears at various points), with each of the approximately 1/2 to 1 page sections being formulated first, before, either in contiguous explanations or in step-by-step instructions, a probate answer is given. Since one can offer books of this kind - practical problems of PC users can never be solved properly enough.
content.title_en: Windows XP: [intelligible answers to the most common questions" ; important tips for Service Pack 2: optimally configure and fix problems]

content.text: The study of the theoretical physics / Torsten Flüssbach; 2: Electrodynamics. This textbook gives an introduction to electrodynamics as offered at the university in the cycle "Theoretical Physics". The author has attached particular importance to a clearly legible, comprehensible and manageable representation. The individual steps are presented in such detail that the reader can understand them without any major difficulty. The preparatory part I presents the mathematical aids needed for the following in compact form. The treatment of electrostatics (Part II) and magnetostatics (Part III) are combined. Based on experimental findings, the field equations are motivated and the various methods for their solution discussed in detail. Building on this, Part IV deals with Maxwell's theory, which describes the coupling of electric and magnetic fields in the time-dependent case. The properties of the Maxwell equations are examined, in particular the general solution and the behaviour under Lorenz transformations as well as the Lagrange formation. Part V deals with applications such as the hollow space waves, the radiation accelerated charge, the frequency of the spectrum of the spectrum of the spectrum of the electrons and the spectrum of the spectrum of the spectrum of the spectrum of the spectrum of the spectrum of the spectrum of the spectrum.
content.title_en: Theoretical Physics textbook / Torsten Flüssbach ; 2: Electrodynamics

content.text: Technology Roadmapping : Future strategies for technology companies; dedicated to Professor Dr. Heiner Müller-Merbach. Technology Roadmapping provides the tools for designing future strategies for technology companies. It serves to further develop the technological position in the course of time, identify market opportunities early and efficiently deploy resources. Powerful core tools such as scenario-based exploratory technology roadmapping and TRIZ-based technology roadmapping help specialists and managers to take a successful approach. In this edition  a comprehensive chapter with practical examples was included, which provides both insights into companies and in EU research initiatives. Substantially expanded the chapters "Processual and content orientation for technology roadmapping" and "Certain tools of technology roadmapping" were added. With the associated doubling of the scope of this book, the aim of becoming the standard work of technology roadmapping was also extended. TOC:Introduction.- Processual and content orientation of the technology roadmapping.
content.title_en: Technology Road Mapping : Future Strategies for Technology Companies ; Dedicated to Professor Dr. Heiner Müller-Merbach

content.text: Integration of migrants: French and German concepts compared. With contributions by Marnia Belhadj, Yves Bizeul, Thomas Faist, Matthias Kaufmann, Dieter Oberndörfer, Walter Reese-Schäfer, Jakob Rösel, Catherine Wihtol de Wenden and Michel Wieviorka
content.title_en: Integration of migrants : French and German concepts compared

content.text: Algebraic Basics of Informatics : Structures - Numbers - Encryption - Coding. Algebraic Structures: Semigroups and Monoides - Groups - Rings, Body and Integrity Areas Introduction to Number Theory: Divinability, Irreducibility and Prime Elements - Divinability of Whole Numbers - Divinability of Polynomials - Congruence Equations - The Euler Phi Function - Prim number tests - Primitive Roots and Discrete Logarithms Introduction to Cryptology: Simple Chiffrier Systems - Perfect Safety and One Time Pad Procedure - Public Key Systems Linear Algebra: Vector Spaces - Linear Equation Systems and Matrices Introduction to Coding Theory: Simple Codes - Perfect Codes - Prefix Codes - Information, Entropy and Sentences of Shannon - Test Mark Encoding - Cyclical Codes
content.title_en: Algebraic basics of computer science : Structures - Numbers - Encryption - Coding

content.text: Problem case German unity : interdisciplinary considerations on all-German issues. The collection "Problem case German unity" leads central discourses in the reunification process and necessary discussions with weak points of the reunification process. Twenty authors deal with constitutional, cultural, social, economic and environmental issues, and also with problems of the transformation process and the special situations of selected target groups. Demographic, psychological, poverty and gender-related aspects of the unification process are taking a deeper look. - Success and failures: Central discourses about the reunification process - Situations in the reunited Germany - Institutions in the transformation process - Gender-related issues - Environmental policy and urban planning Problems of the German reunification - Culture and subculture
content.title_en: Problem case of German unity : interdisciplinary considerations on all-German questions

content.text: Perspectives of the Design of Work and Technology: Festschrift für Peter Brödner. On the occasion of the adoption of Peter Brödner, the articles gathered in this volume present a review of the discussion on the design of work and technology, which brings together different perspectives that transcend the individual sciences. The contributions explore the often rather disrupted relationship between work, organization, information technology and innovation, which for many years has been the central subject of Peter Brödner's work, and document the conceptual debate in the thematic fields.
content.title_en: Perspectives of the design of work and technology : Festschrift für Peter Brödner

content.text: Urmensch und Wissenschaften : an inventory ; [Festschrift für Dieter Groh]. How can the first beginnings of scientific thinking and action be described, analyzed and classified into historical models? What can genetics contribute to the determination of the relationship between monkeys and humans? What does the current family tree of man look like? What fantasies did the Urmensch in science, literature and art underlie in the course of history? What is the relationship between primitive societies and modern societies? Researchers, especially humanities, are trying to develop a diverse picture of prehistoric culture and our images of it here.
content.title_en: Urmensch und Wissenschaften : an inventory ; [Festschrift für Dieter Groh]

content.text: Free Software : between private and community property. Free Software (especially GNU/Linux as the most famous example) is one of the most amazing knowledge phenomena of our time. The programs are not only useful, they also shed a new light on the history of Internet and software, on the property of intellectual goods, on the infrastructure of knowledge and its mediation in education - in short, on how we deal with knowledge and with each other. Their success already gives us a glimpse of what a computer-connected collective intelligence can do.- The book gives a generally understandable introduction to the topic, which allows it to get an overview of this history of the Internet and the current discussion even without prior technical knowledge.
content.title_en: Free Software : between private and public property

content.text: The author is a civil engineer and has been working for years as the father of a severely disabled son in the field of barrier-free construction. The main focus of this guide is on accessibility for all groups of people - not only for wheelchair users - in construction practice and shows the necessity of this construction. The main points of barrier-free planning are detailed: stepless development, level-level door thresholds, barrier-free bathroom, mobbling plan. Other topics are practical solutions and details of the components, current project examples from private and public housing and opinions of people with different handicaps. With numerous photos, construction drawings, tables, excerpts from building regulations and DIN standards. Target group of the understandable, practical advisor are besides planners, craftsmen and builders also members and affected. Basic supplement to J. Giessler (BA 3/05) for barrier-free living in old age, before "barrier-free living" (BA 5/00) and B. Rühm (BA 3/04) (1).
content.title_en: Guide to accessible housing : from theory to practice

content.text: "The IT security in the company is a key element of the strategic approach. Bursch is able to communicate with all the key aspects of an efficient IT security concept. In spite of increasing risks in terms of IT security, many companies are not being smartly affected by the resulting damage - although they have suffered high financial damage, for example due to viruses, worms, Trojans and not least criminal employees. To avoid the enormous range of potential dangers and the resulting financial disadvantages, IT security and the use of tactical security measures have become a priority. For IT management as well as for the entire company. Daniel Bursch succeeds in showing pioneering knowledge about the explosive topic of "qualified IT security". His book shows above all that a complete IT security concept must be considered holistically and cannot be limited to technical measures such as firewalls, access control systems or cryptography. Especially the management of reliable business processes and their support by secure IT services are important factors in the strategic approach. Bursch communicates expertly and compactly all the essential aspects of an efficient IT security concept. A comprehensive checklist catalogue is also suitable for the implementation of a business.
content.title_en: IT security in the company : basics, strategies, check-up

content.text: The volume discusses a number of procurement issues that are of current relevance to local authorities and their companies as "public contracting entities" in terms of public procurement law (public procurement law) and inter-municipal cooperation. The volume deals with the local design options for public-private partnerships (public-private partnerships) and, in the light of the current discussion at EU level, the scope of tendering obligations. The scope of the concept of public contracting authorities plays a particular role in this respect. Furthermore, the question of tendering obligations and their exceptions to PPP models and privatisations is addressed. Further discussion blocks are the awarding requirements for the award of service concessions and the scope of the scope of the award law in the field of inter-municipal cooperation in the field of supply and disposal. Finally, the admissibility of the inclusion of such non-contracting aspects in service descriptions is discussed.
content.title_en: Design options for public contracting authorities from the point of view of procurement law : current procurement requirements for public-private partnerships (PPPs) and inter-municipal cooperation

content.text: This book takes up the most important conditions of living in old age and undergoes a systematic evaluation. This analysis begins with the historical roots of institutional living and leads through the central aspects of acute living to special housing offers and forms with stationary care. Among the most important perspectives of future living in old age are new concepts of residential-related, supportive everyday aids and the further development of communal living forms up to a continuous strengthening of living in care. The book is aimed at all experts who deal with the current questions of living in old age and the assessment of its development perspectives.
content.title_en: Living in old age

content.text: The main focus of this discussion was on the practical recommendations for action in the context of a working group on the better integration of agricultural functions into spatial planning and on supporting the solution of concrete conflicts of use with suitable models. The working group focused on the two areas of spatial planning as part of its planning work, based on available advice, studies and current problem constellations. *Protection of agricultural spatial features in the context of sustainable regional development, *Protection of spatial structures from impairments through intensive livestock management. The present working material addresses the topic of sustainability from both areas of responsibility for resource use and problems in determining, concretizing and balancing spatial structures in the context of sustainable regional development, *Protection of spatial structures from impairments through intensive livestock management. The present work material is presented in the context of the two main areas of responsibility for the management of the agricultural sector, and in the context of the management of agricultural resources and the management of land use.
content.title_en: Integration of agricultural functions into spatial planning

content.text: Basic course of artificial intelligence: a practical introduction. Books on artificial intelligence have been rarely discussed in recent years. Reference is made to G. Görz (BA 2/04), which treats AI as a cross-sectional science between technology, natural sciences and cultural sciences, or A. Cawsey (ID 33/03), a refresher of basic knowledge - for example on exam preparation. This book takes a middle position. It presents important sub-areas of AI application-related, but does not include excessive detail. Readers who have upper-level knowledge of mathematics and have basic programming skills are addressed. Agents, logic, search, closing and uncertainty, machine learning and neural networks are treated. Not treated are image processing, fuzzy logic and processing of natural languages. Numerous tasks classified by difficulty. Extra-marked tasks requiring programming or special computer science skills. Helpful website with further information, but also presentation slides for lecturers. Very well suited also for self-study. (2)
content.title_en: Basic course artificial intelligence : a practical introduction

content.text: Exhaust gas technology for diesel engines: pollutant reduction and exhaust aftertreatment, particulate filter, DENOXTRONIC, on-board diagnostic OBD. Informs about pollutant reduction in diesel engines, filter systems and control systems. Part of the sub-series "Motor control for diesel engines" within the "yellow series" of Bosch publishing house, from which "Diesel series injection pumps" (ID 31/03) was presented here. The present volume is less special and should not only address workshop specialists but also technically skilled lay people due to the fine dust discussion. Not only does the technology, but also addresses international laws, diagnostic procedures, alternative fuels. (2) (LK/N: Pleuß)
content.title_en: Exhaust gas technology for diesel engines : pollutant reduction and exhaust aftertreatment, particulate filter, DENOXTRONIC, on-board diagnosis OBD

content.text: Use of minerals in food: toxicological and nutritional aspects; Part 2. The supply of food supplements and enriched foods (traditional foods of general consumption with added vitamins and/or minerals) is multi-faceted and expanding; therefore it is important to establish uniform rules and maximum levels for these products to protect consumers from possible health damage and also from misleadness. Directive 2002/46/EC, adopted by the European Parliament in June 2002, is a first step towards a uniform regime for food supplements in Europe. First, it lists in a positive list all the substances that may be added to food supplements in the future in the countries of the European Community. It is planned to set maximum levels (relating to the daily dose recommended by the manufacturer) in a next step. [...] (Source: Introduction)
content.title_en: Use of minerals in food : toxicological and nutritional aspects ; Part 2
Foundry / ed.: DIN, German Institute for Standardization ; 2: Non-ferrous metal casting : Standards

content.text: World Wonders : Children as a naturalist. Elschenbroich promotes the focus of "natural science as an educational experience" and the exploration of nature in early childhood.
content.title_en: Wonders of the World : Children as a naturalist

content.text: The Islamic civilization, especially its Arab core countries, is in a deep crisis. It is still superior in every respect in the Middle Ages to Christendom, since then the region of the Near East has stagnated and does not participate in the development that the West has undergone from the early modern era. This is more evident today, after the end of the Cold War and under the conditions of accelerating globalization, than ever before. The result is political radicalism occurring in the religious guise, on the one hand, timid attempts to join the modern age, on the other. The historian Dan Diner, one of the best connoisseurs of the complex Middle Eastern conflict situation, manages convincingly to name the causes of this development blockade. The diagnosed standstill is due less to Islam as a religion than to specific social, economic, cultural and political circumstances of the Near East. They lead to an all-time presence of the sacral even in areas from which it has been displaced elsewhere on the way to modernism. Historically actuating and out of a lack of knowledge of the realms, a new field of view, a new time opened to a single-minded, non-sounding time.
content.title_en: Sealed time: about the standstill in the Islamic world

content.text: Energy transition in heavy seas? : Conflicts over offshore wind power use. On the one hand, offshore wind energy has great potential for ecological conversion of the energy system. On the other hand, the planned wind farms in the German North and Baltic Sea are fiercely controversial. It is noteworthy that the wind farms do not trigger the "classic" economic-ecology conflict. On the other hand, regional structural change conflicts as well as internal ecological conflicts are at the centre of the debate, e.g. about wind farms in marine protected areas or the course of cable paths through the Wadden Sea, where nature conservation and climate protection collide. The authors investigate the opportunities and problems of offshore wind energy. They examine the possibility of viable conflict solutions, in which they consider above all the action dilemata, into the conflict parties such as island and coastal communities, environmental associations, offshore wind farms operators and political decision-makers.
content.title_en: Energy transition in heavy seas? : Conflicts over offshore wind energy use

content.text: Islam in the classroom: impulses for educational work. Ayse does not participate in swimming lessons, Mehmet does not participate in class trips and Nuray sleeps almost during Ramadan. More than 700,000 students in Germany are Muslim faiths. They are no longer a minority and shape schools and residences through their own values, traditions and rituals. Life and learning, however, do not always run without conflict and means new challenges for teachers, parents and students. With the initiative "Vonzeichnen Lernen - Praxisforum Schule und Islam", the Körber Foundation, together with the Cultural Ministerial Conference of the Länder, asked educators for their experiences and successful, practical ideas and projects to deal with these challenges. Whether theatre plays, the deliberate thematicization of differences in teaching, the research of their own family history or the developments of intercultural school profiles - educators between Schleswig-Holstein and Bavaria have developed projects that can be used for dialogue.
content.title_en: Islam in the classroom : impulses for educational work

Publisher's text: Program setup and variable declaration - Logical basic links and function tables - memory functions, flank evaluation, conversion of contact and electropneumatic controls - time functions, clock signals, counting functions, free-graphic function plan - transmission functions, comparison functions, jumps - sequence controls with and without operating mode part
content.title_en: Automation with PLC : Overviews and exercises ; from basic links to sequence controls: STEP7 programming, solution methods, learning tasks, control tasks, solutions, examples for plant simulation ; with 10 introduction examples and 51 project-based learning tasks, 47 testing control tasks with all solutions

content.text: The Third Reich. Excellent overview of central, science and public controversies about the NS state during the last 60 years. (Barbara Dankert) Introductory series. The scientific efforts for the research of the 3rd Reich are extremely diverse, as are the inherent research problems and controversy. M. Kißener (historic of the University of Mainz) gives a lecture on the central, scientific and public debates about the NS state of the last 60 years. These are and were interpretations of Hitler's role, the discussions on the responsibility for the Holocaust, the guilt of the Wehrmacht and other institutions of the NS state, questions about the concept of resistance and the historical processing of the Nazi past. Given the abundance of material, an especially structured, current research state precisely bundled, very legible analysis; as a textbook for students, students (secondary level 2) and historically interested well suited.
content.title_en: The Third Reich

content.title_en: Aluminium : Standards / ed.: DIN, German Institute for Standardization ; 1: strip, sheet, sheet, sheet, sheet, butt, Ronden, welded pipes, pre-material : standards

content.text: The Gothic architecture. Who is not speechless in the miracle of a Gothic cathedral? And who did not guess about the performance of the great builders and the medieval building huts? But what is so sublime as a secret in stone existed before as a draft on parchment. The copper engraving cabinet of the Academy of Fine Arts in Vienna is fortunate to have the world's largest collection of original Gothic architectural drawings from the 14th and 15th centuries. This invaluable inventory - 428 drawings - was first comprehensively worked out by art historian Johann Josef Böker. His research is a cultural historical event of the first rank: it puts the history of Gothic architecture on a new foundation. No researcher will be around it in the future, nor should any lover of Gothicism miss the magnificent volume that now makes the treasure publicly accessible: on 464 pages the architectural plans are presented in four-colour printing, accompanied by historical black and white photographs of the buildings. - - - The restored and digitized collection was awarded the European Heritage Award/Europe Nostra 2003 and was included in the Register of the Worldory.
content.title_en: Gothic architecture

content.text: The interior of the house: the business card of the house. The design of the entrance area as the "headboard of the house" has an important aesthetic function. The author (last BA 2/06) shows architecturally successful solutions on 23 examples of single-family houses, double-houses, terraced houses, residential complexes and public buildings. In addition to the actual entrance area, the new buildings or renovations have been included as well as the colour scheme, route guidance, courtyard and garden design. The projects are presented on 4 pages each with pictures, floor plans, building data and practical information on the design, technical and planning-related tasks. Recommendable collection of ideas for builders, craftsmen and architects on a hardly treated topic in the building literature. Can be used next to "New Entrances" (BA 4/01), on which there is no overlap. (2) The volume shows architecturally successful solutions of entrance areas for various single-family houses, double-houses, terraced houses, residential complexes and public buildings. (LK/KA: Nibbrig)
content.title_en: Home entrances : the business card of the house

content.text: Bike Physics and Biomechanics : Technique, Formulas, Laws. Publisher's text: What happens physically when we keep the balance with the bike, brake, bends, and climbs? Michael Gressmann explains the secrets of bicycle physics thoroughly and intelligibly. Energy, power, acceleration forces and friction resistance, lever ratios and the influence of posture are calculated using the concrete example. This follows many indications for bicycle technology and technical material. Particularly valuable for the practitioner: considerations and calculations on air resistance, gyro-forces, frame geometry, sitting position and cadence.
content.title_en: Cycling Physics and Biomechanics : Technology, Formulas, Laws

content.text: Bird flu: on the social production of epidemics. US globalization critic M. Davis sees in the bird flu less a mutation mood of nature than an inevitable result of capitalist market dynamics. He tries to substantiate his theses of the social production of epidemics by means of the upheavals in East Asia. (Uwe-Friedrich Obsen) Among medical doctors the virus is called H5N1; the city sociologist ("ecology of fear": BA 1/01) and globalization critics ("The Birth of the Third World": ID 40/04) it calls in the US original the "Monster at our Door". Davis places the topic less in the medical-biological context; for him the bird flu is not merely a mutation mood of nature, but also and above all symptom of the capitalist market dynamics with industrial mass livestock farming, inadequate hygiene, political misconceptions and delays, as well as a corrupt poultry and pharmaceutical industry, which is precisely in the poor countries to develop a pandemic slaughter bomb and in the case of the disaster. For example, the bird flu provides the population of the population of the population.
content.title_en: Avian flu : on the social production of epidemics

Over 6 million iPods sold speak a clear language, so books about this cult device (most recently Y. Notomi: BA 6/05) or about the Duo Player and software are not out of place. content.text: Postmodern leisure styles and leisure spaces: new offers in tourism. The book provides you with a comprehensive and in-depth insight into how you successfully manage the changes in tourism and leisure styles. The work provides you with a wide range of insights. From a wide range of perspectives, you will learn about the fundamental factors influencing the postmodern leisure and tourism society. The development of stagings and artificial worlds of experience as well as the central trends of health, wellness and sport are comprehensively discussed and prepared for the development of new offers. Opportunities and risks of the postmodern leisure and tourism society are explored. Concrete examples illustrate all the connections helpful.
content.title_en: Postmodern leisure styles and leisure spaces : new offers in tourism

content.text: LATEX with proTeXt. Latex is a page design language, i.e. a sentence system that allows for the typographically flawless design of demanding text documents. Latex does not work according to the WYSIWYG principle. This book offers more than one introduction for beginners. In densely pressed representation all important areas of use of latex with the associated commands are presented. Examples are limited to the most necessary, explanations are almost always omitted. Many supplement packages are pointed out, which greatly expand the possibilities of latex. Details are to be taken from the corresponding package documentation. The book is based on proTeXt 1.2 (MiKteX as well as a development environment with a very powerful editor, on accompanying CD-ROM). Output format is the PDF format, on PostScript is only briefly addressed. Many useful annexes. Comprehensive presentation; an attentive reading is required - and occasionally also a handle to a not so compressed representation, e.g. P. Schlager (BA 6/05). (2)
content.title_en: LATEX with proTeXt

content.text: Cultural didactics in English lessons. The contributions of this collection deal with fundamental aspects of cultural content teaching. They relate mainly, but not exclusively to English lessons. Numerous methodological references encourage the work with cultural topics in language learning. Concrete suggestions are also made on how to work with the contributions themselves in the classroom or seminar.
content.title_en: Cultural didactics in English lessons

content.text: When the cathedrals grew into the sky: building in the Middle Ages. The author presents the social and technical conditions of medieval church construction and provides an insight into both the financing and organization as well as the construction planning, construction and execution. (Olaf Kaptein) In the accompanying volume "Geheimnisvolle Welt" (Ch. Frayling: BA 2/96) the topic was already initiated into an ARD television series. In this appealing non-fiction book Binding, who recently published with H. Koepf a "Bildwortbuch der Architektur" (BA 12/05) and before that already diligently published to the Gothic sacral building, the social and technical conditions of medieval church construction were introduced. Thus one gets a fundamental insight into both the financing and organization as well as in the construction planning, construction and execution up to the individual works. An excellently made pictureglossary replaces annoying reprints in building style fibules. The numerous reproductions with extensive image signatures from medieval manuscripts illustrate the statements made.
content.title_en: When the cathedrals grew into the sky : Building in the Middle Ages

content.text: The electric locomotive: history, technology and operation of electric traction vehicles. Before describing the function of electric traction vehicles and their components in a language that is widely understood by lay people, the author is dedicated to the history of electric traction. He is the author of the first locomotive, which Siemens had driven around in a circle in 1879, through the variety of types of national railway time and the unit series, to the most modern vehicles in today's operation. Stangl provides information on maintenance and repair of the vehicles as well as on train driver training. The book concludes with tables that reflect important data from individual locomotives or locomotive series and electric railcars over several pages. The author is concerned with both the historical development of electric locomotives since 1879 and with the technology of the locomotives, their components and the necessary operating facilities on the track. (Günter Buhl)
content.title_en: The electric locomotive : history, technology and operation of electric traction vehicles

content.text: The McDonaldization of society. His provocative-critical theory of ?McDonaldization? of society now leads the American social scientist George Ritzer into the 21st century in a completely new edition. Using the example of the McDonald's empire, Ritzer shows how the rationalization of production processes in the sign of globalization more aggressive than ever is taking hold. The international expansion of the powerful corporation and its countless copies are just as of explosive topicality as the rebellion against such machinery: the principles of efficiency, predictability, predictability and control demonstrated at McDonald's imperishment imperish unresistibly into all our spheres of life a social institution, as the education and health care, or even the punishment of this do not remain spared. Diversity, individuality and independence are increasingly caught up in this process of unification, of equalizing and of equalization. Because McDonaldization is by far not only an economic process, but a life-keeping of our society, which does not gain in the opposite, but rather the principle of the same becomes more evident in the first.
content.title_en: The McDonaldization of Society

content.text: Shop design. Publisher text: Approximately 50 architects present their new ideas on the topic of sales rooms. Floor plans are attached if available. Index with contact details.
content.title_en: Shop design

content.text: Methods of cultural-comparative social research : an introduction. Cultural comparison is becoming increasingly important in the course of globalization and internationalization of many areas of life. However, there are hardly any German-language textbooks on this topic. This gap closes the book. The aim of the volume is to present a practical introduction to the methods of cultural-comparative research. In particular, the possibilities and limits of cultural-comparative survey research are discussed. The book provides a solid basis for a critical approach to cultural-comparative studies, but it also provides basic knowledge for the own conduct of cultural-comparative research.
content.title_en: Methods of comparative social research : an introduction

content.text: Restructuring Eastern Germany : with 35 figures and 5 tables. Joint publication of five leading institutions for spatial research in Germany. The yearbook is intended to contribute to information and discussion on questions of spatial development, spatial planning and regional policy, structural policy at EU level and sustainable urban and spatial development (source: IRB)
content.title_en: Restructuring Eastern Germany : with 35 figures and 5 tables

content.text: The study provides an overview of the findings and analyses of a study on the career paths and achievements of former doctoral students of the Hans-Böckler-Stiftung (HBS). The empirical core of the study is a written survey of former doctoral students of the HBS, their supervisors and the trust lecturers involved from four years. The study shows that the practice of funding doctoral students by HBS has proven itself to be a very good practice. The vast majority of the funded persons conclude the doctoral studies and find appropriate professional activities within and outside science. The support from the supervisors and trust lecturers, as well as the handling of scholarship funding and the support from the business offices are largely positively assessed by the former scholarship holders. Similarly, the interviewed supervisors and trust lecturers express themselves in the opinion of the surveyed supervisors and trust lecturers. Many objective and subjective indicators indicate that the scholarship holders of HBS share the experiences of other doctoral students and doctoral students in many ways with regard to the academic community. However, this includes some of the students' opinions and other topics.
content.title_en: Doctoral studies as a process : the promotion of doctoral students by the Hans-Böckler-Stiftung ; results of a survey

content.text: The distribution effects of the Hartz IV reform: results of simulation analyses. The adoption of the Hartz IV law has come up with fierce protests. A central point of criticism is the reduction in benefits associated with the abolition of unemployment assistance. Does the reform actually lead to substantial income losses and the feared impoverishment of the long-term unemployed? On the other hand, to what extent are positive effects also arising from the fact that for subgroups the new unemployment benefit II (Alg II) is higher than the previous unemployment assistance? These questions are examined in a methodically differentiated way by the study. Based on the legal regulations Becker and Hauser develop a simulation model, which uses alternative microdata sources (EVS and SOEP) to examine whether and, if necessary, to what extent a claim for Alg II exists. The result of the simulation shows that there are reform winners and losers. Those who cut better or worse are differentiated according to East and West Germany, gender, household type, employment constellation in the household and age groups. Finally, the income distribution rates are determined by the income distribution.
content.title_en: Distribution effects of Hartz IV reform : Results of simulation analyses

content.text: Wood construction with system: support structure and layer structure of the components. In the mid-1990s, wooden construction was developed in addition to traditional construction methods (block construction, timber timber frame, timber stand construction) and the first modern systems with frame construction and skeleton construction. Wood constructions have now become significantly higher and larger, new support systems have been developed and the building shell serves as function carriers. In the present large-format volume, the wood construction specialist Kolb provides comprehensive, comprehensible and detailed information on the current state of modern timber construction. Material-related basics, individual wooden construction systems with supporting structure, structure and construction, functions and layer structure of building shell, walls and ceilings as well as framework conditions for wood protection and fire protection. Systematically structured and comprehensively illustrated with constructive detailed drawings, black-white and color photos, example projects in Germany and Switzerland. Recommended title for students, construction engineers and architects, which can well replace the older overview of G. Pfeifer (ID 27/99). After basic textbooks, e.g. by H. Schulze (BA 4/06), F. Colling (KID 50/BG/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/G/
content.title_en: Wood construction with system : support structure and layer structure of the components

content.text: Germany - a divided society. In 18 scientific essays, renowned social researchers design an image of German society based on their structural antagonisms. In this context, pairs of contrasts such as "Arm-Reich", "Formed Uneducated", "East-West" etc. Society is understood as being "unified", which at best finds in the diversity of its political and cultural, material and symbolic divisions and divisions". The essays, which are provided with graphics, tables and literature data, which, at different length and quality, usually reflect the current state of social science research, refer history and present problems and offer an outlook into the future. The demanding, from the upper level, versatile compendium draws the multifaceted picture of a "competition society", which must be completed with rapidly increasing divisions in the globalized world.
content.title_en: Germany - a divided society

content.text: The Mammal of God's Graces : Evolution, Consciousness, Freedom. Man - Random Product or Crown of Creation?Ulrich Lüke, biologist and theologian, asks himself this and other questions from the borderline of biology and theology. He knows how to distinguish and draws clear positions, understandable, balanced, convincing.
content.title_en: The Mammal of God's Graces : Evolution, Consciousness, Freedom

content.text: Amendment of the Land Planning Law in North Rhine-Westphalia. As in the other countries of the Federal Republic of Germany, the Land Planning Law in North Rhine-Westphalia has been adapted to the new Land Planning Law (ROG). This process was accompanied by a working group of the Land Labour Community North Rhine-Westphalia of the ARL. After the members had given early recommendations on the short-term adaptation requirements, the focus of the further work was on the need to implement the amendment in the medium term. The focus was on the review of the Land Planning Concepts and Instruments, the design of the targets, the integration of the Land Development Programme and Land Development Plan North Rhine-Westphalia, the advantages and disadvantages of regional land use plans, considerations on technical contributions to the spatial-related specialist planning and the continuous reporting (monitoring) within the framework of the reorientation of the planerical activity. The members of the working group have broadly and directly contributed the results of their consultations in the context of hearings, seminars and discussion forums on the change-making discourse at the Land level.
content.title_en: Amendment of the Land Planning Law in North Rhine-Westphalia

content.text: Great Britain : England, Scotland, Wales ; [Geography, History, Economy, Politics] ; with 22 tables. The national customers of the WBG are characterized by scientifically sound information, a high degree of reliability and good legibility. This also applies to the newly published volume on Great Britain, which is based on the author's 3 decades of scientific engagement with the region. The central themes of the book are the historical and economic development of Great Britain, the urban and rural structures and the geological natural space. Wehling (last BA 2/02) shows how a classical industrial country in Europe has become a pioneer in the deindustrialization and exporter of services. The book is very appealing with 144 illustrations, including many statistics and maps. An extensive literature directory completes the high-quality volume, which can already be regarded as a standard work. There is currently nothing comparable on the German book market. Very suitable for students and students of secondary school II. (2 S) (Rolf Ingo Behnke) Standard work on Great Britain, whose central themes are historical and economic development, urban and rural structures as well as well as the geological region (Rolfo).
content.title_en: United Kingdom : England, Scotland, Wales ; [Geography, History, Economy, Politics] ; with 22 tables

content.text: Hydraulics and pneumatics. Publisher's text: Hydraulics and pneumatics are important techniques for driving and moving machines and equipment as well as for controlling workflows. This book summarizes both areas. It is designed for practitioners and students who want to learn about the mode of action, switching and calculation of hydrostatic and pneumatic work and control elements. Publisher's text: Hydraulics and pneumatics are important techniques for driving and moving machines and equipment as well as for controlling workflows. This book summarizes both areas. It is designed for practitioners and students who want to learn about the mode of action, switching and calculation of hydrostatic and pneumatic work and control elements.
content.title_en: Hydraulics and pneumatics

content.text: The questions are known and new at the same time: Where does the human soul live, how strong is human freedom of action? Are there any mental processes at all, as we place them in our human image in the general way? Is there the immaterial soul? Or is everything just the result of the neuronal apparatus and man rather nonfree in his power of judgment? The author, mathematician and Christian, has already been concerned with body-spirit issues (BA 3/02, 11/98, ID 48/00). This is about the conception of man before the back of a new neurobiological materialism ("brain and consciousness", BA 9/94; "consciousness", ID 12/96; B. Libet: ID 11/05) and in view of new, still mainly experimental computer technologies such as the quantum computer. The third part of the book is concerned with the synthesis of materiality and immateriality: life, mind and soul. Thus the book is in the neighborhood of J.C. Eccles (BA 3/95), H. Hinterhuber (HID/02) and the reader.
content.title_en: Brain, Soul and Computer : the Man in the Quantum Age

content.text: Outlook : [Functions, settings, practical solutions; fast solutions for everyday life & work]. Search - Find - Solve, this is the motto of the new "practice reference" series from Data Becker. It delivers immediately implementable solutions to all important application and function areas. An extensive practical index allows direct access to relevant user questions about Outlook 2003 (XP and 2000). For all functions there are practical examples suitable for everyday use. A grippy book format with high use value, also a work tool for the desk. (2)
content.title_en: Outlook : [Functions, settings, practical solutions; quick solutions for everyday life & profession]

content.text: Assessment of the carcinogenicity of formaldehyde is produced in high quantities worldwide and is contained in many consumer products. The substance is also produced in small amounts in the cell metabolism of humans and animals. Formaldehyde is harmful to health, it irritates the mucous membranes and can cause cancer in the nasal cavity when it is inhaled. This is the result of an evaluation of new studies presented to the public by the Federal Institute for Risk Assessment today. The institute considers it to be sufficiently proven that the substance in the nasal cavity can cause tumours when inhaled, and therefore proposes a change in the applicable classification. The harmful effect of formaldehyde is concentration-dependent. eIn case of room air values of or below 124 micrograms formaldehyde per cubic metre, there is virtually no longer any cancer-caking effect to be expected, says the president of the Federal Institute, Professor Dr. Andreas Hensel.
content.title_en: Assessment of the carcinogenicity of formaldehyde [CAS No. 50-00-0] : Report on the assessment of the carcinogenicity of formaldehyde

content.text: Questionnaire : a workbook. This book is a "practice book" in the truest sense of the word. It is intended to help researchers who want to use social science surveys in their empirical research. It is intended to provide help in the development of their questionnaires, in concrete and detailed terms. The book simulates questionnaire consultation, as the author has done for many years at the Center for Surveys, Methods and Analysis (ZUMA) in Mannheim, very practical and written in such a way that readers can work with it when developing a questionnaire, with many examples of how to do something wrong and how to do it right. After a short introduction to the cognitive psychology and communicative foundations of the survey, a variety of methodological aspects of a questionnaire are worked out, from types of questions, types of scales and the formulation of questionnaire questions to a good cover page, to survey aids and to the layout of questionnaires, all illustrated by examples from survey practice.
content.title_en: Questionnaire : A workbook

content.text: Tourism : a geographical introduction. The latest volume of the series, which is mainly designed for the university sector, deals with leisure and tourism from the point of view of geography. The presentation follows the classification into the central chapters: research approaches and methods, typology of the standard tourist, travel behaviour of the Germans, tourism as an economic factor, destination types in tourism and future perspectives. Clearly structured, well-prepared basic knowledge, which not only students of human geography but also representatives of other disciplines dealing with the subject can be provided. (3)
content.title_en: Tourism : a geographical introduction

content.text: Audio circuits for sound technology, studio and PA. The 10 year old first edition of the tape for experienced electronic based artists (BA 12/96) was mainly adapted to the current component situation (circuits with semiconductor components no longer available on the market were sorted out), otherwise only slightly changed. The tape, equipped with numerous circuit diagrams and circuit layouts, is still integrated into the fields of theory, practice and measurement technology. The author describes requirements for amplifiers and signal paths that enable optimal sound quality. The findings from this flow into the practical replica instructions for power supplies, microphone and line preamps, equalizers and small mixers. Where "circuits around audio technology" (BA 8/05), whose predecessor title "Audio circuits par excellence" (BA 11/04) or R. Sontheimer (BA 3/05) are well used, the current title can be well supplemented. The first edition should be replaced.
content.title_en: Audio circuits for sound technology, studio and PA

content.text: Silicate inks at the building : Advantages of silicate inks for the new and historical building ; application and execution of paints, decorations and wall paintings. Silicate paints are environmentally friendly and have considerable advantages in terms of processing and durability. However, they also require specific expertise, which this volume conveys to the reader. From the material characteristics to the working techniques to the aging behaviour and special application possibilities such as wall paintings, the author spans the content sheet. In addition to sound basic knowledge, he provides extensive practical instructions for dealing with this special coating material
content.title_en: Silicate inks at the building : Advantages of silicate inks for the new and historical building ; application and execution of paintings, decorations and murals

content.text: AGRO-Gentechnik: the seed of evil: the creeping poisoning of soil and food. Collection of articles by expert authors on the use of genetic engineering in agriculture and the influence of large chemical companies on politics. (Hans-Ulrich Struck) Despite warnings from consumer associations and protests from farmers, genetic engineering is on the rise in Europe. Lobbyists are specifically influencing the legislation in Berlin and Brussels. In the USA and Canada, however, patented genetically modified seeds have been grown almost everywhere for 10 years. The balance sheet is sobering: pesticide consumption has increased, yield has fallen, transgenic plants are spreading uncontrollably. Worse still: American farmers are bound to seed contracts by large chemical companies, which they can cost in case of non-compliance the existence of the farms. The report here printed here by the independent consumer organization Center for Food Safety, Washington DC, on the machinations of the Monsanto group contains every amount of explosives. The articles come from professionally versed authors. Overall a clear statement against the use of genetic engineering in the agricultural ruck and lobby technology in the large group.
content.title_en: AGRO genetic engineering: the seeds of evil : the creeping poisoning of soil and food

content.text: Renewable energies: with energy efficiency at the energy turnaround. The authors are leading scientists of the Wuppertal Institute for Climate, Environment and Energy. In a series-typically concentrated style (see also Stefan Rahmstorf: "Klimawandel", BA 6/06) they treat the various forms of renewable energies from solar heat to tidal power plants and address the numerous obstacles that stand in the way of global development. The second focus is on the urgently necessary increase in energy efficiency without which the enormous problems of the coming decades will not be solved. A narrow pocketbook, which is picked with numbers and facts, convinces by interdisciplinary approach and sharp-minded-critical but hopeful analyses. It is equally suitable for demanding presentations (elementary by Paetec "Energy", in this No.) as well as for generally interested readers who want to inform themselves well. "Renewable energies" (BA 11/07) brings more details, but does not offer this systematic approach. Further useful C. Morris: "Zukunftsenergieren" (BA 7/05). For as many libraries. With the use of renewable energies, the use of renewable energy as well as well as many as possible, the use of renewable energy sources.
content.title_en: Renewable energy : with energy efficiency to the energy transition

content.text: The forgotten imagery of Christian art: a guide to understanding the symbolism of animals, angels and Mary. "On the subject of Christian symbolism in art, there is hardly any other book that brings so many and so many useful indications to understanding medieval theology and image symbolism. "Doris Schmidt, Süddeutsche Zeitung What does the Pelican stand for in Christian art? Why do we meet Mary so often in a closed garden? And who are the angels with the four wings and the four heads? This book, written in a vivid way, leads through the diverse animal, angel and Mary representations of Christian art, explains their symbolism and makes known its ancient and biblical sources.
content.title_en: The forgotten imagery of Christian art: a guide to understanding the symbols of animals, angels and Mary

content.text: Charles Darwin. More powerful and systematic than J. Browne (see this no.) the author puts the philosophical aspects of Darwin's life and work into the spotlight. The long-term effects of his theories on the humanities and human sciences, such as philosophical anthropology or epistemology, are described. The close link between natural sciences and philosophy is presented as defining and characteristic of his worldview and the formulation of his findings. Engels also deals with the controversy and confrontations around Darwin's theories. They illustrate the misinterpretations and misunderstandings, in particular the misleading equation of Darwinism with Darwinism, as well as the polemic reductions of his theses on stereotyped Floskeln, such as the "war on existence". A sophisticated, also typographically-pressed biography with an extensive literature directory as well as persons and registers of subjects. (2)
content.title_en: Charles Darwin

content.text: Adobe Photoshop Elements 5.0 : a visual introduction to digital photography. Another well-structured comprehensive introduction to the management and post-processing of digital images with Photoshop Elements 5.0. All topics are explained clearly and comprehensible for beginners, without exuberant jargon of expertise. The author is here in detail both with the basic functions and with the increasingly popular RAW editing. With understandable explanations of all important functions and many (by all means colored) sample illustrations. All examples are easily understandable. The book is opulently equipped with over 400 pages and 770 color illustrations and is designed for beginners in digital photography. The only criticism point: with the price without CD supplement. In addition to R. Klassen (BA 3/07) and complementary to G. Heimann (BA 7/07). (2)
content.title_en: Adobe Photoshop Elements 5.0 : a visual introduction to digital photography

content.text: The hunt for love: Heinrich Mann and the women. His comprehensive monograph of 1992 (see BA 2/93) leaves Jasper with a specialized presentation which can be documented in detail and in detail, as Heinrich Mann's work from the very beginning (extremely contrary to his rather homoerotically tuned brother Thomas) focuses on femininity, the "hunt for love", which was better known as sex as a significant element of life and fruitful stimulant of artistic work. And that his work is constantly dominated by the massive self-interesting exploitation of autobiographical amours and affairs. In an extremely vivid, almost exciting way, Jasper draws works and acts, and reads them in a well-founded manner, an artist biography in the mirror of empathetically sketched life-courses of many women. Less literary-oriented than the last published man-biographies (see P. Stein: BA 11/02 and M. Flugge: BA 7/06), the almost roman, figure-rich-colored depictions are already widely used in a more general manner than the latter.
content.title_en: The Hunt for Love : Heinrich Mann and the Women
