content.title_en: Borderline disorders and sexuality : Aetiology – disorder – therapy

content.text: Scientific work with OpenOffice: [Formatation and format templates, implement scientific specifications, attention through perfect visualizations]. From the versatile computer author already there are introductions to the license-free office software OpenOffice (most recently "OpenOffice 3.3", ID-A 34/11) and to write scientific work with Microsoft Word (most recently on Word 2010, ID-A 46/10). In this new publication, Seimert combines both topics and has adapted the contents of the Word-2010 guide to the text processing program of the current OpenOffice Suite. Besides scarce basic knowledge of formal scientific specifications, it focuses on the construction, structure, structure, structure of extensive manuscripts in writers by using document and format templates, visual aids in the form of graphics, formulas and tables, format templates for source references, citations and footnotes, as well as useful functions such as autocorrection or text building blocks. Series-like with numerous, well-readable screen illustrations and practical tips. On the CD-ROM all examples, templates and OpenOffice 3.3 for Windows, using the Nib language program.
content.title_en: Scientific work with OpenOffice : [Formatting and format templates, implementing scientific specifications, attention through perfect visualizations]

content.text: The book on urban design provides assistance to prospective architects, urban and landscape planners in the preparation of urban projects and designs. The contents and their preparation are oriented towards the design process in practice and embed it in a theoretical framework of necessary background knowledge. As an introduction, an overview of the understanding of city, urban structures and the legislative powers that govern it is given. To make the complex structure of the city more understandable, this is divided into different layers and building blocks. The approach of urban design is described by means of the layer method in the form of successive phases. Examples of urban design projects and competitions illustrate the individual design steps
content.title_en: Urban Design

content.text: Photovoltaics: textbook on basics, technologies and practice; 31 tables. Systematic introduction, especially for students, engineers and technicians, limited also for laymen, ranging from basic prerequisites to semiconductor physics and technology to practical application. (Rolf Raschka) The FH Professor has a systematic introduction to photovoltaics, ranging from basic requirements to semiconductor physics and extensive technology to practical application. The text contains many formulas, technical drawings, tables and some photos. As in the target group comparable Hans-Günther Wagemann (ID 6/08), there are additional exercises, whose solutions are presented on an extra-installed website. In addition, an annex with a literature directory, websites, registers and other information can be found. The excellent book can be used for self-studying, alongside or instead of Wagemann, in practical terms of literature such as Jürgen Brück: "Plan photovoltaikanlagen profektional planen" (BA 2/09) or Hans-Joachim Geist: "Photoschvottfaikanlagen" (BA/07) can be used in theoretically under the "Batherial" (Batherial) of Simon.
content.title_en: Photovoltaics : textbook on basics, technologies and practice ; with 31 tables

content.text: Italian interiors. Italy -- Interior Design -- Hotel -- Restaurant -- Retail -- Shop Design -- Office -- Cultural Building -- Private House -- Plan -- Floor Plan -- Photographs
content.title_en: Italian interiors

content.text: The ultimate practical book on Android smartphones: [on Android 4 and previous versions]. P. Neefs continues Data Becker's introduction (lastly "The Ultimate Practice Book on iPhone", ID-A 9/12) with a 700-page work. In clear, colored screenshots of different mobile phones illustrated chapters he explains the handling and optimization of the operating system up to version 4.xx, as well as the extension by numerous apps and the use in all situations. Unlike other advisors, not only favorite programs are presented here, but potential target groups are addressed. Not advantageous apps are also mentioned, even if they are market leaders. Fineties of the Play Market (previously Android Market), e.g. the return function of apps are presented here as well as the privacy regulations (as of 2012) by Google or alternative apps outside the Google world with the associated difficulties. Neef offers much knowledge for laymen, but also a knowledge increase for professionals. In more detail than H. Dorsch (ID 47/11) or R. Hattenauer (ID 36/11). Primarily recommended. (1) (Anbung Bresser) Functionality for the operating system.
content.title_en: The ultimate practical book on Android Smartphones: [to Android 4 and its predecessors]

content.text: Mathematical foundations of computer science : mathematical thinking and proofs : an introduction. This introduction to the mathematical foundations of computer science systematically presents the basic thinking of computer science. The approach guides the readers on the basis of school mathematics purposefully but carefully towards dealing with exact mathematical descriptions and arguments in computer science.
content.title_en: Mathematical foundations of computer science : mathematical thinking and proof : an introduction

content.text: 3D CAD with Inventor 2011 : tutorial with a continuous project example. This tutorial describes the creation of a complete project vice in a very clear and step by step way. This allows us to understand the course of action at any time. In addition to pure 3D modeling, the design of presentations and animations is also presented and thus a holistic approach is realized. The book is addressed to all beginners who want to learn working safely with this 3D CAD system.
content.title_en: 3D CAD with Inventor 2011 : tutorial with a continuous project example

content.text: Linux: the comprehensive manual; [Basics, Installation, Practice, Command Reference; Linux as Workstation: Multimedia, Office, GNOME, KDE, X11; Kernel, Shell, Network and System Administration, Security, Programming; suitable for beginners; 2x DVD-ROM, 4 Linux distributions plus OpenBSD (multibootable)].The Linux manual provides beginners with necessary basic knowledge and professional users background information. (LK/HB: Isigkeit) Review: The slightly revised new edition of an introduced manual on the Linux operating system has only very little change compared to the preliminary version (ID-B 3/11). Therefore, another use of the predecessor is not in the way. In the first place, the latest Linux distributions are now available, among the tools covered there are a few that are presented in more recent versions and that a cleaning of discovered errors has taken place. Therefore, there is nothing to be called for further use of the predecessor. In the first place, it is suitable for replacement or initial procurement.
content.title_en: Linux : the comprehensive manual ; [Basics, installation, practice, command reference ; Linux as workstation: Multimedia, Office, GNOME, KDE, X11 ; Kernel, Shell, Network and system administration, Security, Programming ; suitable for beginners ; 2x DVD-ROM, 4 Linux distributions plus OpenBSD (multibootable)]

content.text: Land Grabbing : the global race for agricultural land. Introduction to the causes and consequences of the large-scale purchase of arable land by global investors in poor southern countries and possible alternatives and counter-strategies - concise, concise and critical information
content.title_en: Land Grabbing : the global race for agricultural land

content.text: Manual Rhein. The manual provides a collection of knowledge about the current river and settlement landscape of the Rhine, which is without competition in this breadth and detail. The first part contains detailed texts written by experts on complex topics, such as geography and biology of the Rhine, on its economic significance and on ecological issues, but also on flood issues. Each chapter concludes with references to further sources of information. The second part, entitled "A small encyclopedia of the Rhine", explains further connections in alphabetically ordered articles and provides information on important data. The numerous maps, graphics, diagrams and photos also convey a lot of information and provide attractive presentation; a register opens up the work. Fundamentally and despite the high price, also recommended for pupils in upper secondary education. (2 A,S)
content.title_en: Manual Rhine

content.text: The school's educational concept is to be promoted by the school's educational concept. The school's school's educational concept is to be promoted by the school's educational concept. The school's school's educational concept is to be promoted by the school's educational concept. The school's design for dealing with heterogeneity - the school's design for the school's power room - the school's typology The complex everyday structures of the school's learning and educational spaces in the school's schools increase the heterogeneity in school communities and limit the school's educational monopoly. How is the school's school space based on difference to the school's educational concept? What power strategies do these school's concepts precede in dealing with heterogeneity? The analysis of 750 school's school's design contains astonishing answers to these questions. The results of the study are to be concluded by the typology of the school's educational concept of self-reception.
content.title_en: School as an educational power room : typology of school spatial designs

content.text: Automation with SIMATIC : Controller, software, programming, data communication, operation and monitoring. Amazon: Using the example of the memory programmable controllers SIMATIC S7 this book offers a comprehensive and up-to-date introduction to the working method and the construction of a modern automation system. In addition, readers get an insight into the projecting and parameterization of the controllers and the decentralized peripherals. In addition, the communication via network connections are explained and the possibilities for operating and observing a system described.
content.title_en: Automation with SIMATIC : Controller, software, programming, data communication, operation and monitoring

content.text: The rising public debt in Germany and Europe is highly worrying. As high debt is accompanied by a high proportion of interest expenditure on total expenditure, the scope for spending on other policy areas is reduced. If the government is not counterbalanced in time, states are threatened with insolvent. As the debt is largely not cyclically conditioned, the necessary consolidation of public finances must begin to reduce structural deficits. In this study, the Kronberg district presents its own proposals for consolidating public finances and for further development of the legal framework in Germany and Europe. These include the hardening of the Stability and Growth Pact, the introduction of an insolvency regime for EU member countries, the further development of the debt brake for the federal and state governments as well as fundamental reforms of the German tax and social system. Because only successful consolidation creates the framework conditions for sustainable economic growth.
content.title_en: Renovating public finances permanently - in Germany and Europe

content.text: Blog Boosting: Marketing, Content, Design, SEO. A blogger book that addresses advanced and professional internet publishers or those who want to become them. (Roland Roth-Steiner) Blogging has become a serious opportunity to publish content on a regular basis on a particular topic on the Internet. Besides the countless hobby and fun blogs, there are now numerous professional blogs with an influence on public opinion. M. Firnkes is such a professional blogger and sees this activity as a job (--) and source of income. The computer scientist has gathered his experience in a book here, and after a chapter on the "Do's and Dont's" of the blogosphere it goes to the advanced topics: design, content and success measurement of blogs, marketing and search engine optimization, increase of popularity and reach, build up a reader community, monetization (so ways to earn money with the blog), opportunities and risks as well as a look at future trends. The diversity of topics shows that here are advanced and marketing are addressed to 21. For example, for the GrabA 21.
content.title_en: Blog Boosting : Marketing, Content, Design, SEO

content.text: Actor - individual - subject : questions about ‘personality' and ‘sociality'. Social Theoretical Positions in the Discussion - The Current Controversy about the Relationship between Anthropology and Social Theory - Social Theoretically Reflected Social Analysis -historical and normative Perspectives The volume documents the current sociological debate about the actor, subject, person and sociality. Newer discussions are included in the neighboring disciplines such as the social philosophy.The aim of the contributions is to investigate different social theories in order to understand how the connection between personality, sociality and social order is understood. Since the intention is to discuss the concepts in a comparative way, the volume offers an overview of the state of the art in the field of social theory.
content.title_en: Actor - individual - subject : questions about "personality" and "sociality"

content.text: Empty status of residential buildings in rural areas: examples of selected municipalities in the Länder of Hesse, Rhineland-Palatinate and Saarland. Ageing and population decline will lead to significant problems on housing markets in sparsely populated rural regions that are not situated in the surrounding areas of large cities. There will be impairments up to the unsaleability of real estate and empty buildings in these villages and small towns. The following questions will be the focus of the working group from the LAG Hessen/Rheinland-Pfalz/Saarland: To what extent will there be vacancy? What effects does this have on the appearance of the villages? What possibilities exist for the municipalities, the land and real estate institutions to provide planning, political and financial assistance in this area? The aim of the AG is to present a pilot study, ways and means of dealing with the vacancy of residential properties in rural areas. To this end, methods of recording and forecasting vacant spaces will be demonstrated using three case examples. On this basis, informal, financial and legal instruments will be examined, which can be suitable for the value development and utilization of residential properties in rural areas.
content.title_en: Empty status of residential buildings in rural areas : Examples of selected municipalities in the Länder of Hesse, Rhineland-Palatinate and Saarland

content.text: Modern web design: design principles, web standards, practice; [from the first idea to the finished website; principles and basics of good designs; creatively with web standards, HTML5 and CSS3]. Review: Although the book is called the first edition in the imprint, it is the now 3rd edition of a basic practical book for web designers and programmers. Compared to the 2nd edition (BA 4/10; can be used; 1st edition not displayed here, replace) the scope has grown by only 25 pages, but the content updates are not insignificant. HTML 5 and CSS3 are now standard tools and are now presented accordingly, also programming for mobile devices or responsive web design (i.e. the website automatically adapts to the format of the used device) a more important role and are treated for the first time in detail. The basic structure of the preliminary edition, which besides the mediation of programmed Chinese details has been intensively concerned with physical and psychological foundations of good designs.
content.title_en: Modern web design : design principles, web standards, practice ; [from the first idea to the finished website ; principles and basics of good designs ; creative with web standards, HTML5 and CSS3]

content.text: Android programming: short & good. Android is a widely used operating system by Google for mobile devices, which also allows the programming of apps. D. Louis (ID-A 4/13) gives a comprehensive introduction to the programming of apps. Good alternatives to this in non-print form are the video trainings "My first Android app" (ID-A 36/12) and "Apps develop for Android 4" (ID-A 8/12). The present pocketbook addresses readers with previous knowledge in Java. It brings the necessary knowledge for programming apps under the current Android version 4.1/4.2. Differences in this version to the still widely used version 2.2 are discussed in detail, so that the book can also be used for older versions. The author starts with the basics of Android and the related development environment and then comes to programming quickly. Here, the design of the graphical user interface, testing and error search and error handling are well taken into account. Very useful is the closing reference part (Android tools, API overviews, standard actions, ... (2)).
content.title_en: Android programming: short & good

content.text: Human Factors: Psychology of safe action in risk industries. In areas such as aviation, nuclear power, chemical industry, medicine and military, people work with complex technical systems. But in critical situations, man, not the machine, and often under time pressure and with high risk, can have dramatic consequences. Risk industries therefore need measures that minimize sources of error, promote safe action and adequately consider the "human factor". Such measures offer this standard work of Human Factors psychology, updated and revised for the second edition: In the first part of the book, scientists explain concepts for safety, errors and human action. In the second part, experienced practitioners and scientists present current challenges of individual industries and present solutions: How are processes and systems safer and communication made more effective? How can complexity be reduced? What role do personnel management or new forms of cooperation play? How can teamwork be trained? Safety officers, managers, personnel and psychologists in risk industries, engineers, trainers and students find in this book current concepts of human factor psychology clearly explained and illustrated with exciting case studies.
content.title_en: Human Factors : Psychology of Safe Acting in Risk Industries

content.text: Cultural landscape of the motorway: the photo collection of the Baden-Württemberg State Road Administration. The construction of the motorways has shaped and changed our landscape like hardly any other measure to improve the transport infrastructure. The exhibition shows how the state road administration has tried to reconcile motorway construction and landscape design - and how one ultimately failed. The rich picture inventory, which contains photos of almost all aspects of motorway construction and dates back to the 1930s, is evaluated and presented for the first time in this exhibition under aesthetic and cultural aspects.
content.title_en: Cultural landscape motorway : the photo collection of the Baden-Württemberg State Road Administration

content.text: Media heroes : Teaching manual for promoting media literacy and preventing cyberbullying ; with numerous templates and worksheets on CD-ROM. What is cyberbullying? A message - how bad is that? How does my behavior affect others? Self-protection strategies in the digital world. "What can I reveal from others?" - legal background. Parent's Evening. Media Hero Project Day.
content.title_en: Media heroes : teaching manual to promote media literacy and prevent cyberbullying; with numerous templates and worksheets on CD-ROM

content.text: On the Black Mountain : Roman. An idyllic Stuttgart suburb: Emil and Veronika have remained childless. For this they have established a close relationship with Peter, the son of the neighbours. Emil now registers that Peter (now his father) returns to his parents' house in a neglected state: leaving his wife and children, he has lost all will to live. (Annette Freudling) Emil and Veronika are childless, but have established a close relationship with Peter, the neighbour's son. When Peter is left by his wife and children, he returns to his parents' house in a neglected state. (Annette Freudling) Emil Bub, a teacher shortly before retirement, observes from his balcony how Peter, the son of his neighbours, returns to his parents' house. Peter is sick and destitute, his friend Mia has disappeared with the children.
content.title_en: On the Black Mountain : Roman

content.text: jQuery learn and use : develop better web applications with simple JavaScript techniques. Compared to the thematically equally stored publications (L. Beighley and R. Benedetti, both in this No.), the dpunkt title comes pleasantly objective and unrelenting. This applies equally to the outside - because there is no kind of patched layout, boxes and icons - as well as for didactics and language ducts, which prescribe themselves to the topic and do not appeal to a - supposed - young audience. jQuery is a library that takes routine work from the developer and thus allows elegant effects without great programming effort. The book shows the - in itself quite short way - to these things, with which one can smear impression at the client. The path leads over the first steps like selecting elements, formatting and animation towards DOM editing, AJAX and plug-ins. In the appendix you find JavaScript-Clour, a short reference to JavaScript-Cloures, and the test frame is also good for use as a thinning title.
content.title_en: jQuery learn and use : develop better web applications with simple JavaScript techniques

content.text: Incognito : the secret life of our brain. Eagleman is an internationally known American neuroscientist, the book was a "New York Times" bestseller and the title has just been set to jump to the "mirror" bestseller list. The consciousness, Eagleman writes, is not at the center of our brain. And more than that: We can consciously control hardly anything of what is happening in our brain. He explains his theses with a multitude of scientific experiments and impressive examples from everyday life; he also draws on the results of his own research. In the last chapter he discusses how responsible we are for our actions, and considers whether we have a soul that is independent of the biology of our body. He also has revealing examples and explanations on these questions. A remarkable book, really continuing and the look at ourselves changing as well as exceptionally written, vividly and captivating; to read with great profit even for the lay people not familiar with matter. (2)
content.title_en: Incognito : the secret life of our brain

content.text: The discussed region: Problems and planning approaches of the Rhine-Main metropolitan region. The international renaissance of the metropolitan regions since the 1990s is also reflected in a variety of regional cooperations in the Rhine-Main region. Although partial successes can be observed, certain challenges, such as the ongoing suburbanisation, the financial crisis or the everyday concerns of the citizens, are not sufficiently taken into account. With a view to the realities in numerous fields of action, experts from science and practice discuss problems and perspectives of regional cooperation in the polycentric Rhine-Main metropolitan region.
content.title_en: The discussed region : Problems and planning approaches of the Rhine-Main metropolitan region

content.text: Complexity : why the path is never punctual. Using everyday examples, the author examines typical properties of complex systems in the book. In particular, a behavioral pattern, namely the tendency of these systems to increase their complexity and to take a state on the edge of chaos, is being treated. The properties of this state are described and the reduction of complexity is derived as a way of stabilizing. All statements are illustrated by mathematical models of physical, biological and technical systems, whereby formulas are largely omitted.
content.title_en: Complexity : why the train is never punctual

content.text: Genetic engineering in plants : Opportunities and risks; with 18 tables. Are genetically modified plants a future perspective? Do they solve the nutritional problems of humanity?Currently and competently, the authors give an overview of the opportunities and risks of plant genetic engineering: Basic methods, modern methods for the production and identification of transgenic plants, application examples as well as release attempts and commercialization are presented. Boxing with background information Excursions on interesting details, core statements, WWW addresses and an extensive glossary round off the text.For the 4th edition all chapters have been updated to a large extent.All figures are now coloured and thus explain the said even more clearly than before.Here you get factual information as an answer to burning questions.
content.title_en: Genetic engineering in plants : opportunities and risks ; with 18 tables

content.text: Ubuntu GNU/Linux : the comprehensive manual ; [to the current LTS version 12.04 "Precise Pangolin"; for desktop and server: basics, application, administration; with over 300 practical tips for beginners and professionals; Office, image editing, multimedia streaming, security, monitoring and much more]. The extended support Ubuntu version 12.04 - also called Precise Pangolin - is presented in this extensive compendium differentiated. Fischer dares to re-splash and appeal to newcomers and advanced users alike, as in previous editions (last BA 9/10, can continue), and for this edition he has not only updated the content, but also re-edited many chapters and focuses entirely on Ubuntu. The variants Kubuntu and Xubuntu are therefore no longer taken into account. The first chapters, which especially newcomers are able to meet, offer a lot of background knowledge and introduce the basics. Extensive is the new desktop interface Unity. It is now replaced by GOME and the usage of the libl-service is greatly replaced by the Open-service.
content.title_en: Ubuntu GNU/Linux : the comprehensive manual ; [to the current LTS version 12.04 "Precise Pangolin" ; for desktop and server: Basics, application, administration ; with over 300 practical tips for beginners and professionals ; Office, image editing, multimedia streaming, security, monitoring and much more]

content.text: Investment in hunger? : Land Grabbing and food security in Sub-Saharan Africa. The rapidly increasing trend of Land Grabbing in developing countries has taken on considerable proportions since the financial and food price crises in 2007/2008. While some people have repeatedly pointed out the advantages of land investments, there are significant risks for the target companies - probably the biggest is the threat to their food security. Based on international studies, documents and media reports, Daniela Kress presents the current state of research, the complexity and versatility of the phenomenon Land Grabbing. She presents insights about the connection between the shops with land and food security using the example of the sub-Saharan Africa region and discusses possible future developments. Daniela Kress is a graduate regional scientist (LA) and was working at the Chair of International Politics and Foreign Policy of the University of Cologne. She works as a freelance editor for the ZfAS (Zeitschrift für Außen- und Sicherheitspolitik). (Source: www.buchhandel.de 11.09.2012)
content.title_en: Investment in hunger? : Land Grabbing and food security in Sub-Saharan Africa
Pool facilities and equipment

content.text: FEM Formula Collection Statics and Dynamics : Background Information, Tips and Tricks. This formula collection is aimed at users of commercial finite elements programs. The book is designed for users with basic knowledge in a typical FEM introductory lecture and provides a detailed overview of the possibilities for the very powerful program. Because only those who know the differences between the different types of analysis, elements or contact algorithms can use it efficiently. The author uses the most important formulas, explanatory sketches and vivid examples to show the entire application spectrum of the FEM for static and dynamic problems. Thus, the book closes the gap between a FEM basic lecture and the possibilities of a commercial FE program.
content.title_en: FEM Formula Collection Statics and Dynamics : Background Information, Tips and Tricks

content.text: - The following are the topics of 'Living in old age', 'age' and 'age' and gender', 'age' and 'interculturality', 'age' and 'dementence'.
content.title_en: Prevention for families with mentally ill parents : Need, coordination, practical experience

content.title_en: School tasks: how we need to change the education system to meet our children

content.text: Ach, Afrika: Berichten aus dem Inneren eines Kontinent. Updated paperback edition of the great and exciting reports Bartolomäus Grills (see BA 1/04). The author, who has been a correspondent of large German-language newspapers in Africa for 20 years, even living in South Africa, sees the continent as a very positive revolution; Africa has become more peaceful, democratic and prosperous in the last decade (introduction). Thus, since the first edition in 2003, there has been much to repeat, supplement and update; a new final chapter has been added. Based on his profound knowledge, "Grill writes critical-analyzing, subjective, apologetic; he can make it clear that complex historical-political processes are understandable and sometimes funny" (review of the first edition, see above). - Also currently one of the best books on Africa, which should be widely offered. The preliminary edition should be made. (2) (LK/F: Dankert) Exciting repprtages of the Africa correspondent of the "Time" (including) about the changing continent, its black/K.
content.title_en: Ach, Africa : Reports from the interior of a continent

content.text: A lifelong teacher? : Alternatives to the teacher's profession. The need for German schools is great: a third of the teachers suffer from burnout syndrome, another third is chronically overloaded, and 10 percent of the teachers' referendums break their vocational training prematurely. This book takes the suffering pressure of the affected seriously and helps potential dropouts to find the right way
content.title_en: Lifelong teachers? : Alternatives to the teaching profession

content.text: The houses of the others: Roman. Christopher and Luisa have married and set up in life: He is a prospective professor of biology, she is a successful art historian. They have exchanged the old building apartment of their student days for a house on the outskirts of the city as a visible sign of their ambitions. Here in the street on the Kuhlmühlgraben their marriage must prove itself, here they measure their dreams on achieved. But not everything can be done with willpower and self-presentation, that must be experienced by the two as well as the other inhabitants of the district. Silke Scheuermann tells in "The houses of the others" of fragile desires, fears and hopes and describes what happens when people align their lives with others and their supposed superiority is shaken or if they are surprised by happiness. "Some narrative threads hang in the air, and sometimes the tissue is rather thready; the - based on self-experienced - story of the two homosexuals, whose sole purpose for life is wickedness and psychoterror, for example hardly comes over clichés.
content.title_en: The houses of the others : Roman

content.text: Matter: Basic texts on the history of theory. Matter is a key category in the history of philosophy. Since antiquity, the relationship between mind and matter has been disputed, and with the emergence of modern natural sciences the complexity of the debate is increasing: Matter is now increasingly dynamized, even "dematerialized". The volume presents central texts from the discussion of this subject from Anaxagoras and Aristotle to Albert Einstein, Willard Van Orman Quine and Judith Butler. It introduces comprehensively into the history of philosophical and natural science discussions with the concept and phenomenon of matter and illustrates how the former could also become a central category of cultural studies, for example in the field of text sciences, gender studies or material and objects culture.
content.title_en: Matter : Basic texts on the history of theory

content.text: The history of the Amistad : Slave trade and human smuggling on the Atlantic in the 19th century. The Cologne Latin American historian and Cuban expert (most recently ID-B 24/12) Michael Zeuske, who was already involved in slavery in Cuba in "Black Caribbean" (ID-G 40/04), focuses here on the Atlantic slave trade and human smuggling in the 19th century, which had been continued in the course of decades after the official abolition (see A. Hochschild: "Sprengt die Schetten", BA 12/07). Unlike the title suggests, the slave uprising on the schooner "Amistad" is not primarily the focus of this detailed, with numerous sources documented. Zeuske rather takes the rebellion as an occasion to depict the history of the Atlantic slavery system and the illegal mechanisms of human trafficking within the framework of global economic contexts. In addition to the Hispanic-Cuban slave trade, he deals in detail with the African slave trade centres. With maps and literature. After Jochen Meisner: "Black Africa" (BA 8/8/8).
content.title_en: The history of Amistad : slave trade and human smuggling in the Atlantic in the 19th century

content.text: Corporate Museums : concepts, ideas, realization : concepts, ideas, implementation. With articles by Jan-Christian Warnecke, Mateo Kries and Uwe R. Brückner. Museums among others by Adidas exhibition (Herzogenrauch), BMW museum (Munich), Braunsammlung (Kronberg im Taunus), Surgical Museum Asklepios (Tuttlingen), Fein Markenwelt (Schwaebisch Gmünd - Bargau), Juraworld of coffee (Niederbuchsiten), Mercedes-Benz Museum (Stuttgart), Uzin Utz exhibition (Ulm)
content.title_en: Corporate Museums : concepts, ideas, realization : concepts, ideas, implementation

content.text: What are the challenges facing planning rights and procedures in the face of increasingly articulated demands for participation? And how can and should the expert knowledge of citizens complement the knowledge of experts? Civil society engagement is synonymous with the will to shape the living environment and thus increasingly becomes a fixed size for politics and planning. Volume 6 of the IBA series of writings asks about the opportunities and consequences of this development for the future of cities. Practical examples provide insights into the planning and participation methods of several German cities and regions around the world. A particular focus is on the experiences of IBA Hamburg with very different participation formats, which are commented on from several perspectives. Ultimately, the focus is on the level of attention that planners and politicians meet with citizens and on how planning processes should adapt to the constantly changing social conditions in a forward-looking and innovative way.
content.title_en: Metropolis: civil society

content.text: Filigree lightness: discover extraordinary grass gardens. This beautiful book of pictures deals with seductive grass compositions. While for a long time the garden gardeners were "disposable", they are now an important element in modern garden design. The book takes the viewer on a journey through impressive and fascinating grass gardens in France, Great Britain, Belgium and the Netherlands. The large-format pictures of the presented gardens speak for themselves. Therefore, the text is limited to scarce information. Often the plantings seem like carefully woven carpets. Since grass gardens are very easy to care for, they are even more attractive for garden owners. Although in some gardens completely without colorful flowers, they do not seem boring, since planting with grasses always brings naturalness into the garden. Other original design ideas with grasses and plant portraits of important ornamental grasses are found in the closing chapters.
content.title_en: Filigree lightness : discover extraordinary grass gardens

content.text: The methodology of geography teaching is a book for students, referendars and experienced teachers who want to teach geography with success and joy. Written by a school practitioner, the main focus here is on current findings from various fields of education in the field of education, which have proved to be suitable for everyday teaching in the field of school teaching for geography. The experiences with students from uncounted successful and also less successful teaching situations were more important for this book than the theoretical discourse on an academic meta level. In a timely guide, the reader is given examples of applications for varied geography teaching in and outside the school room in numerous excursions. Suggestions for thinking about teaching and an open view of his own profession play a special role here: "Only teachers who convince themselves professionally and humanly achieve their address types and can convey learning successes and impressions that enrich them."
content.title_en: Geography Teaching Methodology
Lead, zinc, tin and their alloys

content.text: Since the issue of environmental protection has moved into social awareness of the problem of even system-faithful groups of the population, it is said that a new "green capitalism" is being discussed, which is not only to heal the wounds of nature, but also to give new impetus to the prevailing economic system. Climate change, poisoning of the seas and drinking water resources, increasing species extinction
content.title_en: What every environmentalist needs to know about capitalism

content.text: Audio technology : for event technicians in training and practice ; with 74 tables and 152 exercises ; [incl. video technology]. Clearly structured illustrated textbook on professional audio and event technology. For trainees and users. The clear systematic structure is loosely oriented towards the framework curriculum for training as "specialist for event technology" and begins with the physical foundations of sound, then passes to the topic audio electronics (audio transmission, recording, digitisation) and then treats equipment and equipment of audio technology
content.title_en: Sound technology : for event technicians in training and practice ; with 74 tables and 152 exercises ; [incl. video technology]

content.text: Nation-Building in Afghanistan: Legitimate deficits within political reconstruction. In December 2001 an ambitious goal was set on the German Petersberg: Afghanistan should be pacified, rebuilt and democratized. But between the fall of the Taliban at the end of 2001 and the announced change of strategy of American President Obama in December 2009, there are about eight unsuccessful years of war and reconstruction on the Hindu Kush. Martina Meienberg analyses why political reconstruction in Afghanistan has failed in many areas. The investigation of the case-example shows how the interventions have affected the behaviour of various actors, including the Karzai government, the Taliban and the members of the Bundeswehr.
content.title_en: Nation-Building in Afghanistan : Legitimate deficits within political reconstruction

content.text: Detect and treat writing disorders in children : the practical book for therapy and pedagogy; [with explanations on RAVEK-S]. This book describes motor writing disorders in children and adolescents and their causes and shows how children can be supported in a targeted way.
content.title_en: Detect and treat writing disorders in children : the practical book for therapy and pedagogy; [with explanations on RAVEK-S]

content.text: IT outsourcing in practice: strategies, project management, cost effectiveness. The reduction of IT costs while increasing competitiveness is more than ever the focus of strategic considerations in the economy. IT outsourcing is one of the top topics in the management days of companies. Torsten founders and other experts describe in this eBook practical and understandable the established service models in the outsourcing market. The focus is on: - success-critical aspects of outsourcing project management - transparent design of the performance relationship - governance and controlling - pricing models and leasing - transition of personnel and economic assets - legal aspects The eBook is characterized by high practical relevance. The author is a proven outsourcing expert.
content.title_en: IT outsourcing in practice : strategies, project management, cost-effectiveness

content.text: More participation ventures : arguments for increased participation of children and young people; [with recommendations for action for municipalities]. Main description: Our society faces reform tasks in all policy areas. To master these requires more civic commitment than ever. A new culture of participation is needed, and the young generation plays an important role in this. Children and young people are almost always affected by political decisions - but rarely have an opportunity to influence them. Changing this situation requires above all a rethinking of actors in politics, administration and schools - municipalities can only develop themselves in the long term with the participation of all generations.
content.title_en: More participation ventures : arguments for increased participation of children and young people; [with recommendations for action for municipalities]

content.text: Calculus versus catastrophe: Communication of climate change. Especially the science of climate change claims and gets the public, but also in an ambivalence-influenced relationship with the mass media. Friedemann Lembcke shows that it is less a problem to solve in the communication of climate change, than a reciprocal condition of calculus and catastrophe communication. Friedemann Lembcke received his doctorate from Prof. Dr. Norbert Bolz at the Institute for Language and Communication at the Technical University of Berlin and is a research associate in the field of climate effects and vulnerability at the Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research. Especially the science of climate change claims the public and gets it, however, in a relationship with the mass media that is characterized by ambivalence. Friedemann Lembcke shows that it is less a problem to solve in the communication of climate change, rather a reciprocal condition of calculus and catastrophe communication.
content.title_en: Calculation versus Disaster : Communication of Climate Change

content.text: The IT-Management is a critical factor for the sustainable business and/or organization success, whether it is about the content of the IT-Management and/or the content of the IT-Management. The IT-Management is a key task of the top management level. It is a critical factor for the sustainable business and/or organization success, whether it is about supporting internal processes or offering IT-based services and products. HMD 284 provides a current outline of the relevant approaches and experiences and addresses questions of the ROI-Ermittlung and IT-Governance as well as that of the architecture and service management main description of the IT-Management and/or the content of the IT-Management and/or the content of the IT-Management and/or the content of the IT-Management.
content.title_en: Strategic IT management : IT project governance, corporate architecture management, Agile IT application landscapes, IT outsourcing, IT management, collaboration roadmapping, corporate information management, sustainable IT management

content.text: Army in action : 20 years of foreign operations of the Bundeswehr ; a publication of the Rosa Luxemburg Foundation. Reader's annotation : Political science contribution to the change of German foreign and military policy since 1990. Among other things, the changes in the political and legal framework for the worldwide military use of the Bundeswehr are described
content.title_en: Army in action : 20 years of foreign service of the Bundeswehr ; a publication of the Rosa Luxemburg Foundation

content.text: Differential geometry : Curves - Surfaces - Multifolds. This book is an introduction to differential geometry and a fitting companion to the differential geometry module (one and two-emestrig). First, it deals with the classical aspects such as the geometry of curves and surfaces, before looking at higher-dimensional surfaces as well as abstract manifolds. The interface is the central chapter "The inner geometry of surfaces". This leads the reader to the famous sentence of Gauss-Bonnet, which represents a crucial link between local and global geometry. The second half of the book is dedicated to Riemann's geometry. The conclusion is a chapter on "Einstein-Raums", which has a great significance both in "Clean Mathematics" and in the general relativity theory of A. Einstein. It places great value on visuality, which is supported by numerous illustrations.
content.title_en: Differential geometry : curves - surfaces - manifolds

content.text: Chemical process engineering : Calculation, design and operation of chemical reactors. Practical and theoretically sound textbook on modelling, design and operation of chemical reactors. Readers are enabled to systematically penetrate the processes in chemical reactors and to record them in the mathematical model.
content.title_en: Chemical process engineering : Calculation, design and operation of chemical reactors

content.text: Profession - Politics - Transparency : Additional activities rules for members of the Bundestag in international comparison. The scandal surrounding the secondary activities of members of the Bundestag in 2005 showed how critically the public observed the financing of the political class. The scandal led to the introduction of transparency rules, which were not only discussed before the Federal Constitutional Court. Stephan Malessa examines the system conformity of the secondary activities rules from a political scientific perspective. In doing so, he first analyses the political implications of the published secondary activities. In addition, he examines the connection between the professionalization of parliaments and the sharpness of the respective transparency rules by means of an international comparison.
content.title_en: Occupation - Politics - Transparency : Additional activities rules for members of the Bundestag in an international comparison

content.text: Embedded Programming : Basic knowledge and application examples of the Infineon XC800 family. Main description: This book presents embedded programming of microcomputers based on specific examples of the Infineon XC800 family. The focus is on programming examples in the language C, which make the solution of concrete tasks easy for the reader to understand; assembler programs and other basics are the subject of the book as it is necessary for understanding. Sample solutions and the sample programs used are available for download. The execution of the programs can be done on real hardware as well as in simulator operation of the free development environment.
content.title_en: Embedded Programming: Basic knowledge and examples of the Infineon XC800 family

content.text: Construction services ; 11: Room and timber construction works VOB/STLB construction : Standards ; VOB Part B: DIN 1961; VOB Part C: ATV DIN 18299, ATV DIN 18334. Contains: DIN 1052-10:2012 ; DIN 1961:2012 ; DIN 4074-1:2012 ; DIN 4074-5:2008 ; DIN 18065:2011 ; DIN 18203-3:2008 ; DIN 18299:2012 ; DIN 18334:2012 ; DIN 68365:2008 ; DIN 68368:2006 ; DIN 68705-2:2003 ; DIN 68740-2:1999 ; DIN 68762:1982 ; DIN 68800-1:2011 ; DIN 68800-2:2012 ; DIN 68800-3:2012 ; DIN EN 300:2006 ; DIN EN 312:2010 ; DIN EN 315:2000 ; DIN EN 336:2003 ; DIN EN 622-1:2003 ; DIN EN 622-2:2004 ; DIN EN 622-2:2006 [Reporting 1] ; DIN EN 622-3:2004 ; DIN EN 636:2012 EN EN 1306:2005 : EN 139-8:2005 ; DIN EN 139-3:2005 ;
content.title_en: Construction services ; 11: Room and wood construction works VOB/STLB construction : standards ; VOB part B: DIN 1961; VOB part C: ATV DIN 18299, ATV DIN 18334

content.text: Ford Fiesta from 10/08 : [with current-flow diagrams]. The guide from the proven series offers detailed maintenance and maintenance instructions for the compact car models manufactured from October 2008 and can also be carried out by ambitious DIY enthusiasts. With well illustrated work steps, fault tables and current-flow diagrams. No comparable title to the models presented here is known so far. (2) (LK/EF: Empty) Rich illustrated guide that offers detailed maintenance and repair instructions for the models built from 2008 on. (LK/EF: Empty)
content.title_en: Ford Fiesta from 10/08 : [with circuit diagrams]

content.text: Experimental Physics 1 : Mechanics and Warmness. MECHANIK and WÄRME are the first of four volumes on experimental physics by Professor Demtröder. The teaching contents of the first semester physics are vivid and easy to understand, but presented as quantitatively as possible. Important definitions and formulas, all illustrations and tables were designed in two colours. Calculated examples in the text, chapter summaries and exercises with detailed solutions at the end of the book help to cope with the material and stimulate our own collaboration. Color plates on selected topics contribute to the fun of this book. The sixth edition has been reworked and updated.
content.title_en: Experimental Physics 1 : Mechanics and Heat

content.text: Greenpeace sustainability barometer: What moves the youth?. The Greenpeace sustainability barometer was developed and carried out on behalf of Greenpeace by the Institute for Environmental Communication at Leuphana University of Lüneburg. The study examines how the status quo of education for sustainable development and environmental education is in Germany. Michelsen ("The Fischer-Öko-Almanach", here last BA 7/91) notes with his team: The youth thinks environmentally conscious and perceives climate change as a serious problem. This is the result of the nationwide representative survey, which selected 1,070 15- to 24-year-olds randomly and interviewed in July 2011. The figures thus confirm the 16th Shell youth study "Youth 2010" (BA 12/10). With 27 figures, 36 tables and detailed literature list. (3) (Heidi Best-Sendel) Results of the nationwide representative survey of 15- to 24-year-olds and qualitative interviews from 2011 on the topic "Sustainability". (Heidi Best-Sendel)
content.title_en: Greenpeace sustainability barometer : What moves youth?

content.text: Metropolis Ruhr : Landsundliche Besuchung des neuen Ruhrgebiet. Current developments in the Ruhr metropolis in five sections: Starting points
content.title_en: Metropolis Ruhr : a national account of the new Ruhr area

content.text: Data quality in databases. If one develops application systems, one is repeatedly confronted with the integration, integration or exchange of data. Everyone who knows this knows how hard it is to first recognize data problems and then to fix them. Especially in the development of data warehouse systems, where different data stocks are to be integrated into a common data stock, the recognition of problems without corresponding software-tools is often a true "Sisyphos" work. If one depends here only on conventional SQL instructions, the knowledge about problems remains just superficial. A claim of data quality in databases is therefore to show approaches, how one can extend relational database management systems with data quality procedures.
content.title_en: Data quality in databases

content.text: The end of the coincidence: how big data predicts our lives. "Big data", "data mining" and "predictability", i.e. the collection of large amounts of data and the resulting prognosis of our actions, whether as consumers, investors, private people or possibly criminals, are the focus of the latest "data revolution" (see also "Data Unser", ID-A 15/12). "Recorded Future" is called e.g. a company from this industry, of which the radio and television man (Ö3, SAT.1, premiere) and communication consultant reports in his flott written book. Network formation, linking, social media - the networked society develops into a predictable society; in the run ahead, those who developed or could afford the best "crystal balls" and finally: "Beautiful new data world - end with chance"! That sounds good and boring at the same time. The core question remains: Who collects data for what purpose? Here, to demand more transparency and democratic participation, as the author does, sounds good, but it must be good.
content.title_en: The End of Chance: How Big Data Makes Our Life Predictable

content.text: HTML5 and CSS3: the new web standards in practical use; develop innovative web pages and apps - including JavaScript APIs and Responsive Design; 16 hours of professional practice knowledge. The trainer of this video training is a proven expert of web technologies. He has a description of the future new HTML standard ("HTML5", BA 9/10). The learning video shown here is based on a training with the exact same title (ID-B 13/12), which however had to be achieved in contrast to the current 16-hour version with 9 hours running time. Both the technical equipment and the intuitive operation are again high quality and need no criticism. In terms of content the chapters were strongly tuned. Partially the chapters were extended (graphic programming), partly completely new topics were taken up (form technology, APIs for mobile web apps). The trainer formulates clearly, understands and is quite flat on the road, but also requires preliminary knowledge. For absolute beginners the "Little Boxes (ID-A 6/12) is still well suited. This new Galileo course should be offered in parallel to the predecessor. Demand guaranteed. (1) (L/H comprehensive) The possibilities of HTML5 and the future is explained in terms of the HTML/H.
content.title_en: HTML5 and CSS3 : the new web standards in practical use ; developing innovative websites and apps - including JavaScript APIs and Responsive Design ; 16 hours of practical knowledge from the professional

content.text: The book on transport: the fascinating world of mobility and logistics. The engineer offers a broad overview of freight transport, passenger transport, communications, the current state of transport technology and the future prospects. He strives to achieve a balanced presentation using tables and numerous illustrations, but can only inspire many topics such as environmentally friendly transport policy (cf. Winfried Wolf: "Verkehr, Umwelt, Klima", BA 2/08). The style is understandable, but occasionally cumbersome and academically marked. On the other hand, the approximately 160-page-wide core of the book, namely the history of traffic, which is illustrated with maps and images attractively from the stone age to the present (sober C. Merki: "Verkehrsgeschichte und Mobilität", ID 48/08), is well-performed. This chapter can already address pupils. A material-rich volume with strengths and weaknesses, which is worth its money and can be recommended for large stocks in view of the extensive equipment. A concentrated textbook wrote by Uwe Köhler with "Introduction to Traffic Planning" (ID-G 23/14). (3) (Rolf Raschka) The overview of the transport time of the traffic technology is illustrated the traffic technology, the present day, the traffic history.
content.title_en: The Book of Transport: the Fascinating World of Mobility and Logistics

content.text: Coordination Chemistry. Since Alfred Werner formulated his coordination theory a little over a hundred years ago, complex chemistry of transition metals has rapidly developed into one of the most important research areas of inorganic chemistry.The multifaceted nature of coordination chemistry is already indicated by the variability of the compounds, which include small molecules such as hexacarbonyl chromium as well as metal enzymes.This textbook is aimed at students in the main study. All important aspects of coordination chemistry - for example ligand field theory, binding theory, properties ...
content.title_en: Coordination Chemistry

content.text: UrbanRESET: Uncovering the potential of urban spaces; how to activate immanent potentials of urban spaces. Angelus Eisinger (*1964). Studied economics. 2003 Habilitation at ETH Zurich. Private lecturer at ETH Zurich (2003-2009), Professorship for Urban Planning and Spatial Development at the University of Liechtenstein (2005-2008), since March 2008 Professor of History and Culture of the Metropolis at HCU Hamburg. Free expert position as consultant and juror with the office Perimeter City in Zurich. Member of the advisory board of IBA Basel 2020, the artistic advisory board of the Swiss Architecture Museum (S AM) and the monument council of the city of Hamburg. Nina Brodowski (*1979). Studied Applied Cultural Sciences in Lüneburg. Subsequently, she worked as a research associate in the Scandinavian evaluation and consulting company Rambøll Management in the field of family-friendly urban development. Since October 2008, she has been a research associate at Angelus Eisinger at HCU Hamburg. Jörg Seifert (*1971).
content.title_en: urbanRESET : Unlocking immanent potentials of urban spaces ; how to activate immanent potentials of urban spaces

metadata.authors: Eisinger, Angelus; Seifert, Jörg; Brodowski, Nina

content.text: Lasers: Basics and applications in photonics, technology, medicine and art. The first laser was built as a laboratory device in early 1960. However, it has only been in the past twenty years that lasers have been produced more reliably, more stable, more compact and cheaper. Since then, the triumphal march of lasers has been unstoppable. Many "technical achievements", especially in production technology, are based on the use of lasers. Laser technology is today a special field of expertise. With the development of durable, stable and cheaper semiconductor lasers in combination with modern optics, as well as more powerful electronics and the use of lasers, lasers are now a special field of expertise.
content.title_en: Lasers : Basics and Applications in Photonics, Technology, Medicine and Art

content.text: The fight for electricity: myths, power and monopolies. Since Angela Merkel's "energy turnaround" is said to have turned the turbo on and the nuclear power plants off, the chaos is still very clear in terms of energy supply. The Renewable Energy Act (EEG) is to be abolished, but then it is not, offshore wind farms are started with a lot of wind, then stopped. Power grids are planned, but not built. Suddenly nobody knows where it actually goes. Instead, lobbyists of all origins dominate the discussion, the politicians turn to one, then to the other wind direction, and the people yearns back to old times, when the electricity just came out of the socket - and in the end the people are supposed to pay for the whole mess even the coal. Claudia Kemfert explains to us all - citizens, politicians and the economy - the energy turn. Now is the time to act. Because the energy turn has just begun to the only proposal of a new Reich-Zeitung, but the environmental scientist Claudia Kemfert is not going to the energy turn... The good thing is that it is no more blue break for the company – the new thing – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis is not to the crisis – but the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis – the crisis –
content.title_en: Fight for electricity : Myths, power and monopolies

content.text: From the Big Bang to the modern man: the development of the world in ten steps. From the Big Bang to the formation of galaxies, suns and planets, to the emergence of life and evolution, which is culminating in man. In addition to the Big Bang, elementary particles, galaxies, dark matter, multiverses and the possible end of the universe are also discussed in Chapter 1. The formation of stars and planets and the prerequisites for the formation of life. The fundamental meaning of carbon and water is dedicated to Chapter 4. It follows the treatment of the biochemical foundations of life, the necessity of multicellularity, the Darwinian theory of evolution, the development of mammals and finally of man. In the last chapter, the view is speculated about the future of humanity, whereby the world strives for an "evolutionary convergence point", after which it goes downhill, represents a basis.
content.title_en: From Big Bang to Modern Man: the Development of the World in Ten Steps

content.text: The theory that did not want to die: as the English pastor Thomas Bayes discovered a rule that, after 150 years of controversy, is no longer to be thought away from science, technology and society. Bayes's sentence allows work with conditional probabilities that are omnipresent in practice and research. It is therefore applied in insurance, econometrics, decision theory and quality management, among other things, to medical forecasts and model traffic flows. Since it allows to conclude from an effect on the probability of an underlying cause, it is of central importance in all questions of learning from experience (testing hypotheses, estimating parameters). This is the history of a mathematical knowledge and its emergence, development and application in the context of long-term controversy as to its validity and applicability.
content.title_en: The theory that did not want to die: as the English pastor Thomas Bayes discovered a rule that after 150 years of controversy is now indispensable from science, technology and society

content.text: The city in space: ideas, designs and designs in pre-modern Europe. A frequently asked demand to historicalize the city in its multi-dimensional relationship to the surrounding and co-generated spaces is addressed and redeemed in the contributions of the present volume by medieval, early modern historians and art historians. Three main topics are the development of urban space, the expansion of urban space into the surrounding area and the participation of urban actors in the construction of supra-local spaces. The approaches of recent urban history research, state education research and diplomacy history as well as environmental and art history are brought together and mutually fruitfully made.
content.title_en: The city in space: ideas, designs and designs in pre-modern Europe

content.text: From heroes and victims: cultural history of the German war memorial. Cultural history of the German war memorial in the 19th and 20th centuries, which documents the change from the Siegerdenden Monument to the Memorial. Review: Cultural history of the German war memorial from the Napoleonic wars to the present day, focussing on the war 1870/71, the 1st and the 2nd World War. The author describes the change of war memorial from the Siegerdenden Monument to the Memorial on the basis of the dramatic historical upheavals of this period. And he shows that this also means that the reception of the historical monument is subject to change. The presentation also always goes into detail, i.e. over 30 concrete monuments (with a certain emphasis on the Southwest of Germany) are described and classified; also on the musical and above all literary commemoration is addressed. Black and white illustrations, literature catalogue, registers. This thorough work on war memorials complements the thematically further literature such as U. Schlies overview of German national monuments (2002) and P. Reichels presentation of all German state symbols (2012).
content.title_en: Of heroes and victims : Cultural history of the German war memorial

content.text: The number that came from the cold: when mathematics becomes an adventure. The Austrian mathematics professor Taschner can be called the feuilletonist of mathematics. As one could already find in his earlier volumes "Der Zahlen ganzige Schatten" (ID-B 30/05) and "Das Infinite" (ID-B 50/05), he needs space and time to develop his thoughts. He also likes to mention historical backgrounds, describes the thought processes of important mathematicians and opens doors to mathematical thought buildings, be it Hilbert's hotel, Gödel's theorem or philosophical considerations about the infinite. As it is a good feuilleton, he does not overburden his readers with mathematical formulas; where this is necessary, it will be banished to an appendix. On the other hand, he does not shy away from explaining in the chapter the Knuthian arrow notation for potency towers in the chapter on large numbers. Also, the encryption of texts using large prime numbers finds its place. Thus, it will give many chapters that are enjoyed, often also be held to gain.
content.title_en: The number that came from the cold : when mathematics becomes an adventure

content.text: The art historian and construction researcher Norbert Nußbaum is known for numerous basic publications on medieval architecture, which are particularly characterized by the fruitful synthesis of meticulous structural research analyses and the critical questioning of structural, constructive and theoretical foundations of architecture. He is also responsible for the transfer of this bridge to the close institutional connection of university art history in Cologne with the practice of building research and preservation of monuments. - - With this volume, colleagues, friends and students congratulate Norbert Nußbaum on his 60th birthday. The topics and methods of the contributions are intended to trace the interests and career of the jubilee: from building research to comprehensive representations of structural problems of construction art to theoretical reflection of academic teaching and work.
content.title_en: Extent and discourse : Festschrift for Norbert Nußbaum on his 60th birthday

content.text: Thinking about urban development: Building blocks for an interpretation in the 21st century. Urban development today faces a multitude of social and ecological challenges in the face of a variety of influences such as globalisation, climate change and demographic change, the scarcity of fossil resources and the energy transition. These can only be overcome by means of concepts that integrate urban planning, social science and design aspects equally. In this book twelve experts explore the contribution that the relatively young discipline Urban Design can make to this.
content.title_en: Thinking about urban planning: Building blocks for an interpretation in the 21st century

content.text: Thailand's diverse landscapes: geology and relief, climate, vegetation and use. This colourful volume presents Thailand's diverse landscapes and explains their origins against the background of earth history, climate and not least the ever-increasing human influences that they created, and at some points threatens them. The author complements the description with data on climate, water balance, use and vegetation of the landscapes; from tropical rainforests in the south to monsunt-rock forests to tropical cloud forests in Thailand's mountains. The book is richly illustrated with over 200 colored pictures and maps as well as many tables, a bibliography completes the work. The German-Thai society wants to address all visitors and friends of Thailand with this volume, who are interested in the development and geographical background data of these exceptionally varied landscapes of Thailand, besides culture and inhabitants.
content.title_en: Thailand's diverse landscapes : geology and relief, climate, vegetation and use

content.text: My first Mac: the easy start; [ideal for beginners; all explained step by step; Internet, emails, photos, music, videos etc.; for all Macs from MacBook Air to iMac]. New edition of the proven Mac guide (last ID-B 51/12). Although the chapter headings en large and en detail signal a broad congruence with the predecessor (only in the music/video sections there were changes), a comparison was made that R. Jacobi has undergone a thorough revision of the band. This is shown in the revised, updated and partly extended texts as well as in the frequently exchanged screenshots. Unchanged this guide provides reliable information for beginners at the latest - i.e. on the latest devices and the operating system version OS X 10.9 ("Mavericks") - and should now be offered additional to the predecessor. (2)
content.title_en: My first Mac : the easy start ; [ideal for beginners ; all explained step by step ; Internet, emails, photos, music, videos etc. ; for all Macs from MacBook Air to iMac]

content.text: Religionhybride: Religion in post-traditional contexts. Post-traditional communities contribute to the re-enchanting of the world by creating site-bound utopias with their own myths and rituals, according to French sociologist Michel Maffesoli. The University of Rostock investigates how these communities represent expressions of religious productivity. Are new forms of religion or religiously overformed lifestyles emerging from religious practices beyond institutionalized religious practices? Contrary to the revision-needed thesis of the disappearance of religion, it is intended to be brought into view how religion in old village churches and other auratic places may re-emerge and be different. Thus, the special forms of communitization and networking, fixed cultures and events such as court festivals, valuations and social motives are also under consideration. The content • The research project "Religion Hybride: Religion, Symbolic Places, Performance • The Transformation Process of Religion in the Western Modern Age The students and teaching staff of religion and cultural sociology The University of Rostock is Professor of Religion Dr.
content.title_en: Religionhybrid : Religion in post-traditional contexts

content.text: Social Media. Platforms such as Facebook, Wikipedia, YouTube or Twitter have changed the Internet considerably in recent years. They are considered to be "social media", because they have a great influence on how people present themselves and their interests on the Internet, how they maintain relationships, re-establish themselves and inform themselves about relevant topics. At the same time they raise a number of far-reaching questions: Does social media leave privacy? Does social media make everyone a journalist? Do social media bring knowledge for everyone? Are social media participative - or monitor and control people? The volume answers these questions from a sociological perspective and thus gives an overview of how social media transforms our individual everyday life as well as our society. The content - self-presentation and privacy - The end of journalism? - Participation in knowledge worlds - The participation paradox The target groups - Decision-makers in the field of politics and media - Journalists - Teachers - Students of the upper level/Abiturients - Beginners The author Dr. Jan-Hinrik Schmidt is a scientific speaker for digital interak-tive media and political communication at the Hans-Bow-Institute of Hamburg
content.title_en: Social media
