content.text: Universities as regional innovation drivers? : Innovation transfer from universities and its importance for regional development. The study is based on an empirical analysis of the innovation process in four East German case studies regions Dresden, Halle, Jena and Rostock. All four regions have both a university and an industrial tradition. However, the development processes since the system broke down in 1990 are different in these regions. The study is based on various data sources: In addition to the analysis of university statistics, the statistics of employees subject to social security contributions and patent statistics, two extensive postal surveys were carried out. One of these surveys was directed at regional key actors (industrial and chamber of commerce, patent offices, trade unions, etc.) and aimed at assessing regional circumstances. Addressees of the second survey were professors in the universities studied. Here, the scope, type, procedure and problems of cooperation activities were discussed. The findings obtained here were further deepened by a series of interviews with actively cooperating professors and the management of universities.
content.title_en: Higher education as a regional innovation driver? : Transfer of innovation from higher education institutions and its importance for regional development

content.text: Management of destinations. Main description: Destinations are the actual competition units in tourism. Because destinations consist of people as citizens and not only employees, because destinations consist of different independent companies and not only of subordinate departments, because tourism generates various external effects and for various other reasons new approaches are needed for the management of destinations. How does a coherent tourist product arise in a destination, what conditions of success can be derived for strategies of destinations, how can the success of a destination be measured in the competition, how can strategies be asserted internally despite contradictory interests of citizens and companies? For these and other explanations and design questions the present book provides answers. First in the German-speaking area it deals with the topic of destination management, which is important in connection with the revitalization of tourism.
content.title_en: Management of destinations

content.text: Health tourism and tourist destination development : a textbook. Main description: This textbook also introduces theoretically and practically into the basics of the topic health tourism: It sets a course from anthropological basics to ethical questions of health tourism. Furthermore, health tourism settings are presented. Operator and architecture concepts, financing alternatives and health tourism marketing are the pillars. Also, destinations are addressed, which face perspective challenges in view of changing target groups and ecological challenges.
content.title_en: Health tourism and tourist destination development : a textbook

content.text: The present volume seeks answers to the question of which possibilities of German cultural policy are open to the necessary re-ordering of human-nature relations. In addition, sustainability as a field of thought and action is examined from several perspectives, the importance of culture and cultural policy is examined, and the triangle of nature, culture and production as a necessary approach to thinking.From the investigations, strategic cultural policy potentials and starting points for the design of human-nature relations are derived.The content: Ambivalents of sustainability.- Cultural policy as an actor.- Political sustainability strategy as an analytical reference and cultural policy framework.- Key question Growth, boundaries as an interpretation pattern, abandonment as an option.- The principle Cradle to Cradle as a possible solution.- Production and culture as a difficult relationship.- Consequences for cultural policy The target groups: Kulturpolitiker.- Umweltpolitiker.- Participants in the growth and sustainability debates.- Journalists.- Environmental consultant The authors Edda Rydzy works as an author in Berlin. Monika Grüf is the director of Kulturholz in Berlin.
content.title_en: Natural growth: explorations of man, nature and growth on a cultural political basis

content.text: The focus: Marine worlds: Journey into the unknown depths of the oceans. The focus: Marine worlds "To go where no human has been yet" - this is not only the motto of the science fiction series Star Trek, but also of most marine scientists. Because large parts of this vast habitat are still almost unexplored. Only gradually the veil of the mystery begins to open. Thus biologists not only succeeded in the first census in the oceans, geoscientists have also discovered with the help of modern diving robots as bizarre as exciting phenomena in the deep sea. Strange asphalt volcanoes belong to it just as much as brooding geysers and even corals in night-dark blackness. The book presents the exotic wonder worlds of our oceans in detail. It also explains how they originated and why some of them are in danger.
content.title_en: Focus: Ocean worlds : Journey to the unknown depths of the oceans

content.text: Learning to program - Basics : Start without prior knowledge ; 5 hours of video training, 58 lessons. Video training is aimed at those who have no prior knowledge and introduces the basics of programming. Among other things, questions are addressed about how a computer program is created, what a command is and what programming language should be learned. The focus is on JavaScript as the language of the web, but generalizations to other languages are easily possible. Video training is therefore an interesting non-print alternative to B. Wurm (ID-A 8/13), which does its examples with Visual C sharp. The video training starts with a short overview of programs, programming languages and source code. The focus is then on variables and data types, loops, character chains and working with arrays. It also takes good account of data access and detection and the removal of errors. Finally, the advantages of object-oriented programming are highlighted and the advantages and disadvantages of different programming languages discussed. Can be used on tablets and smartphones. Easy to understand with many examples. (2)
content.title_en: Learning to program - Basics : Start without prior knowledge ; 5 hours of video training, 58 lessons ...

content.text: Water, wine and oil: the life-supplies of the Roman world. Cultural history of Roman everyday life (construction, medicine, agriculture, trade, etc.) is illustrated by the basic materials water, wine and oil. Review: Using the 3 liquids water, wine and oil, the classical philologist Weeber (most recently "everyday life in ancient Rome", 2012 and the audiobook "Auf einem Wein mit Seneca") traces a very special cultural history of the Roman Empire. Thus, we learn a lot about ancient architecture (therms, aqueducts, mills etc.) in the chapter on water. In the section on wine we are informed about old wine varieties, the rural work and the use of wine as a drug and in medicine. The chapter on oil in the Roman world reports on the use of various oils at sports and religious events. But we also learn something about such profane things as the production of lamp oil. Also important topics such as trade routes and the importance of wine and oil as an economic factor are discussed. Weeber proves with this book its profundity of matter. It makes everyday life clear, as the basic book of the history of the Roman people.
content.title_en: Water, wine and oil: the life juices of the Roman world

content.text: Integrating infrastructures in Europe in a historical comparison; Volume 4: Trains across borders : comparative studies on international cooperation in railway development. Rail transport also operates across political borders and other modes of transport. The book examines how common ideas for rail transport developed – or not developed – using three case studies. Topics are supply concepts, tariffs and infrastructure as central areas of design for rail transport with examples of the late 19th century and the post-World War II period. Borders often meet different political and planning goals. However, especially on rail, there is a lot of coordination needed to make a good offer for international transport as well. It is not only about compatible technical standards, but also about a coordination of ideas and concepts. Also in the present, it is possible to see how difficult steps (back) to a "European" rail system can be implemented in conflict with technical complexity, increasing competition and different ideas.
content.title_en: Integration of infrastructures in Europe in historical comparison ; Volume 4: Trains across borders : comparative studies on international cooperation in railway development

content.text: Quo vadis Social Media? : about the future of social networks and Facebook in Germany. The band is suitable for new entrants as well as for connoisseurs and users of social media. The author manages to present the basics excitingly, to show opportunities and risks of this media use and to outline possible future developments. (Verlag)
content.title_en: Quo vadis Social Media? : on the future of social networks and Facebook in Germany

content.text: The wonderful world of tree houses: Design, construction, inspiration. A place by itself, a retreat in the protection of branches and leaves, unreachable for parents, an airy hiding place with views: All those who have saved their childhood dream from tree houses into the present, the renowned tree house architect Pete Nelson shows how to do it right. Respectfully designed in the way of nature and ecologically sustainable, the "tree whisperer" now plans and builds tree houses all over the world – as a summer residence or as a guesthouse, as a love nest or as a creative zone, as a lookout in the garden or as an exclusive children's room. In his new book Pete Nelson gives not only helpful hints about the construction of tree houses (and the latest technical stand!), he also takes us on an inspiring world journey to the most original, extraordinary and most breathtaking tree houses on all five continents.
content.title_en: The wonderful world of tree houses : design, construction, inspiration

content.text: For a humane society: Dispute writing against the loss of politics. The author takes the political as existential in human existence into account. She analyses how politics is exposed by its actors themselves for their own power advantages and thus initiates an unexplained general political change. Man is devalued in politics, society, economy and culture and degraded to the size of the calculation. Humans and society no longer understand themselves and get into a dangerous situation. In a reinvention of politics by the individual there is a possible way out. Man is an actor, starting point and center of a new "politics of humanity", as the author expects. This policy combines with a development of people and their consciousness. The content crisis? What crisis? Destruction • Politics: The crisis is a crisis of politics • New center • The new social question • The general theory • The target groups • Political psychologists • Sociologists • PhilosopherInnnen • Multipliers in public, politics and society • Politically interested citizens The author Mechtild Jansen is a social scientist and free author in Berlin
content.title_en: For a humane society : Dispute paper against the loss of politics

content.text: Upper level from the point of view of pupils: Re-study of classes and individual support in upper secondary education. Heterogeneity and individual support are both key words in the current pedagogical discourse and the standards of corresponding requirements for pedagogical practice. How these terms are currently discussed in relation to the upper level and how individual support can be realized there is the subject of this volume. Based on a qualitative study on conditions and context of class re-evaluations in upper level, the effects of various heterogeneity aspects and the perception of school support from the point of view of the learners are examined for the first time for this school level, the effects of different heterogeneity aspects and the perception of school support from the point of view of the learners. content.text: Strategies in energy and climate policy: Conditions for strategic management of the energy transition in Germany and the UK. Climate change requires a politically-controlled transformation of the established energy systems. Due to the long response times of climate and environmental policies and the long-term effects of decisions in the energy system, inter-layered and problem-oriented action concepts are required for the energy transition, which extend beyond government changes and political opinion shifts. In some countries, therefore, there are approaches to achieving a climate-friendly energy supply through the development and implementation of national strategy concepts, including in the UK and Germany. Annika Sohre analyses the influence factors of strategic control processes in these two countries. From this, she derives conditions of strategic control in energy and climate policy, which can be used for a further development of strategic approaches. The content Reconstruction of strategy processes in Germany and the UK Participating actors, content and effects of strategies in the case studies Influencing factors in the British and German strategy processes Central conditions of strategic control towards climate-friendly energy supply The target groups Dozierende und Studieren im Bereich der Energie-KlimapolitikPräsieren im Klimapolitik, Wirtschafts
content.title_en: Energy and climate policy strategies : Conditions for strategic governance of the energy transition in Germany and Great Britain

content.text: Mathematics in the study: exercises on the bridge course. Main description: In order to become skills, it is necessary to practice what is read and learned. The book "Mathematics in the study" offers a wealth of exercises, the results of which are also included. However, a mere result is often not enough, once you have run out of time, a thought impulse needed. To make the work with "Mathematics in the study" more effective, this solution book has been created, which contains the tasks, the results and the detailed solutions for each chapter. Thus, each reader can deepen herself into the tasks and also address those for which he or she has so far lacked the approach or certain steps.
content.title_en: Mathematics in Studies : Bridge Course Exercises

content.text: Corruption, anti-corruption policy and public administration: Introduction and European political implications. This textbook deals with the basics of corruption and anti-corruption policy, including corruption terms, forms, consequences and causes of corruption, as well as the problem of measuringability. In addition, corruption is presented as a (political)scientific research subject and anti-corruption policy as a topic of policy research. The second part introduces the topic complex "Corruption and public administration". Corruption is shown as a contrast to various administrative models. Subsequently, causes of corruption in administration and the concern of various administrative areas of corruption as well as various aspects of the fight against corruption in public administration are addressed.The international and supranational anti-corruption policy in Europe is presented in the third part in a comprehensive manner.The content of corruption and anti-corruption policy: Basics.- Corruption and public administration: an overview.- Corruption and anti-corruption policy in Europe The target groups Dozierende und Studieren der Politik- und Verwaltwissenschaft as well as neighboring subjects The author Dr. Sebastian Wolf is an academic employee at the University of Konstanz and Research Officer at the Liechtenstein Institute in Liechtenstein.
content.title_en: Corruption, anti-corruption policy and public administration: introduction and European policy implications

content.text: The beginning of the end of old Europe: the Allied refusal of peace talks 1914-1919. Verlagsinfo: It is widely considered undeniable that the German Empire had a significant part to play in the outbreak of the world war 1914, that it had very expansive goals during the four-year bloody struggle and that in the event of a victory it would have imposed a hard peace on its opponents.That it actually behaved differently, this study shows. (...) During this period England and France were never ready to reach a peace of understanding, but Germany and Austria-Hungary.
content.title_en: The beginning of the end of old Europe : the Allied refusal of peace talks 1914-1919

content.text: Transparency in global supply chains of the automotive industry: approaches to logistics and production optimization. "This book makes the most important results of the research project RAN (RFID-based Automotive Network) accessible to a broad audience. For the first time, there is a consistent concept for the integration of logistics processes, the definition of the events contained therein, the infrastructure for their cross-company exchange, the inclusion of RFID technology and the monetary evaluation of the solution."--
content.title_en: Transparency in global supply chains of the automotive industry : Approaches for logistics and production optimization

content.text: Transformation of society for a resilient urban and regional development: starting points and perspectives for the regional arena. Steps towards a post-fossil economy and a climate-friendly lifestyle cannot wait. The major transformation of economy and society requires a basing of many "small" transformations in the local arenas of the city and region. The design of system transitions involves both the attempt to actively tax and the effort to cushion the effects of crisis and adapt to long-term systemic changes.
content.title_en: Transformation of the society for a resilient urban and regional development : starting points and perspectives for the regional arena

content.text: Generation-oriented and efficient infrastructure: starting points for sustainable financial planning in the Stadt Group - the example of the City of Cologne; results of a preliminary study. How can municipalities manage to reconcile financial capacity and necessary investments to maintain and develop their infrastructure? How is this possible when debt is to be redeemed and sustainable urban development is to be ensured at the same time? How can financial and infrastructure planning ensure long-term financing of investments? What instruments are needed and how should they be used? These are questions that the City of Cologne is asking itself. The starting point is a rough concept developed by the German Institute for Urban Studies for sustainable financial and infrastructure planning. The aim of the preliminary study was to clarify the existing basis for such an instrument in terms of information and data, relevant actors, time processes and methodological approaches. This should also provide the prerequisites and framework conditions for the development of sustainable financial planning in Cologne, with a particular focus on the infrastructure provision of the city.
content.title_en: Generation-oriented and operational with efficient infrastructure : starting points for sustainable financial planning in the Stadt Group - the example of the City of Cologne ; results of a preliminary study

content.text: Subversive urban planning. In the mainstream of urban planning and in the daily business of urban planners, alternative forms of urban action often remain ignored. Sometimes, however, a small occasion or idea is enough to cause a whole system to falter. Motives, cultures and scenes of urban action are so complex and complex that potential driving forces for change are either overlooked or dismissed as irrelevant. At present, however, the impression is that the patterns of action and structures of urban planning belong to a slowly fading era. Social activities and technologies that enable and facilitate participation in knowledge point to fundamental changes. The present study on subversive urban planning is intended to shed light on an already ongoing development and the most important forms of expression in this context.
content.title_en: Subversive urban planning

content.text: Gender justice as a universal concept? : critical and culturally sensitive analyses of gendermainstreaming after a catastrophe. Silke Schwarz is dedicated to the controversial question of gender justice. The transdisciplinary theoretical part combines common theories of social change from the fields of sociology, gender studies and psychology and concludes with an ethnography of Indonesian gender relations. In the result section, the author analyses how the own role and psychological identity within partnership, parenthood, working life and the community, as subjectivity is experienced in a central Javanian village, how a positioning is carried out in everyday life and how recognition and participation are experienced and gained. The book is characterized by repeated critical reflections of one's own approach as an integral part of questions about justice in transcultural, Islamic contexts. The content Critical perspectives on gendermainstreaming in Islamic-influenced disaster and development contexts The theories of social change An ethnography of Indonesian gender relations The target groups of lecturers and students from the fields of psychology, gender studies, sociology, ethnology and economics of the university of Berlin University of Applied Sciences and Humanities
content.title_en: Gender equality as a universal concept? : critical and culturally sensitive analyses of gendermainstreaming after a catastrophe

content.text: The cover fee for engineers. Cover fee is used to cover the fixed costs of a company or the business divisions. To this end, the fixed and variable costs must be known. The cover fee DB is calculated from: DB = net turnover - variable costs. This characteristic can be easily determined from the cost calculation, as net turnover and variable costs are generally known. A multi-stage cover fee calculation can define different price under-limits. Cover fee can also calculate market prices and a break-even analysis can be performed (determining the break-even turnover: turnover, where no profit or loss occurs or the break-even number of pieces: minimum number of profits = 0). Detailed examples and graphics illustrate the correlations. The content Benefits of the cover fee calculation Applications of the cover fee calculation The target groups Engineering and MBA students who want to learn management and management are engineers with management responsibility in companies The author: Prof. Dr. h.c. Ekberting was applied to Rektoralen University of Applied Sciences in 2007 to Rektoren
content.title_en: Financial contribution for engineers

content.text: iTunes Store, iPhoto, iMovie for iPad & iPhone. This volume has not much in common with the simultaneously released title "iTunes, iPhoto, iMovie for Mac" (in this no.) and it is also little used to earlier publications of the authors. Although there are set pieces from "iTunes" (ID-A 13/13), the book seems to be written or at least conceived to the greatest extent. The experienced author trio deals in detail with the apps iTunes (as a central purchasing and playback instrument), iPhoto (image editing and management) and iMovie (importing and creating videos) running under iOS and iPhone. As expected, this volume is also very clear and colourful (including color control system). The versions are quite short this time, but informative: even more attention is paid to the illustrative illustrations than otherwise, they dominate in number and size. In usual quantity there are the text boxes in colour. In view of the high density of the device, a good addition.
content.title_en: iTunes Store, iPhoto, iMovie for iPad & iPhone

content.text: City gardening : successful gardening without gardening. Practical guide on the possibilities of gardening without own gardening with instructions for growing vegetables and sweets, herbs and also ornamental plants on balcony and terrace. (2)
content.title_en: City Gardening : successful gardening without gardening

content.text: Generation Z : how it ticks, what changes it and why it contages us all. The non-fiction author (lastly "players without a regular place guarantee", ID-B 17/03), Professor of Business Administration, describes and analyses here with strong support of the editorship a new generation, that of the digital natives, after in the past years various other types of generations, such as Golf and Y, were widely discussed. Scholz' book offers a good start, is vivid with many examples, material and multifaceted, to the extent that the "Aha!" effect does not remain absent when reading - and yet empirically only little secure. But nevertheless, try to describe and argue with differentiated (even in the delimitation to the previous, already known generations) with a clear description. A book, which is guaranteed by great interest for interested parents, teachers, trainers, whereby the person and the factual register are very helpful at the end. Good equipment, reasonable price. With accompanying blog to the book on the net. Recommendable. (2)
content.title_en: Generation Z : how she ticks, what changes her and why she contages us all

content.text: AutoCAD 2015 and AutoCAD LT 2015 : the official training book. Introduction and training course on the current version of AutoCAD. With numerous exercises and references to the certification of AutoDesk. (LK/SH: Preisler) Industry-independent introductory course on the current version of AutoCAD (last ID-B 48/13). Published as an official training book by the manufacturer and aimed at beginners without CAD prior knowledge, but also at designers and planners in practice. Step-by-step instructions, learning goals and summaries as well as additional exercises with solutions facilitate self-study. With practical tips in the edgebar, continuously colored illustrations and graphics as well as download offers. In the annex important hints on the examination preparation for Autodesk certification. In addition to or before the extensive compendium of D. Ridder (ID-G 5/14) and the more expensive W. Sommer (last ID-B 50/12). S.a. the very comprehensive and expensive title of T. Flandera (ID-G 5/15). (2) (LK/SH: Preisler)
content.title_en: AutoCAD 2015 and AutoCAD LT 2015 : the official training book

content.text: Humanities and social sciences at the University of Tomorrow : Interior views and external perspectives. The humanities and social sciences have often been perceived as unmoveable in the context of current developments in recent years. Contrary to the often-named lack of usability, in view of current political crises, it can be observed that humanities and social sciences research produces socially relevant research results and thus demonstrates its suitability for improving human living conditions and for global progress. The present volume takes up the related question from both the science perspective and the external perspective of how humanities and social sciences at the University of Tomorrow must be designed to fulfil their diverse tasks and to exploit their potential.
content.title_en: Humanities and Social Sciences at the University of Tomorrow : Interiors and Perspectives

content.text: Al-Qaida and the global jihad: A comparative study of transnational terrorism. More than twelve years after the attacks of September 11, 2001, the transnational terrorism of Al-Qaida remains one of the biggest threats of the 21st century. Political scientist Peter Wichmann, who understands terrorism as a publicity and mobilization strategy, examines the similarities and differences in the manifestations of terrorism since the 19th century and analyses the development of Al-Qaida from its foundation in 1988 to the present. The author also documents the links between the Al-Qaida mother organization and its subsidiary organizations as well as the terrorist cells in the West, which, contrary to the popular thesis of the non-executive jihad network structures, have been shown.
content.title_en: Al-Qaeda and Global Jihad: A Comparative View of Transnational Terrorism

content.text: Calculation for engineers. Calculation calculates prices and price limits for products and services. It also provides valuable information for the economy, cost reduction and increase of productivity in all functions of the manufacturing process. Methods of calculation of the surcharge, calculation of machine hourly rates in production as well as calculation with cover contributions, process costs and calculation in trade are dealt with. The clear structuring allows the reader to meet his calculation requirements in practice immediately.
content.title_en: Calculation for engineers

content.text: Architecture and design meets psychiatry : and Alex meets Josef ; the Center for Mental Health in Rhein-Kreis Neuss. "In architecture and design psychiatry meets psychiatry is presented as an example at the Center for Mental Health in Neuss, inaugurated in autumn 2012, the successful triad of architecture, signalling and clinical and therapeutic practice for modern and contemporary psychiatry. - The publication is supplemented by twelve further examples of modern hospital architecture, which document the range of new projects for mental health."
content.title_en: Architecture and design meets psychiatry : and Alex meets Josef ; the Center for Mental Health in Rhein-Kreis Neuss

content.text: Migration and Integration Research : multidisciplinary perspectives ; a reader. Migration and integration research are addressed in many disciplines, but each deals with different perspectives, methods and theoretical concepts. The task of this book is to present these perspectives, methods and concepts in an overview and in comparison. It becomes clear that not one and self-contained migration and integration research is to be defined, but many different research approaches with specific perspectives of knowledge. The book, which has now been published in a second, revised and expanded edition, serves to introduce the topic and is aimed not only at students but also at a wider audience, who would like to comprehensively and thematically address migration and integration research.
content.title_en: Migration and Integration Research : multidisciplinary perspectives ; a reader

content.text: Dictionary of Biology: German-English, English-German. This dictionary of classical and modern life sciences now offers about 60,000 terms (most recently ID 21/09). The English access follows the American spelling, the German corresponds to the spelling reform. Generic and species names of plants and animals are excluded. The thematic summaries of a word field (clusterung) are of advantage. As a general 2-language dictionary on biology before more specialized dictionaries such as Cole: "Wörterbuch der Biotechnologie" (ID 21/09), after less extensive lexicons like "Langenscheidts Fachwortbuch Kompakt Biologie" with 40,000 terms (ID-G 37/00). - For students, scientists and translators. A purchase of the new edition, now in the encyclopedia format and 2-column set, is recommended only for public libraries at university locations, provided that none of the pre-presses (more) is available. (3 A)
content.title_en: Dictionary of Biology : German-English, English-German

content.text: The technical SEO and the technical SEO of the web site is important to the user. The user is still interested in the SEO (Search Engine Optimization) and the user is not interested in the website. For many companies it is vital to find a search on the first page of the Google results. The authors give many well-founded advice on the user- and at the same time google-friendly design of websites, but you can also find hints on other possibilities, such as the paid advertising with Adwords. Although the ranking methods of Google are business secret, often are changed and many evaluation factors (more than 200) contain, one can at least avoid many errors, which are certainly unfavorable. Clearly structured and in HTML code error-free web pages will benefit not only Google's Crawlers work, but also benefit the researching user. Web developers with prior knowledge, which terms or tools like Ajax, Canonical tag or robots.txt, will be familiar with the web page. Many tips are applicable to the use of other search engines, such as Bing, but has become applicable to the search engine usage.
content.title_en: Technical SEO : [with sustainable search engine optimization to success ; expert knowledge for website and shop operators, SEO and marketing professionals, web developers]

content.text: Urban life. Klappentext: The Beuth University of Technology bundles diverse disciplines under the competence cluster City of the Future. The Department III Civil Engineering and Geoinformationswesen contributes significantly to this focus in teaching and research, both with engineering content and methodological skills as well as with social science topics. In Volume 4 of the series Forum GeoBau, versatile contributions to the framework topic Urban Life - Urban Living are presented. The contributions were made from outstanding final papers by graduates or from research conducted in projects of the Beuth University and in cooperation with other universities or institutions.
content.title_en: Urban life

content.text: Introduction -- Geological pre-exploitation -- Assessment of the mountain/mountain and outburst classification -- Underground construction and its types of eruption -- Exploitation methods -- Exploitation by blasting -- Mechanical tunnelling by means of excavators, ripper machines and cutting machines (TSM) -- Safety measures -- Anticipation by means of shielding vaults -- Transport of the outburst material from the tunnel -- Temporary drainage and shut-off measures -- Industrialization of conventional tunnelling -- Performance determination and construction program of conventional tunnelling -- Permanent main sealing of tunnelling plants -- Tunnelling lining -- Types of tunnelling machines -- Tunnelling machines (TBM) -- Tunnelling by means of back-cutting technology -- Re-use of tunneling materials -- Shielding machinery -- Tübbing lining -- Control of advance pressing and placements as well as heading of tunnelling -- Construction of sub-exhausts - Management of tunnelling operations - Management of tunnelling operations - Safety operations
content.title_en: Construction processes and construction processes of tunnelling

content.text: Media Change Compact 2011-2013: Network Publications on Media Economy, Media Policy & Journalism. The volume takes up media change from an economic, political and journalistic perspective of the last three years. The contributions are taken from well-known web publications and take up a editorially filtered overview of the changes in the media landscape through digitalization, the Internet. The contributions are from well-known web publications/blogs and currently, strongly and analytically refer to the areas of media economy and society. The way to print online publications that has so far been unusual in scientific literature is equally an effect of media change and links online with offline world. The content of technology, society, market and politics in media change.- Expanding communication options.- Journalism in media change.- Media Economy in change.- Regulation in media change The target groups - lecturers and students of media-relevant science disciplines - media enterprises, journalism and politics The editor Christoph Kappes is an online manager in media companies and the founder of a digital publishing house.
content.title_en: Media Change Compact 2011-2013 : Net Publications on Media Economics, Media Politics & Journalism

content.text: Footbridges and bike paths : sample collection. Hanging rope bridges / Klaus Idelberger -- Scattered rope bridges and bar-clamped beam bridges / Klaus Idelberger -- Barnbridges / Klaus Idelberger -- Archbridges / Klaus Idelberger -- Buildings connecting bridges, for weather protection Housed / Klaus Idelberger -- Sources and Further Literature
content.title_en: Footbridges and bike paths : sample collection

content.text: Architecture and Crafts: Buildings of the Schmitz family of entrepreneurs 1864 – 2014. Ralf Schmitz's company, based in Kempen/Niederrhein, is able to celebrate an extraordinary anniversary in October 2014. It looks back on an equally moving and moving history of 150 years. Built up over five generations and continuously evolving with care, it was able to adapt to the different social challenges of the time and offer appropriate solutions for this purpose. - - This presentation is now looking for the development stages that shape the history of the company from the founding to the present and to make them vivid in word and image. In particular, the focus of the consideration focuses on the abundance of construction projects that have been planned or realized in the 150 years. This seems all the more important because there are countless treatises on the works of more or less magnificent architects, but only few who have dealt with the complex work of a construction company and thus make architectural creation comprehensible from a qualitatively different perspective.
content.title_en: Architecture and Crafts : Buildings of the Schmitz family of entrepreneurs 1864 – 2014

content.text: Modern architecture A-Z. Alphabetically ordered lexicon, which records 280 entries of architects, architectural offices and schools, currents and styles worldwide. The current first step comprises essentially the 20th century with its predecessors at the end of the 19th century. On at least one double page there are well readable articles and image material of high quality. The rather small-format work is solidly bound, in price-performance ratio not to beat and can be called as a small edition of the title of the same name by Peter Gössel (Bags, 2010; not discussed here). It should be borrowed clearly rather than the 2-volume and very heavy Gössel and fits well with "History of the modern architecture of the 20th century" (ID-A 47/13), which moves on the same level, and "Architects!" (ID-G 31/13), in which 200 architects and builders of the Renaissance are presented to this day scarcely. (1 A) StO Kunst klein
content.title_en: Modern architecture A-Z

content.text: Hieronymus Frog - fascinating experiments for children. Hieronymus Frog, ingenious inventor and title hero numerous pre- and first-read stories (lastly "Hieronymus Frog - On the hunt for the tomato frog"), originates from the drawing universe of A. Schmachtl and is besides "Tilda apple kernel" and "Juli dandelion" a pre-reading figure popular with primary and pre-school children. Thus, in this experimental book each experiment is integrated into a coherent pre-reading story. The covered topics range from water, light, air, weather, sound to magnetism, with often an environmental aspect in the center (including biogas, climate protection, sewage plant). The experiments themselves are well explained step by step and easily understandable with materials from the household. Partially, some parental help is necessary. Through the pre-reading stories this title can be used the many other experimental books (with the exception "Until the brew is boiling", resp. "The Experiment Lab for Children"). Woonymus Frog is not missing.
content.title_en: Hieronymus frog - fascinating experiments for children

content.text: The topic of the topic is: how to achieve the goals of the policy, how to achieve the goals of the policy, how to achieve the goals of the policy, how to achieve the goals of the policy, how to achieve the goals of the policy, how to achieve the goals of the policy, how to achieve the goals of the policy, how to achieve the goals of the policy, how to achieve the goals of the policy, how to achieve the goals of the policy, how to achieve the goals of the policy, how to achieve the goals of the policy, how to achieve the goals of the policy, how to achieve the goals of the policy.
content.title_en: Spatial effects of international migration

content.text: Steel-built road bridges according to Eurocode : Examples of testable stability certificates ; Design of a steel-based bar bridge according to Eurocode 0, 1 and 3 ; [New construction of the Wirtschaftswegbrücke Mühlenweg]. "This book presents the design of a steel-based road bridge using a practical example. The testable static calculation includes all the essential stability certificates of the superstructure of a bar bridge. The example is prepared in such a way that the reader can easily get involved in the new generation of standards of the Eurocodes."--
content.title_en: Steel-built road bridges according to Eurocode : examples of testable stability certificates ; design of a steel-based bar arch bridge according to Eurocode 0, 1 and 3 ; [New construction of the Wirtschaftswegbrücke Mühlenweg]

Full plate, single axis tensioned / German Concrete and Construction Club EV -- Point-shaped Supported plate / German Concrete and Construction Club EV -- Single-beamed finished part / German Concrete and Construction Club EV -- Doubt-driger Cross-beam with rack / German Concrete and Construction Club EV -- Plate bar ceiling with prefabricated plates and statics Acting surface concrete layer / German Concrete and Construction Club EV -- Pre-stressed roof binder / German Concrete and Construction Club EV -- High-rise internal support / German Concrete and Construction Club EV -- Panel bar ceiling with prefabricated plates and statics Acting surface concrete layer / German Concrete and Construction Club EV -- Pre-stressed roof binder / German Concrete and Construction Club EV -- High-rise internal support / German Concrete and Construction Club EV -- Panel bar ceiling - High-rise support / German Concrete and Construction Club EV -- Block foundation / German Concrete and Construction Club EV
content.title_en: Examples of design According to Eurocode 2

content.text: Movement technology : Design and design of mechanical gears; with ... 32 tables. Solving movement tasks is one of the basic tasks of the product developer, who has to design and construct motion systems of machines, equipment and devices in which work organs, tools, workpieces or processing material have to perform certain movements. In this book, all essential topics relevant to the development of movement systems are discussed. Here, special attention was paid to conveying the respective work steps in a vivid and practical manner using general, effective methods and procedures. Prof. Dr.-Ing. habil. Andreas Fricke is Professor of Mechatronic Designs at the University of Applied Sciences and Technology of Saarland. Prof. Dr.-Ing. Detlef Günzel represents the areas of design, CAE and simulation at the University of Applied Sciences Albstadt-Sigmaringen. Prof. Dr.-Ing. Thomas Schaeff is working in the laboratory for multi-body simulation at the University of Applied Sciences in Regensburg. All three authors are active members of the VDI and work with various VDI bodies.
content.title_en: Movement technique : Design and laying out of mechanical transmissions; with ... 32 tables

content.text: Dam. Since 2010, photographer Carsten Meier has been documenting dams in the USA and Europe. Fully embedded in the landscape, the utility buildings in their original aesthetics look like artificial mountain ranges. Their power makes them monuments of human will to form, whose questionability they demonstrate at the same time. Always photographed from the central perspective and in large format, the over 100 dams allow a visual typology of the architectures. Besides the Hoover Dam, Carsten Meier also photographed dams from cinema films, such as the Contra Dam (James Bond: Golden Eye) or the Edertalsperm (Dam Buster).
content.title_en: Dam

content.text: Building communities as urban development instruments: A possible contribution to sustainable district development. Hannes Müller shows in his study how new areas have been created, which are considered as model solutions for sustainable district development, taking into account the concept of building community in Freiburg and Tübingen. The concept of building community promises a great potential - not only for builders but also for the development of municipalities. The author examines what this new type of participatory building is about, how building communities can be used as urban development instruments and what potentials exist that have not yet been exhausted. The content Possible motives for the formation of building communities Development of the guiding principle of sustainable city ecological dimensions of districts Analysis of social dimensions The target groups lecturers and students of social sciences, especially urban planning, architecture, architectural sociology and related fields of study planners, architects, employees of municipalities, construction community members, actors in real estate development The author Hannes Müller conducts research at HCU Hamburg and FHNW Basel, among others on sustainability in urban development as well as on analogue and digital planning and planning processes for building communities and development
content.title_en: Building communities as an urban development tool : A possible contribution of sustainable urban development

content.text: The aim of the study is to examine the regulations laid down under the Energy Protection Act 1975, which, in the event of supply problems for mineral oil and petroleum products, can be used to reduce the potential for saving in the domestic oil market.The calculation of the efficiency of measures restricting consumption was carried out for the reference year 1992 and perspective for 2005. -- All measures of the so-called "light hand" provided by the legislator for the crisis were initially examined which savings potentials could be expected in case of isolated use, separately for the non-traffic sector (private households, small consumers, industry) and the transport sector (e.g. speed limits and driving bans). Subsequently, these measures were examined in simultanic use (in plausible combinations) for their quantitative effects. -- In a further step, the potential savings of rationing measures were estimated by means of "hard hand" to cover the vital needs of the fuel sector, where the use of fuel is not affected by the crisis.
content.title_en: Efficiency of measures to reduce consumption of petroleum supply disruptions

content.text: Evaluation of competitive support models: the regional programme for structurally weak rural areas in Schleswig-Holstein. Improving the efficiency of regional support programmes is an important element in ensuring economic development opportunities in disadvantaged regions with ever closer financial margins of the public sector. One way to increase efficiency is to turn away from fixed eligibility criteria and to turn towards the selection of promising regional competition support projects. One of the first and most concise examples of this type of competitive support models is the regional programme of the Land Schleswig-Holstein to improve infrastructure provision in rural areas. However, support programmes of this kind place high demands on the evaluation of projects. In this work, a comprehensive evaluation design for the ex-ante evaluation of the funding projects, monitoring and ex-post success control is developed for the specific case of the regional programme in Schleswig-Holstein. In addition, an initial interim evaluation of the funding results of the regional programme for the period 1994 to 1996 is carried out. The basis for the design of the evaluation design is the elaboration of the specific starting points of the support regions, the evaluation of possible evaluation and procedures and the presentation of the previous advisory programme in the regional context.
content.title_en: Evaluation of competitive support models: the regional programme for structurally weak rural areas in Schleswig-Holstein

content.text: Adam, Eve and the Serpent : The Theology of Sin. Elaine Pagels: "Adam, Eve and the Serpent". A Theology of Sin. German by Kurt Neff. Rowohlt, Hamburg 1991. 352 pp., geb., 44,- DM
content.title_en: Adam, Eve and the Serpent : The Theology of Sin

content.text: What Google really wants is how the world's most influential corporation is changing our future. From the publishing house text: Whether smartphone, internet search or navigation – Google is our gateway to the world. At the same time, Google is considered to be overpowering and insatiable. Especially in Germany, the company is struggling with image problems, now the EU wants to become active against it. But Google has begun to change. The corporate management firmly believes that the world can change by technology for the better, and is gradually transforming the company into a future machine. In the laboratories and research departments, self-propelled cars, quantum computers, cancer therapies and a drone delivery service are being worked out of the air. Google software will soon no longer control smartphones, but also cars, household appliances and even robots developed by itself. Satellites and balloons at the space border are supposed to provide the entire planet with Internet.
content.title_en: What Google really wants: how the world's most influential company changes our future

content.text: Against the times : Roman. In the early seventies, the mood of the country's rise is in Santiago de Chile: Socialist President Salvador Allende is determined to lead the country out of its economic dependence and to alleviate the plight of the poor population. He is relying on a bold project: The factories of the impervious Andean state are to be networked and controlled by a central computer. An international team, among them the young German industrial designer Hans Everding, is commissioned to build the data network. Hans is enthusiastic about taking the opportunity to participate in the revolution and fight for a more just society. The coup of the military is abruptly putting an end to this dream. All those who have worked on the network are in danger of life. Nobody knows who is a friend and who is an enemy and the collected data must not get into the wrong hands of any of the people.
content.title_en: Against time : Roman

content.text: Socrates : Apology of Plurality. Hannah Arendt thought throughout his life in the horizon Socrates'. In the American beginnings, she placed Plato's teacher at the centre of her attempts to establish a politically relevant and personally durable thinking for modernism. This lecture from the 1950s masterfully unfolds an apology of human plurality. Thus, Arendt opposes the Platonic temptation to confront the relativity of possible truths with the absolute authority of a pioneering approach to thinking. What is decisive for Arendt is the inner dialogue that Socrates philosophically initiated. In addition, she highlights the communication between citizens and friends, which in exchange of opinions can open up common perspectives of world design. In the memories »In Hannah Arendt's Seminar«, her last assistant Jerome Kohn reports how along Platonic texts the common thinking with the philosopher at the New School of Social Research has been shaped.
content.title_en: Socrates : Apology of Plurality

content.text: Handbook for university teaching digital: Guide for modern and media-friendly teaching. The future of teaching is now beginning. Digital university teaching no longer means only online registration for courses and download of powerpoint films. Digital university teaching can do much more: Whether teaching videos, differentiated online tests or even »massive open online courses« - the possibilities are almost limitless. It is time that a forward-looking institution like the university makes targeted use of and drives forward technological progress. Prof.?Dr. Jürgen Handke, thinker and accomplished protagonist of digital university teaching, shows how digitalization is
content.title_en: Handbook for Higher Education Digital: Guide to Modern and Media-Related Teaching

content.text: Biohacking : Genetic technology for all : Tools of the geneticists: biomaterial, devices and software for the processing of genes : practical examples and the future of genetic engineering. Biotechnology in the garage: Affordable laboratory equipment and automated experimental procedures make genetic engineering a civic science that also enables ambitious laymen to conduct professional experiments with the molecules of life. (2)
content.title_en: Biohacking : Genetic technology for all : Tools of the genetic engineers: biomaterial, devices and software for the processing of genes : practical examples and future of genetic engineering

content.text: Evolution : Learning at stations in biology lessons; [Secondary level I ; with copy templates]. The students deal with various tasks in free-lance with the topic of evolution. They learn to experiment in a targeted manner, to carefully log and to derive insights systematically.
content.title_en: Evolution : Learning at stations in biology ; [Secondary level I ; with copy templates]

content.text: Mathematical foundations of computer science : Mathematical thinking and evidence : an introduction. The introduction conveys typical and basic ways of thinking of computer science. Definitions and examples provide for visuality. Review (ekz): Almost unchanged reissue of an introduction to the basic mathematical thinking of computer science (last edition 4th 2009). The textbook is addressed to students of computer science and related departments in the early semesters. In the first part, the term world of the statement logic, the theory of quantity and the meaning of mathematical proofs are dealt with. In the second part, the topic is about proof techniques, and applications from stochastics are also used. In the third part, discrete structures are discussed and the chapter on the statement logic takes up concepts from the beginning of the book again to deal with them at a higher mathematical level. This 6th edition was supplemented by a symbol list and some errors and inconsistencies have been corrected. (3)
content.title_en: Mathematical foundations of computer science : Mathematical thinking and proof : an introduction

content.text: Bunkers are planning to revive the use of the German inner cities? Covered by painting or placement, these relics of the last war hardly play a role in the perception of the city. There are still around hundreds of these high bunkers nationwide, which are still relevant building blocks in the structure of our cities. - - It is also important - in the sense of a sustainable urban development - to deal more intensively with this architectural resource: How can building-friendly, innovative use concepts be developed? Based on already done or planned conversions, this publication from a research project of the Federal Institute for Real Estate Tasks and the Technical University of Dortmund presents possible means and methods and thus gives architects, builders and investors an extensive toolbox for the construction-constructive handling of high bunkers to the hand "high bunkers in German inner cities? Covered by painting or placement, these relics of the last war are hardly yet a role in the perception of the city.
content.title_en: Revitalize bunkers

content.text: International trends in national tax systems - from direct to indirect taxation?. The study provides an overview of trends in the tax systems of selected OECD countries over the past decades. The quantitative development is illustrated by various OECD statistics. Country chapters trace tax policy and develop their concepts and motivations. Furthermore, theoretical discussions are included as well as hypotheses on the prospects of future tax policy. Since the 1980s, there has been a slight shift in the burden of indirect taxation in various European countries. However, a systematic erosion of direct taxes cannot be seen. The reforms of recent years have mostly been aimed at making the burden more economically neutral and increasing the incentive to benefit. The tax rates have been reduced and the tax bases have widened, as lastly in Germany. There is no basic theoretical or empirical evidence that changes in the ratio between direct to indirect taxes or from income to excise duties have significant effects on economic development. Overall, there is much to be said that direct taxes will also occupy an important place in the tax system in the future.
content.title_en: International trends in national tax systems - from direct to indirect taxation?

content.text: Public private partnership as a new regulatory model between public authorities and companies. Public private partnership (PPP) is becoming more important in Germany, and the creation of PPP institutions at federal and national level, standardisation approaches, guidelines, specialist conferences and publications are currently being considered.However, it is still not certain whether innovative forms of cooperation between public and private actors at local, regional and national level are facing the "transitional" stage in a wide range of tasks and policy areas.The exploration of PPP practices in the municipalities, which the study focuses on, has only taken place in a rudimentary manner.The aspect of practical dissemination of PPP projects in large cities has attracted attention, in particular, because they play a pioneering role in a previously neglected field of investigation, which is an analytical approach, the new regulatory model, as it is also presented between public private partnerships, is also the focus of these new forms of cooperation.
content.title_en: Public private partnership as a novel regulatory model between public authorities and companies

content.text: Challenge of offshoring: Internationalization and outsourcing of IT services. If Siemens or SAP, IBM or T-Systems software are developed in India, this is an example of offshoring. Above all, there is a lively controversy about the consequences for employment in Germany, which is being aggressively pursued by companies and business consultants. The debate is about the relocation of tens of thousands of highly qualified IT jobs and the future of the IT site in Germany as a whole. This study shows that offshoring is an expression of a deeper trend: a new boost in industrialization and internationalization now also captures complex services in the IT field. Boes and Schwemmle offer tangible up-to-date material on IT company strategies, the state of offshoring development and the reactions of the unions. And they dare a first empirically justified assessment, which is to hold from the gloomy forecasts, where the journey could go and what the challenges for the IT companies are, the state of offshoring and the reactions of the unions. And they dare to build a first empirically justified assessment, which is to keep the glood strategy of shifting, the jobs.
content.title_en: Challenge Offshoring : Internationalization and outsourcing of IT services

content.text: Cinema of the lie. »This is not blood, that is only red color« (Jean-Luc Godard) Cinema is a world of illusions. But when does it become a lie? 24 times a second? The essay collection traces the lie in cinema by means of exemplary analyzed films of different genres. The films Blow Up, Der Clou, Rashomon, Der Kontrakt des Zeichners, Das Leben ein Pfeifer, Schwarze Katze, weißer Kater, eXistenZ and Lost Highway are examined in an intercultural way both in terms of content and media reflexively towards the aspects of lies, deception and manipulation. The contributors work out the tension of the lie in cinema: they are concerned with lying in film as well as with the specific aesthetic lies of the film.
content.title_en: Cinema of the Lie

content.text: The City of Modernism: Strategies for conservation and planning. How can city-building testimonies of the 20th century be preserved in the present and in the future as a "living-in-life whole"? How should the preservation of monuments be handled with the modern city? Nine case studies on European cities, ensembles and settlements illustrate the difficult balance between preservation and design. The contributions come from historians, representatives from the fields of construction research and inventory, practical conservationists, architects and urban planners. - - What criteria play a role in the foundation of monuments? In addition to physical tradition, urban spatial concepts - the urban design guiding idea, the essential content of the city map or a deliberately desired flexibility in the use - gain increasing importance. - How can the testimonial value be preserved if urban policy decisions, economic, social or demographic developments are to be taken into account for the historical work? Any approach to the modern city requires a holistic consideration beyond the limits of the discipline of preservation of monuments. - - In addition to the impressive abundance of new building materials and working techniques, the new scale of urban construction of the 20th century presents the challenge of the preservation of monuments in the 20th century?
content.title_en: The City of Modernism : Strategies for Conservation and Planning

content.text: (De) Standardisation of educational processes and structures: new perspectives on educational inequality. Scientific and educational discourses have been characterised by contrasts for some time now, which move in the field of tension between increasing standardisation and destandardization. These dynamics, which are characteristic in particular of education systems and institutions, are embedded in an increasing pluralisation of individual educational biographies. The present collection asks about the effects of these processes on the reproduction and transformation of social educational inequality. The tension field of standardization and destandardization is taken into account from macro-, meso- and microanalytic perspectives as well as in various fields of education: Interested are overarching dynamics at the level of educational structures and educational processes. The content - the concept of social inequality - current developments of educational processes and structures - (de-) standardization tendencies in the fields: early childhood education, school, university The target groups are academics in the fields of sociology, education, cultural and political science.
content.title_en: (De) Standardisation of educational patterns and structures : new perspectives on educational inequality

content.text: Rare earth metals: Lanthanoids and third subgroup: A journey through the periodic table. Hermann Sicius is brief in bringing all important information about an important class of metallic raw materials to the reader. The altogether eighteen metals of the lanthanoids (rare earth metals) and the third subgroup are only known to a small part of the public, but of great importance for many future technologies. Are connections of the gadolinium in radar screens and Holmium in high-performance magnets indispensable? Which substances are mentioned here at all? As the main occurrences of these elements are located in China, the search for new deposits in Europe as well as for more effective production and recovery methods is intensified. What possibilities does the industry have to win the race against time? The author describes the current situation and gives an outlook into the future. The content of history, occurrence and production (segregation) of rare earth metals in Europe is intensified as well as the search for more effective production and recovery methods. What opportunities does the industry have to win the race against time? The author describes the current situation and gives an outlook to the students of chemistry and the raw materials professionals. The author has also been working for the United States since Hermann.
content.title_en: Rare earth metals: Lanthanides and third subgroup : A journey through the periodic table

content.text: The implementation of the new rules is described in the following examples: Zero-error management: Implementation of Six Sigma. Many concepts for increasing effectiveness and productivity focus on restructuring and accelerating processes. Zero-error management is one of the most frequently mentioned concepts in this context. The thinking and acting of all employees is oriented towards sustainably eliminating and learning from mistakes made. Six Sigma as a methodology, program and attitude is an essential building block to successfully transfer this sustainable management approach to operational practice. -- The book provides a practical guide to the implementation of Six Sigma. Using a "Six Sigma Roadmap", which is based on the project phases DEFINE, MEASURE, ANALYZE, IMPROVE and CONTROL, the approach to implementing improvement projects is presented. Also, the design for Six Sigma (DFSS) and its integration into the product development process are discussed in the form of a "Six Sigma" . The execution of DFSS projects is also explained in the form of a new version of the new rules.
content.title_en: Zero Error Management : Implementation of Six Sigma
