content.title_en: Manufacturing technology for industrial engineers

content.text: The company is a family-run company, which is a classic example of a medium-sized »hidden champion«. It was already 150 years ago that Mahr's apprenticeships in workshops and factory halls were used in the early days of the founding years. The Göttingen group of companies with locations on several continents has long since exported precision meters to all the world. Its products themselves are inconspicuous, but with their performance they influence the optimization processes of the industry and thus the everyday life of the people. Mahr stands for the path from millimeter to nanometer, from the work bench to clean room and from courageous founder to innovative high-tech partner. At the beginning Carl Mahr stands with his business since 1861, he supplies fine mechanics, and forest offices, factories and railway companies with measuring instruments. His son Oscar Mahr opens the way to exchangeable production by means of border teaching, which enables modern mass production - driven by the armament industry, as this book accurately describes. Members of the family Mahr are an exciting member of the company through post-war and boom.
content.title_en: Fairs with Mahr : History of a family business since 1861

content.text: Excel in controlling: the most important methods for efficient reporting. For efficient use of Excel in controlling - Management and controlling make daily decisions based on data compiled from different sources in the context of company reporting. Excel is often the preferred tool for data analysis and visualization - but due to time pressure and un-systematic knowledge, it is not used efficiently. -- If controlling uses more time to collect, clean and process data instead of analysis, there is clear potential for improvement in the use of Excel in everyday practice. The creation of greater efficiency and effectiveness in using Excel in controlling are the main objectives of this book. It conveys the Excel knowledge required for reporting (without VBA programming) case-oriented and with the help of numerous illustrations as well as hints and tips. -- About the author: Dipl.-Kfm. Daniel Unrein is controller in a listed technology company. He is also the author of numerous contributions in the areas of controlling and international accounting and since 2011 author of a highly respected application of Excel's balance sheet, Excel's reporting series and control management.
content.title_en: Excel in controlling : the most important methods for efficient reporting

content.text: Psychology in environmental protection : Handbook for the promotion of sustainable action. Whether we feed ourselves vegetarianally, ride a bicycle or build a solar system: We continue to make decisions in the sense of the environment - or not. What guides and motivates us in this process researches environmental psychology. The Handbook of Psychology in environmental protection explains with the help of a psychological model how we can better understand and promote sustainable action. As the first German-language work it summarizes the knowledge of applied environmental psychology scientifically and practically. Important topics such as self-efficacy, social norms and emotions each receive a separate chapter. Key questions and everyday examples enable direct application in environmental protection. The handbook is aimed at all those who want to make their environmental projects and their communication more effective - be it in the educational field, in urban gardening, in environmental activism or in work for environmental organizations
content.title_en: Psychology in environmental protection : Handbook on the promotion of sustainable action

content.text: The new edition of this classic of the training of journalists, which can already look back on a 33-year history of publication, does not simply continue the preliminary edition (last edition, 7th edition, 2004), but is equivalent to a complete reworking. Haller, renowned journalist and media scientist and today head of journalism research at the Hamburg Media School (HMS), wants to understand his manual about one of the central journalistic activities as a basic book, which is aimed at all those who want to "know, understand and handle" the connection between theory and practice of research. The book, which is divided into three equivalent parts, first gives an overview of the history of researching before the second part presents the different research procedures in professional practice. Finally, the final part deals with the handling of sources and informants and with the evaluation of information. The preliminary editions, if still available, should be replaced. (2)
content.title_en: Methodological research

content.text: Gardens of mindfulness : Design and enjoy places of peace. A book of pictures with suggestions for creating personal places of well-being in the garden as meditative oases. Review: The trendy title of this book addresses above all people who are open to esotericism and similar directions. The author wants to give suggestions for creating very personal places of well-being in the garden, "places of mindfulness". Atmospheric, matte photos show examples of such meditative oases and invite you to browse through the picture book. The concise text accompanies the photos in flowery language, but gives little garden information. Anyone who seeks simple design suggestions for the establishment of a private oasis of peace and harmony in his garden will surely find some suitable examples in this book of pictures. Otherwise, this visually appealing book is rather medium-sized. It is actually a typical "gift book": Quite nice, but not necessarily necessary!
content.title_en: Gardens of Mindfulness : Design and Enjoy places of peace

content.text: The Action Book for Maker: Movement, Light and Sound with Arduino and Raspberry Pi - Experiments and Projects. Maker books from dpunkt publishing house are books for model makers that can be realized using the simplest means (e.g. the physical computing platform Arduino or the Linux-based single-platinum minicomputer Raspberry-Pi). A good example is a book by the author that shows the reconstruction of the world after a zombie apocalypse. Also this book is dedicated to the two very inexpensive computer tools. It starts with an explanation of the differences between the two platforms and the basics of electronics and then shows based on projects from the areas of movement, light and sound (watering plants, beverage cooling with self-built thermostats, doll dancing party, ...), how these projects are realized in a control-wise way. Working with solder-free plug boards allows easy entry. Many colored illustrations, tabular overviews and graphically highlighted references. Very helpful also from electronic reference sources of reference to pins and references to components are also electronic reference sources of reference for makers.
content.title_en: The Action Book for Maker : Movement, Light and Sound with Arduino and Raspberry Pi - Experiments and Projects

content.text: The reality that is not as it seems: a journey into the world of quantum gravitation. From the atomic theory of the ancient Greeks to relativity theory and quantum mechanics to the theory of quantum gravitation, which the author has co-developed. (2)
content.title_en: The reality that is not as it seems : a journey into the world of quantum gravitation

content.text: The intelligence of evolution: when humans and computers merge. Kurzweil is an expert in artificial intelligence, has received numerous awards and has been the head of technical development at Google since 2012. The present book is a paperback edition of a title, which was published in 1999 in the USA as well as in a German-language edition by Kiepenheuer & Witsch. The original content, consisting of 3 parts as well as prologue and epilogue, is unchanged. Only a preface by Ranga Yogeshwar is added. The topics of artificial intelligence, superintelligence, nanotechnology, neurotechnology and quantum mechanics are dealt with. Part 3 dares an outlook on the years 2009, 2019, 2029 and 2099. From today's point of view, the once bold visions do not seem to us to be so speculative. The development line shown towards the prophesied fusion of man and machine at the end of the 21st century is concrete. Despite the missed time, a book worth reading, which still holds enough material for thinking about our future.
content.title_en: The Intelligence of Evolution: When Man and Computer Merge

content.text: Lieselott Herforth : the first rector of a German university. Lieselott Herforth (1916-2010) was the first German university rector (TU Dresden) from 1965-1968 - and as a physicist successfully in a male domain. In Berlin, Leipzig, Merseburg and Dresden she dealt among other things with radioactive isotopes and
content.title_en: Lieselott Herforth: the first Rector of a German University

content.text: Manual Monument protection and preservation of monuments: Legal, technical principles, procedures, financing. The manual ... - covers all relevant listed and listed areas of work in a comprehensive and clear manner. Lists with legal foundations, examples from the historical practice, important links and much more increase the practical use of the work. - The 4th edition ... - appears fundamentally updated and re-designed. The legal tasks and problems of the preservation of monuments are in the foreground without neglecting the technical questions important for the practice of the preservation of monuments, such as conservation and restoration, the acquisition of monuments and the mediation of monuments. - Current focus of the new edition are the economic imputability as well as the fields of tension between monument protection and the production of renewable energies as well as accessibility. The international and European legal bases as well as the regulations of other European states are presented in more comprehensive than hitherto. Also included is a brief presentation of the essential regulations of the new cultural property protection law. - Issued by ... - Dr. Dimitrij Davydov, Landesamt für Denkmalpflege Hessen, Wiesbaden, and Dr. Jörg Spennemann, Landesanwaltschaft Bayern, Munich. The author'steam was designated for research, Dekte, Dek, Dekmal und Dekte, Dekte, Dekte, Dekte, Dekte, Dektionenmal und Bewerträunstächtung, Dektionen, Dek.
content.title_en: Manual on the conservation of monuments and monuments : law, technical principles, procedures, financing

content.text: Come with us, let's play math! : a Zahlenland action book. G. Friedrich wants to playfully convey mathematics for kindergarten children with this stimulating practical book. He also aims to link math with joy and everyday relevance. He refers to the holistic concept "Come with the Number Country" (last ID-B 27/11), where numbers appear personified, have a fixed geometrically represented place of residence (e.g. the 4 lives in a square) and with which diverse actions (games, songs, verses, movement, sounds and sounds) are carried out. In 10 learning units children with all senses of number space 1 to 10 as well as geometry and order are brought to the attention. The proven successful concept is now used in many day care centers, accordingly the demand for preschool teachers is likely to be great. (2S)
content.title_en: Come on, let's play math! : a Numeral Action Book

content.text: Statistical data analysis with SPSS: an application-oriented introduction to the basic system and the Exact Test module. This book provides beginners with easy access to SPSS and serves experienced users (even earlier program versions) as an excellent reference work. The use of the book is largely possible without any mathematical prior knowledge. Methods and their application with SPSS are explained clearly by examples from the practice. On the book's website all data sets, supplementary texts, exercise tasks with their solutions and further information are available. The 9th edition of this book is based on IBM SPSS Statistics 24 (Base and Exact Tests). Several chapters have been revised as part of the reprint. In addition, chapters on new statistical procedures and an overview chapter on significance tests are added: the latter makes it easier for the SPSS user to choose the correct one for his task from the multitude of tests available in SPSS.
content.title_en: Statistical data analysis with SPSS: an application-oriented introduction to the basic system and the Exact Tests module

content.text: Catalan and Occitan Renaissance: a comparison from 1800 to today. There is no recent comparison of the course of the Renaissance movements of the Catalan and Occitan. These two groups have a special significance for the consideration of minority research in Europe. This historical comparison is done here from the perspective of the periphery, but with embedding in the history of the two (mainly) affected states. The beginnings of the movements are chosen as the cornerstones, the representation extends to the present. It is intended to show how it can come from similar starting conditions to very different developments. The volume understands itself as exemplary and should open up possibilities for comparison with other dominating language groups. It should therefore be of interest to Romanists, especially Catalanists and occitans, linguists and literary scholars and specialists in the field of national sciences, but also to all those who deal with minorities and linguistic renaissance movements.
content.title_en: Catalan and Occitan Renaissance : a comparison from 1800 to today

content.text: The book offers practical explanations on the basics (selection of the correct measurement method and instrument, evaluation of the measurement result, determination and documentation of measurement accuracy or deviations from normal etc.), for students and practitioners. Review: The author (also known from numerous publications on various topics: 2012 but without overlaps to the present title) offers practical explanations on the basics (selection of the correct measurement method and instrument, evaluation of the measurement result, determination and documentation of measurement accuracy, deviations from normal etc.). Complex processes or formulas are explained briefly and intelligibly without simplifying them. The guide is aimed at skilled workers, master, technician, engineers and is suitable for the trainees and students for exam preparation, even if there are no questions/tasks, exercises etc. with associated solutions.
content.title_en: Measurement technology in practice

content.text: The excellently equipped picture book impresses with its complex, partly multifunctional designs on the subject of visual protection. In addition to walls, fences and hedges, visual protection elements made of glass, plastic or concrete are also used. Review: With its text-image-books, the publisher repeatedly presents new unusual ideas for modern garden design. Thus also on the topic of visual protection (H. Modeste: 2007; "Sichtschutz im Garten", 2011). This book by the renowned garden journalist Legoda impresses with the complex, partly multifunctional designs of international landscape architects and garden designers. For the average-earning garden owner such concepts are certainly not 1:1 implementable, but they convey quite well how spaces can be structured and special accents set. In addition to walls, fences and hedges, visual protection elements from glass, plastic or concrete are also used. The designs show in impressive colour photos gardens in England, USA, Germany and other European countries. A practical guide with easy-to-use ideas is B. Faschingbauer (2014)
content.title_en: Visibility protection and room divider in the garden

content.text: SPSS 24 for Dummies. A loose and reliable guide to the use of the slightly extended new version of the software system created for statistical calculations. Review: After the last "SPSS 20 for ..." (2012) and "SPSS 22 for ..." (2014) a further introduction of the relevantly designated author to the new version of the software system, which is now very common for calculations within the framework of statistics. Possible extensions or additions are not easily visible. Furthermore, "Of course, this loose and yet reliable guide, which requires little computer experience or mathematical knowledge, can be recommended to anyone who has to do with statistical calculations" (Wolfgang Grölz)
content.title_en: SPSS 24 for dummies

content.text: Sustainable tourism: Introduction. Sustainable tourism in balance with nature and society. Since the 1980s, tourism has been seeking new ways to reconcile regional economic development with environmental and nature conservation, fair working conditions and the appreciation of culture. Today, many tourism destinations and companies are already focusing on sustainable development. Sustainable development goals identify sustainable tourism as an option for development. The second edition of the successful textbook presents the basic principles and practical approaches for sustainable tourism. It addresses responsible corporate governance, sustainable destination management, tourism policy and the role of critical consumers. It also discusses the challenges of climate change, nature conservation and social sustainability. (Verlagstext)
content.title_en: Sustainable tourism : Introduction

content.text: Network hacking: professional attack and defense techniques against hackers and data thieves: tools for attack and defense: from keylogger to rootkit, Edward Snowden, Prism, Tempora & Co.: lessons from the NSA affair, effective protection for private and corporate networks. The 5 years since the third edition appeared are a long time on the topic discussed here. Much of what has been in focus today was not known or little (Edward Snowden/NSA) at the time or did not play such a big role ("Internet of Things", self-driving cars). In the foreword is exactly what caused the uproar a few weeks ago: blackmailing by an encryption virus like "WannaCry", which apparently discovered and used hidden security gaps in secret services. All those who work or privately with the assurance of computers and entire networks can find herein comprehensible and with screenshots information on the tools and attack strategies of hackers and the corresponding countermeasures can be eliminated as a means of replication.
content.title_en: Network Hacking : professional attack and defense techniques against hackers and data thieves : tools for attack and defense: from keylogger to rootkit, Edward Snowden, Prism, Tempora & Co. : Lessons from the NSA affair, effective protection for private and corporate networks

content.text: Drawing in garden design. Comprehensive guide to gardening and landscaping, which conveys the basic drawing techniques for the presentation of plans, layouts, views and cuts to spatial garden images. Review :The author studied landscape design in the USA and made a name for himself through drawing seminars for the professional fields garden design, gardening and landscaping as well as landscape architecture. This comprehensive guide is a practical drawing course that provides the drawing basics for the presentation of plans, floor plans, views and cuts to spatial garden images. The use of the right materials and the application of the appropriate tools are explained in detail. Easy exercises are available to draw lines, surface representations and coloration. The book is well structured didactically, so that it makes it easier for beginners to get started and provides already more experienced drafters with many useful tips. Not only helpful for garden planners, but also for anyone who wants to draw perspective. The print edition is complemented by a constantly updated website.
content.title_en: Drawing in the garden design

content.text: According to Onkalo: Roman. They feel like heizers on an e-loc: they are still driving along, but they are no longer needed. In the depopulated hinterland of Mecklenburg, a few of the leftovers from the GDR vegetate and watch how everything ends: the pigeon breeding, the weather monitoring, the nuclear waste disposal. "First you have no teeth, then they fall out of you. Between that you bite constantly on granite" (place 4-5 of the SWR Best List of March 2017). "Kerstin Preiwuß uses to tell Matuschek's story, a language in which the Matuscheks talk when they come into the story: very simple sentences, rarely a metaphor, hardly a linguistically remarkable twist. You can't tell the novel that the desire to read comes. You don't want to imagine much of what the author describes, and yet know that it is everyday what she speaks about. Matuschek stumbles like a modern Woyzeck through life. Onkalo's life offers 100,000 on the Internet.
content.title_en: After Onkalo : Roman

content.text: Swift 3 in detail : Introduction and language reference. Swift is an object-oriented programming language developed by Apple that is important for programming iOS apps. Swift 3 is the current version that is no longer compatible with previous Swiftderrivaten sourcecode. The predecessor volume, which is therefore urgently to be exchanged, is hardly comparable to the completely revised title. In this book, the author presents Swift as a language for app development based on the integrated development environment XCode. Many examples are also used to refer to Objective-C, if this is advantageous. The introduction and the basics are now more intensively presented than in the first edition. With a more detailed breakdown of the chapters and a new structure with 100 pages more content, an appropriate price increase of 6 euros was taken over. The good didactical preparation, which is still based on the playgrounds available by Apple at Xcode, was continued. According to Michael Kofler: "Swift 3" and "Developing apps for iOS 10 professionally" by Thomas Sillmann
content.title_en: Swift 3 in detail : Introduction and language reference

content.text: Digital disruption: how you prepare your company for the digital age. Disruption is "creative destruction." Old things are destroyed, new things – better things or something – are emerging. Digital transformation is radically and comprehensively changing markets and companies. Many of these changes are disruptive and destroy existing and functioning things. But there is also something new. It has never been so easy to develop a great idea to start a business and conquer the whole world as a potential market. However, the dangers of being pushed by new, disruptive business models and competitors have never been so great. This book is dedicated to digital transformation. It shows patterns and answers the following questions:- What are the risks, but also what are the opportunities, for companies?- How does digitalisation change the business logic of a company?- How can companies master digital transformation?
content.title_en: Digital Disruption: how to prepare your company for the digital age

content.text: Automation and exploitation : what will become of work in digital capitalism?. The machine as an enemy - transparency for whom? - Semi-automatics - rationalization with artificial intelligence - Smart computers, stupid workers? From handling machines - The rise of platforms (... Sharing Economy) - The mechanization of interaction - Agricultural industry 4.0, rationalization without sense and mind
content.title_en: Automation and exploitation: what will happen to work in digital capitalism?

content.text: Inclusive didactics in practice: examples of successful schools. This book follows Kersten Reich's »Inclusive didactics« (Beltz 2014). The ten building blocks presented there for the inclusive school are explained in detail and tested for their practical suitability. Using the example of nine schools that have won numerous prizes (including the German school prize, Jakob Muth Prize), the authors show how inclusion can be implemented as a programme - in all obstacles - in school practice. The contributions come from the following schools: - Rosenmaarschule, Köln - Primus-Schule Berg Fidel 1-10, Münster - Georg-Christoph-Lichtenberg-Gesamtschule, Göttingen-Geismar - Neue Schule Wolfsburg - Max-Brauer-Schule, Hamburg - Helios Schule, Cologne - Albrecht-Ernst- Gymnasium, Oettien - Geschwister-Scholll-Gymnasium, Pulheim - Landesförderzentrum Sehen, Schleswig (LFS) The ten building blocks for an inclusive didactics are: - Relationships and Teams - Behörungsgebildunggerechtliche Reguistung - Bewertung - Geschung - Geschwindigkeitsssssssgebunggebung
content.title_en: Inclusive didactics in practice : examples of successful schools

content.text: Europe's mosques are an open and open-minded introduction to Islamic architecture over the last decades, combining historical and architectural perspectives of Islam with an open view of different countries. The examples discussed are therefore not only from countries in Central Europe such as France, Germany, England, Italy, Denmark, Spain and the Netherlands. In detail, developments in the Balkans and Turkey are also appreciated and compared with the emerging tendencies in the Islamic world. The spread of mosques in the world and the aesthetic reaction to various cultures, regions and people have changed the forms of Islamic architecture over the centuries and have always adapted them to local needs and traditions. 'Europe's mosques' is a book on architecture and society, politics and form, on representation and symbolism. It presents projects and protagonists, discourses and contexts and also calls for participation. The new European mosques show in an unequivocal way that not only architecture but society is in a state of departure.
content.title_en: Europe's mosques : Islamic architecture in the beginning

content.text: Library pedagogical work : Basics for staff in (school) libraries. The author is a librarian and works in the library centre Schleswig-Holstein. Her hand-out was developed from a lecture at the HAW Hamburg on the topic complex school library and teaching library. The material is divided into basic conditions of library pedagogical work (including concept and position papers, school law), curricular basics (educational standards, curricula, concept of the "spiral curriculum") as well as their conceptual concretization and implementation in school practice. The sub-chapters are preceded by learning objectives, the material mediation is compact and practical. For example, important points are summarized in keywords and tables, and there are many checklists and current literature tips. As library expertise is required, teachers or pedagogical specialists are less questioned as a target group.
content.title_en: Library pedagogical work : Basics for staff in (school) libraries

content.text: Data protection : Introduction to technical data protection, data protection law and applied cryptography. With increasing importance of data processing in economic areas and the "by-pass" recording when using electronic everyday devices, the protection of personal data against misuse is becoming increasingly important. This topic has been discussed so far by J. Schneider (priority EU data protection regulation) and J. Haverkamp (mainly addressed to works councils and staff councils). Legal bases in general commented M. Helfrich. The book here focuses on technical measures for the protection of personal data on the Internet. Very well addressed here is the self-protection of own data by the user and on various cryptological methods. The practical relevance of the book is shown in topics such as anonymous payment, WhatsApp and electronic identification documents. Many illustrations. Each chapter begins with a summary and graphically highlighted learning objectives. At the end of the chapter, the reader finds a conclusion, exercise tasks (without solutions) and literature information
content.title_en: Data protection : Introduction to technical data protection, data protection law and applied cryptography

content.text: Inside Islam : what is being preached in Germany's mosques. Millions of Muslims live among us, but we know almost nothing about them. How many Muslims are there in Germany and how and where do they pursue their faith? Constantin Schreiber has made a search for this and provides the first German mosque report: Where are there mosques and what are preaching imams everywhere during Friday prayers? How is Germany talked about when there is no camera and one feels unobserved? Schreiber researches in a reality that is incomprehensible to many as never before in our society.
content.title_en: Inside Islam : what is being preached in Germany's mosques

content.text: Schinkel or The Economy of the Aesthetic. As much as Schinkel's literature is branched out, a reading has been asserting itself as decisive since the 19th century: the story of the genius, which alone wants to be an artist in the service of good, beautiful and true. Instead, it should be pointed out here first of all, how Schinkel soon had to experience the reaction that was again tonal in Prussia and the disillusionment of the reform officialism also affected him, especially in the knowledge of the then transformation from splendor to economy.0In the discussion about the consequences of this paradigm shift in aesthetics Schinkel clearly took up his position and consistently took account of the break that was founded in a systematic mathematization. Under the impression of his journey to England and the buildings built in the aftermath or plans, it becomes clear how an autonomous aesthetic of the public building system opens up to him. Thus, the irreversibility of his architecture is not in what his work recalls, but in what it anticipates; so it was not surprising that Schinkel's work was for the first time, and that Schingel's work was not a work, or the work was a work.
content.title_en: Schinkel or The Economy of Aesthetic

content.text: Illness as a symbol : Manual of Psychosomatics and Integral Medicine : Symptoms, interpretation, treatment, redemption. Understanding disease symptoms is the definition of the meaning of a disease. Ruediger Dahlke helps us to interpret the message of a disease with the standard work "Sickness as a symbol". In his comprehensive reference work "Sickness as a symbol" Ruediger Dahlke realizes a central concern of his medical - therapeutic work. This symbol - lexicon of disease images can become the ideal reference work for those who are willing to learn from their disease pictures. The secrets behind small, serious to threatening diseases are systematically revealed from A to Z and their core statements, messages and learning tasks are unfolded in keywords before the user. Thus, "illness as a symbol" can become an opportunity to grow in its coping with them. Even if it may be unpleasant in the short term and almost always costs overcoming it to be enlightened about the symptoms of their own learning tasks, it is nevertheless rewarding and liberating over the masses. In total, over 400 people have found the answer to the problem.
content.title_en: Disease as symbol : Manual of Psychosomatics and Integral Medicine : Symptoms, Interpretation, Processing, Redemption

content.text: Newspaper letters and letter newspapers or the beginnings of the newspaper: Richard Grasshoff (1877), Georg Steinhausen (1895), Karl Bücher (1893) and Adolf Koch (1910). In the last quarter of the 19th century, scientists began to take an interest in the written newspapers. Richard Grasshoff first entered the new territory with a historical dissertation on the letter newspaper circle around Melanchthon.He was followed by the national economist Karl Bücher and the cultural historian Georg Steinhausen.The volume presents these three studies completely and adds a summary of the newspaper founder Adolf Koch, who had been forgotten for more than a hundred years. Thus, the volume gives a closed overview of the state of discussion and knowledge about the beginnings of the newspaper, as it had been achieved at the beginning of the 20th century.
content.title_en: Newspaper letters and letter-papers or the beginnings of the newspaper: Richard Grasshoff (1877), Georg Steinhausen (1895), Karl Bücher (1893) and Adolf Koch (1910)

content.text: No one learns digitally: about the meaningful use of new media in teaching. The IT industry has been on the agenda for many years as a business sector. Business associations and IT representatives demand unisono to teach digital technology and programming languages already in primary school so that the students are prepared for the digital future. The use of digital media in teaching is still questionable. Ralf Lankau exposes in this book the economic interests of the IT industry and its lobbyists. He addresses both the scientific foundations (cybernetics, behaviorism) and the technical framework conditions of networks and cloud computing before sketching out concrete proposals for a reflective and responsible use of digital technology in teaching. The author's thesis is: We have to remember our educational task and (digital) media again as what they are in structured classrooms: didactic aids. (publisher text)
content.title_en: No one learns digitally: about the meaningful use of new media in teaching

content.text: Performance-Optimization for SAP BW: SAP Business Warehouse is busy with or without SAP HANA. Do you know this too? The speed of your Data Warehouse system is decreasing continuously – what was actually meant to be easier to work is increasingly dissatisfaction. With this book you will learn which different factors can be responsible for slowing down your reporting and thus the essential basis of your business intelligence. The author of the book conveys from his long-standing consulting experience an overarching understanding of processes and SAP objects and their influence on the speed of SAP Business Warehouse (BW). In addition, the revision history of all data stocks must be guaranteed. The clear goal is to maintain the maximum possible performance of the BW system. The book you have here is to contribute to this. Core topics are:• Basics of BW data keepingo Flat and multidimensional data storageo temporary and data storage units.
content.title_en: Performance optimization for SAP BW : SAP Business Warehouse whether with or without SAP HANA

content.text: Methods in religious and ethical education : a practical manual. The use of diverse methods helps teachers to open up different learning paths for the children and to inspire them to learn. By a varied and methodically appropriate occupation with the contents the children expand their skills. They are empowered and encouraged to develop new content independently. Sustainable learning is promoted. The methods of this volume offer pupils a wide range of learning opportunities (...). This comprehensive method compendium provides valuable help for the preparation of teaching and is an enrichment for each teacher library. [Verlagshomepage]
content.title_en: Methods in religious and ethical education : a practical manual

content.text: The house is the safest stay of a family. Dangers lurk on the street. So what does it mean if the front door is open during the day in the early modern era? Is this an invitation to enter? Or is it so familiar to the authorities that during the day public space is considered safe? What does it mean if the nobility, which is allowed to carry weapons, no longer hides its new buildings behind walls, but uses permeable gate gates? Does it want to present the splendor of architecture or also inspire trust? Who can look into the windows, who out of them? The book investigates these questions using the example of the 18th century noble palaces in Münster. For the first time, systematic trends in the transparency of the nobility architecture of Europe and their references to private and public security are investigated.
content.title_en: Visible and secure: residences of the nobility in Münster in the first half of the 18th century

content.text: Engineering Engineering. A visual, practical textbook that introduces methodological and systematic engineering design in mechanical engineering. The first edition ("Construction Engineering") was published in 2009, and now the fifth edition is already available, so it is important to be up-to-date. The latest additions particularly concern Industry 4.0 and topics such as networking and "smart products". A new chapter "drives", an annex to the material preselection and a CD-ROM, which contains, among other things, the pictures from the book and solutions of the exercise tasks. The scope has increased by about 130 pages. Through multi-coloured layout, memos, info boxes, many practical examples and the above-mentioned exercise tasks, the target group from students and practitioners of technical disciplines is facilitated the learning
content.title_en: Engineering

metadata.authors: Rimkus, Wolfgang; Dambacher, Michael; Bürger, Markus

content.text: In the new edition of this practical work, the path to successful shop planning and shop design is shown across the industry. The market strategies presented, bundled in eight success factors from emotion to excellence, offer a wide range of possibilities for customer loyalty and differentiation from the competitor through the addressing of all senses. In addition, they open up a perspective on the meaningful interlinking of off- and online activities. Over 130 sketches, floor plans, tables and current examples from the retail sector describe the necessary theoretical foundations. (Verlagstext)
content.title_en: Inscenario, seduce, sell more : dramaturgy in store and assortment planning

content.text: Now I'm learning: App development for iOS with Xcode and Swift. For programming apps for the Apple operating system iOS, several books have already been discussed, including Th. Sillmann, who takes into account the development of iOS in the editions of his book and addresses readers with extensive previous knowledge. The book here is a very well-suited entry-level book, which is also very suitable for self-study. It is based on iOS 11, the integrated development environment Xcode (version 9, in some examples 8.3) and the Apple programming language Swift 4. Alternatives to Xcode are mentioned only briefly. The author thus focuses on a very narrow topic (but at a very current level) and hardly requires prior knowledge from the reader. The concepts and tools used are explained with examples, however strictly limited to book topics in each chapter. Source code for the book (in the form of Xcode projects) can be downloaded from the publisher's website.
content.title_en: Now I'm learning: App development for iOS with Xcode and Swift
